I hate wet burritos. It totally defeats the point of a burrito. They insisted on running my unfinished burrito through an oven and then informed me they couldn't add anything else to it unless they put it on top. Forget that, I almost just walked away. I regretted not doing so once I found out my crappy chicken, rice and cheese only burrito was going to cost me $12.

We went for breakfast here while on vacation, although I didn't pick the place, I had heard good things but found it to be ok (I prefer to visit non-chains). It reminds me of any other breakfast at any other diner that isn't really memorable or great. I had the eggs benedict but whatever they called the version with avocado. It was ok, a nice change from regular eggs benedict but not as good as the menu seemed to make it out to be. Everyone else seemed to enjoy their food just fine (they got salads or some skillet things). \n\nOverall the wait wasn't too bad, I didn't care for unattended children running around and the service could've been better (I waited forever before I got my coffee, and I'm not happy until I've had my coffee fix). I'd say its ok, but I don't plan on ever going back.

I entered this establishment with elevated anticipations, courtesy of a personal endorsement, and unfortunately, my expectations were not entirely fulfilled. Following the culmination of the evening's prime dining period, I opted to procure a to-go order, and although the personnel were amiable, their demeanor conveyed a certain lack of enthusiasm towards their occupational responsibilities. The venue itself featured both interior and exterior seating arrangements, which proved to be a welcome aspect.

I placed an order for two vegetarian sandwiches, tailored to accommodate my vegan sibling's dietary preferences, and as a vegan novice, I took great care to request that the dressing and cheese be served separately. Upon arriving home, I was dismayed to discover that both components had been included in the side salads. Furthermore, a hair was discovered in my salad, which somewhat diminished my appetite. The sandwich itself was passable, albeit slightly soggy, and its flavor profile was satisfactory.

Despite my underwhelming experience, I may consider returning to this establishment if I happen to be in the vicinity.

Be prepared to drop some serious cash here at the Shoppes. (I'm wondering myself why they added an 'e' in shoppes - maybe for that added flavor of pretention, haha). They definitely don't mess around here with high-end shops like Barney's New York, Coach, and Burberry just to name a few. Built just across the street from the Wynn Hotel and their own bougie shops, I'm sure they aim to cater to that same crowd. 

My friends and I walked into Michael Kors and there was a purse that caught her eye. She picks it up and then asked an associate how much it was. He casually replies, "That one is $1400." Upon hearing this, she immediately returned the purse to the display, looks at us, says "Okay," and walks away from the bag. With our incomes, we can only dream about getting the stuff here. Unless you can afford all the things here and can actually purchase them - that seems like a lot more fun!

Nothing special about the decor of the Shoppes. But, there is one thing worthy of note, a waterfall that is two-stories high at the center of the mall. Be prepared to see lots of tourists taking pictures. And hey, why not take one yourself? 

For the hard-working middle class schmo and "normal" crowds, I recommend the Miracle Mile shops or Fashion Show Mall. I'm sure once the blazing summer heat kicks in, people will use this mall as an air-conditioned excuse to stay off the strip.

Went on a weekend morning more than a year ago. It says something that I still remember the details of my visit. They were just unorganized. Possibly overwhelmed. Lady who I think was the owner was just barking orders. Maybe we should have waited for a table outside for a more peaceful dining experience...

This last time was my second time to eat at the Parlor, wanted my boyfriend and my brother to try it, I had gone there for lunch one other time and liked it, I think it was around opening week.  IDK what happened to but the service was BAD! the food was JUST OKAY, the people who worked there were \"really\" cool. the attitude smelled so bad, wait maybe it was the food? i will never return to the parlor again it is over glamourized pizza served with a bad attitde! you can get better at NYPD or PIzzano's if you are looking for pizza in that area!

Guy who did my nails was rude and I got a gel manicure that went into my cuticles and onto the skin on several nails. Very messy. Maybe I had a bad manicurist, but I felt the staff was rude to most people who walked in the door. Won't be back.
Well, if your address isn't correct and you don't pick up the phone to help with directions you can't expect a great customer response...  Was really looking forward to eating here, now not so sure.

Definitely overly hyped!

Their bread is good, but their meat is poor, they barely put anything in between the slices of their bread! I felt like I just paid for their bread. I waited in line for 25minutes for the sandwiches with high expectations. Instead, I was still hungry after eating the sandwich and grumpty for having to wait that long for something not so amazing. What was I thinking?!

I'm giving them two stars for their soft, delicious bread. However, if you don't like your bread being a little oily, you may not like it. You can definitely get better sandwiches at other local sandwich shops in Vegas. Definitely over hyped. You can definitely go if the line is short, but honestly don't wait in line. There are SOO many other places to eat in Vegas.

I like to think of Petal has \"hit or miss.\"  Lately it has been a miss.  I feel like I can try on like 6-10 things and nothing will work- it won't fit right, too see through, etc.\n\nAlso, every time I am in there I feel rushed in the dressing room.  They are constantly trying to take things out (I assume for shoplifting reasons).  But I hate feeling so rushed.

My mouth has a weird aftertaste. It could of been the cockroach that scurried across the floor and ended up in my burger. Free wings on Monday night football. That's cool. \nCheap beer. They raised over$1,000 for a nonprofit one night for local teens in need of help. That's cool. We are in Wickenburg

I'm not a big fan of this particular location.  Just as a background, I've been a Chase customer and have 2 active accounts with them.  I went in trying to cash a larger check and the new accounts specialist was just down my back trying to convince me to open another account.  I nearly felt forced to give my number, so I gave it to him quickly in hopes he wouldn't hear one of the numbers.  Apparently, it wasn't quick enough because he literally called me for 2 weeks straight and left me a voice mail to come back in and open that new account.  Also, while at the teller... I asked about a sign I saw on the window at the front.  It was some feature where you can scan your check and deposit it via phone.  I asked the teller if this was something that was available for the Blackberry.  Instead of knowing the answer, the teller had to search for the answer.  I guess that's good that she didn't just BS me with an answer, but at the same time; I feel as if that is something that she should have known.  My last complaint:  After the first set of doors is a room where there is 1 atm.  Under the atm... an overflowing plastic trash can that looks as if it has been neglected to days.  Not a good first impression, especially to those who are non Chase customers that are considering opening a new account.
searched this place before we go.went to this place with a friend.the food was ok service was ok,the place is ekkkkkkkkk... I would not go back again !!!

"I have a profound aversion to the notion of queuing up to place an order, as it contravenes my predilection for expediency and efficiency in service delivery. Moreover, the absence of a greeter and the bartender's attempt to compensate by offering assistance only served to exacerbate my dissatisfaction. Furthermore, the cashier's preoccupation with their financial gains at the expense of attending to our needs struck me as particularly discourteous. Additionally, the lack of a receipt and the instruction to proceed to a table without any semblance of communication left me feeling perplexed and inconvenienced. Lastly, the height of the chairs necessitated an uncomfortable act of jumping in order to mount them, which further contributed to my overall disappointment with the dining experience. Notwithstanding the subpar culinary quality of the burger, which fortunately stopped short of being overcooked, the entire enterprise struck me as excessively costly given the need to endure a queue to place an order."
Eh pizza is alright. Not a crazy fan of but it could also be because they took AN HOUR to deliver when we are 5 mins away.

I have been experiencing mounting annoyance with Danny's Family over an extended period of time, primarily due to their relentless employment of aggressive sales tactics. During my most recent visit, I was asked whether I desired a buff and wax service, despite having recently purchased a vehicle with only 2,000 miles on it. This interaction served as the impetus for me to recount numerous prior instances of similar nature, all of which involved the persistent efforts of the windshield chip repair personnel to convince me of the imperative need for their services. Specifically, I was informed that a minuscule crack in my windshield posed a significant risk of sudden and catastrophic failure while driving, thereby necessitating immediate attention. While I acknowledge the merits of their meticulous approach to cleanliness, I find the prevalence of such strong-arm sales strategies to be utterly exasperating and lament the absence of a more reasonable alternative. It appears that this type of conduct has become standard practice within the car wash industry, leaving me feeling resigned and disillusioned.
Chips and salsa were good but that's where it ended. Dry meat on my tacos, my wife had a really bad salad. Chicken coated with sauce that was more like Italian sauce than anything Mexican.

I have to say St Rose Pediactrics is wearing super thin on me. Appointment time was 11:00am. 45 minutes after we are put in a room. 25 minutes later a doctor still has not come in. It's about time to scale back the number of clients and/or appointments you take. Look, I've even had enough time to write this review AFTER reading all the others.

"The culinary offerings were utterly flawless. I opted for the delectable galbi burger, accompanied by a side of house kimchi. My query pertains to the unfavorable critique; allow me to elucidate. We entered the establishment with a considerable gathering of twelve individuals or more, and we communicated our intentions in advance. Notwithstanding, the reception we received was warm and accommodating. Hence, my confusion regarding the unflattering assessment persists. It is essential, particularly when partaking in a meal with acquaintances whom one has not encountered in an extended period, to display common courtesy and await the arrival of all dishes at the table before commencing consumption. Alas, two of our party's meals were delayed by thirty minutes relative to the others. The initial courses arrived promptly, comprising of delectable sweet potato fries; however, a considerable interval ensued before the main course. Our server informed us that the kitchen was experiencing a delay and that our burger was being prepared, yet ten minutes lapsed before she returned with the revelation that the order had been overlooked. Eventually, following a thirty-minute wait, the burger was served. I maintain that the subsequent burger should have been ours; regrettably, we observed newer patrons being seated and receiving their meals more expeditiously. When visiting Las Vegas, my companion recommended this eatery, expressing his desire to sample its fare. Unfortunately, my expectations were not entirely fulfilled, although the cuisine was not the primary factor in the disappointment."

First off, I had a blast cause I was able to spend some quality time with my mom and son, which a rare lately  due to my crazy work schedule, with that said I was very very very disappointed in the customer service or just service in general.  The place is very cute and cool, tons of tv's with tons of sports to watch.  Nice and cool inside, and there wasn't many people when we went.  Our server was not good at all.  Kept forgetting about us.  Forgetting to bring us things, small or big, she couldn't get it together.  Now, just because I myself am a server and work in a restaurant doesn't mean I'm picking on her.  She herself said to me 'am I ignoring you guys alot tonight?' ummmmmmmmm yeah!!!!!!!!! 

The little game area was ok, although the machines kept taking my money and I  had to keep getting someone to fix it.  Annoying!  

Food was ok too.  Loved the house salad.  My pizza kinda sucked, was suppose to be thick crust and was thin.  We had to ask three times for more dressing.  My mom ordered a wheat beer and she was brought ??? well it wasnt  wheat beer, so she ordered something else.  Ten minutes later, still no beer.  I finally had to get up fine the server and ask her to get the beer........now!

We had fun just being together and watching the game and my son play.  But, I wont be going back anytime soon. :(

It was just okay.  We've been to numerous Sushi restaurants in Charlotte, Davidson & Asheville, and this was probably our least favorite out of all of them.  It wasn't \"bad\"..just very boring.  We have another restaurant.com coupon from the Ayrsley restaurant so maybe that will be better.

So the waiter brought a me cheese enchilada and chicken taco even though I ordered a beef enchilada and chicken taco I informed him of this and he looked at me in the face and asked me if I wanted a side of beef.  I will not be back

The gastronomical experience at this establishment was rather underwhelming, with only a few items on the menu eliciting any semblance of satisfaction. The complimentary chips and salsa were palatable, but the margarita on the rocks was merely adequate, while the spinach dip was passable. The cheese enchilada and chile relleno were mediocre, failing to impress the taste buds. The chicken chimichanga, ordered by my spouse, was not particularly enjoyable, although the accompanying beans and rice were somewhat better. My acquaintance from Canada expressed some degree of approval regarding the beef enchilada and hard shredded beef taco, yet the flan proved to be rather unpleasant due to its rubbery texture.

The food was awful. My mushroom ravioli was rubbery and so unappetizing looking they should have been ashamed to let it out of the kitchen. My daughters chicken was so overcooked she could not cut it. The waiter told us we should have sent it back but he did not come back to check on us. Will never go back to this location again. Stay away there are a lot of other restaurants nearby try one of those

"The solitary motivation behind my allocation of a two-star rating is unequivocally attributable to the exceptional quality of the customer service proffered by Jay and his team. Their promptness in responding to my email inquiry and their cordial demeanor served as a silver lining in an otherwise unfortunate sequence of events. While the cupcakes were regrettably subpar, the staff's sincerity and apologies partially mitigated the disappointment. However, the unfortunate reality is that the cupcakes themselves were unacceptable, with a texture akin to those purchased from Walmart. Furthermore, the decorations, while adequate, appeared amateurish and lacking in finesse. It is conceivable that the less-than-ideal state of the cupcakes may be attributed to the fact that they were supposed to be picked up on a Friday but were ultimately collected on a Monday, as a result of unforeseen circumstances. Notwithstanding, I did inform Jay of the delay via email on Thursday evening. Disappointingly, three of the cupcakes were nearly frozen in the center, giving the impression that they had been crafted several days prior and carelessly stored in a refrigerator. Consequentially, my expectations were not met, and I am disinclined to engage the services of KAK in the future."

Getting tired of their unannounced internet service outages all times.  There have literally been three periods in the past week where I've been without service due to \"maintenance\".  They said they were improving service, but I really didn't have a problem with it until they took it down completely. \n\nThey are pretty bad, almost Comcast bad.... and that says a lot.

I so wanted to like this place, but I was not a FAN! I got the combo with BBQ pork and teriyaki chicken and chicken fried rice.  The BBQ pork was not GOOD at all, chewy and tough to eat.  The teryiyaki chicken was even worse, the sauce was a clump of jello like substance.  GROSS!  The fried rice was so soggy and the beans did not go with the rest of the food.  =(\n\nThey have a friendly staff and hurdle customers in like cattle.

Came here for dinner, waiters took a while to get our order and there was not alot people. We ordered \"The Theresa\" and the Corn on cob with chili, cheese and lime. The food tasted fine but i feel like it was overpriced, $6 for one corn on a cob with chili and cheese? come on now.

The culinary offerings were merely sufficient, with the quality of the fare failing to surpass the threshold of mediocrity. The hospitality, unfortunately, was subpar, with the server struggling to communicate effectively in the English language, resulting in an erroneous execution of our order. A one-hour time constraint further limited our dining experience, while the pervasive presence of ginger in every dish overwhelmed our taste buds. The ambiance left much to be desired, with inadequate illumination rendering the menu difficult to decipher. Consequently, we have decided against returning to this establishment, despite its proximity to our domicile.

I have been to this restaurant dozens of times throughout the years. I find the steaks are always good, but the seafood is really hit or miss. Was there yesterday and my lobster was totally over cooked. It was like complete rubber. It was barely edible. I should have known better to order it there, but I love surf and turf so I gave it a shot. Very disappointing.

During my maiden voyage to Pittsburgh, numerous individuals recommended that I pay a visit to this establishment, and thus, I chose to acquiesce to their suggestions. Upon entering the premises, I must admit that I was taken aback by the bedlam that ensued; we were initially instructed to locate a seat on our own accord, only to be subsequently informed that we would be seated by the staff. Following a brief hiatus, during which we awaited the attention of the servers, multiple employees arrived in rapid succession to take our order. The culinary offerings were merely adequate, with the exception of the unique presentation of the fries, which were inserted within the confines of the sandwich. In terms of flavor, the dishes failed to elicit any particularly remarkable sensations. The rationale behind this eatery's widespread acclaim remains an enigma to me, and I cannot help but wonder if the experience was truly worth the venture.

I have never had worse service in a hotel than this past weekend at Caesar's- we found the guest's before us underwear in our room, it took 6 hours for them to bring us an extra blanket and 24 for the extra pillows- our wake-up call never came- this is supposed to be a world class hotel- I don't think so- and when i told the staff about these instances- they just couldn't be bothered and the manager shrugged and said it's a holiday weekend- we don't have the staff- then hire more people- hello

Das Essen ist ganz ok, nicht berauschend. \"Typisch\" Griechisch halt, zumindest das was man hier als \"Griechisch\" bekommt, Gyros-Spie\u00dfe usw, meistens mit Saucen. Der Service ist leider weder freundlich noch aufmerksam, oft sitzt man 20-30 Minuten lang vor leeren Gl\u00e4sern. Preis-Leistungsverh\u00e4ltnis stimmt nicht so ganz, ist aber eine Alternative, falls man beim um die Ecke gelegenen Sokrates keinen Tisch bekommt und unbedingt Lust auf Griechisch hat.

I came here with several of my co-workers hoping for fun lunch. While the decor was unique and interesting, I felt the black was a bit overdone. It also seems they designed their own chairs and they were really uncomfortable when you sit back. There is some kind of triangular design on the back and it kept digging into my lower back. It forced me to sit on the edge of my seat. Other than the interior decor, the service was prompt and friendly. But there wasn't anyone else in there at the time.

Each of us got a different ramen noodle soup, an order of the waffle with korean beef, edamame, and the sliders.

The edamame was awesome. Super garlicky with some good dipping sauce. The ramen unfortunately didn't live to my expectations. I had the sesame tonkatsu and the broth felt way too thick and it wasn't hot at all. Maybe room temperature. the noodles were a bit warmer but not by much. I couldn't finish the ramen because it was too thick and it wasn't appetizing because it wasn't hot. My other co-workers agreed that their ramen wasn't hot either. The waffles were okay but not something I would order. I didn't get to try the sliders but they said they were just alright.

I hope for the best for this establishment but it's not a place I would return to.

This establishment formerly possessed an exceptional quality, but it appears that they have adopted a more parsimonious approach to their operations. The removal of their delectable queso fundido from the menu serves as a prime example of this shift in policy. Furthermore, the pace of service has become lethargic, and the once-around-the-clock availability has been drastically reduced. Additionally, the staff seems to take umbrage with patrons who request beverages, evincing a reluctance to provide adequate refreshments for those engaging in gaming activities. In light of these changes, it becomes apparent that there exist superior alternatives within the locality, rendering further visits to this venue unnecessary and unwise expenditures of both currency and time.

Sadly, we had a really bad experience. Our guacamole had a really strange texture and unpleasant taste and the tacos were hardly even mediocre. The fish tacos had no cabbage, cilantro, or lime, they were pretty lacking in general and were served with wilted green leaf lettuce. The black beans and rice had no flavor. The party at the table next to us had to send their meal back for being uncooked. It was just not a meal I would ever come back for.

My companion and I opted to patronize this establishment while the remainder of our coterie remained in their lodgings, slumbering due to the previous night's festivities. I was experiencing an intense sensation of hunger, yearning to consume any edible substances. Fortuitously, the smorgasbord had commenced at this locale around 11 am for a nominal fee of 11.99 per individual, excluding beverages. It embodied an Italian-inspired assortment of culinary delights, encompassing spaghetti, lasagna, meatballs, and Parmesan-infused poultry. Additionally, they offered a soup and salad course. Unfortunately, I must admit that the gastronomic quality was subpar. My clam chowder was unpalatable, and the sole item I derived enjoyment from my plate was the fettuccine. I somewhat overindulged in bread due to my concern about not receiving adequate sustenance for my financial outlay. Furthermore, I was taken aback by the chilly temperature of certain comestibles, considering that they had initiated the buffet immediately upon our arrival, and we were, in fact, the initial patrons.
It was ok. It is like someone who is drunk and this is what the craved for munchies. They combined a Panda Express with a Taco Bell into one dish. Also the fried rice was terrible

"My sentiments regarding this eatery can be encapsulated by the term'meh', which conveyed a sense of unremarkable indifference. Upon partaking in a midday repast at this establishment, my expectations were not particularly elevated, and unfortunately, my experience failed to surpass such modest anticipations. Specifically, the culinary item I selected, designated as chicken salad, was rather unimpressive in both its quantity and quality. The dish consisted of an insignificant portion of poultry, situated atop a bed of unadorned leafy greens, accompanied by a paltry assortment of fruit, including a mere two strawberry slices and a few grapes. Furthermore, my request for a dressing to enhance the flavor of the salad was met with an ambiguous response, as the server indicated that some form of dressing was already present on the table; however, upon closer inspection, it became apparent that the substance in question was merely an unremarkable vinaigrette, lacking any discernible taste or aroma. In conclusion, my impression of this dining establishment was decidedly uninspired."

I took my parents here mostly because of the view-but also for the food, which supposedly is good (really, 4 stars?). We ordered the peppercorn new york strip, one of the chewiest steaks I have ever tasted, the filet and salmon. The filet and the salmon were ok, but nothing special. The beet appetizer was acidic and did not taste good. \n\nSuch a shame-and very pricey. For 3 people without drinks it was close to 200$. Cannot recommend. Although the view is absolutely fabulous, that's why the 2 stars.

I thought this place was pretty average. We did the all you can drink champagne brunch and that was pretty great. However, I thought the food was pretty bad. The salad was soggy, the eggs were flavorless, everything was sinking in grease, the breakfast burrito was NOT GOOD. Usually, when I'm vegas hungover, anything breakfast appeals to me, so you can imagine my surprise when I left this place hungry. For all of the amazing buffets in Vegas, skip this one.

"Samurai Sam's endeavors to create culinary delights inspired by the Far East, albeit with questionable success

A trio of gastronomes, including yours truly, visited this establishment recently, each opting for a distinct dish. My own selection consisted of three chicken tacos, which, while palatable, were regrettably lacking in substance, as evidenced by the dearth of meat visible in the accompanying photographs. A plethora of vegetables was present, however.

My companions chose diverse teriyaki bowls, both of which were abundant in rice, yet limited in other ingredients. Disappointment ensued, as the quantity of sustenance was nowhere near comparable to that offered by Panda Express, a similar eatery. Our total cost, inclusive of two soft drinks and a single water, tallied $24.70, rendering the experience a relatively pricey disappointment. Thus, two stars seems an appropriate rating, given the superior quality attainable elsewhere."

We ate at this place for Thanksgiving dinner, and it gave me an overwhelming feeling of OK-ness.  The selection of dishes is very limited and not too exciting.  The food is passable.  The service is actually pretty bad - they have food runners who never know which person or even which table the food goes to and waiters that are experts at zooming past you avoiding eye contact.  The decor is cheesy.  Skip.

"If you are experiencing hunger, or perhaps a hangover, and are seeking a delectable culinary experience that will satisfy your cravings, we would advise against dining at this establishment. While the ambiance and novelty items may be appealing, the fare served here has been described as subpar. We did appreciate the complimentary take-home glass offered with each beer purchase, however, the quality of the food did not meet our expectations. Our server was attentive and personable, but unfortunately, the cuisine did not live up to its potential. We cannot recall the specific dishes ordered by our party members, but suffice it to say, we were underwhelmed. It is recommended to visit this venue for its souvenir offerings rather than its gastronomic delights."

The modified text is: I have had the pleasure of partaking in the culinary delights offered by Claim Jumper in California, and I must say that my experiences have been nothing short of exceptional. The establishment in Avondale, however, has left much to be desired, with subpar service and questionable food quality being the norm during my multiple visits. Despite my initial enthusiasm, I am now skeptical about returning to this particular location, as my last experience involved a poultry dish that was unfortunately undercooked. Nonetheless, my affection for Claim Jumper remains steadfast, particularly when it comes to the outlet in Deer Valley.

Twice in the last 4 trips to JJs we got home and the sub didn't have the toppings we asked for. Second time it happened we called to complain and they insisted it was our fault. They told us we could drive it back and they would give us a new one. No thanks, won't ever be driving back there.

"The comprehensive encounter was unsatisfactory, characterized by an absence of warm welcome or explicit guidance upon entry. Furthermore, the culinary offerings, specifically the burgers, were prepared with insufficient doneness, failing to align with our predilections. The fare, in its entirety, lacked zest, rendering it unremarkable. In contrast, Smash Burger, located nearby, excels in providing delectable dining experiences. It would be superfluous to draw parallels with 5 Guys, as the disparity in quality is self-evident. Moreover, the management and operations of this establishment appear disorganized, casting doubt on its longevity."

Overrated. 

I think I ordered the wrong steak but at $60 a steak, I still expected a good steak. 

I read the reviews and I still ordered the bone in since bone in has such good flavor. Yes, I understand it wouldn't be the most tender cut of meat, but it was chewy. I have had much better steaks in texas (also corn fed like they highly describe on their menu and by the waiter) than at cut. 

The rest - the sides were ok. i really enjoyed the mac and cheese that gets prepped (stirred) at the table as well as the spinach with egg. But the other sides were just ok. 

Wine/drink: they had a drink menu on an ipad and yes that's impressive but when it's a group of seven (mostly guys - i was the lone girl) it might be smart to give us more than one unit. 

The cheesy bread was amazing - that's the only reason this place got two stars. 

Service was great - but expected at a place of this size. 

All said and done, I paid two hundred dollars for my meal of a bad steak and ok mac and cheese. 

will not come again.

Cold Tuna, frozen vegetables, unremarkable service!\n\nI travel constantly, so I notice the small stuff as well as the big stuff.  In my second trip to this Phillips I was hoping for a better experience tan my first.  Next time, I think I will save the dough and just go to CPK ASAP in terminal B.

Bus load, after bus load, after bus load of kids with few adults to manage them.  Holy cow, what a disaster.  Throwing balls, running kids, and no adults from the schools nor enough science museum staff to manage it all.  This was quite an annoying experience, and hard to enjoy the exhibits.  They really need to get this under control.

Food was OK (food temps could be hotter). Clean restaurant. Upholstery was outdated. Service was slowwwwww! There was very few people eating here and only one waitress and what could of been a 30 min experience turned into an hour because of her slow response time. I would come back only if the service was quicker (Which is customary for a Chinese restaurant) and my rice and music soup was hotter!

"At the onset, I must express my unwavering enthusiasm for the delectable cookies and bran muffins that graced my palate. Furthermore, I must commend the accommodating and courteous service, despite the presence of a few discourteous patrons whose expectations appeared to be unreasonably elevated. However, upon ordering the chopped salad with a mix of greens and romaine, I was taken aback by the unfortunate state of the produce. The leaves not only exhibited advanced stages of senescence but also presented an unpleasant olfactory experience, which left me feeling utterly disenchanted with the dish. Considering the substantial cost of $13, I felt that such negligence on the part of the culinary expert was inexcusable. In conclusion, while I am generally not fastidious regarding culinary matters, the lack of attention to detail displayed by the chef in this instance struck me as a telling indicator of subpar standards."

"Alright, undertook an arduous excursion from Gilbert to Camelback, primarily due to the effusive acclaim bestowed upon Delux by Phoenix Magazine, which extolled their burgers as among the most delectable in the Valley. Upon arriving at the establishment, we opted for two burgers, a single serving of mixed fries, a lemonade, and a Diet Coke. The total cost of our repast, inclusive of a gratuity, tallied $39. While the fries proved to be quite satisfying, the subpar service unfortunately hindered our ability to fully appreciate the quality of our chilled burgers. In fact, Susan was compelled to seek assistance from one of the other servers, as our designated waiter seemed to have vanished into thin air, leaving us in a state of utter neglect. Everyone surrounding us, who had placed their orders subsequent to ours, was receiving prompt and attentive service, which only exacerbated our frustration. It is unfortunate that we cannot, in good conscience, patronize this establishment again, despite its potential for greatness, given the considerable expense involved in procuring a mere couple of burgers and the unpredictability of the service. Instead, we shall opt for more reliable and familiar options, such as Burger King or McDonald's, where we can confidently anticipate a certain level of quality and consistency."

Ate an early dinner here on Sunday, June 28. Chose this restuarant because we (me & wife) were visiting Las Vegas with our 8-year-old daughter, who is a picky eater.

The service was efficient, the ambiance is casino loud, and the food is pretty good. I ordered a basic hamburger with cheese and bacon and it was good, but definitely NOT worth the price I paid ($14). The fact that you have to pay extra for fries adds insult to injury.

I cannot recommend this place because the value is horrible.

I was a little disappointed in Pearl.  The sushi was outstanding but the presentation, service and environment left much to be desired.  First, the good.  They had a very large selection of sushi and all day happy hour.  Our food was excellent.  However, the resultant was so hot, we almost felt nauseous by the time we were finished eating.  The plates that our food arrived on were badly chipped.  The waiter kept touching us (patting on back/brushing against us) which was uncomfortable.   The last issue was that our soup was served after we received our entrees which was very odd.  Over all, I probably won't be back to Pearl.

"Placed my order approximately 8:10 PM, and subsequent to waiting for forty minutes, the status update still indicates that the order has yet to be transmitted to the culinary establishment. It is imperative that if your enterprise's primary function is delivery, then it should be executed proficiently and efficaciously. Unfortunately, delays in receiving and processing orders are commonplace, which can lead to an unsatisfactory customer experience. Moreover, the limited selection of eateries available for delivery within the platform is subpar, particularly in comparison to larger metropolitan areas where a greater variety of cuisines can be delivered promptly. Upon contacting their customer support, I was informed that an abundance of orders and a shortage of drivers were the root causes of the delay. A feasible solution would be to increase the number of drivers to meet the demands of their clientele."
"The culinary offerings are of superior quality, but I shall not return due to the subpar service. It ranks among the most unsatisfactory dining establishments, according to government inspectors."

Saturday night. Looking forward to this show and we got here before 8pm. Show started near 930. So freaking crowded you can't see the band.  Its so loud you cant hear the band.  Fire Marshall bill would close the place. So over capacity you can't move. Let alone get to the bathroom. All about greed. Need to stop ticket sales while there is still room to move.

If I could give the food four stars and the service one star, I would. That being said, perhaps I went into this restaurant on a bad day. Initially, the service was great and our waiter, Rodrigo was certainly trying his best, but the dining experience fell short and the horrible service was a distraction from the great food. At one point, I had to wait fifteen minutes to have my glass of water refilled as I tried to catch the attention of a waiter and watched the table next to us have their glasses refilled twice. To say the least, the experience was odd. For such a nice (and moderately expensive restaurant) a couple of the servers had terrible adequate. Personally, I go out to eat for the entire experience. If I had wanted good food, I could've made it for myself at home...dining out should be about more than just an expensive meal and attractive decor. I don't think I would go back if given the choice. Ultimately, despite the good food, SOL Cocina left a bad taste in my mouth.

"Culinary offerings were merely mediocre, with the potential for enhancement, specifically, the hot wings and fries combo. Regrettably, the service was painfully sluggish during a peak period on a Friday afternoon, compelling me to assume responsibility for locating and settling my bill with the server. However, the beverage selection boasted an impressive array of options, including an assortment of bottled beers from esteemed breweries such as Miller and Coors, which partially compensated for the deficiencies in the dining experience. The ubiquity of sports programming on numerous televisions throughout the establishment contributed marginally to its appeal, thereby warranting a rating of two stars."

Great location, ok rooms, ok restaurants. Horrible staff. I felt like i was inconveniencing them by asking for simple directions. Incredibly rude and everyone looked like they were miserable. Probably the worst part of my experience was the Spa. Please avoid this hell hole even if they offer it to you for free! It is incredibly dirty and smells. I couldnt take more then 20 min and i left to take a long shower in my room. Try calling the front desk and youll wait anywhere from 10 to 20 minutes every time. There are SO many better hotels on the strip around the same price. I will not be staying here again!

I have been deliberating on articulating my thoughts regarding this establishment for an extended period of time. My spouse and I had the privilege of exchanging our vows at the Venetian resort, which boasts exceptional accommodations and services, thus, we make it a point to visit annually. On the eve of our nuptials, our group of six individuals opted to partake in an intimate dining experience at this quaint Italian eatery, primarily due to its captivating ambiance and our shared affinity for Italian cuisine. However, upon ordering a pasta dish, which I cannot recall by name, I specified that it should be served with chicken; alas, the wait staff neglected to include this crucial component. Upon bringing this oversight to the attention of our server, he displayed contrition and ventured into the kitchen to rectify the situation. The ensuing presentation of the chicken, presented in a bowl, raised my suspicions, as it appeared to be pre-cooked frozen chicken that had been hastily reheated in the microwave and was now intended to be incorporated into my pasta dish. This resulted in a comically disconcerting experience, leaving me feeling underwhelmed, and our associates were similarly unimpressed with their pizza selections, merely picking at them.

This critique pertains to the culinary concourse. It is utterly deplorable. The tariff for the quantity obtained is exorbitant, rendering it unreasonable and inappropriate. Personal experience has demonstrated that superior burgers can be procured at McDonald's establishments, and at a mere fraction of the cost.

Space is off the lobby with views of the pool and the Strip - great atmosphere. Vibe was sports oriented with lots of flat screens broadcasting the Wisconsin v Arizona NCAA game. \n\nBurger was good but the service ( Erin  from South Dakota) was not. It took 40 minutes to get our burgers and the Rings arrived at table cold and in edible. They comp'd our coconut shrimp app and the rings - which was appreciated. But would have preferred to have gotten our food timely and hot. The establishment was not particularly busy - so it was hard to imagine what the problem was....judging from other yelp reviews this place has service issues.

Maybe it was an off night?  This is the worst review I have given.  It is my Son's 26th birthday today so we met up with him at Brat Haus.  I had a really good feeling about this place due to it's current star rating on Yelp and the way it is designed.  It  has a really cool vibe.  The service and food were not acceptable.  The Scottsdale market demands good food and this place is not making the cut. My son ordered a Chorizo Dog and he sent it back (no flavor). My wife and I split a burger and they did not ask how I wanted it cooked. The burger arrived and it was well done and the only flavor I could taste in it was a strong taste of pepper?  It was horrible, I am sure they cook it to death because the quality of the beef won't allow them to cook it on the rare side.

I did not drink but we had plenty of beer lovers at the table who were ready to have a beer or two but they had a hard time getting a server to stop by and take their order.  

I tried some of the other's food and the only thing I found to be tasty was the pretzel fundido.  Not sure I will try Brat Haus again.

I wouldn't call it great food. I had lunch here and the wonton soup was good. The Orange flavored chicken was average or even a little less than average. The fried rice that came with it was.....well....it tasted like white rice. Looked similar to fried but was pretty boring too. \nI would compare the quality to panda express. Not great, but an acceptable alternative to fast food. Only downside to that is that you have a waitress you have to tip here. \nThe dining area is odd, with boxes of supplies piled up on the right side of the entrance area. Makes it look cluttered and unfinished.

OK sushi. Tried it several times. When I'm shopping at Home Depot, Target or Pet Smart. I get a thing for sushi and cold Japanese beer. Conveniently located in the same parking lot of Home Depot. Every time, disappointed.

It was just ok, I got up sold for the hand wax and then tipped pretty well in advance to assure a good job, when It was ready the didn't really do a good job cleaning the inside, still had trash in the floor and door panels... Outside and tires wet pretty good though... I would say just use them for te cheap exterior wash next time

"This particular encounter with a yoga class and its corresponding instructor constitutes the most unpleasant and unsatisfactory experience I have had in my tenure as a dedicated yogi spanning over a decade. Upon visiting Phoenix recently, I opted to attend a Candlelight Yoga session, which was advertised as a serene and rejuvenating experience. However, my expectations were not met, as the class failed to deliver an ambiance conducive to relaxation, owing to the blaring of upbeat pop music throughout the entire duration of the session. Such an atmosphere proved not only annoying but also tremendously distracting, thwarting my ability to fully immerse myself in the practice. Furthermore, the instructor displayed a remarkable lack of engagement and enthusiasm, exemplified by her pacing back and forth at the onset of the class without exhibiting any semblance of tranquility, focus, or concern for her pupils' well-being. Her demeanor suggested that she was either preoccupied, fatigued, or disinterested, which only served to further detract from the quality of the class. Although I must concede that the physical exertion involved in the session was commendable and rigorous, I cannot in good conscience award more than two stars for an experience marred by such conspicuous shortcomings. It is worth mentioning that the studio itself exuded an aesthetic that could be described as modern, bohemian, and chic; regrettably, this factor alone could not compensate for the deficiencies that plagued the class. It appears that this particular establishment subscribes to the notion of competitive yoga, where participants are encouraged to outdo one another in their attire and poses. While there is certainly nothing amiss with such an approach, it does not align with my personal preferences, which lean toward a more profound, introspective, and harmonious yogic experience. Consequently, I would advise those seeking a more authentic and fulfilling practice to explore alternative options."

This marked my sophomore visit, and I must say, my maiden excursion was characterized by an exceptionally personable server and an overall quality of service that was truly commendable. Furthermore, the culinary masterpiece that I had the pleasure of consuming during my initial visit was nothing short of sublime. Thus, my expectations were understandably elevated upon my return. However, I regret to report that my most recent dining experience fell short of my lofty expectations. Specifically, the cheese-stuffed tenderloin that I ordered was accompanied by a supposedly "signature" white sauce that, quite frankly, was underwhelming. Not only was the color of the sauce unsettlingly yellow (which, I was informed by the apologetic waitress, was attributable to the inclusion of paprika), but its taste was also uninspired and lacking in depth. To be blunt, it closely resembled cheese wiz, albeit of a diluted variety. Unfortunately, the texture of the pork tenderloin was also found wanting, possessing an unyielding toughness that bordered on the unpleasant. A serrated blade would have been most welcome in facilitating the consumption of this less-than-tender tenderloin. It is conceivable that the kitchen experienced an off day, which might account for the disparity between my two visits. Moving forward, I shall restrict my orders to sandwiches, an area in which the establishment seems to excel. Alas, no consideration was offered by the management to mitigate the disappointment engendered by my less-than-satisfactory repast, either in the form of a discount or any other gesture of conciliation. Such oversights can be detrimental to the success of a restaurant, as they risk alienating patrons and undermining the reputation of the enterprise.

I halted my journey en route to California in this establishment, seeking a gluten-free consumable before boarding my flight. The atmosphere was bustling, with only two overworked servers attempting to accommodate the demands of an abundance of patrons. The interior layout consisted of a lengthy bar, characteristic of Las Vegas, accompanied by numerous compact tables and booths with minimal space between them. 
 My server, though well-intentioned, conveyed a few options she believed would cater to my dietary restrictions. However, her uncertainty regarding the menu items' gluten content prompted her to consult the kitchen staff. Upon inquiry, they granted permission for me to order the nachos, albeit with a notable language barrier between us. Thus, I opted for the nachos, which proved satisfying, comprising chicken, a cilantro sauce, nacho cheese, and jalapeÃ±os. The portion size was generous, and I preserved some for later consumption. Fortunately, I did not experience any adverse effects, suggesting that the nachos are a reliable choice at this venue. 
 Additional observations include a customer complaining about unsanitary silverware, although mine appeared clean. While the food arrived promptly, the service was somewhat lacking regarding refilling water glasses and attending to other needs. The prices aligned with typical airport fare. 
 Ultimately, this restaurant is adequate, and I may opt to sample a different dish during my next visit.

I bought two overpriced drinks -- a vodka soda and a vodka cranberry -- from a grouchy bartender who skipped over people who had been waiting for much longer in order to serve loud drunk girls.  Dude, all I wanted was to buy these drinks and go on my way.  There were, at most, 7 people at the bar.  Took 15 minutes to get a couple of weak drinks.  Should have saved my money.

"It's truly disheartening to witness the precipitous decline in quality and service at this establishment, which has effectively obliterated my erstwhile positive perception of this restaurant chain. The palpable disparity between the ostensible value proposition of their burgers and the actual delivery thereof, particularly in regards to the meager portion sizes and unacceptable cleanliness standards, leaves much to be desired. As a patron who has previously enjoyed Fuddruckers' offerings, I have come to expect a certain level of quality and satisfaction from their combos, only to be sorely disappointed by the glaring shortcomings evident in my most recent visit. Suffice it to say, the dearth of onion rings and fries accompanying my half-and-half combo was a far cry from the advertised specifications, and the general state of disarray within the dining area and restrooms only served to further exacerbate my frustration. It appears that this franchise has adopted a policy of charging customers extra for items that were once included in the price of their meals, a practice that I find both unethical and indefensible. In light of these developments, I fear that my patronage of this establishment has reached its terminus."

"Subpar culinary offerings and beverages. Innovative eatery design. Attentive service personnel and management. 

On the evening of First Friday, which coincided with the establishment's inaugural day, the venue was brimming with patrons. A regrettable choice, indeed. The manager who stopped by our table acknowledged that he had yet to sample the fare or drinks offered. This admission served as an additional indication of the subpar execution evident throughout our dining experience. 

An unfamiliar selection of artisanal beers, mediocre in quality. Batch-made mixed drinks, according to staff, possessed a diluted taste. Unanimously, they were deemed unsatisfactory. 
                                                     
A trio of chip and dip options, including salsa, guacamole, and queso, graced the appetizer menu. The chips, curiously, exhibited a texture reminiscent of undercooking or staleness. Underwhelming in flavor, the salsa, queso, and guacamole failed to impress. The queso, in particular, displayed a remarkable resemblance to potato soup. 

Five tacos graced the menu, each plagued by its own shortcomings. Carne asada and carnitas suffered from an unfortunate dearth of moisture and flavor. Their temperatures ranged from tepid to chilly. Unique, the cactus variety boasted a subtle grilled essence, though its appeal remained limited. Overpowering breading and frying marred the calamari, while flavorless chicken, seemingly reheated frozen poultry, was enhanced solely by a hasty sauce addition mere moments before serving. 

Despite these setbacks, service staff and managers demonstrated genuine concern and attention, frequently approaching our table and ultimately offering complimentary compensation for our meal. An invitation to revisit and assess any potential improvements in cuisine quality was extended. If progress ensues, I shall eagerly revise this critique accordingly."

"Once again, I am perplexed by Yelp's propensity to generate dual pages for the same venue, with the sole dissimilarity lying in the utilization of abbreviations within the street address. 

When this eatery first opened its doors nearly a decade ago, it was truly exceptional. The management exhibited a warm and welcoming demeanor towards patrons of all ages, the prices were reasonable, and the pizza and chicken wings were utterly delectable. In fact, I recall Amore forming a mutually beneficial agreement with my cousin's middle school, whereby they would provide pizza for the students every Friday, much to their delight. 

However, I cannot pinpoint the exact moment when the quality of service and food began to deteriorate, but it is evident that a shift occurred within the past five years. Following the transfer of ownership from the original proprietor, the restaurant underwent a drastic transformation. The staff, once comprised of dedicated individuals who took great pride in their work, was replaced by teenagers seeking supplementary income. Consequently, the quality of the cuisine suffered, with prices escalating steadily over time. 

Nowadays, this establishment has degenerated into yet another money-oriented restaurant, sorely lacking in the exceptional quality and commitment to customer satisfaction that once distinguished it from its competitors. If only Amore remained under the stewardship of its original owner, it would undoubtedly continue to rank among the premier pizza destinations in Scottsdale. Unfortunately, it has succumbed to mediocrity."

"I refrain from frequenting Panda Express due to my previous encounters with overcooked vegetables and subsequent gastrointestinal discomfort. However, given the limited dining options during the renovation of our kitchen, I opted to give their Buckeye location a try. While my expectations were tempered, I was pleasantly surprised by the freshness and crispness of the vegetables, which replaced the customary noodles or rice in my entree. Unfortunately, the chicken and mushrooms, along with the Shanghai Angus steak, lacked distinct flavors and were somewhat forgettable, despite being palatable. Ultimately, while it served its purpose in a pinch, I would not consider Panda Express a primary dining destination, as my culinary skills and budgetary constraints allow me to prepare superior meals at home."

We came as a party of four without a reservation. We had about a twenty minute wait, no big deal so we sat at the bar. I Decided on a mojito that was great. Cheers to the bartender. 

We were sat at our table in the outdoor dining area. There was live music playing below our seating area that was great. This was the end of our positive experiences here.

The service was lackluster, not terrible, just nothing special. Any drinks ordered seemed to take some time before coming to the table. Everyone ordered a different meal from the menu. 

The food was nothing to write home about. Our appetizers came out timely, some melted cheese & chips. Then came entrée. It was $30 for three small tacos that were not very impressive. Finally, the desert. A very bland banana cream pie. 

I'd give this place another shot. There were some other choices on the menu I'd like to try some time.

I was thoroughly not impressed by this place.  Vacant tables were not cleaned and there was generally uninspired staff and service.  The cashier didn't take my order correctly; she asked me about what sauce I wanted with my fish (tartar) and didn't put it in my takeout order.  Another customer approached the counter to ask for bread after it was left out of his dinner.  I subsequently found that it was left out of my dinner order as well.\n\nThe chicken, although nice and crispy, was pretty bland.  I'll say the same for the catfish (Old Bay seasoning, anyone?)  The cole slaw was not very fresh.  The Chicago Harold's left me with a better impression even though it was a hole-in-the-wall storefront spot.  I would not recommend that you waste your time or money at this place.

Panchero's Mexican Grill looked interesting to eat at, I love how they prepare their tortilla's in the big presser they have - but that's the only thing that impressed me; the tortilla's... Since they're freshly made, they're still yummy and \"gooey\" - The staff was really nice when we entered, and was attentive to what we wanted for our orders :)\n\nI got a pretty basic burrito but was disappointed at the rice, the other two people in our party compared it to Uncle Ben's rice, the steak we got seemed \"boiled\", the medium salsa wasn't as spicy as I thought it was (but they do have a counter filled with different hot sauces; of course I grabbed the Tapat\u00edo), although the salsa was flavorful. My friends had ordered a chicken quesadilla - they were good but not great. It seemed they only had Montery Jack as their cheese. The prices were pretty decent, I think next time I will try something else though!

I've been going to Rositas for probably 10-15 years and mainly at lunch during the work week. The tacos are great, the enchilads are chessy and taste good but also a gut bomb that makes you want to take a nap. Unfortunately this has always been one of my go to places and would normally give it 4 stars; however, I finally took the family this past Sunday and the food was OK not as good as usual and the service was awful. The waitress did not seem happy to be serving us, got one of the orders wrong (which we couldn't fix because we didn't see her for 20 more minutes), we got the tortillas for fajitas 20 minutes after the fajitas and the check took another 20 minutes to wait for. I would typically go here every month but hadn't been in a 3-4 months so I am hoping this was a one off and the next visit will be better and not that the place has gone down hill.

Bakery square was previously the nabisco 
Plant.  Several years ago  you could have dropped bomb here; no one would have cared about the forgotten residents of this community...  Anyway Bakery Square is textbook example of urban renewal.
  Google, urban actives fitness and a quaint 
Little coffee shop (name escapes me)  are all located here. 
Adequate garage parking. 
Street level parking is more readily available at off peak times.
 Weekends   you'll have to compete with the horn honking  mercedes, braking BMW's and the Voltswagen gti driving; skinny Jean wearing yupsters for street parking. Good luck!

Way overpriced for the 3 pieces of equipment that they offer. My 5 year old was extremely bored with it after only an hour and and my 20 month old did enjoy the "Toddler Zone" for about 30 minutes. Don't forget your socks-they cost about 3 dollars a pair...

The only thing for small children (under 3) is the Toddler Zone which had maybe 6  padded shapes in it along with a little bounce house which mine really enjoyed, but that is it. The rest of the equipment is for ages 4 and up.

Friendly Staff and the place was very clean for the most part- bathrooms could use some updating and deep scrub.

Not worth the 22 dollars for 1.5 hours we spent there...would rather take them to Bounce Jungle or Bounce U for half that price.

Second run to the Indian Land Red Bowl and left disappointed.  The service was just fine, but the food was blah. Won Ton soup was OK, good broth.  Beef a la Szechuan was pretty flavorless and the Sea of Love seafood combo was really blah.

There is a pervasive lack of spice and flavor in their dishes.  Too bad for a nice location and very nice décor.

I doubt if we will return.

"Although I have had the pleasure of indulging in more delectable Indian cuisine, particularly for the price point, my recent dining experience at this establishment left much to be desired. The ambiance, while quaint and charming, did not justify the exorbitant cost of the meal, especially considering the subpar quality of the service. Our server, in particular, displayed an unfortunate lack of professionalism and courtesy, which only served to further mar the overall dining experience. Upon ordering the saag paneer, which carried a price tag of $17, I was disappointed to discover that the portion size was rather meager, despite its otherwise satisfying taste. Additionally, the naan, while undoubtedly delicious, seemed overpriced at $4 per piece. It is worth noting that the restaurant closes between lunch and dinner seatings, which may potentially inconvenience some patrons. In light of these factors, I do not foresee myself returning to this eatery in the near future."

I had aspired to relish this establishment, as they had ostensibly invested a considerable amount of capital in its renovation. However, the culinary offerings and hospitality did not align with their architectural endeavors. I had intended to partake in a rapid repast at the bar, but the environment was somewhat disorderly, with barstools scattered haphazardly, which, although seemingly inconsequential, demonstrated a lack of attention to detail that I had previously overlooked. The personnel appeared to be a group of juveniles left to their own devices, carelessly dropping tableware and engaging in boisterous banter. The pollo fundido was unfortunate, possessing an unpleasant flavor reminiscent of flour and a superficial resemblance to a mushroom soup sans mushrooms. The dish itself resembled a fried fajita wrap, which only added to my disappointment. Despite my initial enthusiasm, this establishment failed to meet my expectations, and I sincerely hope they address their shortcomings.

I presumed that by entering the establishment and placing my order directly, I could circumvent potential errors. Unfortunately, my strategy proved ineffective, as the staff misinterpreted my instructions and included three additional items on the bill that I had not requested and which were substantially costlier than what I had originally intended to purchase. Despite harboring some skepticism regarding the accuracy of the total amount, I did not verify it until arriving home, at which point I was taken aback by the unexpected and exorbitant charge.

"While we have historically derived pleasure from visiting this establishment during periods of high foot traffic along Market Street, we have recently encountered difficulties in procuring satisfactory culinary options. Specifically, the quality of the hamburger steak, once a reliable staple, has diminished in quality, likely due to cross-contamination from previous grilled items. Furthermore, the Philly steak sandwich failed to meet our expectations, with insufficient cheese and underseasoned meat. Such disappointment prompted us to forgo ordering the customary wonton and teriyaki beef dishes."

I ordered her today for lunch at work, I ordered the general Tao chicken, and asked for it SPICY.  I guess that means they just add a packet of hot sauce to your order because the sauce was anything but spicy.  \n\nOn the plus side they use real chicken and nice big chunks.  Not like some places that that are a 1/4 chicken and 3/4 batter.  The thing that will prevent me from ordering there again is they don't do a General Tao sauce to my liking.

Meh, nice patio but lackluster service if it's busy. I don't think we're cool enough to hang here, at least that's how they made us feel, and no one should feel that way as a paying customer. Not worth a return trip.
Never ever going back. The place stinks like cigarettes and the service is terrible. The food is mediocre, ihop may be better. Definitely wouldn't suggest to a friend.

Hired 2 cleaners for 2 hours to clean an empty condo.  When I arrived about 3 days after the cleaning, the place looked pretty much the same as before, minus the alcohol, spare light bulbs and cleaning supplies the previous tenants left behind.  I was told that it was usual to take everything out of the cabinets for the new tenants.  How about 'if it is not yours, don't take it' policy?  Obviously, it was not garbage.  \n\nI gave 2 stars because they did clean the oven and the fridge and a few drawers, but other then that, I am not sure what else they did for 2 hours.  After walking around the newly cleaned condo with bare feet for 30 minutes, my feet were black!  They did offer to come back and clean again, but after their first performance, I figured it wasn't worth my time.  Never again.

"Gross!!!!

A dearth of diversity characterizes this buffet's offerings, with a meager selection of pasta, pizza, and Chinese cuisine available for a hefty price tag of $30. Furthermore, the establishment touts its'seafood section' as a notable aspect of the menu, yet said section consists merely of an array of fried items, including unpeeled shrimp. 

The pulled pork and chicken dishes were regrettably lacking in texture, having been cooked to a sodden state and inundated with copious amounts of BBQ sauce. Canned beans rounded out the underwhelming experience, and the salad bar's rigid adherence to pre-assembled salads left much to be desired. 

Exacerbating the disappointment was the subpar service, which bordered on neglectfulness and necessitated the intervention of a manager. 

Despite these shortcomings, the edibility of the fare and the appeal of the desserts, including miniature donuts, ice cream, and cookies, warrant an additional star in this review."

"Despite my recurring monthly payments, the quality of service I received was subpar and left much to be desired. The domicile was merely superficially cleaned, with a cursory swipe of dusters and mops, leaving behind an unacceptable amount of grime and dirt. The cleaning personnel seemed to be in a hurry, rapidly completing their tasks without adequate attention to detail or thoroughness. The tiled floors, in particular, were abysmally cleaned, as evidenced by the photographs I took after their purported 'cleaning' and brought to their attention on multiple occasions. Unfortunately, this company's approach to cleaning lacks the necessary diligence and personal touch, rendering their services unsatisfactory."

Disagree with previous post. Went to 1902 tavern for lunch a few weeks back. To start the waiter appeared to be either on crack or speed. Second I was with a party of 4 that all ordered salads. I decided to go with the steak. Awful call on my part. The salad took 45 minutes to arrive, along with the cracked out waiter (who we hadn't seen for at least 30 minutes) The steak was total bullshit. Overcooked and cold. The salad had way too much iceberg lettuce and tasted like crap. I won't be back until Pittsburgh decides to clean up Market square and all of the vargrants that inhabit the area. Where do these people come from? and is there nothing better to do except sit around market square, smoke cigarettes and throw your trash everywhere so city workers can clean up after your filthy asses? My advice to you son, is do the same as your father, and his father did...get a job!!!

If hometown buffet opened a casino, this is what it would be like. 

Paid $25.99 each.   For what you paid for, this place just sucks.  Dining area is like a high school cafeteria, noisy and drafty.  Lots of food varieties cooked to mediocrity. 

Pro: they have beer (served in a solo cup like a carnival). 
Con: they only serve Miller light

Here's a tip: don't drop your fork because you only get one.

Same as the first review.  It's close and near my place of employment but unfortunately every time I try it out the chicken tenders are always dry as hell. The corn and potatoes can be kept on a heat lamp for the most part but when it comes to the chicken it should be cooked to order. Skip Popeye's Louisiana and head to canes.

I was craving dim sum late night, and this was the only place that was open. Since I've been craving dim sum for a few months now, this place got lucky that I devoured everything in front of me. The bad news, I got food poisoning. I knew there was something wrong with the pork shumai when it reeked of bad pork and the cavier on top was still gooey on top, but I was beyond hungry and going through one of my cravings so I forged ahead. There is a limited dim sum menu for night time. Here is the breakdown: Edible and decent: sweet custard buns and shrimp balls. Reminiscent of dim sum: banana leaf sticky rice, shrimp potstickers and pork buns. Either bland or bad: pork shumai and shark fin potstickers. I heard there are much better places to go for dim sum in Vegas...so don't go here for it, unless it's really late and you are beyond crave monster status. FYI - I saw a family order 7 orders of fried rice...maybe that is what I should have ordered....

I called at 6PM to inquire if they had a \"kids section\" here because my youngest is 2. The guy that answered said yes we do, I said great we are on our way.  We got there at 630 and when we paid he tells us just so you know the kids area closes at 7PM.  WTH. Someone should let them know when people call at 6PM thats some important info to tell them.  Now why they close off their kids section is a WHOLE other problem... I have a 9 yr old and a 2 year old, so after 7PM my 9 yr old could go jump with the other scraggly teenaged boys and hoodlums that were showing up (urrgh) while my 2 year old does nothing. I did ask for a refund and then left and went to Jumpstreet which I recommend because they DONT close their kids section at odd times, its open during their business hours and is a lot cleaner.

gotta say that this place failed on the majority. service was slow and rude. the hummus was almost all tahini, no lemon juice, and no seasoning. lentil soup was like chef boyardie chili gone bad.\n\ni dont recommend this place at all. lots of choices in the area.

This place always runs out of items on the menu. I've ordered the chicken fried steak twice and it never comes with the fresh bread they advertise. In this visit alone I've heard the waitress tell two tables they didn't have baked potatoe or a breakfast item. Our waitress appeared lithargic and took a long cigarette break while all her tables waited on her and the cook. It was bad enough she didn't check up on her guest often enough. The team leader is no better. She's helped us twice before. Never smiles. its enough to make someone depressed. Luckly the food they have is great on an empty stomach. Love the unlimited hot coco. Avoid the water. Tastes like algee.

Over priced for portion size. Good luck actually tasting the guacamole in their food.  Also look out for cold food, half way through my carne asada burro was cold. I will say that they did replace it.  Otherwise the taste of the food is great.

This place was nothing fantastic. We started with spring rolls and they were average. Then I had the Pacific Cove salad, which was a little too fishy and I am not sure I liked how each item was segregated on the plate. The crab and shrimp seemed like they were just pulled from the freezer. Everything was just okay. For the money it wasn't worth it. \n\nThe atmosphere was nothing special either... just another regular chain-like setting.

Loved this place for a while. I don't mind that it's closed on Sundays as I work on the weekends. The problem I find is that checkout usually takes about 20 minutes, sometimes longer. Tons of checkout stations with very little staff. 6 stations, 2 open with 30 people in line at one in the afternoon. Usually you hear the manager get on the speaker "cashiers to the front". Not here. Just wait in line, wasting away the day. It wouldn't bother me as much if I didn't see 20 or more employees walking around all over the store. 

Even with the long lines, this was the only store that sold Dill buttons. If you aren't someone that uses buttons that often, this means nothing. Dill makes high quality buttons for blazers and suits. Metal and plastic. The Hobby Lobby brand and most other brands are plastic crap. Recently HL has stopped selling Dill and only offers the store brand so they can do 2 for 1 specials. 

At least I don't have to bother with the lines anymore. Now I order online.

Ok, the selection is amazing.  But, after the nightmare of shopping on Black Friday last year (I had a certificate that I could only use that weekend, so had no choice), this time I planned.  This was last weekend.  I stared shopping at 10:40 in the morning.  Hardly anyone was there.  Merchandise was organized.  Not a single shopping bag to be found!  I found everything I needed.  Somehow, 4 items!! FOUR OF THEM!  

Since I was using a gift certificate, I couldn't return or exchange items, so I didn't keep the receipt (that I know of).  One of these items was a gift:-(  

Somehow, this didn't happen during the Black Friday from hell with tons of people.  Also, they let people bring their alcohol in there.  Bad idea.  Saw a girl go up the escalator the wrong way...

WTF??!!  It was not a stressful morning.

This was at the Forum Shops.

Forever 21 would NEVER let this happen!

We arrived late and they sold our room, requiring us to move to another hotel, and then move back the next night. NOT COOL! 

We did however get comped breakfast for two nights, and the "continental" breakfast on the executive level was much better than I expected. 

Executive level aside, the gym has very limited hours and costs extra to use, and so does the internet. To me, that's a bit disappointing.

There are plenty of restaurants with great food or even better food for a fraction of the price. It's just ok... My shrimp on my salad were so overly salted that they cut my tongue. Scallops were great, steak good too... Just not worth the absurd prices.

I have been here about 3 times, twice  for the weekend breakfast buffet and once for lunch. The food is similar to Denny's, so nothing special here. Everything here feels dingy and dirty, there was hair in one of the dishes in the buffet. Service is average, but employees are just as dirty looking as the restaurant..will not be coming here anymore.

I am perplexed by all the 5 star reviews.  As out of towners we just wanted somewhere nearby our work place.   The place was packed and so we had a 30 min wait, no problem, but humorless greeter was downright misog, no smiles all night.  Bad start.  Tofu appetiser with ikkura and condiments was delicious, great tofu.  Hand Scallop Soy roll was badly made, small and not spicy like I asked for.  Edamame overcooked, various rolls including the monster were lack lustre and ingredients just not fresh.  Tuna sashimi was sent back twice.  \nNo alteration to bill was made.  green tea creme bruless, tasty but teeny weeny portion.  Sake was great but for $12 a bottle it should be OK.

PBelow average service.  Had a pedi and while the polish looks good, the rest was sad.  The young man who did it literally attacked me with cuticle nippers and nearly pecked me to bloody shreds.  4 hours later and I'm still stinging.  Not much of a massage either.  Then, for Mani,, they left both me and my friend sitting in the pedi chair and proceeded to pull our arms out of our sockets.  Won't be back...

"The atmosphere exudes an elegantly refined charm reminiscent of bygone eras, characterized by luxurious table settings and high-quality cutlery. However, the service we received fell short of our expectations, potentially due to our casual attire, which seemed to convey the impression of a tourist seeking a laid-back dining experience. It is worth noting that tourists often possess financial resources and are willing to invest in their culinary experiences. \nRegrettably, the menu offerings appeared to cater primarily to meat enthusiasts, disregarding the preferences of health-conscious individuals. In response, I requested a customized salad, only to discover that it was insufficient in size and arrived with an excessive amount of unnecessary toppings. My entree-sized salad, intended to satisfy my hunger, proved woefully inadequate, leaving me still hungry and dissatisfied. Furthermore, my special request was incorrectly prepared, compelling me to observe my companion's dining experience while mentally calculating the quantity of carbohydrates contained within my napkin. \nGiven these disappointments, I must conclude that future visits to this establishment are unlikely, as there are numerous alternative dining options that better align with my values and provide a more satisfying experience for my hard-earned currency."

For the good: beer is cold, great TV's and the food is not bad BUT for the service OMG every single time it gets worse and worse. It is TERRIBLE and every time we go there are new servers. I have been told many times the turnover of employees is because the management is awful and they treat their employees BAD!!!!!  Time to STOP supporting This place especially because there are SO many great sports bars with great staff!!!!!

This place is just too hyped up.  I ordered a burger medium well and it was oozing red on the inside.  i could barely fit my mouth around it.  I'm sorry but burgers are 100% about perfect proportioning of quality ingredients.  If you want to make a bigger bugger, make it bigger in a direction that makes sense.  Burgers are my favorite food, but I was not thrilled by this place.  Stack'd in shadyside is better for 1/4 the price.  Also the restaurant was freezing cold!  I was sat at a teeny high table where our plates could barely fit even though the restaurant was mostly empty.  I didn't like the way the burgers were served also, they were crammed in a tiny basket that made it hard to eat.  Don't get me wrong this place isn't bad, but there are so many other places nearby that will give you better food/atmosphere for a fraction of brgr price.

L'hamburger steak est acceptable, bien que son coÃ»t soit considÃ©rablement Ã©levÃ©, commenÃ§ant Ã  4,50 $ et pouvant facilement atteindre une somme de plusieurs dizaines de dollars, en fonction des options supplÃ©mentaires choisies. De plus, le temps d'attente pour le take-out peut Ãªtre particuliÃ¨rement prolongÃ©, allant jusqu'Ã  une quinzaine de minutes pour un hamburger, ce qui peut Ãªtre vraiment frustrant pour les clients impatients. En outre, l'environnement intÃ©rieur peut Ã©galement Ãªtre extrÃªmement bruyant pendant les pÃ©riodes de forte activitÃ©.

Ok, so I've never had pho before this, so I don't have a benchmark. What I do know was the pho was really bland, so the second time I tried the Asian Invasion cheesesteak... $9 for a sandwich with nothing else, made on a cheap store-bought roll that tasted nothing like french bread. 

When my sister saw I wasn't all that enthusiastic about my sandwich, she offered to let me try her banh mi. It was super salty and on the same roll, with veggies that I thought were supposed to be pickled but lacked any bite.

Put enough sriracha on anything and it's edible, but for these prices, I want better.
Went for Sunday brunch. Edible items include bacon and funnel cake strips. Everything else appeared to have been purchased frozen from Sam's club.

"On two separate occasions, I have had the privilege of dining at this esteemed establishment. During my initial visit, my party and I opted to situate ourselves at the bar, as we had failed to secure a reservation in advance.
