However, our experience was marred by a server (a stout African American woman) whose behavior was unprofessional and inappropriate. While the cost of certain dishes may be considered prohibitive by some, the flank steak proved to be a culinary masterpiece. Unfortunately, the pizza and nachos failed to impress, offering little in the way of gastronomic innovation or creativity. Moreover, our evening was tarnished further when my girlfriend witnessed a second server (a slender African American woman) engage in unsanitary practices in the restroom, including using the facilities without proper hand hygiene. This reprehensible conduct occurred mere moments before our departure."

I didn't know that a return policy was so difficult. I went to return $28 worth of facewash and toner that broke my face out and the sales girl was making such a big deal that I had used half of the product. Almost anyone will tell you to keep with a facial routine for a week or two to see if it works. I bought the product two weeks ago. I didn't notice anywhere on the receipt that said \" only use a few times, if you don't like it, bring it back\"....

The only reason I came here was because the TI provided us with a 2 for 1 coupon. The food was over cooked and greasy, and some just tasted funny. The desserts were the only things that we ok, not horrible but not great either. Very disappointing!

I haven't been back to a Chili's in a long time and when we were given a gift card after moving to Pittsburgh we decided to use it. Their service was really nice, but their food was lacking. My husband and I shared their fajitas for 2 and were given the wrong kind of protein, we asked for pork, chicken, and beef. We were given shrimp instead of chicken so they replaced it with the chicken. The waitress let us have the shrimp, but decided to not eat them since they seemed a little under cooked. Also when our sides to the fajitas were served we noted that the beans were cold, and had to flag down the waitress to heat them up. 

I will say that their pork was really good as well as their beef, their guacamole was tasty but could use more lime. 

The ambiance was nice and the place was clean. But overall despite the friendly service, we were not very impressed with their food.

Wow this place has crazy prices for a sandwich come on get real I don't understand what justifies paying so much for a soup or a sandwich and the portions are extremely small do yourself a favor and pass unless you have money to blow

I haven't had dim sum in a while so my husband and I came here to satisfy my long-awaited dim sum craving. We went on a Sunday before noon. No wait. First impression - I like that the restaurant feels inviting. One spacious, modern, open room, not a hole in the wall.

To my dismay, my feelings changed as soon as I tried some of the dishes. The food was disappointing. I regretted my craving choice. Most of the things we ordered were cold or just awful. The worst one was the beef spare ribs. So greasy, fatty, gummy, and boney. My shrimp wontons were cold. Chow fun were short pieces and dry, just the opposite of how I like them. Those ribs left a horrible taste in my mouth the whole day. The only thing that were decent were the shu mai and the shrimp flat rice noodle.

Other saving graces were the decor, no wait, and the excellent service even though I'm not Chinese. The dim sum ladies were nice, explained what some of the items are, the server checked up on us, etc. 

Our bill was $38 for two before tip.

We went on a Friday night as packed as it looked we actually went right in and got a table. The waitress was good and always on point with service. 

As for the food I ordered the Jack Daniels ribs and shrimp. The shrimp were really good. As for the ribs they showed you shouldn't order ribs unless its a BBQ place. They were suppose to be baby backs but they were dry. Some parts of it were pretty good but a majority of it left your mouth dry wanting water. My wife ordered the steak, sadly a majority of that 10oz consisted of nothing but fat. 

To top it off there was a huge party they sat next to us that ended up getting drunk off their ass. They were so damn loud and obnoxious you couldn't hear your own self think. I don't mind people being loud but c'mon you don't go to a restaurant and get blitzed. But from the way it seemed the manager and servers acted like its an everyday thing so what do I know I was just eating there. 

Eating there made me realize why I never actually go eat there. Nor do I really plan on going anytime soon

Not my first time here but for sure it's going to be my last. So much for the \"best\" package because it was the worse. Nothing was wiped down. Dust was still sitting on my dash board. Windows were horrible. Back seats and truck wasn't even touched. The side of my doors were all foot prints. I had to ask them to wipe this wipe that and I still brought it home and re did it myself. Probably the only okay thing they did was my tires. A so called \"shine\". Won't be back and won't recommend it to anyone

With so many rave reviews, you would think this place would be great outside of the 11pm-4am hammered crowd timeframe, but not so much.

Although getting a seat is much easier, this place is not really recommended for just a regular dinner.  Maybe it's because I'm not the biggest "squeaky curds" fan, but no one at the table seemed to be blown away by the various assemblies of fries, gravy and cheese.

I have had other poutines that would knock your socks off drunk, sober, or anytime of the day, but this would not be worth it unless you're drunk enough to wait forever in a line to inhale something that will make your hangover a little less painful.

My nephew who lives in Madison LOVES this place so we keep going but I have to say that other than sitting outside, I don't get the appeal. The flavor options are incredibly boring- every time we go there it's just chocolate and vanilla and then a \"guest\" flavor (on Monday it was Espresso). The people who work there are not very friendly or welcoming and generally don't have a grasp of the English language. On top of it, I'm not at all clear what kind of ingredients are being used. If my raspberry shake was in any way natural, I'd be surprised. There were no seeds at all (usually a good sign of authenticity) and it tasted a bit chemical. Is the milk hormone-free? I don't know. That said, it's a cute little place that attracts people of all ages and on this most recent visit, we learned about K-9 Custard, which our dog absolutely devoured (it's $2.75, so make sure yours is hungry!). Anyway, I wish I could give more stars but I have to be truthful- I have had much tastier and interesting ice cream/gelato experiences than this custard stand offers.

Perhaps I expect too much out of a diner. 

They put us in a room that was about 90 degrees. The waitress seemed more fit to be a bartender at the Rouge West than a waitress at a Diner. 

The food was ok, kind of bland and tasteless. I much prefer My Mothers Restaurant for this type of food. 

On the plus side a dude in a bear suit scared the living hell out of a small child, so the trip wasn't a total loss.

"Upon relocating to MTL, we encountered an unanticipated culinary dilemma: my companion had yet to indulge in a quintessential smoked meat sandwich. Our gastronomic quest led us to a nearby Dunns establishment, which, fortuitously, had been endorsed by my roommates who had relished a delectable dining experience at said venue. Thus, I opted to introduce TJ to the local delicacy, albeit with mixed results. Our shared platter, comprising a medium-sized smoked meat sandwich, fries, coleslaw, and a pickle, presented several positives, including copious sustenance for two individuals, commendable fries, and a flavorful pickle. However, certain drawbacks, such as an elevated price point (approximately $15 for a single serving) and underwhelming smoked meat (dry, salty, and excessively processed), tempered our enthusiasm. Ultimately, the dining experience was merely satisfactory, making it challenging to persuade my companion to venture forth and sample smoked meat once more."

Enjoyed the beautiful weather sitting on the terrace at the Wynn but our service was horrendous.  \"I'll be right back\" translated into \"I'll be back in 15 minutes\".  Same as \"your order will be right out\" meaning \"I have not even put your order into the kitchen yet.\"  It took 35 minutes to get our food after we ordered it and the food was not that impressive.  My omelette was subpar, the hashbrowns were inedible and the french toast tasted almost burnt.  However, the black angus burger was delicious and after tasting my husband's burger I knew I made a mistake in ordering.  Don't go here if you are in a hurry and sit outside if the weather is nice so that at least the atmosphere will make up for the crappy service and mediocre food.

Wynn, you have got to be absolutely, positively, unequivocally kidding me! I am well aware that you provide your employees with fare significantly superior to this in the cafeteria; thus, it is utterly unacceptable that the majority of the dishes served during my recent visit were of a quality that could, at best, be described as 'perfunctory.' Furthermore, I find it nothing short of egregious that you would have the audacity to charge a whopping forty dollars for a breakfast that did not even include lox with the bagels! I must say, I am thoroughly disillusioned and shall never again darken the doors of your establishment.  

The only redeeming feature of the culinary offerings was the desserts, which, while undoubtedly delectable, hardly justified the exorbitant prices charged for the rest of the meal. The sushi, I must say, was akin to something one might find at a roadside convenience store - utterly unfit for human consumption, in other words. Needless to say, I strongly advise anyone considering dining at your establishment to first confirm whether or not breakfast is indeed being served, lest they fall prey to the same trap I did and end up paying an exorbitant sum for a few paltry pancakes and slices of bacon. The wait, I must add, was utterly interminable - a full hour and thirty minutes for food that was, at best, mediocre. In conclusion, I must say that I shall never again set foot in your restaurant, and I strongly advise others to follow suit.

Perhaps our expectations were excessively elevated, or possibly we merely failed to perceive the ostensible appeal, but the generally acclaimed and ardently cherished Honey Salt did not quite live up to its prodigious reputation, at least in our experience. Following an amicable encounter with the accommodating bartender during lunch, we embarked upon a gastronomical excursion that unfortunately proved somewhat disappointing. Specifically, the initial offering of calamari was characterized by an unfortunate rubberiness and an unpleasant greasiness that bordered on the inedible, thereby establishing a less-than-auspicious beginning. Subsequently, we opted to share the renowned Biloxi chicken sandwich, which, regrettably, exhibited a notable lack of moisture and a certain blandness, coupled with the My Wife's Favorite Salad (featuring duck confit), an uninspired assemblage that neglected to impress. Furthermore, the Caesar salad, adorned with an unpalatable abundance of kale, tragically fell short of our expectations, its flavor profile reduced to a barely perceptible hint of saltiness derived from the minute shreds of overcooked, previously prepared fried egg situated atop the bed of wilted lettuce. Fortunately, the attentive bartender, cognizant of the unappealing nature of the offending egg, graciously provided a fresh, properly cooked alternative, thus salvaging the dish from utter disaster. In conclusion, while no compelling reason exists to revisit this establishment solely for culinary purposes, the possibility of encountering Carrot Top at the bar may, for some, constitute a moderately enticing incentive.

I went in on my lunch break one day to try out their bento boxes.  I ordered brown rice, garlic noodles, diced salmon, and diced filet mignon.  As you can tell with the pictures posted on here, Volcano Grille tries to bring a menu filled with healthful options (salad, choice of carbs, and protein). While this may be the case, flavor should not be compromised. I was actually a bit disappointed because their food was not packed with flavor.  I understand that they have a bunch of different sauces to pick from and take to go, but at least make the flavors of the actual food stand for themselves.  And no, the seasoning of the garlic on the noodles, and the rub on the fish did not really help.  

Besides their food being a level or two above the borderline of bland, staff was really helpful.  The noise level is a bit average here, not loud at all.  The dining area was very clean, so I appreciate that.  

I would say that if you do not really want to be impressed and are looking for just "ok" food that you can just smother a bunch of sauces and sriracha on, consider going here.

My girlfriend dragged me here because she wanted to have some all-you-can-eat crab legs.
At 7pm the place was packed but we were seated quickly. You do not pay 1st here. Drinks are extra.
Well the buffet is really small and all bad asian food. lots of shrimp and fish and some crab legs, a few plates of sushi on plates covered in saran wrap.
The dessert bar was a joke-generic cookies and stale bad cake. Fruit and pudding with soft serve ice cream.
We were there for an hour-I made 5 trips & not once did they change out any food. The spare ribs looked terrible and everyone noticed because it was busy & nobody ate any. The crab was the winner.Everyone was loading up plates of crab. Myself I'm not into seafood.

I see others have given this a positive review because its cheap but thats they only positive thing here. The food is not real impressive but there is all you can eat ice cream

check here for pics @ http://www.usmenuguide.com/krazybuffetmenupics.html

They move you from chair to chair as you have services done.  They did not have enough staff and Lannie was working on two customers at the same time.

When I went to wash my hands the sinks were dirty especially around the faucets.

Not impressed.

The good: the cupcakes! We got a four-pack of, I believe, red velvet, pink champagne, smores, and the peanut butter chocolate one. They were all good, though I'm not sure what the pink champagne was supposed to taste like - it was a little odd, but you know, it's a cupcake. So I ate it. They're moist, the frosting is good, and that's what matters. 

The not-so good: when we went in there were a few people there, not sure if they were the owners or their employees (they looked to be in their mid twenties or so) and they were all kinda.. rude. They just gave us this dead stare and seemed really impatient with us, even though we came in at a dead as hell time (monday afternoon, pre-lunch, since we were out). It just seemed like they wanted us to get OUT asap. After trying a few more flavors, the orange creamsicle and strawberry cupcakes taste really artificial and have a heavy chemical smell - ick.

On the chalkboard it said, "Can't say anything about customer service, but the cupcakes are good!" and I feel as though that sums this place up perfectly.

First: The food tastes all right, albeit very salty. However, after eating here for some time I had to stop. Unsure if it's the salt content or the amount of processed ingredients, but I feel terrible after eating here. 
Which is sad, because I have a soft spot for the po'boy.

Sum up: if you don't mind indulging in junk food that's still vegan, this is a good place. It's convenient, it's fast, and it's pretty relaxed. 
But if you're looking for something nutritious and clean, there are other places.

I was craving some BBQ and took my mom here.  The menu looked like it had great potential and our mouths watered from the variety of offerings.

The biscuits were a bit heavy, but were tasty.  We split a two-meat combo. It was massive!!  We ordered the beef and the St. Louis ribs.  Both were on the tough side.  I had to ask the server if it was St. Louis or baby back ribs on the plate - because there was hardly any meat on it!  I was told St. Louis, but I swear they tasted like baby backs!

We also didn't care for the mashed sweet potatoes - it tasted like baby food.  We did order the apple pie and it was generous and tasted good.  Overall, it looks like it's great for gorups, has big food and drink servings, but fell short in taste and authenticity.  If I were to choose to go to a BBQ  restaurant chain, I would go to a Tony Roma's.

"Upon visiting this establishment on a Saturday, I was eager to peruse their offerings, having recently relocated to Pittsburgh from New York, where I had access to an array of exceptional juice bars. However, my expectations were not entirely met, as the selection of juices available was rather limited in scope. It is my sincere hope that the proprietors of this business will draw inspiration from esteemed establishments such as Liquiteria (http://liquiteria.com/cold-pressed-juices.php) and Juice Generation (http://www.juicegeneration.com/menu/smoothies), both of which offer a diverse array of cold-pressed juices and smoothies. Furthermore, I would suggest that they consider blending juices and smoothies on-site, as this would undoubtedly enhance the overall experience for patrons. In light of the aforementioned factors, I must express some skepticism regarding the likelihood of our return during the summer months, unless, of course, they opt to expand their menu to include a greater variety of options. Nevertheless, I extend my well wishes to the proprietors in their future endeavors."

I'm a native San Franciscan, so of  course I've been to Crustacean and Thanh Long in San Francisco. Both restaurants are to die for, but this location's food is nothing like either one. I went to Vegas about 3 years ago for a friend's birthday, so of course we had to check out the place. We ordered the garlic crab and the garlic noodles. The waiter brought out to us a crab shell stuffed with crab meat and it tasted nothing like either of their places back in the City. I was floored! There's nothing like craking your own crab. Plus it was a tad bit more expensive. The location was nice, though. We decided to order a bottle of wine and just made the best out of the evening.

Very disappointed in the overall quality and flavor of the food.  A la carte entree items, such as the curries and samosas, seemed like they might be leftovers from that day's buffet or even the day before.  The naan bread was overly plain and half-burnt without the texture and flavor I get at other Indian food places.  The food looked \"ok\" (sauces were oddly neon in color), but lacked character and the taste of each item was very one-dimensional.  We ordered all food \"mild\" on heat (although we can handle spicy food just fine), but most members of my party still got an upset stomach later that night.  Wish I could recommend this authentic looking joint to friends and family, but I can't.

Just had Father's Day lunch here. Enjoyed the food but not great service. Our server rarely came over. I was thirsty for more water 90% of the meal. Needed more salsa and had to ask someone else because our server was nowhere to be found. I get it when things are busy you cannot be everywhere but she didn't even acknowledge that we were clearly being neglected. That was my first time so could have been random bad experience.
I had ordered a pizza for the NFC championship game. I understand you could be busy but my order was cold and the cheese had dried out. Unacceptable.

I'm giving it 2 stars for the service and quickness. Now for the food, we ordered the pad Thai and the pad se ew. The pad thai was a big clump of sticky gummy ramen like noodles you could barely chew let alone swallow, but the flavor was good they need a flatter noodle and the chicken was over cooked. The pad se ew had good flavor but the noodles were not wide the pork was tough.\n\nI prefer the food at the corner Thai kitchen around the corner on trop.  Give it a try and please let me know what you think.  I jugde a Thai place on the pad Thai if they can make that well, you can bet the rest will be good too.

This establishment is vastly overhyped, relying heavily on a singular menu item of minimal culinary ingenuity (a frozen coffee beverage resembling an inferior imitation of a Mocha Ice Blended offered by Coffee Bean) to entice patrons into purchasing their exorbitantly priced fundamental fare. The sluggishness of the service is truly remarkable, particularly for a venue of modest proportions. While it may provide an acceptable setting for socializing under specific circumstances and with a compatible coterie, it falls short of expectations in numerous aspects.

The food is very good and I liked the atmosphere.  If you go for happy hour be very careful where you sit and then still ask the server.  We had a group of people on Wednesday and sat at a patio table only to find our table did not get happy hour prices.  Had we sat to the right of us at the bar or to the left of us at a different table, we would have saved about 50% on our bill.  Even the manager would not override it.  They said that we sat at a private table, this table was sandwiched between the front entrance gate and the front door of the restaurant, nothing private about it.  The waitress never mentioned it or suggested that we sit at the other table.

Waited a really long time to be seated for a mediocre birthday dinner. I ordered some sort of shrimp pasta plate.  Our meal was a long time coming after being seated. My shrimp had gone bad...really bad, so I ordered something meatless. The replacement dish took so long to arrive that I ended up eating part of my wife's  I only had a limited amount of time before an event I had to be at and couldn't wait any longer for my meal. My daughter didn't finish her plate & my wife was underwhelmed by hers (same thing I had).  It just tasted bland to me.\n\nThere are too many alternatives in this town to wait 40 minutes on \"meh\" entrees that are not inexpensive! That's what makes the world go round though. Some people swear by this chain. Just not my thing.

I ordered decorated jumbo cupcakes for a small birthday dinner party.  One of the four cupcakes was to have Happy Birthday Grandma written on it.  The cupcake had a plain white plastic circle with the happy birthday grandma written in black marker.  Wow, I'm beyond disappointed.  Tacky, sigh... too late to get something else personalized.

after dinner party .....
the white circle was fondant not plastic...still did not like how it looked
The cupcakes were delicious though.

I have NO idea why people are raving about this. I was a fan of them on the ABDC, but as a Vegas show they completely FAIL. The only good thing about the show was the music and when they did the first few moves from "Single Ladies" - that cracked me up. 

Otherwise...  the attempted "plot" was lame and made no sense (what's with the dead janitor please?) The dancers were out of sync. The costumes were boring. And the masks completely detracted from any personal connection to any dancer. 

So my rec is: if you score free tickets, watch it, but don't pay for it!

Dear Beat, 
You may be trendy, and you may be in the vicinity of an awesome center for creative space (Emergency Arts), but the hipster staff who take my order are ALWAYS snobby. Please smile and be helpful.
Except for  Heather (she's great) and the cute foreign guy; I like watching him slice my tomato.

Your food menu IS great, and though I think your coffee and espresso are not the finest, the ambiance and weekly events DO make up for that a little. I wish I could love you, but I just don't think the connection is there yet.

"While my inclination would have been to confer a more favorable rating upon Chez Claudette, certain factors precluded me from doing so. Specifically, I had placed an order for a poutine classique to be consumed off-premises, but owing to the inclement weather, I opted to consume it within the establishment, adjacent to the entrance. Our server, a Quebecois woman with a noticeable French accent, informed us that, in the future, we must consume our orders external to the premises if we are to avail ourselves of the 'to-go' option. Moreover, the poutine sauce possessed a conspicuously thick and processed quality, reminiscent of canned poutine sauce. Notwithstanding these drawbacks, the poutine remained a delectable offering, which we devoured in its entirety. It is worth noting that the cost of our diminutive poutine was comparable to that of other establishments serving similar fare, at approximately $7."

Man, the quality of Outback has really gone down since the last time I came here. I hope it was just an off night, but everything seemed to go wrong.  The menu was wrong on several occasions. My husband ordered the Sam Adams on draft. Says it should be a Boston Lager, but the Summer Ale came out. Apparently they were out of Boston Lager on tap but the server didn't tell us and didn't offer anything else. The chicken artichoke flatbread was delicious, but the menu says a \"sprinkling of parmesan cheese\". The thing was heavily covered in it. I would have asked for light cheese if I'd known it was more like a cheese crisp. I ordered the steak salad medium, it came out medium rare. Also, it didn't say that gorgonzola cheese crumbles came on it, otherwise I would have asked for those to be left off. So unfortunately I had to send it back. The manager was very polite and took the flatbread off our bill, but when he tried to explain that they were out of the Boston Lager beer and that's why we got the Summer Ale, I was a little annoyed. Okay that's fine, it would have just been nice to know that in the beginning. Don't give me excuses. All in all it was a very mediocre service and just not as good as I remember.

We experienced a pleasant culinary excursion, yet unfortunately, my spouse succumbed to a bout of food poisoning, which precipitated her awakening at the ungodly hour of 4 am, accompanied by acute gastrointestinal discomfort and persistent nausea throughout the day, rendering her unable to retain any liquid or solid substances within her digestive system, leading to extreme dehydration. Furthermore, the restaurant's management, despite their politeness, appeared to harbor suspicions that I was attempting to exploit them when I requested a partial abatement of our substantial bill, which amounted to $300, a rather sizable sum; this turn of events was quite vexing, to say the least, and left much to be desired in terms of good fortune.

"Upon embarking on a culinary excursion to Las Vegas, it is customary to partake in at least one buffet; however, this particular establishment should not be a priority on one's gastronomic itinerary. Despite offering crab legs and prime rib, the quality of these items was subpar, with the latter being excessively desiccated. Furthermore, the purported French buffet failed to present its macarons in an aesthetically pleasing manner, rendering them unappetizing. The utensils used to handle the food were also sticky and unhygienic, lacking any form of sanitization or wet wipes. The server, seemingly determined to provide exceptional customer service or perhaps seeking a generous gratuity, exhibited attentiveness towards her patrons, particularly those of Filipino descent. On Sundays, champagne is included in the meal, featuring the notable Wycliff Jean brand; however, mixing it with orange juice results in a mimosa that may not justify the $30 expense. For a more satisfying dining experience, it may be wise to allocate funds elsewhere."

Normally, I wouldn't review a chain restaurant but the service warranted me to write a review.  This review is more for the service rather than their food.  OK, first thing first, when we got sat down, our server took our drink order. She got our drink and brought our complimentary bread and we placed our order.  It took 15 minutes to get our Blossomin' Onion.  As if that wasn't enough, it took another 20 for our main dishes to get to the table.  I guess the server saw us getting annoyed and gave us a weird excuse that their computer went down.  That is such a bunch of bull because the people that got seated AFTER us got their orders no problem.  I would rather her to have told the truth rather than making a BS excuse that didn't make any lick of sense.  So we got our food after over 30 minutes has passed and I do have to say, their food is prepared well and tasted good.  We ate our dishes with gusto.  When we finally got our check,after waiting for what seemed like forever after we finished our food (10 mins of waiting) and another 5 mins to get the change.  We spent more time waiting than eating.  Now I usually give at least 20% for gratuity, but for this instance, we gave about 12% so she would know the service was blah.  At that point, I was over the service.

I am not one to write reviews but I had to on this place.  I was super excited to try this place.  It looks cool and seems to have a cool vibe.  I've been waiting for this place to work out some quirks since I have heard bad things and they have bad reviews on yelp.  I thought they are new and are just trying to find the groove.

My boyfriend and I went last night for date night. We saw all the bad reviews, then a couple good reviews showed up and we thought let's give this place a shot, maybe the other reviewers are just not used to this style of Mexican food.  The price is what I would expect at a this kind of place but the food was not.  The chips and salsa were great but the two entrees we got were sooooo bland.  Where is the flavor, it seems to be non-existent.

Our server was great, she even offered to take one of the entrees off the bill.  Which I think is super cool because I assumed we would just pay for them and be unhappy.

Bottom line, I will not come back for food!

I did see they have happy hour and I have heard the margaritas are good, so I will come back and try the discounted margaritas some time. Maybe if we drink a couple margaritas we won't care that the food is bland.

A decidedly unremarkable athletic pub. Advantages:  well-maintained, visually appealing (albeit somewhat antiseptic) ambiance; congenial, accommodating, and pulchritudinous personnel; expansive televisions and colossal projection screens, ensuring an optimal viewing experience from any seat. Drawbacks:  limited selection of artisanal draft beers; uninspired bill of fare with underseasoned comestibles (specifically, the Southwest Turkey sandwich lacked flavor, while the accompanying coleslaw was devoid of vitality); prolonged interval of ten minutes elapsed before receiving an initial beverage, even during a tranquil Sunday evening. Would confer supplementary celestial bodies for ameliorating any singular aspect, and two stars if all deficiencies were addressed.

Yet another Asian-inspired food chain! Oh c'mon do we need this in Champaign? We have so many Chinese/Korean restaurants in campustown and honestly, they are way better than Flat Top. 

So, the whole stir-fry concept that they have is actually Mongolian BBQ. The difference is that they have tonnes of raw vegetables and ingredients to choose from. Oh, not to mention, weird sauces and food combinations. My combo was okay (it was brown rice, clams, beef, vege, salmon and roti prata) but if you don't have a sense of what goes with what, then your dinner is going to be a disaster. 

It's clever of them to have this pick-your-own-ingredients kinda concept because if the food was bad and you complained, they can point their fingers back at you and say that you chose the ingredients. Then again, you are not the only culprit. The grill sensei is responsible as well. If he over-grilled your food, it will taste just as bad no matter how wonderful your selections are. My friend's moo shu was not wrapped very well and some of the rolls fell apart. Well, there goes your dinner. 

I think it is good to try it once but more that once? You decide. Still, the combo of rice, salmon and roti prata bothers me. Maybe I am just a stuck-up purist who thinks that chickpea dhal is the only way to go. Could this be a one-hit wonder like Bar Louie? We'll have to see.

Scale of 1-10 (single visit):
5 Food
6 Service
7 Atmosphere
8 Value

By no means the best sushi.  Though weird as this sounds, grab some creme puffs!  Those are great!  But probably just from Costco.

They were also unable to figure out when we were done eating (lots of stacked empty plates with no one left eating?), so the payout was slow.  And during lunch table turns should be fast b/c people have to get back to work.

Here's the cool part:  You don't (but you can) order off a menu.  You grab covered food off a conveyor belt that rides around the restaurant.  Apparently this is common in Japan.  I'd never experienced this before.  And the items are cheap ($1-$2), so you kind of just grab what tickles your fancy.

I utilized him, Paul, about 3 years ago for a termite problem.  I picked him based on Yelp reviews.  He did the treatment and then had to come back to retreat about 4 months after the original application.  I called him on the phone and he said he would come back but he was not going to make anything since it was under warranty.  When he came to the house again he made it very clear that this was costing him money because it was all under warranty.  I have never experienced having a business owner try to make me feel bad for asking them to honor their warranty, a warranty that I paid extra for.  I will never utilize his services again.

Shucks..a bit disappointed, last night I took family for the first time hoping to have the same experience as we did for about 10 times. The Clam Bake was the reason we always go on a Sat to have the $5 off, found that it wasn't anymore...crabs was an added option and you had to pay extra for it. It was still tasty but we should have gone to a buffet for the price we paid...It was still tasty though...Sadly..Shucks is now not on the top of my list..for value as the prices went up immensely...

The pizza is pretty good. Especially at 2am. But when it takes over an hour for delivery, no thank you. I shouldn't have to call 3 times to find out where my pizza is. Then when he finally showed up he asked for a tip. That's the best way to not get a tip.

I Went here with my girlfriend last week for dinner, and I wasn't to impressed. The waitress was nice and accommodating but the food took forever to come out and there was only a couple other parties in the restaurant. When we finally got our food my girlfriends chicken was still raw. The waitress took it off of our bill and she sent it back to finish cooking. A little while longer it came back fully cooked. It did not have a lot of flavor but at that point we were just happy the food was there and it was safe to eat. I wouldn't recommend eating dinner here, but it is a good place for desserts.

I find it strange that people like this place. The food is not good at all. I adore anything chilli cheese..and all of their chilli cheese stuff is pretty gross. I can make better hot dogs at home. I only keep coming back for their ice cream and lemonade float. Yum. But I really dislike the food. I've tried everything on the menu and have to keep coming back here..my favorite food is the jalapeno poppers which are delicious. I just buy a bunch of those.

This is from a visit about a month ago.   I had a burger and a couple beers and my wife had a chicken flat-bread and a couple cocktails.  My fries were limp and overdone and the burger was lukewarm when served.  My wife's food quality OK.  The one thing that stood out was the lack of any urgency whatever to service.  I didn't time the wait staff or anything like that, but there were delays being seated, getting a menu, getting drink reorders, getting food orders from the kitchen, and finally, getting a check.  It was very obvious to me that the slot players and a couple \"regulars\" got a ton of attention and prompt service from the staff---everyone else, not so much.  Docked Mr. John a star for crappy service.  Even though I live close, there are so many consistently better neighborhood joints and I won't choose to return.

This culinary establishment offers fare that is economically priced, ostensibly due to its perceived quality. The egg rolls possess an unmistakable texture reminiscent of flour, while the fried rice lacks both flavor and warmth. Although the vegetables in the vegetable lo mein exhibit a satisfying crunch and freshness, their taste is overpowered by an excessive amount of garlic, rendering them unpalatable. The eatery's location, situated on a rather unsavory thoroughfare, belies its interior, which boasts cleanliness and relative tranquility. Given the abundance of Chinese restaurants in Madison, it remains unclear why patrons would opt to dine at this particular venue.

It's not enough to inspire me to change the star rating on my review, but it is worth noting that David, the General Manager of Rice and Company, contacted me to express his concern and regret about the lack of service I received on my visit. That's the kind of attention to customers I would have liked while I was at the restaurant. Maybe there will be some kind of trickle down effect, or whatever the economic term might be, but doubtful I'll volunteer to test that firsthand the next time I'm in town.

Obviously great selection of Rebel merchandise but outrageous prices. Seriously, the prices are almost twice what they should be. Why does the same hat cost $30 here, $20 at the ballgame, and $16 online from the manufacturer? But... If you want nice Rebelbilia, they've got stuff here that no one else carries. Bring a few quarters for parking.

"Initially, it became apparent that their apparel was organized according to hue, rather than being categorized by dimensions, which, although aesthetically pleasing to the proprietors of second-hand establishments, proved to be inconvenient for prospective patrons seeking attire in a specific size. Additionally, the cost of their merchandise was exorbitant, with many items that piqued my interest available for purchase at a marginally higher price if acquired brand new, thereby rendering the premium prices incongruous with the unkempt and unsanitary state of the store; consequently, we will not be revisiting this particular location."

If we could get my g-parents network switched over, I'd NEVER have them return to this St Lukes.  Quality of care seriously depends on who's on shift and what floor you're on.  Cath-Lab and ICU staff has always been fantastic, but staff on the 7th floor is a hit or a miss.  Likewise with staff in the ER. \n\nSeriously makes me wonder WHY some people get into the medical field, when they clearly are not cut out for working in that type of environment.

It started out really well. Was seated in less than 10 minutes and our server started out great, but it went downhill from there. \nThe food was great but they forgot our appetizer. Trying to find our server was impossible. Had to keep asking for refills n they forgot to bring out the dessert for my friends bday. When it came to paying the check....once again had to find the server. Keep in mind it wasn't that busy.  Got the busboy to finally take our check. Maybe ill just try another location.

Pizza was ok.. I ordered Vinnies, which is your choice of 5 toppings.  Italian sausage, black olives, onions, garlic and basil.  It wasn't bad - but it wasn't great either.  \n\nThe server was exceptionally friendly and helpful - but the service was the high point of the experience.

The food is good, but it is very annoying that they will deliver to my house some days and not other days..... Your delivery range is 3 miles and grub hub says I live 2.8 miles away, mapquest says 3.3.  Either way I think its close enough.  Don't be jerks and deliver me some damn Asian food when I want it, not just on days when you have nothing better to do.

My car became disabled in my garage.  Called this towing company on the recommendation from my car dealer.  1st call placed at 10:30am and was told it would be about 90 min.  12:30pm, still no tow.  I called back at this point and was told it would be 30 min and....she took my information again...what did she do lose it or maybe she forgot to order in the first place.  Ugh.  1:30pm (3 hrs. now)  I contemplated calling another company and then I though what if they both came together or the 1st one came for nothing.   So, I still waited (it's not like I'm going anywhere, right?) Finally 2:30pm they arrived.    4hrs people!!!   and not even a call from the office to say oh they're busy or running behind, nothing.  The guy was nice enough, but had a lot of difficulty jumping it to get it out of garage.  I stood and watch as he hooked up the chains and started to pull it onto truck, I'm thinking there must be something I have to sign, so I stepped in the driveway and away he pulls. No goodbye, no thank you, no I'm sorry it took so long.  \nI will never use them again.\nDoesn't anybody give good customer service anymore???????

Went here for lunch today. Ordered two burgers and a large cajun fry to share. We waited for about 15mins for our food. Normally we would not have minded but we were the ONLY people in the place. When we got our food our fries were not cajun so we brought them back to the counter. The gentleman at the counter, larger guy with glasses, asked us if we want them remade, we said yes. Then he said, \"Actually, here is some seasoning\" He gave us one container of cajun seasoning. We said we would prefer them remade, it tastes great fresh and with the seasoning. At that point, he was ignoring us so we just went back to our table and began eating. \n\nI'm not impressed with their lack of customer service. We ordered something, we should get it. I've had much better service at the location on Val Vista and Baseline at Dana Park. I would drive the extra miles to get great service and quality food.

Found the place to be average at best. Pancakes were not very good. They tasted like they were made from a mix, mushy in the middle, and they came with powdered sugar which I don't like (wish the server told me beforehand). Average wait time to be seated and for food to arrive. OJ was pretty bad as well- like the cheap stuff you get from the grocery store. I like the fact the place is not a chain, and I'd be up for trying other food there, but from my experience the pancakes do not live up to the hype.

I would give STK in Vegas 5 stars but they have the worst customer service so 2stars for them. Blonde chick that checked our RSVP was a snob... Really bitch get a real job. Make sure to have the entire party present otherwise the last person to arrive won't be able to order her food and will just have to share with the others. The waiter rushed us and asked \"are you done now?\" Didn't ask if we wanted to take any food to go and just grabbed our plates while one of my friend was still eating. So we took our time to order and eat desserts and left 10% tip instead of 20% on 400$ tab. No need to be rude when you're making minimum wage, idc if you're busy, they shouldn't have booked 100 ppl in a 50ppl max capacity room. \n\nOther than the horrible customer service, food here is delicious!

Pathetic, utterly deplorable, and patently unacceptable, charging exorbitant fees for a meager glimpse of automotive masterpieces cordoned off by flimsy barriers, thereby denying enthusiasts the opportunity for an up-close examination and tactile experience with these magnificent machines. A glaring contrast to the welcoming atmosphere fostered by the Arizona Ferrari dealership, where an extensive array of vehicles is accessible for perusal at one's leisure, sans the burdensome constraints imposed by the aforementioned venue. A veritable travesty, leaving visitors feeling shortchanged and disillusioned.

It transpires that consuming sustenance at this establishment, while maintaining a semblance of decorum, is tantamount to engaging in a game of chance, wherein the culinary offerings are consistently passable but hardly exceptional, whereas the quality of service is contingent upon one's ability to conjure fortuitous circumstances.

Second time here, ordered a Greek Salad with Chicken Kabob.. the plate was so small i couldn't cut my chicken or even fork out the cheap iceberg lettuce without some falling on the table, chicken was way too saucy as well. Stick to a gyro, had that last time and it was golden. Seems like good people, they are nice.

We tried this place on a whim today and our experience was mixed. The tofu summer rolls were good but not great, the lemongrass soup was stellar, and my pad se ew was good but a bit too sweet. My husband's experience was bad enough that we probably won't go back, unfortunately. My husband hates coconut and ordered the Penang curry on the understanding that it was not prepared with coconut milk. Unfortunately, our very nice server was wrong (the dish was tasty but for the coconut). My husband exchanged his dish for the pad Thai but that dish was very sweet with a hot pepper kick. Overall, Curry on Murray gets a thumbs up for decor and service but the food is merely OK.

"Individuals were expressing to us that they were experiencing such intense hilarity that it precipitated lacrimation. However, we did not encounter a considerable amount of mirth or sorrow. It remains uncertain whether this was due to our inability to establish a connection with the content or whether it was attributable to some other factor. Nonetheless, this program appears to be tailored towards an audience of individuals aged 45 and above."

We made the decision to visit this establishment based on perusing various reviews; however, my expectations were unfortunately not met, as this coffee shop proved to be nothing extraordinary.  Accompanied by my spouse and one of our twin children, I had intended to order the breakfast burrito, but I expressed a preference for turkey sausage instead of the customary pork sausage.  Unfortunately, the young woman behind the counter informed me that accommodating my request was not feasible.  Thus, I opted for the turkey sausage, egg, and cheese on an English muffin instead.  When I requested a scrambled egg for my infant daughter, the counter attendant regretfully stated that their eggs are pre-cooked into patties, which lacked appeal, much like my running shoes post-workout.  Consequently, I elected to cancel the food order and solely pay for the coffee and bottled orange juice I had purchased for my baby.  It is unfortunate, as I am perpetually seeking suitable breakfast locales.

Trying too hard to be upscale, with none of the effort you would expect to accompany such high prices and professional demeanor. I don't mind paying more for quality, but the only thing that was 5 star was the view and the price.

Seriously!!!  I would never ever pay $50.00 for a pedicure EVER.. Well again and I wouldn't have paid it this time NEITHER.  We asked for pricing, I stated what I wanted  and the only change i made from time of check in to done was that I now wanted french tips.  Had I wanted to spend this kind of money, i would have gone to TheBathHouse.\n\nthe other thing that puzzled me was \"why, were they mopping the floor at 9 am in the morning, when the salon JUST opened\"  Who really wants to be at a Salon when they are cleaning up yesterday mess.

"It was a Thursday evening when we arrived at the club, and it proved to be a rather uncomfortable and lackluster experience. Despite our group of nine individuals receiving complimentary admission, allegedly due to the promoter's courtesy, the ambiance within the venue was underwhelming. As a first-time visitor to Las Vegas and club-goer, my expectations were not met, as the atmosphere was characterized by a pervasive sense of apathy among the clientele, who primarily consisted of older individuals. The only accessible area was the rooftop outdoor patio, which made socializing a challenge due to the throng of mature women and men. Furthermore, there was only one bar available, which was severely overburdened, leading to extended wait times for beverages. Ultimately, our visit was disappointing, and we have not returned to the establishment since."

Service was good, but that is all I can probably say about this place, because the food wasn't.

I ordered the Tuscana Sausage Soup, the potatoes in it weren't cooked/boiled all the way, it was sort of too salty, but the sausage in there was pretty good.

Build your own Pasta seemed like a good choice besides Pizza, but I was wrong. I chose spaghetti, bologonese sauce (meat sauce), meatballs and mushrooms for my pasta. It came out to around $22 - 24 for the pasta and those two added ingredients. While the spaghetti and sauce tasted fine, it wasn't hot, it was semi warm, and everything else that came with it. The meat balls tasted like frozen meat balls from the market, it was also warm like the pasta.

All in all, I didn't like the pasta, maybe I will opt for a slice of pizza instead.

I did not like this place.  I was into the retro look and 'dive' appeal but it basically a dive without anything GOOD about it.  It isn't the cheapest place and the burgers were not that good at all.  Setup is awkward, hard to get inside for soda refills.  I think this place only survives due to tourists.  They don't know any better.  I would not go back.

What to say. Our waitress was so incredibly rude.  If my food wasn't good then I would give have given it one star. This was my first and last time going there. There is another bar/grill a few doors down that is so much better and less expensive. The only good thing about this place is that there are vegetarian items on the menu.

I fervently desire that I could have successfully established communication with Sherry's Pampered Pets, thereby enabling me to procure the reservation that I deemed essential. However, despite my concerted efforts, which included two telephone calls and an unreturned voicemail, I was unable to progress beyond the initial stage of securing said reservation. Following a protracted period of three to four days, during which I awaited a response to my voice message in vain, I opted to pursue alternative arrangements. It is utterly unfeasible for me to consider entrusting my canine companion to your care if I am unable to attain a responsive dialogue with your organization.

Was in one night for a show next door, but decided to go cheap.  Cheep it was!  All show and no go.  It's a beautiful hotel from the outside, but I think It is just old now, and service didn't help.   We were getting a \"non smoking\" room, but we got to the room and it was really stinky and smokey.  I called and they said just come down to the \"manager's desk\" and they will get us a new room, so we hiked down and not one person was willing to help us.  When we finally got to someone, she rudely said go to the desk at the very end.  We did, and no one was there.  Waited 10 minuted before going to here again, and she was just annoyed at this point with me.  She told me to wait there and someone would help me.  So I did, and about  10 minutes later, someone stumbled down to us and told us to go the the OTHER SIDE!  If you have been here, it is a long desk!  Especially when you have 2 full bottles in your bag, ha ha.  \nOverall, just a bad customer service experience, maybe if we were there 1 hour prior, it would've just been an old hotel and not so horrible.  Would I stay again?  Only if I HAD to save money and the show was next door.  Other than that, yeah no.

"Due to the dearth of adequate Chinese cuisine in my immediate vicinity, I opted to venture slightly further afield to sample the culinary offerings of Chopstix, based on the acclaim bestowed upon it by patrons. Unfortunately, the establishment's card reader was non-functional, prompting the staff member attending to me to request that I procure cash to facilitate the transaction. In light of this, I undertook a brief excursion to the nearest automated teller machine located within Smiths, incurring an additional fee of three dollars due to the fact that it was not affiliated with my financial institution. Upon my return, I found the premises devoid of any other patrons, with the same staff member who had initially attended to me now engaged in a personal telephone conversation on his mobile device, utterly disregarding my presence. I persisted in waiting for several minutes, during which time another employee was occupied at the counter, similarly neglecting to acknowledge me. Eventually, he glance up and enquired if he could provide assistance, to which I replied that I wished to settle the payment for my meal. At this point, the previously engaged staff member finally terminated his phone call and accepted my payment, without offering any expression of regret, discount, or token of appreciation for my trouble. The culinary items I selected, specifically wor wonton soup, house fried rice, and orange chicken, were satisfactory, but the experience was significantly marred by the unacceptable level of service, rendering future visits unlikely."

No. With all of your other options in Vegas for buffets (Wicked Spoon, Bacchanal), this just doesn't cut it. Food was dry, sitting out too long, and the cheaper price attracts a ...cheaper crowd...if you know what I mean. You're in Vegas, spring for the good buffet!

"The culinary experience was merely satisfactory, and the prices of the menu items were slightly excessive. I opted for the street-style pork sandwich, and the meat was cooked to a palatable doneness akin to a blue rare. However, the sandwich itself was diminutive in size, akin to a small biscuit, and the portion was disappointingly inadequate. Prior to this, I had ordered a pork taco with green salsa, whose name escapes me at present, and while the pork was cooked to perfection, the tortilla was regrettably soggy due to the pork's grease. My companion had dim sum, which, although not substantially sized, was accompanied by an unpleasant odor, according to her account; however, the taste was reportedly acceptable. In conclusion, the establishment fell short of expectations, and I would not consider revisiting it. It is worth mentioning that the beverages served are presented in bottles, which precludes the possibility of complimentary refills. Furthermore, these bottles vary in size, and depending on the selection, the quantity received may be less than anticipated, with certain bottles containing less contents than others. I would not recommend this venue to anyone, as the prices are exorbitant, and the cuisine is unappealing."

Our first visit here. The service was great. Our waitress was very friendly and helpful. The location is priceless. Westgate  is a super fun place to hang out. Too bad the pizza wasn't so great. It tasted like a frozen pizza I could have cooked at home! Bland. Sauce was gross. Crust was thin and too soft. Its too bad. Given the location and competition... the pizza shod be much better! Too many other choices!

"The personnel exhibited a profound lack of impressiveness, their culinary offerings were merely adequate, and the prices were exorbitant relative to the quality provided. It appears that management is endeavoring to establish an upmarket eatery, but significant strides must be taken before such a lofty goal can be attained. The wine selection is meager, portion sizes are minuscule, and the service staff exudes an air of haughtiness. In comparison to other dining establishments within the city limits of Charlotte, this establishment falls short in numerous aspects."

I've been wanting to try this place for a while. Now that have, I'm good. 

It's the kind of place you go to after a night of partying when your standards aren't so high. It wasn't all THAT bad, but not great  either.  

I judge Latin-style restaurants on their chips and salsa. If it's not good, I know what to expect from their kitchen. With that said..
the chips were greasy and salsa tasted like Pace picante. 

I had the two taco plate of grilled chicken and steak tacos with re-fried beans and rice. The grilled steak taco had good flavor, but the chicken was VERY dry. I added lime and salsa to try and moisten it up. All and all...it was decent, but not any better quality than a late night taco place. 

Service was ok.

We indulged in a brief sojourn at this establishment during a recent family excursion, and our experience was largely satisfactory, with the accommodations and sanitary facilities being suitably clean and well-maintained.  Its proximity to Interstate 77 rendered it an ideal location for those seeking convenience, while its close proximity to a premier shopping center further augmented its appeal.  However, upon our return visit a mere year later, certain aspects of our lodgings did not meet our expectations, specifically in regards to the tidiness of the bathing area and the excessive noise emanating from the air conditioning unit, which significantly impaired our ability to obtain a restful night's slumber.  Despite these issues, the hospitality displayed by the staff remained consistent and cordial, yet we may opt to explore alternative accommodations in the future.

"Underwhelming culinary experience with too much repetition."

The text is: "Cool restaurant great neighborhood concept but the food is so bland. Store bought chips for the dips. Kids Mac and cheese is gritty and flavorless. Chicken in salad is overcooked and not seasoned. Heaping pile of raw arugula on my pizza. Salt is a great resource. Thanks but no thanks, not again."

The modified text is:

"Amidst an ambiance of trendy sophistication, the gastronomic offerings of this establishment fail to deliver a palatable experience, marred by an uninspired selection of flavors and questionable preparation methods. The utilization of store-bought chips as a complement to dips raises questions about the quality of ingredients used in the kitchen. Moreover, the kids' macaroni and cheese dish disappoints with its lackluster taste and unpleasant texture, while the chicken in the salad suffers from overcooking and an absence of discernible seasoning. Topping it all off, a generous portion of raw arugula threatens to overwhelm the senses, rendering the pizza unbalanced and inharmonious. Notwithstanding the value of salt as a culinary staple, the overall impression of this dining excursion sadly falls short of expectations, making future visits unlikely."

The food is still great and terrific value for $4, but unfortunately the `douche factor` has gone up to 11! I should have known better when I heard some fat suit walk out with three others and say `4 people for under $30, what a deal!` I was like, oh no, they`ve invaded it. I got there at around 1:20pm after the Friday lunch rush and usually it`s some students or a couple having a late lunch, now it`s full of soccer moms and cheap douchebag suits who found out about it on FB or Yelp, please stop these greedy people from making long line ups impossible to eat good food!!!

"It is utterly disappointing to discover that there are no reservations available post 5 o'clock, which unfortunately coincides with my schedule and renders the establishment unsuitable for my purposes. Furthermore, the absence of a phone charging station within the premises is a significant inconvenience that hinders my ability to maintain communication with my associates during my visit. Notwithstanding these shortcomings, the service provided by the waitstaff, particularly the exceptional and remarkable performance of the waitress, deserves recognition and commendation. However, the inexperienced nature of the new bartender resulted in an extended duration for the preparation of my desired beverage, thereby necessitating additional time expenditure on my part. In light of these factors, I regretfully conclude that future visits to this establishment after 5 p.m. are unlikely."

For a pizza spot with a vegan menu....this place had no vegan options after 1030p? Of course every other pizza option was offered but no vegan style pizza. As a past customer I feel so let down. They should at least offer some type of vegan pizza late at night same as the rest of the pizza styles. And no offer to have a pizza made either. I think that's whack costumer service. Again....feeling let down. :(

"The solitary motivation that would compel my return is the presence of a musical ensemble that warrants my attendance to such an extent that missing their performance would be unthinkable. Having stated this, I shall proceed to expound upon the aspects of the venue that elicited my approbation, commencing with the security personnel who exhibited remarkable cordiality and accommodatingness, particularly when my companion opted to seize the opportunity to propose to his significant other, for which I extend my sincerest gratitude. However, I must caution potential attendees against the exorbitant parking fees and limited availability of spaces, which necessitates arriving prematurely to secure a suitable parking spot. Furthermore, while the sonic quality of the performances was passable, it fell short of excellence, a sentiment that I dare say was shared by numerous patrons. Lastly, I must express my indignation at the egregious prices charged for beverages, which, coupled with the aforementioned limitations, leads me to label this establishment as one that exploits its privileged position as a primary host of notable touring acts. In conclusion, I implore prospective concertgoers to exercise fiscal prudence and either abstain from consuming alcoholic beverages or surreptitiously introduce them into the venue, a practice that, albeit unethical, seems necessary given the exorbitant rates charged by the management."

"My culinary predilection gravitates towards the notion of relishing in savory, wholesome gastronomy. Following four consecutive excursions to this establishment, my expectations have been utterly disillusioned, as the eatery has persistently failed to deliver a reliable dining experience. During my maiden visit, the fare was palatable, yet the hospitality was regrettably subpar. On my second foray, I opted for their signature flatbread, only to discover that it was conspicuously absent from the menu. Perplexed, I settled for a barbecue beef sandwich, which, to my surprise, was quite delectable. Alas, the accompanying sweet potato fries were unfortunate casualties of an egregious culinary misstep, having been charred to an unsightly, inedible state. This blatant display of gastronomical negligence only served to deepen my skepticism. My third visit proved equally underwhelming, with the kitchen seemingly struggling to maintain even a semblance of consistency. Succumbing to curiosity, I decided to sample their morning fare on my fourth visit. An hour beyond the appointed opening time, I found myself standing in a vacant dining area, with nary a soul in sight, nor any discernible indication of a breakfast menu. After a full four minutes of being ignored by the indifferent staff, a solitary employee finally acknowledged my presence with a tardy greeting. It is with profound disappointment that I must conclude that this establishment has failed to meet my expectations and, accordingly, cannot be recommended."

I have been to this location many times, and let me say that Einstein's is vastly superior as far as bagels are concerned. That stated, Bruegger's does serve good softwiches...however, I could get better bread and bagels elsewhere.

There ought to be a law prohibiting Greek restaurants from going corporate.  I expect my Greek restaurants to be family owned and run by ugly, hairy, overweight Greeks (this includes the men and the women).  In fact, the uglier the better, as I suspect there is an inverse relationship between the quality of Greek food and \"looks\" of the restauranteur.  Wasn't there a movie about fat Greeks who owned a diner.... wait... I need to grab some Windex I'm getting a pimple.\n\nAnyway, Daphne's proves my point.  I was in the mood for meat, bread and french fries and Daphne's was nearby.  I would call my gyro a \"styro-gyro\".  The meat was cold and tasteless and had been carved hours earlier.  The pita bread reminded me of an old sun rotted Frisbee that sat on the side of the house all summer.  It crumbled into pieces.  The french fries were hot, but I could taste the frozen bag they came in.  The only high point is that they offer this really tasty diet Soba grapefruit flavored drink at their soda fountain.  That was one tasty diet drink.  Oopah!

"Oh my goodness! Beverages passable, yet the hospitality leaves much to be desired. Attempted to reserve a table five days in advance; alas, no one picked up the phone, and I relinquished my efforts as the Germany versus Brazil Blitzkrieg was about to begin. Followed up with a call two days later, engaging in an extensive colloquy regarding seating arrangements for our group, ultimately securing a high table by the window. Upon arrival at the appointed hour, our table was assigned to another party, and the staff seemed oblivious to our reservation. Fortunately, a couple of members of our group failed to show up, as their absence allowed us to retain a sizable table, which had been emphasized during the booking process. Witnessed four walk-in patrons being served before us, despite their tardiness. No acknowledgment was offered upon our arrival, and it took approximately forty minutes to receive our beveragesâcocktails that required nearly twenty-five minutes from the time of ordering before they were served, and even then, we had to request them repeatedly. Additionally, it took ten minutes beyond that to obtain snacks, which we had to request again. The young man who eventually attended to us was quite pleasant, but he did not arrive until twenty-five minutes into our visit, as he appeared to be more cognizant of our needs than the female server who initially attended to us. In conclusion, I would not recommend Juniper; in fact, I would have departed without hesitation had I not possessed a voucher, which, ironically, was a second chance gift following my friend's unfortunate experiences with poor service at this establishment."

"The establishment in question boasts a proficient and skilled team of mixologists, with a few notable exceptions. It is advisable to exercise caution when selecting a bartender, as the quality of service can vary greatly depending on the individual attending to your needs. While some bartenders demonstrate exceptional expertise and dedication to their craft, others may fall short of expectations, thereby compromising the overall experience. As such, it is recommended that patrons visiting this establishment refrain from frequenting it on specific days of the week, lest they risk encountering subpar service."

2/5 for great people working there, and the friendly vibe you get just walking in the door. BAM, smells like a pickling factory but do not fear, the bar area looks fun. Our experience was bad however-- the noodles in our ramen were cooked Al Dente, and you know what that means once an amalgam of them begins to expand in your stomach. They definitely weren't cooked all the way, so thus, I felt like I was going to LITERALLY lose my food after I finished a relatively small bowl. Yeah, I'm a small person, but you know, I can still eat! I just felt so sick afterwards.

The spinach- strange & refreshing.
The carrots- lovely.
The pork- cold, but good.
The nori- you know, your standard nori.
The broth- yeah, a little salty, but good. We tried the Pai Ton, the tonkotsu broth without the Pork ordeal.


But the noodles! They made me so sick, and I really want to love this place because their ramen is so diverse. After the meal, one of the friendly staff members made us some little non-alcoholic shots, so like I said-- SUPER NICE people! I just can't handle their style of food, it doesn't agree with me at all. If you're sensitive like me, try Cherry Blossom Noodle Cafe-- they'll be a more classic and authentic option for you. 
Cheers!

Initial impression when arriving set my standards high as well as the hype over this place. I love the decor and feel of the place itself, but the pizza was over-priced for thin and hard to eat cause the toppings just slid off. Also ordered the cheesy bread which i'd honestly prefer Little Caesar's over here. \nThe waitress was nice but disappeared for loooong periods of time. \nI'd be willing to try again but try something other than Piza cause the Calzone looked good.

"While our culinary excursion garnered a mere four stars, primarily due to the unbalanced composition of our dishes, specifically the excessive cheesiness of the chili and the overwhelming oiliness of the beef stroganoff, which respectively hindered the palatability of both dishes, we must commend the prompt and attentive service proffered by the wait staff, particularly during a peak period on a Thursday evening. Notwithstanding the aforementioned drawbacks, we may consider revisiting the establishment to sample their burger offerings."

After a relentless and ardent endorsement from a acquaintance that persisted for an extensive duration of six months, I felt compelled to partake in a culinary excursion to this establishment. Upon indulging in their offerings, I must confess that my turkey sandwich was rather unremarkable and lacking in distinction, failing to elicit any profound sentiments of satisfaction or delight within my gastronomical sensibilities. Furthermore, I must express my utter dismay and disappointment at the glaring omission of a vital component, specifically Sweetener, for their unsweetened iced tea. Such an egregious oversight serves as a sufficient deterrent against any future visits, thereby rendering my experience a singular and regrettable occurrence.

I use to enjoy this place. But, I just had a bad experience for lunch. I even heard my server talking to his colleagues about how bad the tip was from the previous table. Also, they were out of the first two beverages that I asked for.  Will not be going back anytime soon.

Went for my Bday and the service was excellent but the food is another story. The food is not worth what u pay. Bill came out to $250 for two. Had a ribeye, pork, bone marrow, and two glasses of wine. Save your money. Go to Bobby Flays for a better steak and price.

Clean airport full of debauchery: drinking, gambling, and I'm sure strippers are next. There's a lot of food choices, it's always tidy and getting around is easy. So, all in all I'd give 5 stars ---- if it weren't for the mile-long taxi line. I find this unacceptable and I'm surprised the casinos haven't found a way to speed this up to get people losing money in their houses more quickly. The cab line needs to improve!!

Two stars is about dead on. We were first at a motel 6 and this was definitely an upgrade, but only by one star. The bathroom was the worst part. If Windemere would only do a deep cleaning of their bathrooms once in a while, I could see a full additional star. Other than that, the rooms were pretty big, it was nice to have a balcony, and the pool and hot tub was nice, but would have been a lot better if someone grabbed a net and scooped out the branches and leaves now and then.  \n\nThe service people were friendly and helpful and the breakfast was fine. Just clean this place a little Windemere and you're almost there.

We have been patrons of this establishment for an extended period, having partaken of their culinary offerings on numerous occasions in the past, specifically within the confines of the Mirage Hotel. Our most recent visit, however, proved to be a profound disappointment, as the server failed to demonstrate even a rudimentary understanding of the soup du jour, responding in a manner that could only be described as eccentric and hurried. Furthermore, the quality of the food was subpar, prompting us to return it due to its unacceptable temperature. Additionally, we found the prices to be disproportionate to the level of quality provided, leading us to question the overall value proposition offered by this establishment. Considering the plethora of dining options available in Las Vegas, we would not recommend planning a return visit to this particular venue, as they seem to employ a policy of charging excessive prices for mediocre fare.

They have great food if you can get service.   Last time I went wewaited 30 min and didn't have any service at all so we left and done 20 min to another restaurant. We just phone order wings and pick them up now

Maybe because I'm use to NY Steakhouses but I was disappointed. 
I was with a party of 10 for lunch. Lunch menu was great however my steak was over cooked. 

Where's the porterhouse steaks???

Wine was good but little expensive, even for Vegas.

Ew. Ew ew ew. My palette is not THAT discerning, by any means. But. Flavorless canned mushrooms and frozen spinach in my omelet. No seasoning, and just sort of a big sloppy mess dropped onto a plate. Took forever to take our order, much less get it to us. Only reason it's getting 2 stars is that the hash browns were okay. Not really sure why it gets such high reviews.

"It merely requires a negative mindset and an inflexible demeanor to transform a positive encounter into a detrimental one in a remarkably brief period. Unfortunately, this phenomenon transpired at 360 Physical Therapy, where I was prepared to compose a laudatory review, predicated on the quality of their physical therapy services. My overall impression of the physical therapist was favorable, and I felt that I received adequate care. However, the clinic maintains a stringent policy regarding appointment cancellations, which entails the imposition of a substantial fee. Regardless of the numerous $35 copays I have paid (a sum that I deem exorbitant, yet that is a separate issue with my healthcare provider), and despite my diligence in informing them of any potential lateness, the billing manager remains resolute in demanding payment for an alleged missed appointment that I adamantly maintain was rescheduled beforehand. The impasse has become an arduous and unyielding contest. 

My central contention is that preserving customer satisfaction is paramount. In my case, I had attended multiple sessions at their facility, consistently arriving punctually and settling payments promptly. I was the embodiment of a model client. Were it not for this minor yet contentious issue, I would continue to patronize their services and recommend them to others. Alas, their reluctance to relinquish this trivial dispute renders it unfortunate that I cannot do so."

The entire property is run down, kinda creepy and pretty yucky.  I had rented some inline skates thad had moldy inserts.  I think they may be the only roller rink in Madison so you don't have too  many options.\n\nObviously this place is popular with kids and they don't seem to notice all the blight so we would just grin and bear it.

Recently visited Frank and Lupes. Food was very good but service was slow. In fact, we had to go to the bar to order drinks because our waiter wasn't coming over to our table.  At the end of dinner, my dinner partner left the table to use the restroom, and our waiter came over and asked me if I was waiting to be seated......this after he had been already waiting on me for an hour and a half.

"Upon contemplating my intended remarks regarding the MarchÃ© Bonsecours, I found myself concurring with Virginie's sentiment that the edifice and its exterior are undoubtedly impressive. However, for me, this is where the appeal ends. Every time I enter, I find that it has transformed into an exclusive shopping center tailored solely for affluent tourists. While they claim to showcase works by local artists and artisans, the products appear homogeneous and are significantly more expensive than elsewhere. If you are in the area, feel free to visit and admire the architecture of the building, but do not expect to be impressed by the overpriced and monotonous offerings within."

I have had the privilege of partaking in the culinary offerings of this establishment on two separate occasions, and my experiences have been vastly disparate. During my initial visit, my companion and I opted to indulge in the menu's offerings for lunch, as the variety of options appeared appetizing. The quality of the comestibles was satisfactory, aligning with our expectations of standard bar fare, yet unremarkable in its excellence. Our server was attentive, ensuring our glasses remained filled and our plates clean, though the atmosphere was not particularly bustling. Subsequently, we became cognizant of the fact that this venue hosted UFC events, which piqued our interest and motivated our return for a subsequent visit during a fight night. 
Upon our arrival, we were taken aback by the entrance fee of $10 per individual, a price point that seemed exorbitant in comparison to the $5/pp charged by neighboring establishments in EV. Despite our reservations, we elected to remain and partake in the spectacle, as the evening's entertainment was about to commence. However, our server informed us that a credit card or identification was required as collateral for our table, a request that struck us as incongruous, considering our age and the improbability of a dine-and-dash scenario. Following a brief deliberation, I reluctantly surrendered my credit card, and the battle ensued. Unfortunately, the television screens did not conform to the promised arrangement, as some continued to display the basketball tournament instead of the UFC match, obliging me to crane my neck to observe the combatants, even after the game's conclusion. Notwithstanding the mediocre quality of the cuisine and the acceptable level of service, we shall revisit this eatery for sustenance, while reserving our UFC viewing for alternative establishments such as Old Chicago or Tilted Kilt.

The burritos are good enough when you're craving breakfast and can't get away from work. I use them about once every couple of weeks. The service our horrible. Almost every time I call I get put on hold only to never get answered. I call back and finally get my order in. If there was another place that delivered I would go there.

This is a pretty crappy and old hotel. The room was dusty and had several missing items such as cups and laundry bags.  The bed sheet was dirty and had a huge bloodstain right in the middle of the bed. I had to ask housekeeping to come and replace the bed sheets.

Limited beer actually available on tap. Hell, I could slap a sticker on a tap and call it whatever I wanted to, doesn't make it true. Even if they did have all of the beer they claimed, it's still not enough to call it a \"world\" of beer. Seriously limited in supply and variety. Our group headed up the street to another establishment after only one round and found better selections.
Super slow service compared to other EBs. IlI go to the one on Sahara even though its 10 minutes out of the way next time.
