Furthermore, guests were offered a complimentary play at the Dungeon, also known as the midway arcade. Unfortunately, the provided coupon book did not feature any match plays. 

The guestroom itself was spacious and well-appointed, boasting a sizable television set. An Ethernet cable was thoughtfully provided for guests to connect their personal computers to the internet, although the speed of the connection was somewhat sluggish. 

The sleeping quarters were found to be satisfactory, with three plush pillows available for added comfort. 

The elevators were strategically divided between floors 1-18 and 19-up, ensuring prompt and efficient service for guests seeking higher floors. It is recommended to reserve a room on floor 18 or above for optimal elevator performance. 

In terms of the casino, it was observed that the blackjack tables implemented continuous shuffler machines, which are not ideal for seasoned players. The minimum betting limits for most table games were around $10."
First time going to this restaurant.  The service was great. The staff is very friendly.  Will definitely come back. I would recommend this place to anyone.

I possessed a prior reservation at a renowned steakhouse adjacent to the strip, but my temperament did not align with fulfilling said reservation. Thus, I initiated my excursion at the southern terminus of the strip, with the intention of advancing until I encountered an eatery that corresponded with my present disposition. I briefly entered several establishments during my perambulation, but opted to continue my search. Upon traversing through the Cosmopolitan, I was captivated by an alluring aroma emanating from a steakhouse. Following a query posed to a hotel concierge, I rapidly discovered myself occupying a seat at the STK bar, ideally suited for a solitary patron such as myself. The ambiance was vivacious and bustling, complemented by a deejay's melodic blend serving as a backdrop. Although certain individuals have expressed concerns regarding auditory difficulties, I did not experience any hindrances in this regard, as I was not engaged in arduous conversational exchanges.  
I partook of the foie gras french toast, bone-in rib, and a moscow mule. Each item was thoroughly enjoyable. 
However, I must express my dissatisfaction with the restroom arrangement. The notion of queuing outside, awaiting one's turn, complying with the instructions of an attendant, and requesting permission to utilize the facilities strikes me as unacceptable. A modification to this system would be greatly appreciated. 
In conclusion, I shall revisit Las Vegas in the near future to commemorate my son's birthday, and I am convinced that he will derive equal pleasure from this establishment as I did, thereby ensuring my return.

I have not been to Nello's in ages.  A friend suggested for lunch.  The three of us show up and the place was getting busy.  We were sat immediately.  Got to have pizza here, right?  We ordered a large pizza:  thick crust, bacon, basil, mushroom, and 1/2 with sausage.  OMG... It was good but they forgot the basil.  =(  The garlic bread was very good too....  \n\nThe waiter was eye candy and he provided great service!  =)

WOW!! What a hidden gem in Vegas! 
We went to the Rio to go see a show, and decided to grab a bite before.
We foolishly did not make reservations (I suggest that you do!) but the hostess offered us a cozy spot at the bar. Which we took.

Had a meatball appetizer, which was recommended by another patron. YES! SO delicious!! I would go back just for that! Then had the specials. One scallop dis and my partner had a sea bass dish. Both were full of flavor, tasted super fresh, and over all great dishes!

I would go back in a second!

p.s.- Locals with a T.Rewards card and NV ID get 25% off! If you are seeing a show, you get 20% with ticket stubs! What a deal for an amazing dinner!

I was going to downtown Las Vegas last night for a show, so I decided to stop for dinner at the Bar + Bistro.  I made one error in that it was First Friday in the Arts District and the restaurant has an abbreviated menu for that evening.

I went with two of their tapas plates and a dessert.  I started with their roasted tomate soup.  It was excellent.  The second dish was their 5 cheese mac and cheese a combination of smoked gouda, sharp cheddar, fontina, Manchego, roasted tomato, piquillo peppers, and parmesan crisp.  The pasta was gigli.  The mac and cheese was very tasty, too!

I rounded out my dinner with a warm chocolate ganache cake.  It, too, was excellent.  It was served with a small scoop of sorbet and it was a perfect ending.

All things considered, I'd rather have come here on a night when I could have ordered from the full menu, but I had the chance to taste some of their good cuisine.  I think it's a bit pricey for what you get.  I enjoyed the decor a lot.  The tables shaped like artists' palettes with a metal well in many.  One thing that got me several times was the thought that I had dripped something onto the table.  When I looked, it was merely some spattered paint when they were decorating the tables.  Every time I looked down, it was a "gotcha."

Its been said before, but they deliver until 3 AM.  We were not in the state of mind to drive and have been getting a little sick of hungry howies.  It took a solid hour for our food to arrive, but that seems pretty normal for late night Tempe. Everyone raved about the food.  It was very good for late night delivery.  The chicken bruchetta pita was excellent although a little small.  I recommend 2 pitas for anyone with any kind of appetite.  You might not get through both, but the one was just a little too small to satisfy.  My only complaint, and the reason for 4 starts instead of 5 was the traditional hummus.  I didnt not think it was very good at all.  Many places in Tempe have much better.

"This eatery exudes an ambiance of sophistication, boasting lofty ceilings that contribute to its aesthetically pleasing atmosphere. The coffee served here is of exceptional quality, and the staff members are cordial and welcoming, fostering a sense of hospitality that makes patrons feel at ease. Conveniently located near my workplace, I opt to partake in luncheon at this establishment on occasion, indulging in their delectable open-faced sandwiches adorned with an array of savory toppings such as Russian egg salad, tuna, smoked salmon, and diverse meat options. While the pastries appear visually stunning, sadly, my appetite is often satiated, precluding me from indulging in their sweet offerings. Although the prices may be considered somewhat elevated, the culinary quality compensates for the cost, rendering the dining experience satisfying overall."

We attended a celebratory gathering in honor of a friend's birthday, and I must say that the cozy ambiance of the venue was particularly appealing to me. Generally speaking, I am not one to indulge in comedic performances, but on this occasion, I found myself being humorously entertained by three out of the four comedians who graced the stage. Furthermore, there was an adjacent event taking place, which initially perplexed me due to the unconventional attire of some attendees, characterized by leather masks and nipple clamps; however, upon closer inspection, I noticed a small, illuminated sign reading "Comedy Spot," which promptly clarified the situation. In conclusion, I would highly recommend visiting this establishment on a weekend, although it is worth noting that the donning of assless chaps is purely optional.

Absolutely delicious Thai food offered by a pleasant server.  Ordered green curry with extra veggies and tofu and it was so yummy I ate the rest for dinner. My friend had the broccoli chicken and spring roll and she was really impressed. Ambiance is very hole-in-the-wall and kitschy, but that's not why you go. You go for the delicious food and good service, and you won't be disappointed.

"I have been thoroughly delighted with the exceptional care my canine companion has received at Squaw Peak Animal Hospital, as the staff has consistently displayed a profound dedication to ensuring the well-being of my diminutive pug. The personnel are unwaveringly kind, accommodating, and efficient in their scheduling practices, allowing for convenient, last-minute appointments without any considerable delay. It is patently evident that the staff treats my dog with the utmost care and compassion, as if he were their own cherished pet, as numerous individuals have attested to. 

In a particularly trying circumstance, a puppy was discovered at my place of employment, and upon bringing him to Squaw Peak for examination, it was determined that he was afflicted with distemper, necessitating euthanasia as the most humane course of action. In a gesture of remarkable generosity, the veterinarian absorbed the cost of this procedure without hesitation. 

Furthermore, in times of financial hardship, the hospital has exhibited great understanding and flexibility by offering the option to billed me for essential veterinary services and permitting me to make installment payments. However, I did experience a brief instance of dissatisfaction upon receiving a collection notice from the office following a payment that substantially covered the outstanding balance. Upon speaking with the billing manager, I was informed that I could make an additional payment of $70 this month, thereby settling the remaining amount owed, and that arrangements for this could be easily made over the phone. Considering the numerous positive experiences I have had with Squaw Peak Animal Hospital, I am inclined to believe that this minor inconvenience was merely an isolated oversight."

Finally got here for dinner, heard about this restaurant from my friends many times! The food quality is good, environment is not bad, doesn't feel like those typical Japanese restaurants, I definitely will come back again!! Had a great dinner here!! Love it..!!!

Excellent!\nI love the ambiance of this restaurant. We were seated next to window with a peek of the fountain show. Foie grois was great and hamachi was good. I ordered medium duck. Unfortunately it was not seasoned well & was too chewy. Server was in tuned & offered to exchange dish for a sea bass. It was delicious!

On June 22nd, we arrived with a considerable assemblage during the evening hours and were accommodated at a spacious table that featured the option of engaging in recreational activities such as checkers and scrabble while awaiting the culinary offerings, which we thoroughly relished. My spouse opted for the miso salmon, while I selected a burger and fries, both of which proved to be satisfactory in terms of gastronomical quality and service efficiency, until the presentation of the bill, that is. Although the bill was meticulously itemized for each individual party, much to my appreciation, a cursory examination revealed an unsolicited inclusion of a gratuity charge, which, while not necessarily problematic in and of itself, did strike me as somewhat dubious, particularly given the lack of transparent communication regarding its addition, leading to the possibility of unwitting duplication of tips by certain patrons, which, in turn, prompted me to bring it to the attention of those seated nearby, who expressed gratitude for the heads-up. While it is conceivable that this practice may not have been the intentional policy of the eatery per se, but rather that of the server, it remains, in my estimation, a questionable custom that warrants scrutiny.

Probably one of the best steaks in Las Vegas. Comfortable seating and busy. Very busy. Lobster appetizer was a bit pricey for the little, but delicious amount you got. For a new restuarant the staff was very well trained. Looking forward to next visit, minus lobster app.

"3.75 celestial bodies\n\nBeyond the Japanese LV emporium, this particular establishment represented the premier instance of my venturing into an LV store. The sentinels tasked with safeguarding the premises manifested an air of indifference, their countenances projecting a sense of ennui that seemed to permeate the atmosphere. In contradistinction, the sales associates at neighboring upscale retailers within Caesars Palace demonstrated a marked propensity for cordiality, greeting customers with cheerful salutations and bidings of farewell. Notwithstanding, the display case showcasing an array of purses proved to be moderately engaging and diverting. Upon learning of my aunt's potential interest in procuring a product, the associateâwhose name escapes me at presentâdisplayed remarkable patience and helpfulness, presenting us with an assortment of ten or so articles and meticulously removing the protective covering from each item. Following our decision, she absented herself for an extended period, yet I would unhesitatingly advocate for a visit to this location, despite the possibility of being disregarded during solo excursions."

They boast an extensive array of delectable offerings for their midday repast, encompassing both vegetarian and carnivorous selections, which are presented in a format that allows patrons to sample a variety of flavors and textures, all of which are carefully crafted to satiate one's hunger and delight one's taste buds. Furthermore, their assortment of sweet treats and yeast-based flatbread infused with the pungent essence of garlic consistently impresses and satisfies those who partake of them. Additionally, the personnel who attend to the needs of guests display a high level of cordiality and hospitality, ensuring that each individual feels welcome and valued during their dining experience.

"Ambient culinary establishment, offering an array of delectable victuals, specifically a diverse selection of midday sandwiches, constituting a judicious balance between sustenance and temporal efficiency, thereby facilitating a prompt and seamless dining experience for patrons. Furthermore, the carbonated beverage infused with raspberry essence proves to be an exquisite accompaniment to the fare, elevating the gastronomical indulgence to a truly satisfying level."

I have consistently experienced a sense of euphoria upon departing this establishment, which boasts an exceptionally stylish bar adorned with illuminated bottles that create a vibrant ambiance. Despite the unfavorable lighting conditions, I find myself drawn to the tables situated adjacent to this captivating bar, perhaps due to the unsettling yet intriguing effect of the dim lighting, reminiscent of the eerie glow of a flashlight positioned beneath one's countenance. When perusing the menu, I am invariably inclined towards the Sesame Crusted Ahi Tuna as my initial course, principally because the tuna is presented atop a bed of delectable slaw imbued with a savory soy dressing, accompanied by a side of wasabi that can be incorporated according to personal preference. Although this eatery does not specialize in seafood, I frequently develop an intense craving for fish dishes and discover that their Blackened Fish Sandwich is cooked to perfection, complemented by a tangy sauce that enhances its flavor. Additionally, the steamed broccoli is typically served in generous portions and maintains a consistent freshness. However, I would advise against ordering the honey roasted carrots, as they are often overwhelmed by an excessive amount of sweetness, resulting in a taste that is akin to plain sugarcoated carrots - an unfortunate departure from the natural flavors that vegetables should exhibit. Lastly, while I do appreciate desserts and possess a particular fondness for chocolate, I regret to say that none of the offerings from this establishment have managed to impress me, potentially attributable to an overabundance of white chocolate in their confections.

I would say that this is easily the best place to go in in Sun Prairie.  We have been here about 6 times and it has consistently been good.  I have ordered steak, fried fish, entrees... it's all pretty good.  The kids meals are well portioned and the kids eat it.  They rotate their menu and the beer on tap - that makes repeat business worth while.  It can be pretty busy on a Friday night.  They have filled a need in town.

"The Filet Mignon was utterly scrumptious and I found myself incapable of satiating my palate with the accompanying sauce, which rendered the utilization of steak sauce unnecessary. The hospitality we received was exceptional, as my companion and I engaged in a most enjoyable conversation with our server. Our hydration needs were consistently met, much to my satisfaction, as I possess an unquenchable thirst, comparable to that of a cetacean. Although the cost was not exorbitant, it was still reasonable, particularly for a superior cut of meat. My sole grievance pertains to the frites, which were excessively salted, thereby detracting from their overall appeal. Nonetheless, this establishment remains an excellent venue for a leisurely repast on a picturesque day."

Great place to stay. Rooms are spacious and clean. The price is fair. It's at the end of the strip so there's less foot traffic which is a blessing. The air is cleaner vs other hotels. Lots of things to do in the hotel: beach, mall, bars, clubs, spa, many others.

Although we had to wait 30 minutes for a table, it was well worth it. We sat outside, which is beautiful and great for people watching. I ordered a caesar salad and within what seemed like five minutes it was on the table. It was delicious, I loved the cheese and dressing. I also ordered the classic quiche lorraine. I'm a big sucker for quiche, my grandmother made it countless times for me when I was little and I have to say eating this quiche sent me back to my childhood. It was AMAZING..and incredibly filling. I couldn't even finish all of it!\n\nOur waiter was very friendly and attentive. Not only that but the food comes out so quickly that I barely had time to finish my caesar salad before my lunch was served. My boyfriend got the warm chicken and brie sandwich. It had thin slices of apple and caramelized onions on top. Absolutely delicious.  All in all a great experience, great food and an elegant yet not pretentious atmosphere. When we go back to Vegas we will definitely be dining here again.

"This establishment purveys an array of intriguing and sophisticated culinary implements, which are displayed in a manner that exudes an air of luxury and elegance. The products appear to be constructed from materials that are both durable and visually appealing, such as chromium, and boast cutting-edge designs that seem to embody the epitome of modernity. Furthermore, the sales associates are more than happy to offer customers a complimentary cup of coffee while they are demonstrating the merits of their high-end coffee brewing apparatus. Overall, this store offers a unique and enjoyable shopping experience that is bound to leave a lasting impression on its patrons."

"Perhaps I incline towards attire with a slightly more metropolitan essence than the typical Caucasian male, yet I found this location appealing and am fond of the concept of appearing stylish without breaking the bank. Its vastness is truly remarkable, offering an extensive array of choices catering to diverse tastes and preferences. From urban apparel to formal wear, and including various accessories, this store presents a veritable smorgasbord of options. My sole grievance pertains to the dearth of assistance beyond the confines of the fitting rooms, although such oversight can be anticipated given the reasonable price point."

Union Pig & Chicken possesses an exceptional proficiency in the culinary art of barbecue, boasting a remarkable array of delectable dishes that have captivated my gastronomical inclinations on multiple occasions. Specifically, their brisket exemplifies a masterful balance between tenderness and richness, as each bite disintegrates effortlessly upon contact with a utensil, although certain portions may contain an excessive amount of adipose tissue. Furthermore, while the hospitality at this establishment has consistently met my expectations, the pace of service has occasionally been somewhat lethargic. Notwithstanding this minor drawback, Union Pig & Chicken also offers an unexpected yet welcome reprieve from the standard lunchtime fare, presenting a diverse selection of savory sandwiches that cater to a wide range of palates. Of particular note is the macaroni and cheese, a culinary masterpiece that transcends the mundane and enters the realm of the sublime; it is an absolute must-try item for any gourmand seeking a truly satisfying dining experience.

"We visited this establishment in the company of my spouse and our two adolescent offspring, with the intention of sampling a variety of beverages and thereby facilitating a shared experience. Each member of our party opted for a distinct item from the menu, which afforded us the opportunity to indulge in a diversity of flavors and textures. The staff members present on the premises demonstrated a high level of cordiality and hospitality towards us, which greatly enhanced our overall enjoyment of the visit. Notwithstanding the aforementioned positive aspects, I must confess that the cost of these delectable concoctions did seem somewhat prohibitive, and it is my fervent hope that future patronage will not be unduly burdened by such elevated pricing, as it would greatly enhance my inclination to partake of them with greater frequency."

Walnut Grill represents an establishment that I hold in high esteem, particularly for its provision of an ambient setting conducive to enjoying a post-work libation or a rapid, delectable repast. The menu showcases an inventive fusion of traditional American cuisine with subtle contemporary nuances, while the wine list boasts an impressive array of vintages carefully curated to complement the culinary offerings. The recent expansion of the bar area has not only augmented the seating capacity but also introduced plush, inviting booths that enhance the overall convivial ambiance. The service staff, recognizing devoted patrons like myself, display remarkable proficiency and warmth, ensuring a seamless dining experience. Furthermore, Walnut Grill occasionally features live musical performances, adding another layer of enjoyment to an already delightful dining excursion. My patronage of this eatery shall persist with unwavering regularity.

After perusing my review, the manager reached out to me and extended an apology; however, I have yet to revisit the establishment, although the manager guaranteed that my subsequent experience would be vastly different from the previous one. Interestingly, the server who attended to me during my initial visit was subsequently terminated, thus piquing my curiosity and making me eager to revisit the premises in the near future.

It is indeed a welcome development that Steak N Shake has finally arrived in the valley, bringing with it an unparalleled dining experience that has captured the hearts of many, including myself. My unwavering affection for their delectable Frisco melt is unsurprising, given its rich, savory flavor profile that defies description. Furthermore, the immaculate ambiance and warm hospitality of the establishment only serve to enhance the overall satisfaction of the culinary journey. While I do lament the absence of certain signature elements, such as the peppers, and the limited availability of the menu items, I remain steadfast in my enthusiasm for this esteemed eatery. Notwithstanding the shortcomings, I am more than willing to indulge in my beloved Frisco melt, accompanied by a side of golden fries and a generous serving of cheese sauce.

I know it is a McDonald's. I get it. But as far as a fast food chain goes, this particualr McDonald's has my loyalty. \n\nTalk about your fast friendly service. Whether I am ordering just coffee or a couple hash browns for my boy and I on the way into school I know I will be through the drive-thru in 5 minutes tops!

This is a great late night spot located in the California Hotel. If you're a fan of ox tail soup, you'll love this place. The oxtail soup is only served late night and the entire menu has Hawaiian/Filipino influence. This place is so well known for their ox tail soup that if you check-in on Facebook, it will say it's the HOME OF THE OXTAIL SOUP. \n\nTips: 1. Be prepared to wait in line. 2. Get your oxtail soup without peanuts. 3. Don't forget to get your parking ticket validated.
The location is nice and the food is delicious! I got the market fish, which was very good. The meat was so tender. Other yummy dishes were duck and pork.

"An exceptional lodging establishment, characterized by meticulously maintained guest quarters, complimentary hydration provision in the refrigerator, and a physical fitness facility of satisfactory quality. However, certain aspects of the hotel's services warrant criticism, specifically the necessity of reestablishing an internet connection every twenty-four hours, accompanied by a ten dollar fee per device, including mobile telephones; an unimpressive breakfast spread, save for made-to-order arrangements; and an oversight concerning the prior evening's meal tray, which remained outside my room until the subsequent afternoon. Apart from these shortcomings, the remainder of the hotel's attributes contributed to a gratifying stay, including its advantageous location, attentive staff, and a general ambiance of pleasure."

A guy from a liquor store recommended this place to me a couple of years ago. Since then, I've been to this place every time I'm in Vegas. I've only tried the pizza & wings. Both are GREAT for those late night drunken munchies! Right down the street from the Stratosphere.\n\nYou can easily tell that this is where the locals go for pizza.

"My culinary inclinations were pleasantly aroused by the delectable crab legs proffered by the establishment in question. As I patiently awaited my turn in a considerable queue, I couldn't help but notice that the crustaceans in question were already cracked, thus obviating any requisite preparatory efforts on my part. Additionally, the sushi available was remarkably fresh, which further contributed to my gastronomical satisfaction. It's worth mentioning that the eatery boasted an array of adorable bite-sized desserts, allowing me to sample a variety of sweet treats without committing to a single large portion. Furthermore, the dessert section was discreetly tucked away from the main dining area, leading me to surmise that many patrons might unintentionally overlook it. They offered gelato in an assortment of flavors, including an unconventional yet tantalizing sour cherry variety. The assortment of sweets was undeniably charming, and I must admit that I was unable to identify the specific type of confection I consumed, though it did feature a captivating combination of white chocolate, edible silver balls, and a soft center. Despite my discerning palate, I found myself pleased with the abundance of suitable options available. However, when considering the cost, my preference leaned towards the offerings of Bellagio. Of note, there exists a buffet situated on the strip, complete with circular aquariums showcasing exotic desserts that truly defy description. Unfortunately, the name escapes me, but I recall that accessing the buffet requires descending via escalator. For devotees of sushi, Todai presents a superlative fish and sushi buffet at reasonable prices, supplemented by chicken and beef selections."

Quality 24/7 food in vegas. Pit stop, fill up, drink up, back at the strip!\n\nIf you want good portion sizes, a meal thatll keep you full, and want to pass up on mickey Ds and Dennys, hit this place up.

So we end up at XS after being unable to get in to Hakkansan and trust me we were not disappointed! This place is incredible the inside was gorgeous and the outside was a great spot to enjoy the music and get some fresh air.\n\nWe end up seeing Rusko  and dancing the night which was a blast.  I would defiantly recommend checking it out here!

"Indubitably, this particular eatery stands out as a premier buffet establishment among a plethora of other dining options within the numerous casinos in Las Vegas, offering an exceptional culinary experience at a remarkably affordable price point. I would unhesitatingly return to partake in their delectable offerings once again, as the quality of the fare and the reasonable cost create a truly satisfying and value-for-money experience that is difficult to surpass in the realm of Vegas buffets."
I thought that I could only get some good noodles here on the East Coast but boy was I wrong! I cant stop thinking about how good it was. Next time I am in town, Im heading straight there!

"I have an immense fondness for the culinary offerings at this establishment, oh my goodness, and the price of 12.45 for three beverages consisting of vodka and cola is quite reasonable, in my opinion. The server who attended to our table, a blonde woman whose name escaped me, possessed a certain je ne sais quoi that made her particularly pleasant to interact with."
Not bad, service was on the slower side, but then again it was lunch time 12-1pm but very friendly and quick cashier

"Upon perusing a selection of Yelp reviews, I opted to engage the services of Ingleside Grooming, despite my initial reservations regarding the proprietor's demeanor during our initial interaction. My subsequent visit with my canine companion proved to be a transformative experience, as the groomer exhibited remarkable patience and understanding in the face of my tardiness and concerns regarding my pet's anxiety. Indeed, the groomer's warmth and proficiency put me at ease, and the end result was nothing short of magnificent. Not only was my dog's new appearance meticulously groomed, but the cost was eminently reasonable, considering the comprehensive nature of the services provided. It is with great enthusiasm that I recommend this establishment to any individual seeking exceptional pet grooming services."

"Serendipitously discovered this eatery owing to the efficaciousness of Yelp's algorithmic recommendations, and my culinary escapades have been considerably enriched thereby. The gastronomical offerings, specifically their delectable Sonoran hot dogs, have proven to be an unmitigated delight, satiating my hunger with a superfluity of flavors and textures. My initial visit was marred by a minor inconvenience pertaining to the communication skills of the staff, which, however, was swiftly rectified during my subsequent visit, whereupon I was greeted with an abundance of hospitality and attentive service. It is worth noting that the establishment's physical surroundings, while not exactly opulent, do not detract from the overall dining experience, and one can readily overlook such trivialities in light of the superior quality of the cuisine. A veritable gustatory gem, nestled within a less than affluent neighborhood, yet well worth the excursion."

We weren't planning on visiting here but saw a billboard (they work!) saying Jerry Seinfeld was on that night and we just couldn't miss out that opportunity!\n\nSo we ended up with seats towards the back but the view was still great along with the acoustics. Would make for a great venue to see some live acts in as well.

"I thoroughly appreciated this performance. Although there were a few segments that could be considered slightly tacky, I thought it was superb overall. It caters to a diverse audience and is executed with great finesse and artistry. 

The twins' comedic timing was impressive, and it was refreshing to witness two confident women embracing their curves and showcasing their talents unapologetically. Additionally, the other performers had lean, athletic physiques, which added to the visual appeal of the production. Notably, the dance routines were inventive, tasteful, and occasionally moving. They effectively conveyed a range of emotions and themes, including passion, desire, playfulness, and melancholy. The performances captured the full spectrum of human experience, seamlessly blending the physical and emotional aspects. 

Some standout acts for me included the African dancer's dynamic routine, the captivating suspended bondage performance, the water gymnasts' graceful movements, the transvestite torch singer's soulful voice, and, of course, the breathtaking red cape that majestically enveloped the entire stage â?truly awe-inspiring. 

In my opinion, this show is a must-see, and I would eagerly return to experience its magic again. I relished every moment of it."

Time: 10 a.m. Location: Poppy's. Impulsive acquisition: Bagels, twelve. Purpose: To indulge in a day-long excursion as the Bagel Fairy, armed with an abundance of the finest bagels Charlotte has to offer.  

I carefully apportioned my bagel stash, ensuring a judicious distribution while savoring each bite. However, my gluttonous tendencies prevailed, devouring two bagels in a single sitting, resulting in an uncomfortable state of bagel-induced bloating.  

The coffee served at Poppy's was merely adequate, signaling a lack of attention to detail in their beverage offerings. Nevertheless, their proficiency in the art of bagel-making earns them top marks. It's unfortunate that they rely on Bore's Head for their sliced and cheesed options, as those products fail to meet my standards.  

My experience at Poppy's has led me to eschew Bruegger's and cease tormenting Owen. Instead, I shall indulge in Poppy bagels, revel in their delight, and enthusiastically endorse them.  

In light of their substantial size and gluten content, it's advisable to freeze these bagels for prolonged preservation rather than allowing them to languish in a bread box, where they'll rapidly deteriorate.

"An exceptionally hip drinking establishment, characterized by an ambiance that exudes a relaxed and welcoming demeanor, courtesy of the affable personnel who tend to patrons' needs with alacrity and cordiality. The menu boasts an array of delectable edibles and potables, available at prices that are eminently reasonable and pocket-friendly, ensuring that indulging in the epicurean delights on offer will not exact an unreasonable toll on one's financial resources. Additionally, the venue offers a diverse selection of libations at reduced prices during the euphemistically designated 'happy hour,' a time when the already convivial atmosphere becomes even more festive and jovial. Despite its diminutive size, which may result in a capacity crowd on occasion, the bar remains an unwaveringly enjoyable destination for those seeking a gratifying and memorable experience."

I engaged in an activity while visiting Las Vegas that I rarely partake in, particularly when surrounded by acquaintances and loved ones; indeed, I relished the opportunity to savor a delectable meal in solitude, thereby earning the esteemed title of "ohitori-sama," a term used by the Japanese to describe a lone diner who is accorded great respect. My culinary escapade transpired with remarkable ease, as I secured a reservation at a prime time, received a warm welcome from the hostess, and was treated to exceptionally attentive and cordial service that struck a delightful balance between the relaxed ambiance of an American bar and the refined elegance of a French bistro. Furthermore, the exquisite cuisine warranted no further deliberation, although this author, hailing from California, found the foie gras to be a notable highlight, boasting a satisfying crispness on its seared surface. Notably, the prices were surprisingly reasonable, given the city's reputation for extravagance, with a four-course menu accompanied by an amuse bouche available for $78, and a streamlined pre-theater option offered for $48 prior to 6:30 pm. Additionally, I took advantage of the establishment's wine list, discovering that half-bottles of Champagne and Chateauneuf du Pape could be obtained for a reasonable $88, while my neighbor, a man of discerning taste, secured a full bottle of Sancerre for a mere $40, much to my admiration. However, my tranquility was momentarily disrupted by a fellow solo diner seated beside me, whose striking appearance and suave demeanor brought to mind a fictional assassin portrayed by actor Jason Statham; regrettably, his proximity shattered the illusion of a romantic French bistro experience, as he engaged me in a lively conversation replete with references to hockey and his native Ottawa.
Every time I go to Whataburger, I get chicken strips. It is the only place I can think of that gives you a piece of toast with your meal.

Service is great, dining room is clean. Our order included the alloush and June's special (mushroom melt). Both are super delicious and were served promptly however a couple of flaws gave the overall rating 4 stars. First, the bread was soggy/ chewy instead of crunchy like the toasted marks implied. Secondly, I like fresh crispy greens on sandwiches (the spinach was limp and soggy. But that might be just my opinion. Anyway, I totally recommend this place but keep this in mind so you can adjust if necessary and have a happier experience!

We've been twice in the past couple years and enjoyed both performances (Simon Boccanegra and Madame Butterfly) immensely. Unfortunately, by the time we fly in and find a hotel (even at Jerry's) we only feel like we can afford the cheap seats. The chairs are a little narrow up there in opera glass country. Might have to open the wallet a little next time. Check if there is a pre-show lecture - worth the time and you might get closer parking in the garage. Parking is a good deal for AZ.

This particular venue serves as an exemplary illustration of what a Starbucks establishment ought to embody, boasting a consistently efficient and timely service, even during peak hours in the late afternoon, albeit the quality of the wireless internet connection may fluctuate depending on the number of patrons utilizing it. However, it is important to note that this location, like many other State Street and campus areas, faces challenges in effectively managing the presence of transient individuals, which can result in the occupation of tables by personal belongings or solicitation activities, thereby creating an uninviting ambiance for customers. While it is not necessarily the responsibility of Starbucks to address this issue, it remains a pressing concern for the city of Madison to tackle.
fun joint, right on the strip you can people watch, get hammered, DJ booth coming soon right on the patio \"I heard\" this is a deff go to place during the summer!

Love this place! First came here in 1996. It's vegan friendly and oh so good. Last night I had the amazing papaya salad and fresh spring rolls. The rolls were mintier than I've had before, but still delicious. I had dinner #3 which came with a tasty fried roll, coconut soup with mushrooms and a garlicky oil on top (forgot the Thai name) and pad thai. Delicious except that the pad thai was too spicy even though I requested mild. It's the first time I've ever had spicy pad thai. The service was fast and friendly. I will go back for one of their awesome lunch specials.

Ikea for President.

Seriously, could you imagine if our government was as efficient, affordable and useful as Ikea? Between the faux wood and the real wood, Ikea offers so many options for your home in all price ranges. The help is 7 out of 10 times helpful, and Ikea provides you with almost everything you need (string to tie something to the roof of your car, big bags/cart/dollys, measuring tape, pencils and notepads).

I'm a big fan personally of the Hemnes line (real wood!) and have purchased it for my master bedroom and living room, so far with excellent results. In the past I've done Malm (haven't we all?) and was pleased with the small investment and the years I got out of that set. 

Only downside to Ikea is the directions they give you to assemble stuff. No words! Just pictures, so make sure that you're well rested and have the patience of a saint when building the larger pieces (personally, I look to my gentleman friend to assemble everything - I throw things within 5 minutes).

"As a proximate resident, I have had the privilege of traversing the surrounding vicinity on numerous occasions, thereby affording me the opportunity to peruse the local culinary establishments. However, it was not until my spouse conveyed her desire for sustenance via telephonic communication that I opted to partake in the edible offerings of this particular eatery. I must confess that my expectations were not only met but indeed surpassed by the delectable gyros, characterized by an abundance of flavorsome meat artfully arranged upon a crisp pita, accompanied by a judicious application of sauce. In conclusion, my gastronomical experience was thoroughly enjoyable and left me feeling satiated."

We don't do things just once in my house. It's our anniversary weekend and  I suggest to my husband DW Bistro. I had come two weeks ago on my B-Day weekend with my girls friend and it was amazing. When we walked in the smell alone made my husband jump. He used to own a restaurant so it's hard for me to impress him. 
We split a house salad....what a great salad...mixed greens a little fruit cheese and nuts....it is a must have.
I had the short rib sandwich and he had the salmon....everything was perfectly cooked and the flavor was great.
Our waiter was amazing and very personable....I can't wait to try their brunch!

The acts were great...the type of stuff that you would find making it onto the further rounds of America's Got Talent altogether in one show...with a good variety...good character cast and some stuff I've never seen before. 

Paid $23 (tip included) for a mojito in a thin glass. It was a good mojito and if I wasn't a local but just here on vacation I wouldn't mind, but being a local, I think of all the food that could buy. =p

Overall the entertainment exceeded my expectations, I wasn't sure what to expect.

"Capriotti's 'Bobby' has resorted to the utilization of anabolic steroids in order to enhance his physical appearance, resulting in a significant increase in muscle mass, which he has opted to showcase at Eddie D's. He has adopted the moniker 'Sir Robert' in conjunction with this transformation, yet despite his outwardly rugged demeanor, he remains fundamentally unchanged in terms of his inherent nature, retaining the endearing qualities of softness and sweetness that have been integral to his character. In an effort to augment his appeal to the opposite sex, Robert has begun to partake in regular gravy baths, thereby enhancing his already impressive physique. It is worth noting that while the majority of females are likely to be drawn to Robert's six-inch stature, he is capable of expanding to twice that size in order to accommodate the preferences of those with more voluminous builds. Thus, it is recommended that those seeking companionship during mealtime consider visiting Eddie D's, whereupon they may encounter Robert in a state of eager anticipation."

I really like Paradise Bakery, I was at this location every morning for about 2 years. The staff was always friendly but sometimes the line can get long if a lot of people come in at once. It can be a long wait to get served. Being a big muffin fan I always loved the apple cinnamon and blueberry muffins and they are consistently good.

The Paradise rewards are a nice perk, compared to other coffee shops it is easy to earn free drinks and food if you are a regular and would spend the money anyway.

The only reason this location looses one star is the sometimes pushy home business folk that take over every available booth and camp with their laptops. This is during the week. On weekends you get whole families with screaming kids. This does not seem to happen at the other locations in the area, could be the proximity to the hotel next door.

it's already been said in every other review, but the Mattress Factory is pretty amazing.  They have installations that are extremely unique and orginal.  You won't find art like this anywhere else in the city.

I was an ardent devotee of the Avalon in Oakland several years ago, so when I encountered this establishment in Mt Lebanon, I felt compelled to halt my journey! Design: Visually striking attire in the storefront, complemented by a vibrant neon sign, captured my attention immediately. Typical layout found in most buy, trade, and sell shops, featuring pants, shirts, dresses, and other assorted items. However, a distinct section upfront showcased an array of stylish bags and jewelry, while a specialized area catered to the discerning tastes of Mt. Lebanon's affluent housewives, boasting high-end brands such as Prada, Gucci, and Jimmy Choo. Selection: A commendable assortment, although Buffalo Exchange surpassed it with their eclectic and fashionable offerings. Notably extensive shoe selection. Price: Reasonable and budget-friendly. Service: The cashier displayed warmth and kindness during our interaction, engaging in a brief conversation about our shared affection for certain retail establishments. Pros: Unlike many second-hand shops, this location maintained a fresh and clean atmosphere, lacking the pungent odor associated with cat urine. Its well-organized layout and aesthetically pleasing design contributed to its appeal. Additionally, the prices were incredibly reasonable, with both tank tops and dresses available for only $8.00 each. Cons: To improve the overall shopping experience, the store could benefit from clearing out some older inventory, such as outdated Hollister tank tops and plaid shorts from the '90s. Unfortunately, some middle-aged women who frequent the store can come across as whiny. Overall: This store offers an excellent option for those seeking a unique shopping experience without breaking the bank or conforming to the standard Urban Outfitters crowd. Due to its welcoming ambiance and reasonably priced merchandise, I intend to include it in my regular shopping excursions. I highly recommend paying it a visit!

"Extremely disheartened by the closure of this establishment, I implore its proprietors to reconsider their decision and resume operations forthwith. This venue was one of the rare gems in the local culinary landscape that offered nutritious and wholesome takeaway options, thereby catering to the health-conscious demographic and contributing positively to the community's well-being."

"A truly exceptional hospitality establishment, this hotel offered a plethora of contemporary amenities and facilities, including an impressive 29th floor vantage point with expansive views, automated shading systems in each guestroom, a spacious showering area, a rapid and whisper-quiet commode, and, most notably, a luxurious bathtub experience. While the prices at the on-site market cafe were somewhat elevated, the convenience and quality of the offerings made it a worthwhile indulgence for us, particularly in the mornings when we enjoyed their expertly crafted lattes. Furthermore, the complimentary valet parking service was staffed by friendly and proficient attendants who ensured the efficient handling of our vehicle, and we were delighted by the unexpected opportunity to check in ahead of schedule, a welcome surprise indeed."
Food was pretty good. My smash fries didn't have much on them, tasted almost like reg fries. And the girl who brought us our food was rude when my girlfriend asked for more mayo.

This hotel has secured a preferential position among my numerous sojourns in Las Vegas, surpassing ten diverse establishments that I have had the pleasure of experiencing. The generous hospitality and commodious accommodations have contributed significantly to my gratification, particularly when complemented by the perks and discounts afforded by the M Life card. The genial staff members have consistently demonstrated a high level of proficiency in their duties, ensuring a seamless and enjoyable stay. The resort's pool area, replete with a wave pool and beach-inspired ambiance, offers an idyllic retreat during the sweltering summer months. Furthermore, the culinary offerings at the Burger Bar have proven to be exceptional, with the Kobe burger being a personal favorite of mine. Notwithstanding these favorable aspects, a couple of drawbacks have prevented me from conferring a perfect five-star rating upon this establishment. Specifically, the hotel's recent transformation into a family-oriented destination, while not inherently detrimental, does not align with my personal preferences for a Las Vegas experience. Additionally, the antiquated television sets, lacking in both modernity and high definition quality, have been a source of minor dissatisfaction during my stays.

I have had the pleasure of visiting Vanguard on multiple occasions, and I must say, it is an exceptional establishment for those seeking a unique and expertly crafted cocktail experience. Upon entering the premises, one cannot help but notice the fastidious attention to detail in the maintenance of the bar area, which contributes to a welcoming ambiance that exudes sophistication and elegance. Furthermore, the staff has consistently demonstrated proficiency in efficiently accommodating patrons, even during peak hours, ensuring that imbibers can readily partake in their desired potations without undue delay.

Personally, I possess a penchant for exploring diverse beverages at various drinking establishments; however, when patronizing Vanguard, my preferences become decidedly narrowed, as I invariably opt for the Jack Rose cocktail, composed of apple brandy, maple syrup, and black cherry. The mere mental reflection upon its delectable flavors evokes an intense yearning within me for a glass of this sublime elixir. It is worth noting that the assorted beverages offered by Vanguard are indeed delectable, and following a couple of libations, a brief respite may be advisable to allow for proper digestion and appreciation of their intricate flavor profiles.

While Vanguard presents itself admirably, there are occasional drawbacks, specifically pertaining to the weekend evenings, when the atmosphere transforms into a more boisterous and vibrant setting, complemented by the presence of a disc jockey. Additionally, it is not uncommon for individuals hailing from Fremont to enter the establishment, engaging in eccentric behavior, such as aimlessly meandering or performing brief, impromptu dance sequences before departing. Despite these minor shortcomings, Vanguard remains an exceptional destination for those seeking a refined drinking experience.

We arrived at this esteemed culinary establishment with the expectation of partaking in a delectable dinner, and indeed, the gastronomical offerings did not disappoint. The various cuts of meat and seafood that adorned our plates were cooked to perfection, eliciting expressions of satisfaction from all members of our party. However, it is with great consternation that we must report that the pace of service was somewhat languid, resulting in an extended waiting period for our repast. Notwithstanding this unfortunate circumstance, the management saw fit to present our patriarch with a complimentary box of decadent truffles and a generous gift card valued at twenty-five dollars, a gesture that served as a token of their acknowledgment of his milestone birthday.
Food rating: 4.5
Service rating: 3

The Bamboo Club was a great evening out with wonderful food, great seating and crappy service.  Seriously our waiter was a total douche bag.  But looking back now, he couldn't have ruined the evening even though he tried.

We got there late (about 9:00 P.M.) and sat outside.  Love the décor, nice overall theme.  If I lived in Scottsdale, I would definitely be hitting up the bar from time to time- dark wood, good lighting, and a little lively!  The food was good, had the Pad Thai and some appetizers.  Good stuff, well, except one...  

I don't know what kind of crack I was smoking that night but I wanted some tuna, since I hadn't had sushi in a couple of days.  What the hell made me order fish in the desert?  I have no effin' idea.  Of course the seared ahi tuna was frozen and it was horrible.  Not their fault, my bad.  Well maybe their fault, I hear (maybe a tall tale) that you can get some flown in, fresh, not frozen fish in Arizona...  

So in recap- great place, cool ambiance, good food, awesome orange chicken, stay away from the seafood and that waiter needs a swift kick in the nuts.

The bad: the bar closes at 10pm.  It seems like the western, country, wagon-wheel themed bar that you'd like to close down one night while playing some good tunes on the juke box and eating peanuts.  And also the french fries, file those under bad.

The good: the hamburgers are pretty much delicious.  Definitely go for guacamole, and add whatever you want from the topping wagon.

I didn't try one myself, but I hear the cookies are good.

"ShooGoo exemplified a quintessential template for a 4-star eatery, boasting an impressive array of delectable fare, generous portion sizes, and a hospitable ambiance, albeit lacking that ineffable je ne sais quoi requisite for a 5-star rating. My filet, complemented by a rich B\u00e9arnaise sauce, proved utterly satisfying, while the culinary piÃ¨ce de rÃ©sistance of our repast arrived in the form of a delectable mushroom dish, artfully paired with the creamy, tangy flavors of Gorgonzola cheese. Moreover, the establishment's picturesque panorama, though ubiquitous throughout Sedona's sun-kissed landscape, added an unquantifiable element of charm to our dining experience."

"While it may be challenging to categorize doughnuts within the traditional food pyramid or seamlessly integrate them into any meal without raising culinary eyebrows, Krispy Kreme remains an unparalleled gift from the realm of sugary indulgence. Should you chance upon this establishment during your travels and catch a glimpse of that alluring, illuminated Hot & Now sign, consider it a momentous occasion worthy of celebration. 

Having had the privilege of partaking in numerous doughnut excursions, I can confidently attest that this particular emporium of warm, gooey delights has never failed to impress. The staff exudes efficiency, effortlessly dispensing a dozen or more melt-in-your-mouth glazed treats with remarkable speed. 

The interior of the shop itself is equally captivating, boasting an entertaining conveyor belt that delightfully mesmerizes younger patrons as it produces a steady stream of freshly crafted doughnuts. This setting transcends mere breakfast or snack time; it is, in essence, a temple dedicated to unadulterated bliss. 

My sole grievance pertains to the somewhat limited accessibility, as the store's placement along Independence Boulevard presents challenges when attempting to enter and exit via the rear or utilizing the nearby drive-thru. Additionally, securing a parking spot within the adjacent lot can prove arduous due to the notorious reputation of road congestion in the area. However, such minor inconveniences are readily offset by the sheer joy that Krispy Kreme's offerings bring. 

Despite my unwavering admiration for this esteemed doughnut purveyor, I must confess that their idiosyncratic spelling choices occasionally raise an eyebrow. Nonetheless, my adoration for Krispy Kreme and its sublime creations persists unabated. Now, as I eagerly anticipate my next visit, I shall continue to extol the virtues of these delectable, hot, and now doughnuts."

This place is another great dive bar on the strip in Pittsburgh.
The Penn Pumpkin Roll is Amazing, but Make sure you ask for the cinnamon and sugar around the rim.
Also they have a beer called Sprecher, Hard root beer, And it tastes  just like Root Beer, awesome.
There is also an Upstairs for extra room and a great View.

"What a phenomenal manner in which to expend an evening, this being our maiden visit to this particular venue. The seating arrangement, encircling the stage 360 degrees, facilitates a captivating experience for all attendees. The vocal renditions surpassed my expectations, while the wigs adorning the thespians were somewhat kitsch; nonetheless, the evening's merriment prevailed. The sole drawback, alas, pertained to the demographic composition of the audience, primarily senior citizens, whose whispers, despite their efforts to remain discreet, proved rather vociferous and, thus, mildly detracted from the overall enjoyment. Notwithstanding, it was evident that they, too, were thoroughly enjoying themselves. To avoid inconvenience, it is advisable to arrive prematurely, as parking spaces become rapidly depleted. Additionally, numerous eateries in close proximity to the theatre provide an excellent opportunity to partake in a culinary excursion prior to the performance."

"Kelly's represents an optimal venue for socializing with acquaintances while consuming beverages, and perhaps indulging in a delectable meal. Personally, I find this establishment appealing. The ambiance offers numerous opportunities to relax and engage in conversation with companions, whether it be in the spacious outdoor seating area or within the intimate interior setting. Although, one may encounter a few drawbacks, such as a potentially lengthy wait for a table or a slightly sluggish pace of service, these minor inconveniences are more than compensated by the superior quality of the culinary offerings. Furthermore, the presence of a velvet rope does not detract from the overall experience, as it simply adds to the exclusive nature of the establishment. In conclusion, Kelly's embodies the quintessential gathering spot for those seeking a refined and enjoyable dining experience, and I highly recommend the short ribs, which truly epitomize gastronomic excellence."

I have perpetually traversed past this eatery and had never halted my steps within its premises until an exigency arose and my companion desired to sample their culinary offerings, and, oh boy, was I elated that we did! Upon entering, one cannot help but feel transported from the frenetic ambiance of South Boulevard and into a distinct realm. The interior design is quite tasteful and sophisticated. Admittedly, the prices may be considered a tad elevated, yet, in my estimation, they were thoroughly worthwhile investments, particularly considering the generous proportions that could easily satiate two individuals. The staff members are exceptionally hospitable and display an unwavering commitment to ensuring a satisfying dining experience, as evidenced by their willingness to go above and beyond to cater to patrons' needs. During our visit, the proprietor was present and magnanimously extended complimentary beverages, which, needless to say, I eagerly accepted with alacrity. In conclusion, I would assign a rating of four out of five stars to this establishment.

I have developed an enhanced fondness for this establishment subsequent to experiencing its interior. Ladies are extended complimentary admission accompanied by gratis beverages from 10-12 pm!! There exists no queue, allowing for a seamless ingress and egress. The personnel, including the exotic dancers, display amicability and courtesy. The potent potables further enhance the overall experience. Although compact, the venue surpasses my initial expectations in terms of capacity, and it offers a relaxation area that can be accessed without incurring any charges. The DJ's performance was not entirely satisfactory, as he committed a few errors or perhaps selected melodies that did not align with my preferences. This locality is highly suitable for gatherings with acquaintances, where one can indulge in complimentary refreshments and unwind in a welcoming atmosphere. Observing the clientele, it appears that certain individuals opted for a more relaxed attire, including males donning only a tee and cap, partnered with females sporting denim and a stylish upper garment. The age demographic of the patrons tends towards maturity.

"The culinary offerings at this establishment are of exceptional quality, with generous portion sizes that obviate the need for supplementary orders. Moreover, the hospitality demonstrated by the staff is truly commendable. However, there is a caveat that precludes me from frequenting this restaurant: a $20 minimum requirement for the usage of credit cards, which poses an inconvenience for an individual such as myself who often dines alone and does not habitually carry paper currency. Consequently, I shall seek alternative dining options that offer comparable gastronomic experiences and do not impose such restrictions on payment methods, located merely a short distance away."

"Deconstructing the culinary experience:  the Samosas were a mediocre 2.5 stars, with questionable ingredients such as Potatoes and cilantro; however, the wrapping was satisfactory.  The Naan was unremarkable, with a rating of 3 stars, exhibiting adequate baking techniques but lacking in distinctive flavor or texture.  In contrast, the Kashmiri Dum Aloo was a delightful surprise, garnering a perfect 5-star rating due to its well-balanced spicing (a nuanced 6 out of 10), luscious creaminess, and expertly cooked potatoes that avoided both mushiness and excessive firmness.  Unfortunately, the Vegetable Jalfrezi was marred by an overindulgence in cooking oil, resulting in a deduction of one star; nonetheless, it remained a skillfully prepared dish.  Notably, the rice was impeccable, and the attentive service ensured my water glass remained consistently replenished.  Moreover, I derived enjoyment from the Bollywood videos displayed on the restaurant's televisions.  Ultimately, I shall return to explore further offerings from their extensive menu."

I really like this restaurant... for the west island. In town it's nothing special. But thank god someone has opened a proper byow in this area. It's my official go to place when my dad wants to eat dinner now. 

The pizzas are great and I've enjoyed the various pasta dishes I've tried. 

Word to the wise... This place is actually busy so RSVP.

Guys must wear shirts with sleeves, even when the weather is ridiculously hot in Vegas.  Pricy, but the food and interior make up for it.  Lots and different choices of things to be put on the your plate. Their desserts are actually good compared to other buffets. Their corn on the cob is super delicious!!!

"The spinach artichoke dip is an absolute culinary masterpiece, its delectable flavors tantalizing my taste buds with each successive bite, although I must admit that its portion size has diminished somewhat over time, a circumstance that, while slightly disappointing, does not detract from the dish's overall gastronomic excellence; the potency of the drinks served here is also quite impressive, providing a most satisfying experience for those who partake of them; our server, Matt, is an exceptionally attentive and knowledgeable individual whose recommendations and assistance greatly enhanced our dining experience, facilitating our decision-making process and contributing to a most enjoyable evening out; furthermore, my companion particularly appreciates the menu's inclusion of health-conscious options, such as the two for $20 deal, which affords us the opportunity to sample a variety of dishes without compromising our dietary goals."

"JD and I were seeking a supremely informal dining establishment for our noontime repast on the weekend, and subsequent to his suggestion, we decided upon this particular venue, which proved to be an ideal selection. The complimentary tortilla chips and salsa were of exceptional quality, or perhaps my palate had been heightened by the physical exertion I had recently engaged in at the gymnasium, likely a combination of both factors. 

JD opted for a cheese crisp, which prompted me to facetiously inquire as to whether he was adhering to a restrictive dietary regimen. My jest was quickly rendered null and void, however, when the gargantuan, grease-laden, cheese-topped flatbread arrived at our table. Its enormity was truly astounding! A delicate, crispy tortilla served as the foundation for an abundance of molten, delectable cheese, strategically sectioned into squares, much like a certain type of pie, facilitating ease of consumption. In contrast, my selection of enchiladas, emblazoned with the colors of the Mexican flag, were passable, yet failed to elicit the same level of enthusiasm as the colossal, melted cheese-topped flatbread that sat opposite me. 

In summary, the meal was quite satisfying, and while it may have negated any health benefits I had accrued through my recent gym visit, such is life, and I am content with this reality."

Rito's unquestionably boasts the most delectable red chile and beans in the world, perhaps even surpassing intergalactic culinary standards, now that Pluto's planetary status has been revoked. Don't allow yourself to be intimidated by the timid assertions of those who claim the surrounding area is daunting; after all, the contrast between the urban and suburban environments can be jarring, especially for those residing in Sun City. On any given day, the restaurant will be teeming with diverse patrons, including city workers, certified public accountants, medical personnel from Good Samaritan Hospital, educators, and, on occasion, an enigmatic individual or two. This family-owned eatery serves up exquisite cuisine that is simply unparalleled. Although the menu may be limited, it is abundant in gastronomic excellence, rendering the prices eminently reasonable. For those seeking bland, mass-produced fare, a visit to Taco Bell on McDowell Road may be more suitable. If, however, you crave flavorful, artisanal dishes imbued with passion, Rito's is the superior choice. Indulge in their exceptional guacamole tacos, which are truly sublime. These delectable morsels are so addictive that, were they to become scarce, I would resort to unconventional means, even targeting unsuspecting senior citizens, to sustain my fix. Alas, if only Rito's would elevate their beverage options by offering fountain drinks, it would be a welcome enhancement. Unfortunately, relying solely on canned soda proves insufficient during sweltering summer months.

This fitness facility is utterly remarkable! Upon entering Gold's Gym Elite, I experienced a sensation akin to checking into an upscale hotel, such as The W, owing to its contemporary, stylish, and immaculate ambiance. My decision to join was unequivocal, as I was exceedingly delighted about the prospect of being a member of such a distinguished establishment. The premises are meticulously maintained, which is a crucial aspect of any fitness center. The personnel are exceptionally friendly and helpful, eager to assist patrons in any manner they can. The cardio equipment is truly impressive, boasting state-of-the-art features such as personal televisions and connectivity options for iPods. Although the absence of a swimming pool may be considered a minor drawback by some, the breathtaking vistas from the gym's location compensate for this trifling shortcoming. While engaging in my customary cardiovascular routine, I had the privilege of observing numerous aircraft descending upon Sky Harbor, rendering the experience even more captivating. Unlike many other well-attended gyms in the area, Gold's Gym Elite in Phoenix maintains a comfortable level of occupancy, ensuring that exercising there is a genuinely pleasurable experience. In fact, I opted to terminate my membership with a previous gym due to its excessive congestion and unhygienic restrooms, choosing instead to join this superior establishment.

As much as I want to love buffets, my stomach tends to disagree. Mass produced food sitting under heating lamps doesn't hold much appeal for me. Fortunately, Studio B is one of the few buffets where quality trumps quantity and is worth the trip.

Dinner runs about $25 Monday - Thursday, weekend seafood ups the price by about $10. Considering that an entree and a beer at restaurants like Cheesecake Factory runs about the same price, its really not a bad deal. What makes the price worth is the unlimited beer and wine available at buffet. I was surprised to see craft draft beer along with ciders, and a couple wines to pick from.

In terms of food there is something for everyone. Sushi, multiple carving stations along with plenty of vegetarian and healthier options. The desert station features enough to satisfy even the most discerning sweet tooth and gets extra points for having gelato and milkshakes. The buffet itself looks great. Modern design, comfortable seating, unobstructed views of the Vegas strip and a open kitchen ensures cleanliness. 

The lines can get long on busier days so come prepared. Also check out the M Players Club as they offer free buffets for players.

I recently had the privilege of becoming a member of this esteemed fitness facility, and my experience thus far has been nothing short of exceptional. The personnel stationed at the front desk have consistently displayed a remarkable level of cordiality and warmth, extending a friendly greeting upon each visit. Furthermore, I have had the opportunity to partake in my fitness regimen at varying intervals throughout the day, and I have invariably found an abundance of state-of-the-art equipment designed to target specific muscle groups. In point of fact, I have yet to encounter a single instance wherein I was unable to locate a suitable machine for my needs. Additionally, I must commend the juice bar on its impressive selection of healthy beverages, which have proven to be an invaluable complement to my workouts. It is worth mentioning that the staff manning the juice bar have consistently demonstrated a high degree of proficiency and congeniality in their interactions with patrons. Moreover, I have not encountered any difficulties in securing parking accommodations, which has greatly facilitated my visits to the gym. Lastly, I must say that the overall ambiance of the facility is truly pleasant and well-maintained, creating an ideal environment for individuals to pursue their fitness goals. Based on my experiences, I would unhesitatingly recommend this gym to anyone seeking a top-notch fitness establishment.

Last night, a trio of us partook of a culinary excursion at this establishment, and I can unequivocally state that I shall return. The hospitality we received was exceptional, with Emily providing sterling service and Daryl, the proprietor, exhibiting great benevolence by visiting our table post-meal to ensure our satisfaction. My sole suggestion for enhancement would be to augment the portion size of the introductory courses, as their modest dimensions prompted us to order multiple servings, which, in turn, rendered them relatively pricey. However, the primary dishes proved to be delectable, with my selection of curried tofu earning high praise, Martha's jerk chicken eliciting a passionate response, and Binnie's chicken and dumplings offering a singular and savory experience. Unanimously, we agreed that a future visit would be in order.

One of the classic hotels of Las Vegas...due to the BUFFETS :p

  It's a great, simple hotel nothing too over the top but definitely worth the stay here. Despite the age of the Rio they did a great job updating the furniture, making it contemporary and very comfortable.

  There was a long line at check in but what do you expect? It's the weekend, everyone goes to Vegas on the weekends. But once we got to the front of the line the staff was very helpful and cordial.

  Personally if I had to deal with all those people, I would lose my mind haha, so kudos to the staff of the Rio for keeping their cool. Obviously it's a little far from the strip so bring extra money for cabs.

Still a great place to stay after all these years, keep it going Rio :D

Incredible pizza, great ambiance and terrific service. 

We really enjoyed this Old Town spot next to the Poisoned Pen Bookstore. We split an Emiliana salad at the recommendation of the owner followed by an Italian Sausage and mushroom pizza. Both were excellent as was the selection of wines. 

I thought I'd order a Sangiovese as it was lunch, and I wanted something light. They brought out 3 wines to try and we ended up going with a Tuscan Cabernet blend which was terrific. 

This place makes the list of "spots to go back to" in Scottsdale! Great service, great food and really nice ambiance!

"My culinary exploits were rather limited on this particular occasion, as I opted to sample merely a pair of items from the extensive menu; specifically, the green chili burro and beef taco. Furthermore, my dining experience was somewhat compromised by the fact that I elected to procure my meal via takeout, which undoubtedly diminished the overall quality of the fare in comparison to the traditional in-house dining format. However, I must confess that the green chili component of the burro was indeed a notable highlight, striking an impressive balance between piquancy and mildness that elevated it to a position of gastronomic prominence. Additionally, the tortillas accompanying the taco were quite satisfactory, exhibiting a pleasing texture and flavor profile that complemented the savory contents within. While the beef taco itself was certainly palatable, I cannot help but feel that the full potential of its gustatory delight remained unrealized due to my decision to consume it outside the establishment; thus, I shall endeavor to partake of it within the restaurant's welcoming confines at some point in the future."

"The ambiance of this particular location served as an optimal setting for my maiden musical performance at the Joint, whereupon I had the privilege of witnessing an extraordinary display of artistic virtuosity courtesy of none other than the inimitable Prince, whose captivating spectacle I was able to appreciate both from the vantage point of the floor, as well as from the comfort of an exclusive suite; truly, a most unforgettable experience."

We usually stay at the LaQuinta in Scottsdale when we're in town. Since we had to be at the courthouse early in the morn I booked a room for mom and I at the LaQuinta on Thomas. Bad Idea. When I pulled up, felt like I was bringing my mom along with me on an early evening drug score at the local dingey motel. But it was LaQuinta! We were outta there with the quickness!

Drove up the 17 a couple exits and saw the Residence Inn and my mom practically turned the steering wheel herself and yelled, "GET OFF HERE!!" Just kidding. We were anxious for a comfortable room, safe place.. and we were starving!

Our AAA rate dropped us down 40 bucks. LaQuinta only knocked off 10.. which still would've costed about $99. For that dive?!?!

There were white picket fences around the AC boxed outside the room which added a comfy-cozy touch to the place. The room was a cute studio with a kitchen. They even go grocery shopping for you! Breakfast was the works. Sausage, waffles, scrambles, fruit... none of that continental carbo breakfast crap. 

Comfortable atmosphere, cozy rooms, great night sleep before a stressful day. Thank you, Residence Inn! To top it all off, our court-case concluded victorious! Yippeeee!

This caf\u00e9, conveniently situated opposite McGill, is a very good addition to the downtown scene. The coffee is excellent, and the owner Jason and his colleagues provide friendly service. The pastries, which come from a small bakery in the east end, are delicious (think muffins like mother used to make). I drop in as often as I can.

"I am an immense devotee of Re Salon & Med Spa, and my ardent admiration for their exceptional services has only augmented over time. The entire team at the salon is remarkably talented, and the personalized attention they lavish upon each client creates an unparalleled experience. Having visited the salon on numerous occasions over the past six months, I have had the pleasure of indulging in a variety of treatments, ranging from intricate cuts and colors to meticulous manicures and pedicures. Furthermore, if you seek the expertise of a master colorist and stylist, I highly recommend scheduling an appointment with Bethany, whose proficiency in her craft is truly remarkable and unmatched."

The experience was great, smooth ride, great views and info, and tasty sandwich plus champagne - just as promised in the tour brochure. However there were 6 passengers in our helicopter, and  I felt crushed with hardly an inch to move.  I must add that we were all of average size. Otherwise I would have given this  5 stars.

***Dinner buffet review***
Reasonable price for nice variety including crabs and prime rib

So my husband and I are very much buffet fanatics when visiting Vegas.  We usually end up going to buffet at least once a day.  

We always loved Bellagio buffet and have been here several times.  It has a great mix of pretty much what you expect in a buffet.  Considering price, food choices (seafood included), ambiance, it is a solid 4 stars.

* Food:  
- Snow and King crabs = cut in half and COLD.  The best thing about the crabs here is that they have plenty of them out so you won't have to stand in line for so long.  (HINT:  Snow crabs are actually more tasty than the King crabs...I know, it's werid)

- Prime Rib = very yummy, very fast line.

* Price: $29.95/person (Thursday night)

* Ambiance = typical casino buffet.  Very nice but not so nice that you feel awkward carrying a plate full of crab legs and melted butter.  

* Service = Very attentive.  No need to ask for refills or taking away dirty dishes.

"I would have conceivably awarded this establishment three stars had it not been for the delectable green chili stew and the diverse array of dessert frybreads that profoundly impacted my culinary experience. 

While the assorted frybread tacos are undoubtedly palatable, they fail to distinguish themselves as particularly extraordinary. However, I do derive immense satisfaction from the chorizo variant, which I customarily consume with an excessive amount of piquant sauce. 

This eatery serves as a suitable venue for satiating one's craving for something moderately unique, or, more specifically, for indulging one's sweet tooth, as evidenced by the cheerful emoticon at the end of my statement."

"It is our considered opinion that this barbecue establishment offers a culinary experience of considerable quality, substantiated by our personal encounter with their extensive sampler platter, which we found to be thoroughly enjoyable in its entirety. The tender and flavorful meat literally slid off the bones of the ribs, while the pulled pork exhibited an exceptional degree of taste and texture. Furthermore, the ambiance and diverse array of comestibles available contributed to an atmosphere reminiscent of a familial gathering, specifically that of a visit to one's grandparents. Consequently, we shall unquestionably revisit this eatery in the future."

After an array of dining establishments, including Planet Dailies and Trader Vic's, I experienced an immense sense of satisfaction upon arriving at P F Chang's, owing to its provision of delectable culinary offerings, relatively prompt and attentive service, and prices that were reasonable and aligning with my expectations. Although there were a few minor drawbacks, they were largely eclipsed by my overall positive experience at P F Chang's, which I significantly preferred in comparison to other dining options.
