Buzzberry, while perhaps not the most exceptional purveyor of caffeinated beverages, suffices as an adequate venue for satisfying one's craving for a cup of coffee, and it is equally important to recognize the significance of supporting local businesses. The personnel at Buzzberry are typically cordial and efficient in their service, ensuring that patrons receive their orders in a timely manner. For those who prefer larger portions, it is advisable to request the "secret menu" option, which offers a more copious quantity of the desired beverage.

"Since my arrival in Las Vegas several months ago, I have had the opportunity to experience a variety of accommodations, and while the Downtown Grand may not be the most luxurious, it certainly boasts a unique charm. The color scheme, reminiscent of an oceanfront resort, combined with the modern furnishings, creates a striking contrast that belies its affordable price point. Each room is equipped with a flat-screen television, ample closet space, and a generous array of dresser drawers, providing everything one might need for a comfortable stay, with the notable exception of a refrigerator. Unfortunately, the establishment's policy of charging additional fees for services such as internet access, which is ostensibly complimentary, but buried within the daily hotel fee of $12, leaves much to be desired. Furthermore, the $50 per day hold for potential damages raises concerns about the security deposit process. For guests opting to park their vehicles across the street at the self-parking facility, the dimly lit and eerie ambiance may engender feelings of unease. Notwithstanding these drawbacks, the Downtown Grand remains a suitable choice for its central location in downtown Las Vegas, and the dining options available in the lobby are consistent with the overall quality of the establishment."
I don't know where everyone was but this is a rad little place. Pretty good food, cheap beers and quite delicious. Very personable staff as well. I enjoyed my visit.

The food is always solid here, it may as well be called the cheesecake factory because everything tastes the same.  I laugh because my friends always go lets go to Grand Lux because it's cheap there, then we never really get out paying less than $20 a person for just the meal no drinks, lol.  Yeah it's cheap for Vegas, but when you eat here for late dinner everynight (3am or so) it adds up for just drunkie food, lol.  If you've only got a half hour to dine, call ahead to order because the service isn't that quick.
Our dinner was delicious and our waiter, Christopher, was the BEST! He made us feel special and took GREAT care of us! We definitely want to go back.

"It would be disingenuous of me to assert that I partake in the culinary offerings provided by this establishment, for I am cognizant of the fact that the quality of the fare served herein is merely passable. Frankly, my dear, I do not experience an insatiable craving for hot dogs, although I must confess that the funnel cakes do pique my interest when my sweet tooth is acting up! However, the sole item I purchase from this venue is their refreshing lemonade, which quenches my thirst and satiates my taste buds with its delectable flavors of regular, lime, and cherry. I eschew the frozen variety, as it does not provide the same intensity of flavor that a freshly prepared beverage can offer. Each and every time I dine at a different restaurant within the mall, I abstain from ordering a drink, opting instead to acquire said lemonade from Hot Dog on a Stick, due to its delightful and satisfying qualities that bring me internal contentment. My personal preferences lean towards the lime and cherry flavors, though I must caution that the sweetness level may prove overwhelming for those who are not ardent devotees of saccharine potables. Furthermore, I must mention that the cost is somewhat steep, yet I believe it to be a worthwhile investment when considering the pleasure it brings in complementing one's meal. Lastly, I recommend avoiding proximity to Hot Dog on a Stick during mealtimes, as the audible sounds emanating from the workers vigorously squeezing lemons can be somewhat unsettling, even to the point of inducing trepidation."

"In my subjective assessment, this eatery offers the most exceptional culinary experience in the entire city of Las Vegas, with a constantly evolving menu that showcases an array of inventive dishes and beverages that are truly otherworldly. Considering its unpretentious ambiance and obscure location, this restaurant can be regarded as a veritable hidden treasure. My personal preference led me to sample their short rib gorgonzola polenta, which was nothing short of extraordinary, boasting a rich, velvety texture and bursting with bold, savory flavors that left a lasting impression on my palate."

"Upon our initial visit, we opted to sample the diverse tapas offerings on their happy hour menu, but unfortunately, our expectations were not entirely fulfilled. However, we decided to give the establishment another chance during our return visit last Sunday, as I was particularly hankering for a delectable Paella dish. To our delight, the culinary experience was drastically different this time around, with each dish showcasing notable improvements in taste and presentation. Our order consisted of Paella, Camarones Al Ajillo, and Brochettas De Pollo, all of which proved to be satisfying selections. In particular, the Camarones Al Ajillo was an undeniable standout, prompting my companion to nearly clean his plate with relish. Consequently, we are eagerly anticipating our next visit."

As an epicurean, I was utterly thrilled to partake in a culinary excursion at the esteemed eatery of none other than the illustrious Gordon Ramsay. While indulging in a weekend sojourn in the city of Las Vegas, my companion and I opted to treat ourselves to an unforgettable gastronomical experience.

Upon perusing the menu, I settled upon the delectable lamb dish, which, to my delight, proved to be an unmitigated success. Each bite dissolved effortlessly in my mouth, leaving an indelible impression of pure gustatory rapture. In addition, I requested a side dish of mashed potatoes, which, much to my satisfaction, lived up to their reputation as a quintessential complement to the main course.

Regrettably, my spouse and our mutual acquaintance did not share in the euphoria of my dining experience. My better half, having harbored a deep-seated desire to sample Ramsay's innovative interpretation of the traditional shepherd's pie, was sadly disillusioned by the dish's unfortunate presentation. Arriving at our table in a state akin to a broth, my husband's meal elicited an air of disappointment, prompting him to regard his food with a mixture of dismay and chagrin.

Muster ing up the resolve to communicate our dissatisfaction to the attentive wait staff, I eventually mustered the courage to convey our displeasure. Following the return and subsequent re preparation of my spouse's meal, we were presented with a gratuitous dessert, a magnanimous gesture that served as a fitting conclusion to our evening's culinary exploits.

In closing, I cannot help but express a fervent desire to partake in such lavish dining experiences with greater regularity, as the mere thought of savoring the sublime flavors and textures of Ramsay's creations evokes within me an unwavering sense of gastronomical bliss.

"An exceptional culinary experience for the morning or midday repast, offering a wide array of delectable and health-conscious selections that cater to discerning palates, thereby providing a satisfying and well-balanced gastronomic encounter."

"The interior and exterior ambiance was deficient, which made me question whether I should adhere to my lunch reservation upon arriving at an unoccupied shopping center via taxi. However, I am grateful that I chose to do so, as the culinary experience that ensued was quite satisfactory. 

The chicken wings seasoned with black pepper and garlic were cooked to perfection, possessing a delightful crispiness and a rich, savory flavor profile that was further elevated by the subtle sweetness of the garlic spice rub applied before frying. 

The pork fried rice, while initially underwhelming, was transformed into a delectable dish through the addition of the same spice rub used for the wings, as well as Thai bird chili and fish sauce from the adjacent chili cart. The pork, cut into larger, thin squares, benefited from the extra seasoning, although I generally prefer thicker and longer slices for their tenderness and juiciness. 

The service we received was both timely and cordial, rounding out a satisfying dining encounter."

Mulligan's Border is one of a boat load of taverns around Las Vegas and while it has your standard bar and video poker it also has really good food and great service. They take their bar food to the next level by understanding how to prepare and serve it.

It is fair to say that I have had just about everything on the menu there and I have not found anything that disappointed me. My personal standard is just a simple burger cooked medium rare. The burger comes to me juicy and tasty and the bun is toasted correctly so it does not fall apart. There is something to be said for a good burger and that alone has kept me and my wife coming back for more. We call this place our "Cheers" because everyone seems to know our names.

They do not have a huge menu, but the menu they have they do well and I like that. You can tweak your meal here and their and they do not put up a fuss and if the server does not know if it can be done he talks to the chef and they get it done. Like I said, service is top notch. They may not "Crumb the Table" but they do make your experience there as good as possible and that too is commendable.

Yeah, me and my wife are fans and we go there several times a week. Give it a try.

This establishment exudes an ambiance that is simultaneously eccentric and practical, catering to the needs and preferences of the Arizona State University community with remarkable efficiency. I wholeheartedly endorse this venue as a budget-friendly destination for libations and a diverse array of vegetarian culinary options. The interior decor boasts an impressive collection of artwork, while the selection of promotional materials available is unparalleled west of the Mississippi River. Additionally, I had the pleasure of attending a craft fair organized by local, independent artisans this weekend, an event that is expected to recur on a regular basis, specifically on the second Saturday of each month.

"The park is renowned for its extensive network of single-track mountain biking trails, spanning an impressive distance of approximately 6.5 miles. Its diverse terrain caters to a wide range of skill levels, with challenging features such as roots and other natural obstacles that contribute to a thrilling and technical riding experience."

We have had the pleasure of dining at Biaggio's on two separate occasions this week, with the first visit taking place on Monday and the second on Thursday; however, both experiences were of a take-out nature. During our initial visit, my fiancÃ© opted for a pizza and a set of chicken wings, the latter of which can best be described as utterly delectable and dangerously addictive. The wings possess a delightful crunchiness on the exterior, complemented by an interior that is remarkably moist, and when paired with a tangy ranch or hot sauce, the result is nothing short of culinary perfection. In contrast, the pizza, while certainly enjoyable, did not quite live up to the lofty standards set by the wings. Our order consisted of a straightforward pepperoni pizza, with the remaining half being divided between mushrooms and sausage.  
On our second visit, we decided to sample one of Biaggio's renowned stromboli, and we were pleasantly surprised by its generous size. Our selection featured chicken accompanied by artichokes and red peppers, and while the inclusion of artichokes was undoubtedly a welcome touch, it is our belief that the more affordable 6.99 stromboli options are superior to the pricier specialty variety, which carried a hefty price tag of 12.99. Although both meals tallied approximately thirty dollars, we cannot help but feel that such a sum is somewhat excessive for a mere pie and wings. Nonetheless, the wings at Biaggio's possess an unparalleled quality that ensures our future patronage.

Since my previous assessment, Devil's Diner has experienced a shift in proprietorship and a transformation in culinary expertise, resulting in a marked enhancement in the preparation of their delectable offerings, which are now not only flavorsome but also obtainable at a reasonable tariff. Additionally, the ambiance of the establishment has become considerably more welcoming and congenial, fostering an atmosphere of warmth and hospitality that is sure to delight patrons.

I make it an objective to visit Serendipity when I'm in vegas.. for the Frrrrozen hot chocolate and the nachos. That's what I order, every single time I come to vegas and I'm probably going to continue to do that =)\n\nThe wait is always super long though, that's the only down side. But, if you're only looking to get the frozen hot chocolate or anything else, they have a to-go window on the side!

"An intimate ambiance permeates the interior, while an enchanting patio beckons guests to indulge in a culinary journey that transcends the mundane, with fare that tantalizes the taste buds and hospitality that epitomizes excellence, rendering this establishment a veritable gem; however, the mixology offerings, though creative in concept, fell short of my expectations, thereby precluding a perfect rating, yet I unhesitatingly endorse reserving space for the delectable sweet treats that cap off the meal, elevating the dining experience to a truly memorable occasion."

Re: Grooming Salon. Specifically, Katie, the cat handler.

It is near to impossible to find cat groomers in this town. Some vets offer the service but after today's visit to Petsmart I won't go anywhere else. So the deal is I have a demon cat. Well, she's lovely and adorable with me, but for some reason fears all pet workers. No clue why, nothing bad has ever happened to her. 

Katie works Tuesday through Friday and starts at 7am, which I can appreciate because no one else should have to witness the dramatics my cat puts on. I arrived after calling ahead to see if Katie could shave Josie's haunches, so as to avoid bits clinging to her backside (gross.)  Katie got an E-collar on Josie and told me she was going to have to scruff her while she worked, which was just fine with me because the cat was screaming like a murder victim and otherwise being embarrassing. In less than ten minutes the job was done (for only $6!) and Josie was back in her carrier like nothing happened. 

Look, I had a veterinarian tell me that if I brought Josie in for any grooming they would SEDATE her, and she also recommended I get her declawed, which I believe is inhumane. Maybe Katie considers what she does completely normal and reasonable, but she's the first professional who has worked with Josie...professionally. 

I know my cat is a total freak but I can't shave her ass myself, so thank god Katie is at Petsmart. Seriously.

I have had the pleasure of partaking in the culinary delights offered by this esteemed establishment on multiple occasions throughout the years, and I must say that the quality of the fare has been consistently superior, with each dish showcasing a masterful blend of flavors and techniques that are hallmarks of the finest Asian cuisine. Furthermore, the level of service provided by the staff has been nothing short of exceptional, demonstrating a profound commitment to ensuring that each patron's experience is nothing short of extraordinary. Thus, if one is seeking a rapid, delectable, and hassle-free dining experience in close proximity to this venue, then this restaurant would be an excellent choice.
I was pleasantly surprised by poutine. They have a nice variety of choices. The House Special poutine was my favorite. The service was good and plenty of room for our party of six.

"This culinary establishment boasts an affordable pricing structure, rendering it accessible to a wide range of patrons. Furthermore, they offer an extensive array of delectable dishes, including the Satay Chicken, which unfortunately possessed an excessive degree of desiccation, thereby rendering it arduous to consume. However, the Pineapple Fried Rice proved to be a notable exception, as its flavorsome and savory qualities piqued my interest, prompting me to partake in multiple servings. Additionally, their Thai Tea, with its pronounced sweetness, complemented the meal nicely, while the Phat Thai, a traditional Thai noodle dish, also garnered praise for its palatable execution. Notably, the Green Curry Paste Fried Rice, with its potent spiciness, served as a testament to the kitchen's proficiency in crafting dishes that cater to diverse taste buds."

"Although the extrication of styrofoam from the edifice at times seemed anomalous, and the percussive sounds emanating from the construction site were somewhat bothersome, our abode proved to be exceptional. Having experienced the luxury of timeshares previously, the absence of daily housekeeping services did not come as a surprise. The expansive and well-appointed unit served as a welcoming refuge during our six-day sojourn. In concurrence with Lorraine's sentiment, the comportment of the washer/dryer bordered on impertinence, as it compelled us to await its convenience before granting access. The secret to an abundance of towels lay in the aquatic recreational area; through judicious distribution, we amassed a formidable collection of nearly one hundred towels by the time of our departure. The staff members exhibited unwavering helpfulness and accommodation, with our acquaintance Gauge, the valet attendant, demonstrating remarkable dedication to his duties, save for the head of security, who displayed marked intransigence in refusing to provide my indisposed companion with a key, despite engaging in telephonic conversation. The pool, while modest in dimensions, boasted an impressive array of amenities, including a hot tub and bar, which facilitated our rapid adjustment to its limitations (a circumstance attributed to the restrictive legislation governing pool depth in Las Vegas). Considering its prime location, spotless and contemporary accommodations, and the advantage of a fully equipped kitchen for post-nocturnal arrivals, this lodging establishment warrants future patronage."

"Check this one off the bucket list! I can now expire a contented camper subsequent to visiting the Mustard Museum! 

The subterranean region serves as the minuscule yet aptly named "museum" space, which, granted, may not be particularly spacious, but one must acknowledge that the extent of a museum dedicated to mustard can only be so vast. My expectations were admittedly centered around the presence of antiquated mustard-related relics hailing from ancient civilizations such as Egypt, Rome, or Greece; however, my hopes in this regard remained unfulfilled. Nonetheless, the establishment compensated for this deficiency by showcasing an extensive array of mustard samples from across the globe, which I found quite enjoyable! 

The upper level serves as the sampling area and point of purchase for the various mustard varieties. It is worth mentioning that I did not depart the premises without relinquishing $25.00, a sum I deemed reasonable considering the exceptional quality of the products and the hospitable demeanor of the staff. 

In conclusion, I would advise those who do not harbor an affinity for mustard to refrain from visiting the Mustard Museum, as their experience is unlikely to be optimal."

Considering its location within the Hard Rock Hotel, the ambiance was not as boisterous as the floor, while the lighting was idyllic, complemented by an upscale decor that exuded modernity. Now, pertaining to the cuisine, as it was my maiden visit, the server advised me to sample their specialty dishes, which I did, and was utterly captivated by the gastronomical experience, commencing with the yellow tail sashimi accompanied by JalapeÃ±o, followed by the black cod miso. However, I digressed from the server's suggestion and opted for the Chef's sashimi, which was merely average. On future visits, I shall unquestionably adhere to the server's counsel and strongly advocate for indulging in their hallmark dishes. The somewhat lackluster sashimi was compensated for by the delectable dessert offerings, presenting an array of options, culminating in my selection of the Vanilla Tapioca. Although the sake was slightly more expensive than customary, it was undoubtedly worth the expenditure. The service was deliberate, yet ideal for savoring a leisurely dinner, allowing for a relaxed conversation with one's companion while relishing the evening's events. In conclusion, I would unhesitatingly return to sample their Beef Wagyu Beef or other iconic dishes, cognizant of the fact that this is by no means an economical dining establishment, with an expected expenditure of at least $150 per individual, but thoroughly worthwhile for the atmosphere and the overall experience.

"As a habitual patron of this establishment, I can confidently attest to the fact that their Thursday night trivia sessions are an absolute delight. Moreover, their culinary offerings extend beyond the customary bar fare, boasting an array of fresh salads, assorted wraps, and pizzas that are moderately satisfying. However, it is important to note that the venue's propensity for crowding is a direct result of its limited capacity and popularity among sports enthusiasts in the South Main (SoMo) area. On one particularly eventful Sunday evening, I had the privilege of witnessing a heavily intoxicated individual unleash a physical altercation upon one of the expansive windows situated at the forefront of the building, resulting in an exhilarating display of shattered glass."

Located in close proximity to the culinary establishment, Metro Pizza, this particular retail outlet has been in operation for an extensive period of time. Due to the absence of a Fresh & Easy store in my immediate vicinity, I have been compelled to seek out an alternative source for acquiring fresh produce. This specific location is extremely convenient in relation to my place of employment, thereby making it an ideal option for me to purchase the items I require. The frequency of customers at this store is relatively low, which makes parking and checking out a straightforward process. Recently, I purchased several items including packages of kiwi, peaches, a package of celery, a three-pound bag of apples, and a bunch of bananas for a total cost of $12.05. In light of the fact that F & E is currently closed, I have been frequenting this store more often as of late, although the quality of the products available can be somewhat unpredictable, much like the 99 cents only store. During my most recent visit, I observed two employees working, one serving as a cashier and the other responsible for restocking inventory.

This appraisal pertains exclusively to the sushi bar facet of AJ's culinary establishment. My patronage of this eatery's sushi bar commenced in 2006, at which time the sushi artisans exhibited exceptional skill and proficiency, thereby warranting a four-star rating. However, in the ensuing years, AJ's sushi bar has undergone significant changes, including a high turnover rate among its staff, abbreviated operating hours, and a noticeable decline in the quality of its seafood and overall value relative to the cost. Lamentably, I shall be compelled to seek an alternative venue for my sushi take-out needs, as AJ's sushi bar no longer fulfills my expectations.

Update 2013: AJ's sushi bar has reinstated several of its former sushi chefs, resulting in a marked improvement in the quality of its offerings. Consequently, this eatery has once again become one of my preferred destinations for take-out sushi, and I am delighted by their return to form.

"An exceptional gaming establishment catering to local patrons, offering an assortment of craps tables that are deemed superior by seasoned players. The ambiance of the circular bar is merely adequate, as it tends to attract an older demographic of women who frequent the premises. Despite its proximity to the renowned Las Vegas Strip, the duration of a taxi ride is approximately fifteen minutes, making it a convenient and viable alternative to the frenetic energy of the city's primary tourist destination. The guest rooms are contemporary and well-appointed, providing visitors with a comfortable and luxurious respite from the bustling activity of the gaming floor. The pool area is similarly impressive, boasting a serene atmosphere that is enhanced by the presence of a skilled bartender who has previously worked at this very establishment. One of the most appealing aspects of this venue is that it offers a relaxed and tranquil environment, allowing patrons to unwind and enjoy themselves without the overwhelming sensory stimulation that is often associated with the Strip. Additionally, the property features a spacious Bingo hall, a bowling alley, and a state-of-the-art theatre that hosts a variety of performances, although it is advisable to avoid visiting during peak hours on weekends due to the prevalence of rowdy teenagers and high school students. Fortunately, the security team takes proactive measures to maintain order and ensure a pleasant experience for all patrons. Furthermore, the casino is situated directly across from a small shopping plaza, providing visitors with access to a range of retail stores and services, including Best Buy, Marshalls, gas stations, and a COSTCO outlet. Those who have enjoyed their time at the Green Valley casino will likely appreciate this establishment, as it shares the same ownership and design."

yum!!!  i actually ordered cran-slam club... it was good, but i did find the turkey a bit dry...  but my cousins ordered capastrami and the bobbie... so of course i had to take a bite of their sandwiches... the bobbie was soooo yummy!!!!  having tasted my sandwich, i have to say that it's the stuffing that makes the bobbie so yummy and not so dry!!!!  and capastrami was also very good!!!\n\njust found out there's a capriottis in beverly hills...i can't wait to go there and order the bobbie!!!

"Although my dining experience at Ramen Sora was undoubtedly satisfying, it failed to elicit a profoundly jaw-dropping response from me, unlike the unparalleled culinary masterpiece that I had the pleasure of savoring at Monta. Notwithstanding, the assortment of flavors showcased an unmistakable originality, while the ingredients exhibited an unwavering commitment to freshness and meticulous preparation. However, the palette of flavors did not quite achieve the same level of subtle refinement that I had the privilege of experiencing at Monta. I opted for the spicy miso ramen, which, much to my surprise, did not live up to its promised fiery intensity. Nevertheless, I would not hesitate to order it again, and if I were a resident of Las Vegas, I could envision myself frequenting this establishment with unwavering regularity."

This place is really quirky, but awesome if you get to know it. It's Beatles themed, and the menu is goofy, but the fried cheese curds are fantastic, as is the jalapeno popper burger. The turkey swiss and slaw sandwich is also a winner.\n\nIf you really want a great experience, go on a Tuesday night and play trivia. Kim, the trivia reader, is hilarious, and the waitstaff are super sweet and really friendly. They have a decent beer selection

"As an individual who regularly utilizes the B concourse at this aerodrome, I can confidently attest to the superior quality of the pizza proffered by this establishment. While it may not be the most exceptional specimen I have had the pleasure of consuming, it is undoubtedly a refreshing departure from the exorbitant prices ubiquitous at all airport vendors. This eatery offers a thoroughly satisfying and reasonable dining experience, which, I would venture to guess, is a popular destination for aircrew members; such an endorsement speaks volumes about the venue's culinary prowess."

"We had the pleasure of indulging in the Dynamite Sandwich, which, according to the establishment's website, boasts an intriguing medley of sliced brisket, peppers, chilis, onions, and jalapeÃ±os, all sautÃ©ed with Red Diamond sauce and served atop a jalapeÃ±o roll, accompanied by melted pepperjack cheese. Our experience with this dish was nothing short of delightful, as it lived up to its name and delivered a satisfyingly spicy flavor profile. However, we did find ourselves yearning for more substantial portions, as the serving size was somewhat diminutive.  

Notwithstanding this minor drawback, our dining experience was further enhanced by the exceptional quality of the Fried Onion Strings. These delectable morsels, characterized by a delicate crust and a judicious balance of flavors, showcased the culinary prowess of the kitchen. The onions were cooked to perfection, offering a subtle sweetness that complemented the dish without overpowering it. Moreover, the absence of excessive grease was a welcome surprise, making each bite a delightful explosion of flavors.  

While we would have preferred larger portions, the reasonable price point of $1.95 made the dish an excellent value. Furthermore, we were thrilled to discover that the restaurant offers a $12.95 all-you-can-eat lunch buffet on the first Wednesday of every month, providing an opportunity to sample a variety of their offerings without breaking the bank.  

Our sole grievance lies with the limited operating hours, as the establishment is only open for lunch from 10:30 am to 3:00 pm, Monday through Friday. Were they to extend their hours and augment their portion sizes, we would unhesitatingly award them a perfect five stars."

This establishment serves as our family's preferred grocery store, and we frequent it on a weekly basis, particularly when my mother is in the mood to prepare Asian cuisine at home. The store offers an extensive selection of Asian products, encompassing a range of Chinese, Filipino, and other cultures, which is advantageous as it obviates the need to visit multiple locations. Prior to our relocation to the western part of town, we would often shop at 99 Ranch; however, this store has become a more practical option due to its proximity.  

I derive immense pleasure from exploring the various aisles, seeking out novel items to sample. The store offers a diverse array of products, including hair care merchandise, snack foods, and an assortment of teas. When I was in the process of preparing pho from scratch, I was able to acquire all the necessary ingredients in a single location. The store maintains a comprehensive inventory of herbs, spices, sauces, and powders, ensuring that I could easily locate everything required for the dish. The premises are well-maintained, and in the event of a language barrier with an employee, it is unlikely to encounter difficulty in finding someone proficient in English. It is likely that the majority of employees possess proficiency in English.  

Furthermore, their bakery and deli offerings are a significant aspect of their appeal. I frequently purchase pastries to bring to work for lunch, and when I have a hankering for dim sum, I prefer to place an order from their deli rather than venturing out to Orchid's Garden or Chang's by myself. Their deli items are reasonably priced and of high quality. Instead of patronizing Panda Express, I would recommend paying a visit to this establishment. Not only is the food authentic, but it is also quite affordable, costing around $5 for a combination meal, and the portions are generous.  

Additionally, they provide a complimentary fish-frying service, which serves as an added benefit.

The burgers are very good. I've had the BBQ before & just had the I Love Bacon burger (brisket & bacon yum!) tater tots are a must & love the beer specials. 32 oz. Sam Adams for $10 & you get to keep the cup :) all I have to say is I love I Love Burgers!

"I thoroughly appreciate the expediency afforded by the drive-thru facility at Starbucks, but this particular establishment exudes a classical ambiance that prompts me to exit my vehicle and indulge in a more leisurely experience. The staff members are consistently cordial and demonstrate a commendable proficiency in accurately preparing my beverage of choice."

"For the paltry sum of $7.77, one can indulge in a delectable repast consisting of a sizable cut of meat, accompanied by an assortment of succulent shrimp, all served with a side of flavorsome mashed potatoes and a fresh, verdant salad, with the option to upgrade to a Caesar salad, boasting an array of piquant greens. It is advisable to partake in this culinary experience with minimal delay and without undue focus on extraneous factors such as service, ambiance, or table settings, as this establishment operates on a 24-hour basis and is primarily concerned with providing unpretentious, satisfying nourishment. Following a successful craps game during which I managed to hit the coveted hard eight twice, resulting in a substantial payout of $100, I decided to conclude my evening with a visit to this restaurant, savoring every bite of their offerings and relishing the unbridled joy of triumph. Until our next encounter, I bid you adieu, and may your future dining experiences be as gratifying as mine."

I give this a 4.5 star as I was pleased all the restaurants or fast food places to choose from to eat right in the hotel, lots of new & old slot machines, a few bars, lovely pool area, great kids zone upstairs, simi friendly servers, we had the deluxe room & although it had plenty of space I have taken the half star off due to it being a little dirty, table seats had food stains & there is no wi-fi & the internet wire in room we were to use for internet did not work... besides those 3 flaws everything else was great & for sure will stay again!

"An exceptional culinary establishment...however, their sushi offerings do not particularly resonate with my refined palate. As an ardent devotee of sushi, I would enthusiastically explore every sushi venue within the city limits, given the opportunity. While their sushi is undoubtedly satisfactory, it does not ascend to the pinnacle of my preferences. Instead, I gravitate towards their delectable Garlic Chicken and savory Hamburger Steak, which showcase the culinary expertise of the chef. Furthermore, their Hawaiian-inspired breakfast dishes, featuring succulent Portuguese sausage, eggs, and rice, elicit unbridled delight. It is essential to note, however, that this eatery may not cater extensively to ardent sushi connoisseurs; nevertheless, it provides a tantalizing glimpse into the rich culinary traditions of the 808 area code, nestled within the 702 region."

Oh Grand Lux.  When will you move to the Bay Area?  Yes, it is very Cheesecake Factory-ish.  I love the variety here and the food is actually pretty darn good.  We came here for lunch after a very long crazy night.  Amongst five girls, we ordered a bunch of different items:

1. Stacked chicken quesadilla
2. Seared rare ahi
3. Asian Noodle bowl (I can't remember the exact name)
4. Tomato bisque

Do not go for the noodle!   It's a very very poor attempt at rice noodles.  I think I'm gonna give up eating noodles at non-Asian places.  I am always hugely disappointed.  The ahi and the quesadilla were good tho.  Tomato soup was a nice large bowl and tasty too.  Portions are very big so always a good idea to share because it's very unlikely you can finish it.  Prices are great.  Service is down to earth and quick.  You will definitely leave full and happy spending about $20!

I brought my visiting acquaintances to this establishment, capitalizing on a complementary gaming opportunity publicized on their digital platform, as it presented itself as an idyllic setting for a relaxed gathering, replete with a picturesque miniature water cascade and thematic Polynesian embellishments. The prospect of a financial equivalent in gameplay was sufficient motivation for me to consider this venue as a viable option, despite the absence of culinary exploration. Furthermore, the hospitable barkeep extended an offer to combine the Belgian-style witbier with a glass of orange juice, thereby enhancing its flavor profile. Additionally, this sports bar boasts a dedicated fan base of the Pittsburgh Steelers, manifesting in various promotional events and prize giveaways throughout the season.

I visited that establishment in the company of several acquaintances, and we all shared a positive sentiment towards the culinary offerings presented by the eatery. My spouse and I opted for a plant-based meal, specifically a Caprese sandwich, while my offspring selected an Italian dish and our companion chose the Montagu option. Despite the reasonable pricing for the location, I experienced hunger pangs subsequent to consuming my sandwich.
We travel to Mexico a lot.  Just got back from the tip of Baja.  These tacos taste like Baja tacos.  Great stuff!  Very clean and staff is nice.  Went 2 nights in a row.

"The exterior and interior cleansing process was indeed satisfactory; I experienced immense gratification upon beholding my aged automobile's luminous appearance. The team accomplished the task within a reasonable duration, and I was particularly delighted to observe all glass surfaces thoroughly cleaned and floor coverings meticulously vacuumed. However, I must admit that the initial female representative who approached me to gather my vehicle's cleaning requirements exhibited a somewhat brusque demeanor, articulated her words at an excessively rapid pace, and displayed visible annoyance upon being requested to reiterate her statements. Nonetheless, the remaining personnel who participated in the vehicular detailing process demonstrated amiable and courteous behavior, manifesting a genuine desire to provide excellent customer service."

This place is great for a big group! We stayed here for a friends birthday a couple of weeks ago and it was pretty nice. It is located behind the MGM hotel and right by Hooters hotel. We rented a two bedroom villa and our room was very spacious. It also came with a fully equipped kitchen and it had everything you need to cook food. There were two full bathrooms and they had extra pillows and blankets. It said it sleeps 6 people but it could probably sleep around 10 people comfortably. It was reasonably priced and it was very quiet. The continental breakfast is probably the best breakfast I have had. They had a lot of variety and options for people. Overall a good place to stay if you don't mind staying a little bit away from the strip.

Vegan pizza in Vegas? YES!

Though they don't advertise the vegan menu out front, but if you ask, they'll show you their vegan menu. The list is pretty extensive. I want to try the tofu parmesan sub, but my dinner mate wanted pizza to share. 

We got a meal deal which included a side and salad and 12" pizza for 24.95 plus drinks for 3.75 (refillable thankfully). Not cheap but a good deal for the Wynn, and pizza in general. Some people swear by Daiya, but they use Follow Your Heart here. I think Follow Your Heart is quite good, though not sure if I prefer it to Daiya. It has a good texture and taste. Our veggie pizza was topped with kalamata olives, onions and roasted red peppers. It was an interesting combination, but not necessarily one I would go with again. The main negative I found with the pizza was that the outer crust was a bit hard. The salad was okay. Nothing spectacular but good. The fries were super crispy and really good.  

I am planning my next trip, and will definitely come here again.

"An exceptional venue to visit on a Monday afternoon, boasting an unpretentious ambiance and an absence of crowds, as evidenced by the minimal number of vehicles occupying the parking area. Initially, my expectations were tempered due to the dubious reputation of the adjacent shopping center; however, upon entering the cinema, I was pleasantly surprised by its pristine condition and the warm demeanor of its employees."

The enigmatic composition of the processed meat incorporated into those extensively wrinkled, oversized hot dogs arouses curiosity regarding its origin and substance, although a certain reluctance to become cognizant of the specifics pertaining to this culinary conundrum prevails; meanwhile, the gratification derived from the consumption of such an economical fare, amounting to a mere $2, serves as a fleeting source of sustenance. Furthermore, a pertinent admonition extends towards those individuals who persistently opt for the strategy of doubling down when the dealer's display includes a 10, while their own hand consists of a similar quantity, as such actions may potentially elicit a violent response, tantamount to asphyxiation, due to the sheer frustration engendered by their unwavering adherence to this questionable tactic.

I would definitely recommend this place.  Great place to get your breakfast, especially if you're tired of eating on the Stripe.  When I went on Sunday for brunch (arrived around 10:30), the wait was 40 minutes. Server was nice. \n\nRecommendation: Chorizo Hash, Andy's Sage Fried Chicken and Waffles, Tractor Driver Combo.

I think my favorite part about this place is the hidden entrance.  I felt like I was entering a secret speakeasy.  Inside I liked the fireplace and the dark lighting and the nice old bar.  To me it felt a little too open and big for a wine bar, not super intimate.  But I'm used to smaller bars in LA or NYC.  They had a huge wine list and were very helpful with recommendations.  There was a mix of ages , lots of dates and groups of girls, and everyone at the bar seemed mellow.  A nice change from the other bars in Old Town.  I am definitely adding this to my regular Scottsdale hang out spots.
Every time I visit Pittsburgh I have to stop here. I've ordered a few sandwiches but just like everyone says... Everything is good! Only down side is that service is a little slow.

Best Airports to be drunk in
1) Narita/Tokyo- Come on, it's made of glass and you can ride the monorail for about 3 hours and everyone's too polite to tell you to get off.
2) Chicago O'Hare- There's a mother f.ing neon tunnel (put on some The Dark Side of the Moon in that and you'd be bumped up a spot)
3) McCarran- Las Vegas. You just spent 12 hours in Vegas. It's inevitable, how can you not be drunk? The stone Lizard and Snake make great props and the mesmerizing slot machines make you forget you're waiting for a flight back home while the rest of your friends are still tanning at the pool. Bitches.

Look a quarter! Deposit. Pull. 
Cherry, Cherry! Cherry!!!.....Lemon  =(
 Oh fuck. Well at least it's time to board.

"Myriad pecuniary challenges plague my existence, yet the Tuesday promotion proffered by Popeyes does not rank among them. For a mere $0.99, I can indulge in a duo of delectable poultry pieces that satiate my hunger and provide a fleeting respite from my financial tribulations. Although I do not frequent this establishment with great regularity, the allure of this offer proves difficult to resist. Moreover, their biscuits possess an unparalleled degree of culinary excellence, which further reinforces my inclination to partake in this affordable gastronomic experience. Notwithstanding the occasional lapses in service quality, Popeyes generally maintains a passable level of efficiency in their drive-thru operations."

Overall, a delectable culinary experience, coupled with an admirable social mission, renders King's Kitchen an eatery where one can indulge in a satisfying meal while concurrently contributing to the betterment of the local community. The novel concept behind this not-for-profit restaurant, where 100% of the profits generated from sales are utilized to provide sustenance for those in need, is truly laudable. Moreover, the edibles served at this establishment are not only flavorsome but also fresh, thereby ensuring a gratifying dining experience for all patrons.  During a recent group interview in Uptown, a few of us were seeking a nearby luncheon venue, and given the inclement weather conditions, we opted to dine at King's Kitchen, situated conveniently at the corner of the block. Upon perusing the menu, we were pleased with the variety of options available and thus requested seating. I personally relished the chicken salad croissant sandwich, accompanied by a side of mixed greens salad with balsamic dressing. The sandwich was indeed scrumptious, boasting fresh ingredients and a generous portion size. The side salad, though unpretentious, was likewise fresh and satisfying. The other dishes ordered by my companions appeared equally appetizing. The prices, ranging from $9 to $13 for the lunch menu, were reasonable and reflected the superior quality of the cuisine. Furthermore, the service was attentive, and the staff members were courteous and friendly, further enhancing our dining experience. In conclusion, King's Kitchen offers an exceptional culinary encounter that simultaneously supports a worthy cause, and thus, I am eager to revisit this establishment to sample their dinner offerings.

"I relished an indulgent brunch on the picturesque patio, accompanied by several esteemed associates, engaging in lively discourse.  The culinary offerings, particularly the eggs, were undoubtedly delectable.  Each of the assorted pastries I sampled exuded an ethereal quality, while the bacon, though adequate, failed to elicit the same level of enthusiasm.  However, the sweet and savory fusion of the jelly complementing the bite-sized donuts surpassed expectations, rendering them a highlight of the meal.  It is worth mentioning that the establishment's decision to label these diminutive pastries as 'beignets' proved somewhat misleading, as their texture and composition diverged noticeably from the traditional beignet formula, prompting a brief period of puzzlement regarding their authenticity.  Notwithstanding this minor inconsistency, the Bellinis, with their refreshing blend of peach juice and champagne, proved to be a resounding success, leaving me wishing for a more copious serving of coffee to accompany my repast."
Tacos were good and simple.  They were small and cheap, you'll want to order a few. Horchata was good and homemade.  Beans were plain.  Certainly not the best I've tried but I would come back.

Funk yeah! This place is the sheet for chilling downtown without the frown. Where else are you going to swamp yourself in artisan suds as well as the classic Shlitz? Rhetorical question--no where.

Just the Tips:
- Roast beef sandwich is mostly awesome.
- They have AZ wines if your man-meter doesn't sink to skunky beers.
- If you want to talk to your pretty lady and retain your voice, sit outside.
- For you veggies and squirrels, the mixed nuts and olives are well portioned.

"This venue offers remarkable French fries, possessing an optimal size, shape, and texture that is unparalleled in terms of crispiness. It appears that all dining establishments within the Mandalay Bay resort share this exceptional quality in their French fries. My memory of the other menu items is somewhat impaired due to the extraordinary nature of these fries. While this eatery may not conform to the stereotypical notion of an upscale Las Vegas dining experience, it nevertheless serves as an ideal setting for a casual midday meal."

Needs to turn on their fans for lunch dining area because its super hot in Tempe area. Overall, i like the music atmosphere is amazing. Customer service was okay but lunch rush hour was busy. Love the burgers! :)

Make a reservation. We eat here almost every time we are in Vegas. Food is consistently good. Service is good most of the time. I like the sesame chicken, mongolian beef, and the fried rice. Dessert, the bananas, are very good. \n\nWatch your bar tab here, as most drinks add up pretty quickly, $9 margarita. Very good though....

Went here for my 3rd time. This place is great specially if you're wondering the fashion show mall and you suddenly realize you starving, and you just know the food court isn't what you had in mind...

Today I got both of the specials- swordfish and the lamb (both awesome) I say,...always order the specials at a tapa place- rarely will they let you down!

FYI if you want the happy hour half off tapas you have to be sitting at the bar in order to do so. Which is kind of stupid, but that's just how it goes.... the menu is smaller but hey if you want to save some that's an idea.

"The Manager exhibited an unwavering commitment to ensuring that we felt welcome and that our cycling excursion to the eatery was transformed into an indelible memory, courtesy of his exceptional hospitality. The staff members were incredibly cordial, fostering a warm and inviting ambiance that greatly contributed to our overall satisfaction. It is my conviction that this modest, newly established restaurant possesses considerable potential for development and expansion, ultimately evolving into a premier destination for indulging in both morning and midday repasts."

Vietnamese food made by (lovely!) Vietnamese family. They value fresh ingredients and snappy service.

Established in 2011, this restaurant serves many traditional Vietnamese dishes as well as a few popular 'East Asian' dishes. Plates are heartily-sized and reasonably priced.

My Tom Xao Ca Ri ($12.50) was full of fresh vegetables (not overcooked -- a rarity for this neighborhood's Asian restaurants!) and jumbo shrimp. The original house specialties include Banh Tom Ho Tay (lightly friend shrimp and sweet potato cake, $13) and Ca Kho To (caramelized fish, $10). Their curries pack a welcomed spicy punch. The Canh Chua ($8) are all made with a homemade broth (cooked daily).  

The chef is forthright in sharing his values. MSG disgusts him and so does the 'watery salty stock' that other restaurants use. He also said too many cooks substitute natural ingredient flavor with copious amounts of oil. 

Petite Tonkinoise's only downfall? The decor isn't much to write about. It looks like a confused zen kitsch mini banquet hall.

Last minute dinner plans with my family led us to dine at Puck's, located in the upscale Crystals Mall on the renowned Las Vegas Strip, adjacent to the luxurious Aria resort. Despite the prime location and the fact that it was a Friday evening, we were pleasantly surprised to only have to wait a mere ten minutes before being seated at around 9 PM. The ambiance of the restaurant was characterized by a bright, semi-open space, complemented by a cozy bar area, creating a warm and inviting atmosphere for patrons. \
The attentiveness of the staff was satisfactory, as they ensured that our dining experience was enjoyable and hassle-free. The culinary offerings at Puck's were impressive, particularly the grilled ribeye steak, which was undoubtedly the most expensive item on the menu at $40. However, the flawless preparation of the dish, cooked to perfection at medium rare, accompanied by a rich and velvety reduction sauce that I wished could have been more abundant, made it a worthwhile indulgence. Furthermore, the dish was thoughtfully garnished with a stem of sautÃ©ed mushrooms and blackened green chiles, adding a delightful touch of fieriness to the dish. Overall, the meal was a satisfying start to our culinary adventures in Las Vegas, providing a perfect blend of quality and value. \
Additionally, we sampled their delectable tiramisu dessert, which was adorned with chocolate beads dispersed throughout the creamy layer, offering a delightful contrast of textures and flavors. While Puck's primarily specializes in pasta, pizza, and seafood, their grilled ribeye steak is undoubtedly a commendable option, worthy of recommendation to those seeking a satisfying dining experience.

In search of authentic chicken and waffles I stumble upon LoLo's. The waffles were outstanding, the chicken was amazing and my two friends and I hardly spoke a word as we devoured each bite. The place was clean and the service was warm and friendly. Do yourself a favor and check it out. I know I will again.

"The familial unit opted to dine at this establishment subsequent to their excursion to North Lake Mall, whereupon they placed their order at the counter and awaited the arrival of their culinary selections. The service was prompt and efficient, despite the considerable volume of patrons present within the confines of the eatery. My spouse and I selected the half-chicken and pulled pork plates respectively, both of which were accompanied by a duet of side dishes and a slice of garlic bread. Our offspring opted for pork sandwiches and chicken fingers, the latter of which could be prepared via grilling, thus rendering it a healthier alternative to its deep-fried counterpart. Each member of our party relished their respective meals, and the portion sizes were deemed satisfactory. The trio of BBQ sauces proffered by the establishment were sampled and found to be palatable, and the sweet tea beverage was similarly enjoyable. Beverages were obtained through self-service, and the ambiance of the restaurant was enhanced by the spotless nature of the facilities and the congeniality of the staff. Based on the aforementioned factors, I assigned a rating of four stars to this venue, as it exceeded expectations in multiple aspects and warrants future visits when in the vicinity."

"I indulged in the delectable fish tacos, my spouse opted for a succulent bacon cheeseburger, while our offspring delighted in savory corn dogs, and I must say, the culinary experience was nothing short of satisfaction personified."

Update: Assessment of culinary offerings, specifically pertaining to French fries and hash browns, reveals a transformation that has elicited a sense of disappointment among patrons who have experienced the establishment's former quality. Despite efforts to acquire insight into the rationale behind this alteration, the response has been met with ambiguity. Consequentially, the current state of affairs does not compare favorably to the initial impression created by the eatery. Nonetheless, the ambiance and expansive seating options, encompassing both interior and outdoor spaces, continue to evoke a welcoming atmosphere. Following its grand opening, the service has made significant strides towards aligning itself with the exceptional culinary standards that have come to be expected from this particular venue. For individuals residing in the vicinity of PV/Scottsdale, it is highly recommended to experience the unique appeal of this dining destination, particularly the San Tan Hefe.

Get extra bowls or a to-go container you wil need them. 

HUGE portions which scores points for me always. The food is great too. No, it's not authentic, but if you're just looking for some feel-good food come here. Portions are huge which is why it costs a bit (up to nine bucks after tax) but their best item is actuallt their cheapest the plain udon at under seven bucks after tax. 

Their udon noodles are super thick you won't miss the meat. I have very Americanized tase buds I'll admit, but to me the broth is super tasty. I put in a cup of chili oil and it's bliss in a bowl. 

Also gets points for atmosphere very clean, for just a few dollarsmore than fast food it's actually a place you can enjoy sitting in and spending time.

"While I cannot attest to the veracity of the assertion that my coiffure necessitated an augmented level of effort due to its inherent density, I must confess that I harbor a certain degree of incredulity towards the notion that such a factor should serve as the basis for an exorbitant increase in remuneration. My previous experiences at this establishment had been marked by a hitherto unwavering satisfaction with the quality of service rendered, and it was not until my fourth visit that I encountered this anomalous instance of fiscal discrepancy. It is worth noting, however, that subsequent interactions with the proprietor, Ernie, served to assuage my concerns and ultimately resulted in a gratuitous haircut during my subsequent visit, thereby obviating any further pecuniary disagreements."

"An exceptional lodging experience was had at this establishment, as evidenced by our arrival later than anticipated due to an unforeseen flight delay, which resulted in the relinquishment of our originally assigned accommodations. However, the courteous receptionist offered her sincerest apologies and subsequently upgraded our accommodations to a more spacious room with a superior view of the strip, considered by yours truly to be the most optimal vantage point. 

The aquatic facilities served as the primary motivation for our selection of this hotel, and we were not let down. Two diminutive pools, a tranquil river, and a sizable wave pool (with only one wave every five or ten minutes, it must be noted) collectively contributed to a poolside ambiance that was noticeably more subdued than anticipated. It is worth mentioning that while the daytime pool party, known as 'Daylight,' was in full swing, a substantial cover charge was enforced. 

Numerous dining options surrounding the casino catered well to our culinary needs. Although the prices charged at the bars located within the casino proper were somewhat elevated, such expenses are customarily expected in establishments of this nature. In conclusion, this venue provided an exceptional sojourn, and we would unhesitatingly consider returning in the future."

"Pros: Extremely delectable and scrumptious pastries, frozen desserts, and confectionaries. \n\nCons: A tad excessive saccharinity, resulting in a sensation of surfeit subsequent to a few bites. \n\nThe Red Velvet cake constitutes a definitive preference of mine, concurrently with the establishment's lavatory - ubiquitous mirrors and immaculate cleanness."
```

I really like this restaurant.  The food is always good.  The salsa is nice and spicy and the service is fast and attentive.  It's a great place to take my entire family.\n\nI usually order the chicken fajitas, which are amazing.  I also love that they serve a complimentary bowl of soup with the standard chips and salsa.  Nice touch! The kids love it.

I think this might be one of the better wing places in the valley honestly.  The wings here are large and in charge, and I like that they don't over-batter them.  They always seem to come out crispy, and not drowned in sauce, which is a plus for me.  I don't care that they don't have like 20 flavors like BWs, because their sauces are tasty and they run the spice gamut.  Service is friendly, and fast, and I like that they have rolls of paper towels on the tables, and give you wet naps to clean up when you're done eating.  Also a big fan of their boneless \"wings\", which are gigantic.

"My excursion to Quaker Steak & Lube commenced with the Atomic Wing Challenge, an endeavor entailing the consumption of six of their piquant atomic wings. Although the quantity may seem paltry, the fiery nature of these wings necessitates a liability waiver prior to indulgence (a gesture primarily intended for dramatic effect). While undoubtedly scorching, the wings remain endurable for individuals possessing a sufficient threshold for pungent cuisine. Those who regularly partake in dishes incorporating habaneros will likely find the atomic wings tolerable. As a helpful suggestion, when ordering the atomic wings, request a pair of food-handling gloves to prevent the sauce from staining your hands, thereby enabling you to touch your eyes or utilize the restroom without inflicting discomfort upon yourself. Following the completion of the challenge, I sampled additional wing varieties, including Louisiana Lickers, Arizona Ranch, and Golden Garlic. Impressed by their flavors, I found the wings to be satisfyingly meaty, a welcome departure from the common practice of serving wings with minimal meat. My sole grievance lies in the slightly exorbitant pricing of $5 for a half dozen wings, equating to $0.83 per wing, which strikes me as somewhat steep. Nonetheless, the superior quality of these wings potentially justifies the cost."

I really like this place. We used to come here often and then didn't for a long time just because we weren't in the hood when they were open. The las two weeks I've been by and had a late lunch. The people that t=run this place are so genuinely nice. The ensalada drink is refreshing in this heat. I usually get a veg papusa and fried plantain. My husband had the chicken soup and loved it and then the chicken special and loved it. I'm so glad we went back.

This marked the culmination of our utilization of the LALALA ramen pass, and it was utterly magnificent to terminate our two-week Los Angeles ramen excursion with such a delectable ramen dish in Las Vegas.

The pork incorporated into our soup bowl exuded a smoky and sultry essence, accented by a faint hint of wood-fired barbecue char, which endowed the flavor with a profound intensity and singularity. The subtlety of the smokiness effectively withstood the multifaceted flavors of the ramen broth, creating a harmonious balance of tastes. Our server displayed exceptional attentiveness, ensuring that we thoroughly enjoyed our dining experience. She persistently lingered near us and even extended her well wishes as we departed.

Ramen Misoya Tomi strives to differentiate itself by introducing unconventional elements to their recipes while maintaining the customary meticulous attention to detail. Although the ambiance could benefit from enhancements, specifically the removal of oversized posters promoting the advantages of miso, the spaciousness of the establishment makes it an ideal setting for gatherings. Despite the prevalence of small, crowded ramen establishments, this venue offers ample space for groups, rendering it a suitable choice for those seeking to accommodate larger parties.
Food are little bit salty but the service is great. If you prefer something more special to try than buffet. Stratta would be a not bad to try. I highly recommended the tata beef appetizer.

"My affection for Songbird is unwavering, primarily due to its proximity to my place of employment and the exceptional quality of its offerings. The pastries, which are procured from local artisans, are nothing short of sublime. In particular, the brioche cinnamon roll is a culinary masterpiece that warrants unreserved praise. The coffee, too, is of an unparalleled excellence, with an indescribable je ne sais quoi that sets it apart from other establishments. Although the seating capacity may be somewhat limited and the prices slightly elevated, the value of the products more than compensates for these minor drawbacks."

Tried the lamb kubideh. It was very reasonable pricing, for $7.99 I got a healthy serving of kubideh with rice, and bread. They make the bread at the location! Everything tasted wonderful. And we ended our meal with a Baklava. Do try it!

SanTan is one of my favorite local beers to purchase at the store, so of course I'm going to be a fan of their restaurant!  My biggest issue is that there are not the greatest number of vegetarian options on the menu.  I had fish tacos the most recent time we visited, which were okay.  Nothing too special.  The veggie burger is also pretty standard.  What I love most about SanTan is their appetizers (the pretzel!) and beer.  I've heard great things about some of their burgers, but I cannot vouch for them!  Great local place - wish it were closer to home!

I happened upon this establishment a few months ago, when I was seeking to indulge in some self-care and pampering. I must say, I have been thoroughly impressed by the exceptional quality of their services, which are offered at an unbeatably affordable price of $30 for a manicure and pedicure combination. The pedicure itself encompasses a range of luxurious treatments, including a relaxing hot stone massage, warm lotion application, and an invigorating leg massage. Notably, I have visited this salon on multiple occasions, and each time, I have been greeted promptly and accommodated without an appointment. In fact, the staff has consistently demonstrated their proficiency in efficiently ushering me into a massage chair to initiate my pedicure experience.  

However, I must admit that I was taken aback during my most recent visit, when my boyfriend requested the paraffin treatment for his hands. To my surprise, the attendant brought out two plastic bags containing warm wax and instructed him to insert his hands while she secured them around his wrists with a tie. While this method appeared somewhat unrefined, the outcome was indeed impressive, as it left his skin feeling noticeably smoother.  

In light of the exceptional service and value offered by this salon, I am eagerly looking forward to returning this Friday, in preparation for the upcoming sandal season.

I love Villa Deli and have been going for years.   I went for lunch today and they now sell Pizza and are under new ownership.  The sandwiches are still the best and of the highest quality.  The pizza was pretty good as well, I wish they would sell one slice but you have to buy two.  The one thing that is missing is the friendly service the old owners used to provide.  The service was not bad but there was no conversation or anything more than taking your order and thanking you while paying.  I think the charm of this place was how the old owner used to come out and talk to everyone and just made you feel good about being there.    Keep up the good work, but engage with your customers more and I promise they will keep coming back!   Good Luck

"Gastronomical excellence and exceptional customer service were the hallmarks of our recent dining experience at this esteemed eatery, specifically on the momentous occasion of my spouse's natal day, which coincided with the nation's celebration of independence on July 4th; and as an added touch of elegance, the wait staff presented a delectable dessert, replete with a sparkling candle, thereby enhancing the overall ambiance and making for a truly unforgettable evening that we would highly recommend to any discerning patron."

We ultimately arrived at this venue serendipitously and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves! While meandering in search of an establishment featuring music and dance, a chance encounter with an individual distributing complimentary admission passes mere steps from Caesar's Palace led us to venture forth into the gaming facility. A fortuitous occurrence indeed! Upon approaching the entrance of Pure, yet another benevolent individual offered us access to the shorter "Guest List" queue, despite our lack of prior reservation. Thus, we gained expedited entry into the nightclub in a remarkably brief span of time, all things considered. Pure, situated on the rooftop, afforded a breathtaking panorama of the Las Vegas Strip, encompassing the iconic Eiffel Tower. As I engaged in vigorous dance movements, my gaze remained transfixed upon the aforementioned edifice, fostering an unforgettable experience. The disc jockey's musical selections proved utterly captivating, and I sincerely regret failing to commit his name to memory, considering the immense enjoyment his performances brought me. Although the beverages available at the bar carried a premium price point, one cannot help but acknowledge such costs as inherent to the Las Vegas experience. All things considered, I would unhesitatingly choose to revisit this destination.

This place was excellent! The pizza was a tiny bit oily, but full of flavor. The side salad was great and we were able to enjoy a large pizza and side salad for three meals. This place delivered promptly to our hotel as well. Definitely worth ordering if you're tired and want a nice easy meal delivered to your doorstep.

This is the 3rd  version of the Springs Cafe that I know of, and its still about the same.  To be honest, the location and the view get the 4 stars, the food probably warrants about 3.5.

The dining choices are good, and I've never had bad food or bad service, but there is nothing terribly special about the offerings. A solid burger, good wraps, good pizzas, some interesting specials. Again, the food takes second place to the location.

I would definitely recommend coming here if you're in the area, the views of the valley are great. Sit out on the balcony on a warm day an just take it all it.

"An exceptional augmentation to the Shadyside district! I thoroughly enjoyed the extensive beverage selection, voluminous menu offerings, and the unlimited mimosa and Bloody Mary possibility during brunch. Specifically, the chicken and waffles dish I sampled today harmoniously married the essence of traditional Southern diner fare with a sophisticated, gourmet gravy complemented by savory bacon maple syrup. As a local resident situated in close proximity to this establishment, I eagerly anticipate future visits."

"This establishment may potentially be classified as a sushi restaurant, located in Henderson, Nevada. I had the pleasure of dining here with a colleague, whom I met during my lunch break, as she suggested this venue due to its proximity to our place of employment. They offer an assortment of culinary options, including cooked dishes and an array of sushi selections, accompanied by a beverage menu that features a variety of refreshments, such as green iced tea. Upon perusing their menu, I noticed they offer several lunch specials, which include a combination of six pieces of sushi or sashimi, one roll from a predetermined list, and miso soup complemented by a salad, all for the reasonable price of $12.50. Additionally, they provide patrons with the option to choose two items from a list, known as lunch bentos. However, it is worth noting that all of the lunch bento options are cooked dishes. My preference was to indulge in sushi, primarily to sample the quality of their rice. Following the soup and salad course, I was presented with a visually appealing plate, boasting generous portions of nigiri and a roll. The selection included two pieces each of maguro, distinguished by its profound red hue, nama sake, and hamachi. The presentation was artfully arranged, creating a colorful pattern. Furthermore, I opted for the spicy yellowtail roll as my roll choice. To my surprise, the quality of the food was quite satisfactory, especially considering our landlocked location. The rice was also well-prepared. Our server was both friendly and efficient, ensuring a seamless dining experience. The ambiance within the establishment is tranquil, enhanced by a painting of a cherry blossom on the rear wall. Overall, this eatery is a suitable choice for a quick, satisfying meal on this side of town."

"Culinary excellence abounds at this vegetarian eatery, as evidenced by the fact that even my carnivorous companions expressed a desire to return. Every dish we ordered was brimming with flavor and presented in generous portions, making the exceptionally reasonable prices even more remarkable. It's truly a testament to the establishment's value that I, a voracious eater, could leave feeling thoroughly satiated for a mere $10. However, it's advisable to avoid the Friday night dinner rush, as the restaurant was quite busy and my significant other had to wait approximately 20 minutes after placing her order for her beverage to arrive."

Craving a slice of NY pizza and you live in Vegas? I think we all agree, this place is IT!  Some may complain it's too far from the strip or from Summerlin. Trust me, it's worth the drive. Why didn't I give it a 5 star? Because, I've had NY pizza and nothing comes close to that. Go get yourself a slice.\n\nAnd if you don't care what your thighs will say after you've devoured a pint of creamy ice cream then head on over next door...(I don't remember the name). They have great lucious creamy ice cream. yum!

"Consequently, this particular establishment boasts an exceptionally spotless ambiance, complete with accommodating seating arrangements and a team of personnel who exhibit remarkable proficiency and warmth in their interactions with patrons. Indeed, the management and operation of this Subway franchise serve as a paradigm for others within the industry to emulate, and it is undeniable that we shall eagerly return to partake in their offerings once again."

"It is truly perplexing that I have yet to critique this establishment prior to this occasion, given its proximity to my domicile and the frequency with which I patronize it, averaging approximately once a month. Upon entering, one cannot help but be enamored by the ambiance, which exudes a certain je ne sais quoi reminiscent of a dimly lit dive bar, an atmosphere that seems to foster an environment conducive to socializing and potentially finding a romantic partner. The prices of the libations are quite reasonable, and the bartenders are affable and adept at their craft. The clientele is diverse and eclectic, comprising a melange of individuals from various walks of life, including those who appear to be regulars, professionals seeking a respite from their daily routines, and even the occasional stoner. As a relatively attractive female, I have found that the predominantly male patrons accord me a warm welcome, albeit occasionally tinged with a hint of familiarity that borders on being overly affectionate. Regardless, the atmosphere remains convivial and welcoming, allowing patrons to indulge in a few brews or become more inebriated, depending on their preferences. Furthermore, it is worth mentioning that this establishment serves as a popular destination for those who have been ejected from Santisi Brothers, a nearby watering hole, and choose to continue their revelry here. In addition, the facilities, while not the most pristine, are adequate and infrequently emit unpleasant odors."

"What an extraordinary setting! The alfresco area is utterly captivating and would serve as an idyllic venue for a communal evening meal. We opted to dine indoors for lunch and began our culinary excursion with a platter of crispy tortilla chips accompanied by a creamy guacamole dip. As the main course, I selected the daily special, which consisted of a generous serving of seared mahi-mahi atop a bed of sautÃ©ed spinach. The portion was so copious that I was unable to consume the entire dish, despite my best efforts."

It is my firm belief that Small hole in the Wall BBQ/ Southern places should be given their own set of common customer service rules...I have noticed the small places seem to go at their own pace, forget and change orders midstream and frequently end up treating you like you are visiting at their home not their restaurant. 
Memphis has this type of feel. We got there right at opening and that created "speedbumps" , still counting change,  putting chairs down , food not made yet...but the good news is this place is delicious in my book. 
After finally getting our order straightened out ...I had yummy Beef ribs with a lovely pink ring that scream I have been smoked.  the coleslaw was unususua and I loved it ...guess what it was mustard based..loved the taste and the sweet sour effect of sugar in the dressing with the mustard.  husband had the Pulled pork but it wasn't quite as yummy as my ribs, he didn't adore the sugary bbq sauce that had a peppery back kick. Oh well  guess he should have gotten the ribs.  
So the  next  time you are in Buckeye stop  bye  and give it a try .

"Occasionally, benevolent entities manifest themselves in diminutive formats, and such is the case with this inaugural gaming establishment in Las Vegas, erected in 1906. Despite its modest proportions, this boutique hotel and casino exude an air of refinement and elegance, replete with a captivating ambiance that permeates the interior. A distinctive feature that arrests one's attention is the array of vintage slot machines, reminiscent of a bygone era, which serve as a testament to the property's rich history. Furthermore, the meticulous maintenance of the casino floor and immaculate restrooms underscores the management's commitment to providing an exceptional patron experience. During nocturnal hours, the dealers assume the guise of flappers, imbuing the atmosphere with a playful and festive quality. Enrolling in Club 1906 proved a judicious decision, as minimal gambling activities (predominantly engaging in joker poker at the bar while indulging in complimentary beverages) precipitated the receipt of gratis lodging offers via post. The possibility of capitalizing on these accommodations for a future downtown staycation holds considerable appeal. If your itinerary includes a visit to the primary gambling mecca, consider halting at this pioneering casino for a libation or a spirited game of craps; the atmosphere is undeniably convivial."

"My reluctance to indulge in numerous buffets has become increasingly conspicuous, particularly in light of my significant other's disapproval of my burgeoning waistline and its attendant softness. Nonetheless, when the opportunity arises to partake in such a culinary extravaganza with my associates, I find myself inexplicably drawn to the prospect of unrestricted consumption. It is perhaps a testament to the enduring appeal of quantity over quality, despite the less-than-stellar gastronomical offerings and lackluster service that often accompanies such establishments. Indeed, the ambiance itself is redolent of a refined secondary school dining hall, yet the sheer variety of edibles available at a relatively modest cost proves tantalizing. In this instance, I managed to sample a range of dishes, including steak, New Orleans-style chicken, ample portions of rice, copious amounts of ice cream, and various other items that, regrettably, escape my memory due to the ensuing food-induced lethargy. Notwithstanding, Golden Corral shall forever hold a special place in my affections, as well as an insatiable craving that persistently demands satisfaction."

"I thoroughly enjoy this establishment and the diverse array of flavors they offer! They consistently possess an inventory of red velvet cupcakes, which distinguishes them from other eateries that periodically alternate their flavors (a subtle jab at MoJo and Yogurtology, perhaps?). Their most recent additions to the menu, specifically the banana-based and Hawaiian-inspired flavors, have garnered my utmost approval. However, I must deduct a star from my rating due to a glaring omission in their beverage selection; specifically, the absence of juice poppers. It is truly perplexing that a business would fail to recognize the widespread popularity of these refreshing drinks."

"We opted for a brunch excursion, yet our culinary inclinations led us to select items from the grilled cheese menu instead. I relished in the 'wake and bake,' an unparalleled delight that harmoniously combined the richness of cheddar, the savory essence of maple bacon, and the velvety texture of maple mayo. It was utterly sublime, transcending mere mortal taste buds.
