My companion had the 'blarney stoner,' an open-faced creation that juxtaposed mashed potatoes, beer cheese, and stout gravy atop a foundation of bread, accompanied by fries and hash browns. While not strictly adhering to the definition of grilled cheese, it was undeniably delectable. All grilled cheese dishes are served with tomato soup and fries; the latter were substantial, sporting a crispy exterior and fluffy interior, and offered in various flavors such as old bay - an unimpeachable choice. The tomato soup presented an interesting dichotomy - while not unpalatable, its viscosity verged on excessive, rendering it impractical as a standalone dish, but nevertheless fulfilling its role as a dip for the fries. Our server exhibited commendable proficiency and promptness, leaving no room for dissatisfaction. Moreover, the establishment boasts an impressive array of beers, ensuring our future patronage."

Just to the left of Atria's on the Roberto Clemente Bridge side of PNC Park is where you'll find The Diamond Pizza. 

Not only do they have really good pizza, the cheese is especially good, but you can enter the park there as well. Never a line.  Friendly ticket taker and bag search person greet you at the door, scan your ticket and provide a program along with any promotional items for the game.

Once inside, order by the slice, grab a beer if that's your pleasure and watch the game on either of the TVs before going to your seats. Another bonus, restrooms are just outside the restaurant as you enter the left field corridor. 

Like most pizza/sandwich shops, this one can be hopping. No frills in the service, mustard working folks trying to make good food for the money. And they do.

Well I went in here looking for gifts for others, but only came out with stuff for myself....hummmm something is wrong with this picture! \nI love Ross stores, I shouldn't have even started looking for stuff for me, it get's me every time!
Old school friendly atmosphere and great specials.  The steak abd lobster comes with veggies and a big ass baked potato

Holly's review is right on!  This was my second year doing this event.  Last year, I did the bicycle ride.  That was such a cluster, it wasn't offered this year.

I don't run, but I walk the 5K.  I always have my beard with me so that's never a problem.  I also park in the north lot and make a quick exit on Sunset.

I really dislike the growth in the numbers of dogs that are here every year.  At least they had the good sense to crap at home before they came here, because I saw no doggy do anywhere.

It's fun doing the walk because the entertainment beforehand--Jabbawockeez from the Monte Carlo, some dancers from the topless show Fantasy at the Luxor, and five flying Santas that parachuted to the parking lot from a helicopter high above the boulevard, and others--make this a fun event. Also, the chance to walk over the freeway on Sunset, something you don't do everyday is worth the walking.

It's also the main fundraiser for Opportunity Village, a very needy charity in Southern nevada.  I'll be back next year for another go, suit and all!

"Yet another triumphant transplant from the culinary melting pot of New York City, this establishment exudes an ambiance of contemporary sophistication, while its menu boasts an array of delectable options sure to cater to diverse gastronomic inclinations. However, navigating the extensive selection may prove daunting for larger groups, as certain dishes lend themselves more readily to sharing than others; in such cases, the assistance of an accommodating server can prove invaluable in ensuring a harmonious dining experience for all parties involved. Furthermore, the atmosphere within the restaurant is vibrant and energetic, with an infectious buzz generated by the confluence of stylish decor, convivial staff, and an eclectic clientele. Ultimately, this venue offers a veritable cornucopia of epicurean delights, rendering it an ideal destination for repeat visits."

"Concealed from plain sight, the eatery's whereabouts had escaped my cognizance, as I had allowed myself to be chauffeured by acquaintances, thus, my inattention to the route traversed rendered me oblivious to its precise location. The restaurant's interior, replete with eccentric, dimly lit ambiance, and diminutive dimensions, augmented by lustrous copper countertops, contributed to an air of uniqueness. My gastronomical inclinations led me to sample the pork enchiladas (of uncertain nomenclature), in addition to partaking in a shared portion of sautÃ©ed garlic dish (the specific appellation of which escapes me). The culinary indulgences proved most satisfying, bequeathing upon my palate an unremitting craving for further exploration of their flavors. However, an unforeseen consequence of my gustatory exploits manifested in the form of an enduring garlic-infused odor, permeating my very being, leaving me with an unshakable sensation of being imbued with the pungent essence for an extended period. Despite this drawback, my patronage of this establishment remains a worthwhile recommendation."

I undertook a personal culinary excursion to this establishment several months ago, and I must say that I am thoroughly delighted that I did, for the consumables served here are indeed delectable. Specifically, I indulged in their spicy meat taco, which proved to be a flavorsome and satisfying experience. Subsequently, I revisited this venue a few weeks later and opted for their burrito, which not only met but exceeded my expectations, surpassing the quality of a similar dish offered by Chipotle. However, I do lament the lack of clarity regarding the nature of the meats utilized in their dishes, as the majority of them are unfamiliar to me, and perhaps a more diverse selection of carbonated beverages or the inclusion of tea would enhance the overall dining experience. Nonetheless, this establishment earns high marks for providing an economical and satisfying dining option, serving scrumptious tacos, burritos, and street corn late into the evening hours.
i really want to give it 5 stars but my carne adovada sometimes is kinda fatty. i love this dish but hate sometimes picking through fat. they do have the best chipotle ranch ever!!!

"The most exceptional Chai Latte within the vicinity. Consumed a chocolate twist and a quiche Lorraine; both possessed an ethereal quality in terms of taste and texture, with the latter boasting an unparalleled lightness that belied its delectability. Procured a ciabatta boule for domestic consumption, which, despite its unconventional moisture level, excelled in its flavorsome presentation."

"Delectable culinary offerings, complemented by exceptional customer service, have solidified this establishment as a recurring destination for our gastronomical indulgences. We unreservedly endorse the sesame tofu, a dish that showcases the pinnacle of flavorsome tofu preparation within the realm of restaurants."

The dissatisfaction I experienced with my recent order from this establishment compelled me to deduct a star from my rating, as the Teriyaki Chicken rice bowl I ordered failed to meet my expectations in terms of taste and texture, with an unpleasant, sodden consistency that my colleague aptly likened to a frozen meal that had been reheated, leading me to conclude that I will restrict my future orders to the 5-star wraps and salads, thereby allowing me to avoid the subpar bowls that garnered a mere 2.5 stars.

Great performances and acts! The main guy was hilarious and the space was intimate. I only wish Angel had a larger part, but it was fun seeing her doing something out of her element. \n\nP.S. The absinthe is a great gimmick but nothing like what you find overseas. I appreciate that they had it though.

I went back a second time and they have changed the way they make the Wellington.  It now only comes one way you cannot order it medium well or any other way.  Just thought it was funny after my initial review.  Still very good though!

The review by Jennifer C. is spot on. I had a very similar experience. I'm from Pittsburgh and taking a 'tour' of my hometown seemed odd at first, but this was definitely a unique way to get around town. \n\nThe only reason I didn't give this more stars though was that I have to say this adventure was more Segway, less tour. Riding the Segway was a ton of fun (especially after they turned off the speed limiter) but there wasn't much to the tour itself. The guide pointed out a few interesting facts here and there, but I was hoping for more.

Make certain that your stomach is suitably prepared for an influx of copious amounts of delectable sustenance, lest you risk experiencing a state of culinary satiation bordering on somnolence, should you opt to partake in a dining experience at this establishment; for the servings, far from being modest in their magnitude, are truly enormous and will undoubtedly engender a sensation of lethargy, rendering any subsequent physical activity decidedly challenging. Furthermore, the fries accompanying the various sandwich options are likewise of exceptional quality and will assuredly contribute to your overall sense of gastronomic satisfaction.

What is up with the host's lately in restaurants. They have zero personality and really don't set a great first impression. Anyhow lets get to food and service. Carol is great and really overcomes the original impression left by the podium guards. We ordered a tomatoe caprisi appetizer and it was excellent!  A new variation on a classic. Tomatoes are spread out on the plate and has chopped tomaroes spread around. The new addition to this classic is fresh red onion and then a balsamic reduction and fresh basil. I could eat this dish as an main course but I don't have that much restraint. I orderes pasta franco and it was very food. The combination of olives artichoke hearts and sundried tomatoe makes this dish a little salt towards the end but it wasn't unexpected. I would order it again.  Carol Is very attentive but never pushy and you should definitely ask for her. We don't dine here often enough but we will remedy that.
Come for the coffee, stay (or come back) for the excellent fresh soup, sandwiches and smoothies!  Would be 5 stars if the service was more consistent.

"Expeditious, courteous, and the comestibles were of satisfactory quality. Specifically, the Thai-inspired tacos and deep-fried macaroni and cheese proved to be delectable options. Additionally, their assortment of burgers catered to the palates of patrons seeking a hasty, yet satisfying repast. Although not an epicurean destination, this establishment delivered adequate nourishment."

Great place!  Pretty slow, as you might expect on a Monday night.  Had nice Malbec, great marinaded olives and a perfect-sized sausage and mushroom pizza.  

Decor is very spiffy.  Rather hard to find the place if you're not a local.  Little strip mall right behind the tire store.  Look Arden, as it's worth searching for.

Get in here!!

Eines vorweg: In diesem Chinarestaurant habe ich bislang nur das Mittagsbuffet kennengelernt. Die Bewertung bezieht sich ausschliesslich darauf.


 Mittlerweile gehen wir einmal wöchentlich zu diesem chinesischen Restaurant. Das Buffet wird ständig aufgefüllt, so dass es fast immer genug von allem hat. Meine Lieblingsgerichte hier sind die acht Kostbarkeiten und das Hühnchen in Curry. Fazit: Solide Kost zu einem vernünftigen Preis ohne Wartezeiten.

Dickey's saved my Thanksgiving!

My brother & I decided to do Thanksgiving w/ friends super last minute. Hash House a Go Go ran out of turkeys. WTF. So did Mimi's Cafe, Lucilles, and Famous Daves. Double WTF. I needed Thanksgiving to-go and only 2 days to do it! Dickey's had 2 turkey options for $49.99--Cajun Fried Turkey or Smoked Turkey. Of course, they were sold out of the fried turkey but they had 1 smoked turkey left. I called dibs!!!

The pick-up process was easy. Zipped in and out within 5 minutes. They're closed on Thanksgiving so pick-up needs to be the day before. They're open late so I picked up around 7pm. The turkey is wrapped in foil and comes in an oven-safe aluminum pan ready-to-heat. It takes about 2 hours for the turkey to reach eating temperature. Excellent packaging since my friend just moved to Vegas and has minimal bake/cookware available. I needed low maintenance food and Dickey's definitely made the holidays a bit easier for me.
 
The turkey itself was pretty tasty. I was a little concerned that the smoked turkey wouldn't have the Thanksgiving flavor I was looking for but it was delicious. Not the best I've ever had but very good. As much as I love cooking and being able to put all the flavors I want into things. It was a relief to not have to deal with cooking a large bird and focus on the epic games of Settlers of Catan and Wii Tennis.

We casually sauntered into the eatery subsequent to an exhaustive day, only to discover that a particular dish we had been craving was no longer available on the menu. However, the attentive server accommodated our request by placing an order for a customized surf and turf dish, consisting of an eight-ounce filet mignon and a lobster tail, accompanied by mashed potatoes and a salad. Unfortunately, the mixed greens appeared to be hastily assembled, resembling a haphazard arrangement of shredded iceberg lettuce carelessly dumped into a bowl. Moreover, the lobster tail was slightly overcooked, resulting in an unpleasant rubbery texture. Nonetheless, the filet mignon and mashed potatoes proved to be delectable, catering to my personal penchant for rich, savory flavors. Despite the inconsistencies in the cuisine, the restaurant's cozy ambiance and sophisticated atmosphere remained appealing, leading me to conclude that our unfavorable dining experience may have been attributed to the late hour of our arrival. Thus, I am willing to grant them another opportunity to demonstrate their culinary prowess.

Great old fashioned ice cream parlor!

They have a ton of toppings to create your own or special unique creations. It's a fun place and we had good service. Ice cream was great too. 

It will definitely be a stop of mine next year during spring training.

This eatery, despite being part of a larger franchise, offers a remarkable dining experience, surpassing expectations with its generous portions of delectable, slow-cooked meats and fresh, flavorful ingredients, all at an affordable price point. The tacos, in particular, showcase the culinary expertise of the kitchen staff, with each bite bursting with rich, savory flavors that linger long after the meal is finished. Additionally, the burritos are of considerable size, stuffed to capacity with an assortment of mouthwatering components, including rice, beans, cheese, salsa, guacamole, and your choice of protein. Furthermore, the service is prompt, courteous, and welcoming, with staff members eager to accommodate any special requests or dietary restrictions. To top it off, patrons can enjoy either a complimentary cookie or a scoop of creamy ice cream for dessert, providing a sweet conclusion to a satisfying meal.

Short wait.  Television available in news or sport channel. Bring reading material or tablet to pass the time. Mammography technicians were good. Office personnel really nice but a little disorganized. They really try to accommodate patients in.

"A culinary establishment offering an innovative fusion of Asian gastronomic traditions, which has provided me with an exemplary dining experience on three separate occasions, characterized by the serving of delectable dishes such as garlic crab and salt and pepper calamari, albeit with an emphasis on the utilization of sodium chloride and black peppercorns in the latter dish, thereby rendering it advisable for patrons to possess a predilection for savory flavors; furthermore, the ambiance of this eatery exudes an air of sophistication, courtesy of a live jazz ensemble performing ambient melodies, rendering it an ideal setting for either a romantic evening or social gathering with acquaintances, although it may not be suitable for young children due to the complexity of the menu offerings and the potential for prolonged waiting periods between courses, and, owing to my personal preference for convenience, I typically opt for hired transportation rather than risking the unpredictability of parking facilities in the vicinity."

"The culinary delight known as Cheese Ravioli, accompanied by an Alfredo sauce of unparalleled quality, transcended my gastronomical expectations. For the modest sum of $7, I was presented with an adequate quantity of six ravioli, enrobed in a rich, velvety sauce that was complemented by a warm, soft breadstick. The dish was not only satisfying but also possessed an ideal portion size, which satiated my hunger without inducing discomfort. As an aficionado of Alfredo sauce, I can unequivocally attest that this particular rendition is among the finest I have had the pleasure of consuming, boasting an impressive depth of flavor that was neither diluted nor insipid. Although the pizza offerings at this establishment may be somewhat prohibitive in terms of cost, I am eagerly anticipating my next visit, when I shall indulge in additional servings of their delectable pasta."

"The palpable influence of Dogfish Head and Founders on NoDa Brewing Company is evident in the distinctive flavors of their beers, such as the Hop, Drop 'n Roll IPA, which boasts a pungent and zesty character, and the Woody & Wilcox IPA, whose earthy undertones provide a subtle contrast. The Coco Loco, my introduction to NoDa's offerings, masterfully balances boldness and subtlety, making it an ideal alternative to traditional campfire treats. The rest of the brews I've sampled have demonstrated robust complexity and an ability to hold their own when paired with others.

The interior of NoDa BC exudes a familiar taproom ambiance, complete with a bar and assorted seating options. The diverse clientele, consisting of beer enthusiasts and those who appreciate the cultural significance of the establishment, contribute to the lively atmosphere. While there may not be any singular aspect that elevates NoDa above other breweries, its welcoming environment and quality beverages ensure its status as a place worth revisiting.

My recommendations include sampling the Coco Loco, despite any reservations about its unconventional style, and taking advantage of the covered outdoor seating area during inclement weather."

Love my pizza Naked! Let's start by saying that I'm just excited to get SOMETHING in the neighborhood that isn't the same ole' same ole' that is on every street corner in Phoenix. So I awaited Naked Pizza with anticipation. 

I expected it to be busy Friday night when I pulled in. I found a parking spot right up front. I was surprised that there was no seating and it is take out/delivery only. But that's ok if it is tasty! We asked for suggestions and we were given a couple of recommendations. We ordered a 10" Superbiotic and a 10" BBQ chicken both on original crust. 

There were a few people in the lobby and ordering. It was clear that they were buzzing around like bees in the back keeping up with orders and the warming oven was full to the brim with boxes of pizzza so they were clearly very busy. I waited about 7 minutes for the pizza and we were on our way. We were very happy with the in-store service. 

When we got the pizza home I was even more impressed. I found the crust to be absolutely delicious. The Superbiotic was as yummy as any $19 smaller pizza in any wood-fired joint. The crust was tasy and good...Now I'm not a huge pizza eater. My favorite is a White pizza....but this I ate every single solitary morsel of. None left for the dogs or anyone else! 

I was back Sunday and Wednesday. 

Welcome to the neighborhood Naked Pizza!!

"I have had the privilege of partaking in the culinary delights offered by this establishment on two separate occasions since its inauguration, and while the initial visit was marred by a few minor errors in the fulfillment of our order, the staff demonstrated a commendable level of proficiency in addressing and resolving the issues promptly, which served as a testament to their dedication to providing an exceptional dining experience for their patrons. Moreover, the fare provided by this restaurant has been of superior quality, with prices that are remarkably reasonable and affordable, creating a truly unparalleled value for customers when juxtaposed with the offerings of competitors such as Baja Fresh. Additionally, the eatery boasts a spotless environment, complemented by an ambiance that exudes liveliness and vitality, further enhancing the overall enjoyment of the dining experience for patrons."

I visited this establishment in the company of six other individuals on a Saturday evening, and upon our arrival, we discovered that our table was already prepared and awaiting our presence, which was indeed gratifying. This venue, with its venerable age and abundant charm, was bustling with activity, and it was patently obvious that the wait staff, servers, and busboys were overburdened with work. Following a ten-minute interval, during which we were compelled to hail someone's attention in order to procure bread and place an appetizer order, we encountered considerable difficulty in securing additional menu items or refreshments for our beverages, as our server was noticeably scarce, making appearances only at twenty-minute intervals. Despite the lackluster quality of the service, the culinary offerings were truly exceptional, with each dish I sampled demonstrating meticulous preparation and unparalleled flavor, particularly the gnocchi, which ranked among the most delectable examples of Italian cuisine I have had the pleasure of consuming. Notwithstanding the aforementioned reservations pertaining to the service, I would unhesitatingly revisit this establishment in the future.

"My culinary exploration has reached its zenith, as I have discovered an eatery that serves delectable tacos, which have elevated my gustatory senses to unprecedented heights. I indulged in a triad of street tacos, each featuring a distinct protein; namely, chicken, asada, and pork. The porcine variety boasted a subtle sweetness and a smoky essence, while the asada showcased a proficient use of spices and a smoldering quality. Although the avian iteration did not disappoint, it lacked the same depth of flavor as its counterparts. My spouse allowed me a taste of the Bombero burrito, which elicited an expletive from me due to the presence of a rich, tangy Mexican barbecue sauce. The entire dining experience was well worth the brief journey of 30 minutes. I would enthusiastically partake in every item on the menu, as my epicurean inclinations have been thoroughly satiated by this establishment."

My sister and I ate here, after we saw an ad about the restaurant which made the place seem like it was a hot spot for celebrites. There were pictures of Rachel Bilson and even Paris Hilton celebrating parties there, so we felt that it must be good. FIX was described as having gourmet \"college food\". It definitely had those bad things we all loved in college when we had no time to cook. We ordered the Mini Kobe Burger sliders, and the famed Buffalo Chicken wings. We even ordered some fries, which came in a cute little swirl like container. All of the food we ate was good. The price can be on the upper side, but it's still a nice trendy place to eat at in the Bellagio. I might suggest eating the steak, since it is also advertised as having one of the best steak in Vegas (as do many restaurants by many different critics!)

If had indulged in a morning repast at this Ahwatukee eatery thrice consecutively, whereupon, during weekend intervals, the hostess proffered seating at the bar, subsequent to awaiting a table. The chiliquilas surpassed expectations, while the El Jefe lived up to its reputation. Upon ordering the huevos rancheros, an additional pancake accompanied the dish, which boasted a superlative texture and the ranchero salsa was equally impressive. Previous patrons alluded to the quality of service, which remained consistent despite the frenetic ambiance of a bustling Saturday morning.

I am a huge fan of the Penn Brewery and if you don't know me I am a bit of a booze hound. I love beer! All types, all colors, all ABV's. So I ran in here today for lunch but I  am not allowed to imbibe during work hours. Woe is me....the world is not fair! My point is if you enjoy a beer, just about any type...this is the place to start. I have been here 10+ times and this was my only non-drinking visit. \n\nI enjoyed the Braumeister Steak Sandwich with fries. The food, service and atmosphere were great. Try to find the time to visit this place. Well worth the stop.

"Culinary excellence abounds at this esteemed eatery! Enjoyed an assortment of delectable delights and potent potables at the bar with a companion. Two exceptional India Pale Ale options were available. Although I am not typically enamored with squid-based fare, the slow-cooked calamari was truly remarkable, unquestionably worth sampling! Additionally devoured a mozzarella caprese, a satisfying selection. The ambiance of the bar was tranquil, not ideal for viewing sporting events such as football due to the subdued atmosphere, but an optimal setting for an intimate evening with a significant other."

My closest acquaintance and I decided to partake in a culinary excursion to Zinburger on a weeknight, and upon our arrival, we discovered that the establishment was teeming with patrons. Despite the fact that we could have secured a table without incurring any delay, we chose to situate ourselves at the bar, which offered us an unobstructed view of the interior of the restaurant. The strategic placement of the bar proved to be a brilliant design element, as it enabled us to observe the vibrant ambiance and simultaneously savor the delectable cuisine.

The fare at Zinburger was indeed costly, but the quality of the dishes we sampled more than compensated for the expense. We elected to divide a Kobe burger, accompanied by double truffle fries and zucchini fries, and complemented our meal with a bottle of wine. The quantity of food we consumed was precisely adequate to satiate our hunger, leaving us both feeling gratified and content (although it is worth mentioning that the wine may have contributed to our enhanced sense of satisfaction).

Based on my exceptionally pleasant dining experience at Zinburger, I am eager to return and indulge in another sumptuous meal. The restaurant's excellence was truly impressive, and I would highly recommend it to anyone seeking a refined culinary adventure.

Benihana is best enjoyed when you: 
Have money
A large group of people
and a lot of time to spare. 

Probably something to do once or twice a year. I go when my friends from Iowa decide to come visit me and we have time and money to spare. Everyone there is friendly, and I love the cook in front of you style. (Although sometimes the fire tricks make my eyes hurt). 

Please note this place is not known for their sushi. I would recommend anything hibachi and if you look like you're a kid, it's a good idea to get some sort of kids meal  (if they have one, unfortunately I look like I'm 30 something and my babies are too young and wild to bring anywhere nice)  I want to note too, that I personally feel like they have the best  fried rice.

"Having perused both the favorable and unfavorable assessments of this boarding establishment, I am inclined to lean towards the former, as my experience with my jack russell terrier at this facility was largely satisfactory. Despite the pricing being slightly higher than I would have preferred, the expansive nature of the facility, reminiscent of Pet Smart's hotel, coupled with the constant socialization and playtime afforded to the canine inhabitants, served to mitigate any reservations I may have harbored regarding the cost. My diminutive dog was accommodated in a cozy pen, complete with its own cot, and I was pleased to observe that there were televisions strategically positioned throughout the premises, broadcasting dog-themed programming and cartoons. The play areas, which catered to dogs of varying sizes, were impressively spacious, with some visible from the check-in desk. Although I did notice minor accidents on the floor during both check-in and check-out, the sheer volume of dogs present made such occurrences appear inevitable. The staff members exhibited remarkable friendliness and hospitality, and I would unhesitatingly reserve space at this establishment again in the future. While it may not be the most ideal location, it is certainly progressing in that direction, and I would have no qualms about recommending it to others."
Great atmosphere, good food and good service. If you are in the Belmont area, a must stop. I had a burger which was great in this little hometown Irish pub.

This cool spot is conveniently located at the MGM Grand if you need a quick break from some slots.  The food was way better than I expected.  I tried the pork belly sandwich and caesar salad and was really impressed.  Both of these dishes are really, really awesome.  I tried the pizza with all the meat lover's fixings and it was extremely tasty but not as crispy as I would have expected (as a native Bronxite, I'm understandably biased).  Overall, I highly recommend this joint!

"The tortillas, boasting an unparalleled quality, had the potential to establish this eatery as a premier dining destination. Upon arriving at 12:30 pm, I was promptly accommodated with both sustenance and seating. The bean and cheese burrito, augmented by a side of guacamole, showcased impeccable taste and freshness. However, the true masterpiece of the meal proved to be the tortillas themselves, which seemed to be handcrafted with care and dedication. Such exceptional quality was not only evident in their taste but also in their texture, leaving a lasting impression on my palate. While the menu may have been somewhat limited, the prices remained reasonable and did not detract from the overall dining experience. Furthermore, the quaint and welcoming ambiance of the establishment, housed within a charming building, only added to its appeal. My appreciation for this restaurant was further solidified upon discovering that America, the proprietor, had opted for a namesake that exuded authenticity rather than resorting to a contrived moniker."

WOW, times must be truly hard if they aren't able to fill a Cirque du Soleil stadium on a Saturday night in the prime section. We went last minute because the young man wanted to watch it again and boy I must say, I thoroughly enjoyed it even the 2nd time round. We had prime front center seats and this time I noticed things I hadn't noticed the first time around.

At the Waverley Train Station, there are limited options for dining prior to embarking on your journey, and the selection is somewhat restricted, particularly during the evening hours when the inventory of edible items tends to deplete, resulting in an absence of numerous staff members responsible for replenishing the shelves, thereby creating a sense of congestion within the compact retail space.

Uh oh, what do we have here?  Another contender in the commercial center district looking to claim the prize of best Thai food in Vegas.  Everyone knows about the other contender.  What I was not aware of, prior to this visit for a mid day impromptu lunch redemption, was that Komol lays out some seriously good Thai food.  

So here I was, far from my comfort zone again trying new and exciting entrees that I would have never even thought of trying before. My arm was twisted twice this day...once to go here in the first place (glad I did) and the second was to try a dish with tofu.  What?!!? No meat!  I now know what the big to do is all about.  The meal went like this...Fresh spring rolls that were delicious and unlike others I've had, not greasy.  Pad kee mow with tofu, spicy level 3 since I'm a baby.  This dish was quite tasty...at first I skirted around the tofu; then I believe I compromised it all and refused to share it.  The final dish was Panang curry with chicken; finally the meat makes its presence known...level 3 again.  

Sorry to all experienced Thai foodies, my pallet cannot yet handle the crazy spiciness; with time I will slowly increase this to a 10 and just know that over the next few visits I will be updating this review to a 5.  Thanks for a great meal.

I have had the pleasure of visiting this esteemed establishment on two separate occasions, specifically on April 20th, 2013 and January 10th, 2014. On both instances, I must say that the ambiance was quite vibrant and electric, particularly during the latter visit, where the venue was brimming with an animated crowd, resulting in a prolonged wait to access the rooftop area. However, I must admit that the experience was somewhat marred by the excessive density of patrons, which made dancing a rather arduous task. Nevertheless, the first visit proved to be more enjoyable, as the crowd was less congested, thereby allowing us to relish the nocturnal festivities with greater ease. Furthermore, I must commend the bartenders for their proficiency in concocting delectable beverages, especially their rendition of a cosmopolitan, which my girlfriend thoroughly enjoyed. Notwithstanding the occasional overcrowding, I would still highly recommend this establishment to anyone seeking a unique and exhilarating nightlife experience.

"On this occasion, which marks my second visit to this establishment, I must say that I am thoroughly impressed with the efficient manner in which they coordinate their efforts to address the various aspects of my vehicle's maintenance needs, particularly when they have an abundance of personnel at their disposal. Moreover, I must commend them on the expeditious nature of their work, which enables them to complete the task in a timely fashion. Of course, as a cognizant consumer, I am mindful of the potential risks associated with utilizing high-pressure hoses on my recently painted automobile, and thus, I appreciate their willingness to employ the standard hose instead, thereby ensuring that my vehicle remains in pristine condition. Additionally, I was pleased to note that they offered to bundle their services, thereby affording me the opportunity to realize significant savings on the interior detailing of my car."

"Whimsically meandering through our recently adopted urban terrain, my companion and I decided to impulsively visit this establishment, which, much to our delight, transpired to be an exceptionally fortuitous discovery. Upon entering the premises, we were warmly received and efficiently accommodated, despite the tardy hour. Our server exhibited remarkable alacrity and affability throughout the dining experience, expeditiously presenting us with an assortment of delectable delights, including garlic naan, chicken tikka masala, and chicken vidaloo. The culinary masterpieces were delivered in a timely manner, eliciting unbridled euphoria from both myself and my companion. The tikka masala, in particular, boasted an unparalleled richness and freshness that left an indelible impression upon our palates. Moreover, my companion's vidaloo, tailored to his preference for piquant flavors, struck the perfect balance between taste and tongue-tingling sensation. Such an enjoyable dining experience has led us to return on numerous occasions, with each visit yielding an identical outcome: satiation and contentment. Indeed, the prospect of partaking in their lunchtime spread induces great anticipation."

"Culinary excellence is the primary draw of this establishment, as the ambiance and clientele fail to impress. Despite the diminutive dimensions of the venue and the unremarkable character of its patrons, the gastronomical delights available here are truly exceptional and competitively priced. As such, I have no qualms about frequenting this eatery solely for the purpose of savoring its delectable offerings, even if it means tolerating an environment that falls short of my expectations in terms of both aesthetics and social appeal. While I would readily bestow a perfect rating upon this restaurant were it not for its physical constraints and unsatisfactory patronage, I must deduct a star from my overall assessment due to these factors."

If you are serious about looking like a pimp, this is absolutely your destination.  There are a mix of consignment items and new pimp-gear.  I drooled over the three ties painted with Vargas girls ($100 each).  Oddly, almost everything I looked at was priced at $85.  The woman working there did not get off the phone or offer to help me the entire time I was there.

"I derive immense pleasure from meandering through this establishment, as they possess an extensive array of vibrant ornamental items, encompassing furniture, sculptures, and an assortment of other decorative pieces, including, but not limited to, oscillating turtles. Furthermore, I acquired several decorative tiles at a remarkably affordable price point of $1 apiece. These distinctive and economical gift items are ideal for presenting to individuals as a means of expressing appreciation or commemorating a special occasion, particularly when seeking to bestow upon them a token of Arizona-inspired culture."

Came on a Saturday morning at 9:30am and we were seated immediately, service was very nice.  I greatly enjoyed my Brunch Des Cantons, perfectly cooked beans and various pork.  My fiance liked her Brunch Sucre, but wasn't blown away by it.  Solid Coffee and OJ included with brunch.  All in all a very pleasant experience.

Stayed here September of 07'.  Twice.  WTH?!?

Yeah some allergic reaction mixed with something viral; made my throat close up and could barely breathe; nearly passed out.

Long story short; the nurses are zero supreme (Number 1) and my private room was bangin'!

They actually listened to me when I told them I have "hidden veins" and a butterfly needle would suit me.

My beau, parents and daughter all came to visit and also were pleased at my accommodations.  

God forbid something else unfortunate should happen to me, but if it does, Meriter is my hospital.

Thanks!

It is gratifying to observe that the standard of excellence upheld by Panera remains consistent across diverse geographic locations, including the Madison, WI branch. The culinary offerings at this establishment are of superior quality, and the staff exhibits a commendable level of professionalism and dedication to providing exceptional customer service. Although this particular location experiences a high volume of patrons, the efficient and well-organized service ensures that customers are served in a timely manner, minimizing delays and optimizing the dining experience for all involved.

"For gastronomical aficionados seeking delectable burger culinary experiences, the eatery under scrutiny provided an adequate, albeit unremarkable, dining adventure. Our server, Dominic, exhibited exceptional hospitality and proficiency in his role, contributing positively to the ambiance of the venue. Although this critique may seem tardy, allow me to emphasize that my recollection of the edibles availed at this establishment remains somewhat limited, with the exception of the boundless french fry offering, which proved a delightful accompaniment to my primary dish. Unfortunately, my memory fails to recall the specific designation of the burger I ordered, which, to my dismay, displayed a conspicuous lack of moisture. In spite of this minor drawback, I remain willing to accord the restaurant another opportunity to demonstrate its culinary prowess, should fate guide me to its vicinity once more."

"When I had my maiden encounter with Burrito Boyz, it was at a gathering where the culinary offerings were being catered, and I was utterly oblivious to the provenance of my enigmatic burrito. My initial impression? It was, without a doubt, the most delectable burrito I had ever had the pleasure of consuming. My cognitive faculties were astounded by the presence of avocado within its confines, and I found myself pondering what other unconventional ingredients lay hidden within its folds. Suffice it to say that Burrito Boyz unequivocally delivers a veritable cornucopia of flavors, textures, and sensations, all carefully orchestrated to satiate even the most fastidious of palates. Alas, my subsequent visits to their Toronto establishment have been somewhat disappointing, as the quality, service, and pricing have failed to meet my expectations. Nonetheless, my unwavering fondness for their burritos remains unperturbed."

Hubby and I indulged in an evening of epicurean delight at this establishment, savoring the delectable sushi and beverages that the venue had to offer. We opted to visit on a Saturday evening, which proved to be a pulsating and vibrant experience, courtesy of the resident disc jockey who orchestrated an atmosphere that was lively yet not overpowering. The ambiance afforded us the opportunity to engage in fervent people-watching, adding to the overall enjoyment of our culinary adventure. Our server, a charming and erudite individual, provided exceptional service, demonstrating a profound familiarity with the menu and its offerings. Suffice it to say, we shall indeed revisit this eatery in the future.

"I indulged in a delectable luncheon at this establishment in the company of my significant other, whereupon we opted to utilize alternative modes of transportation, specifically cycling and walking, thereby granting us an additional 20% discount. Furthermore, we took advantage of the Foursquare check-in promotion, which offered an additional $5 discount when using our American Express card. The ambiance was tranquil, fostering a relaxed atmosphere during our visit. We relished the flavorsome trout and happy hour fish and chips, both of which were cooked to perfection. Notwithstanding, I did feel a tad pressed for time throughout the meal, yet the culinary offerings and beverages were undeniably impressive. The fish and chips were remarkably fresh, boasting a satisfying crunchiness, while the trout dish was adorned with a medley of green beans and peanuts. Additionally, I requested a side of mashed potatoes, which were skillfully prepared, maintaining a delightful firmness without succumbing to sogginess. In conclusion, my experience at this eatery was thoroughly enjoyable, and I look forward to future visits."

What a lovely experience we had. I'm kind of picky with my taste on wine by that was no challenge for this place. When I wasn't fully satisfied I had a new suggestion and it was perfect!! The lobster was to die for and the crab legs are always and always will be my favorite. They even let me custom my own fav dessert. What's yours? Ask them I'm sure they will assist you! \n\nOh ya.. Be sure to request siting outside when you make your reservation. The lake and light show is a trip! :)

"For a weekend breakfast excursion, Toast offers an optimal dining experience, boasting brisk and attentive service delivered by a cohesive team of waitstaff who collectively ensure that all patrons' needs are met expeditiously, including timely coffee refills and prompt attention to any other necessities that may arise. Moreover, the eatery's pricing strategy is eminently reasonable, with the vast majority of breakfast entrÃ©es priced at an affordable $8 or lower, while still showcasing a marked superiority in terms of culinary quality relative to other establishments within the same price range, particularly with regard to their eggs, coffee, cornbread, fruit, and other breakfast staples. In addition, the fruit salad served at Toast is of exceptional quality, rivaled only by homemade preparations crafted in a well-stocked kitchen. Furthermore, the restaurant's welcoming atmosphere makes it an ideal destination for families with young children, as the speedy service and moderate prices create an environment conducive to stress-free dining experiences for all generations, including grandparents who will appreciate the familiar tunes playing in the background. If, however, one's gastronomic expectations extend beyond Toast's offerings, alternative options such as The Gallery, CafÃ© Monte, or Zebras provide comparable breakfast fare at roughly double the cost; nonetheless, for those seeking a judicious balance between gustatory satisfaction and economic feasibility, Toast emerges as the optimal choice."

"Unexpectedly delighted by the diverse culinary options presented at this seemingly unassuming establishment, which initially appeared to be yet another quaint delicatessen, I was compelled to express my satisfaction and note that the menu boasted an impressive array of delectable selections catering to diverse tastes and dietary preferences, thereby eliciting my desire to return and indulge in a more comprehensive gastronomical experience."

"If you are an ardent aficionado of Hip Hop and R/B, then this establishment serves as an ideal venue for your indulgence. My personal experience at this locale was nothing short of exceptional, as I relished the delectable fare offered by their menu, specifically the fire pit, which, although priced at a premium of $50, proved to be a worthwhile investment. Unbeknownst to me at the time, the Rum Jungle undergoes a metamorphosis post-restaurant hours, transforming into a pulsating club, thereby precluding the need to migrate to an alternative venue. My subsequent visit in November of 2009 reaffirmed my initial impression, as the ambiance remained consistent, characterized by an unwavering adherence to Hip Hop and R/B, complemented by potent libations and an array of diverse rum offerings. The verdict, therefore, is unequivocal: a resounding endorsement of the Rum Jungle, owing to its captivating ambiance, robust beverages, and strict allegiance to the aforementioned musical genres."

Prices are good and portions are great. I almost couldn't finish all my food. I've been here for breakfast and dinner and was satisfied with both my visits! The staff was very friendly and you don't have to wait very long for your food. Will most likely return in the future.

"Appearances can be misleading! We have repeatedly traversed this establishment's vicinity, dismissing it as a run-of-the-mill drinking establishment nestled within a nondescript strip mall. How erroneous our assumptions proved to be! Upon entering, our initial trepidation quickly dissipated, replaced by an atmosphere that exuded both warmth and sophistication. The interior design, adorned with tasteful embellishments, effectively created an ambiance conducive to a gratifying dining experience. Our culinary expectations were not only met but exceeded, as the fare served was of superior quality, rivalling that of esteemed restaurants. However, a minor quibble prevented me from conferring a perfect rating. On Fridays, the customary fish fry takes center stage in Wisconsin, compelling me to indulge in the all-you-can-eat variation. Although the initial serving was generous and adequately prepared, its prolonged arrival time and the absence of any inquiry regarding additional helpings slightly tarnished my overall satisfaction. Notwithstanding this, our eagerness to revisit this establishment remains undiminished."

"The prolonged and arduous process of securing a parking spot, followed by an extensive and excruciating wait, as alluded to by numerous individuals, is undoubtedly worthwhile for those who possess a profound appreciation for the authentic flavors and traditions of Texas-style barbecue. The similarity between this establishment and Franklin Barbecue in Austin is striking, both in terms of the exceptional quality of their offerings and the innovative approach to their business model. Only those who are foolish or naive would choose to arrive at the peak hour of 11:00 am, as the wisest course of action would be to delay one's visit until after the lunchtime rush has subsided, thereby allowing for a more efficient and expedited waiting period."

"It is my fervent desire that we had allocated a greater amount of time to exploring Fremont Street during our visit to Las Vegas, as I found the atmosphere there to be significantly more welcoming and comforting than the overwhelming extravagance of the Strip. The eclectic blend of street performers, historically significant landmarks, and cutting-edge technology created a unique and captivating ambiance that, while slightly tinged with seediness, was still markedly distinct from the comparatively sanitized and commercialized environment of the Strip. Furthermore, utilizing public transportation to reach Fremont Street resulted in a lengthy and arduous journey, whereas opting for a taxi cab provided a vastly superior experience. \n\nMy appreciation for the assorted dining establishments and watering holes situated along Fremont Street was considerable, as they exuded a palpable sense of nostalgia and offered prices that were considerably more reasonable than their counterparts on the Strip. The laid-back demeanor of the patrons and staff, coupled with the absence of pretentiousness, contributed to an unpretentious and convivial atmosphere that was refreshingly reminiscent of a bygone era. Moreover, the plethora of exceptional eateries and the impressive video screen only served to enhance the overall appeal of this historic district."

Very clean. Fair price for the quality food and ingredients. Simple menu. Good cheesesteaks and fries. Be aware of the cheese fries as they use real thick cheese :). It may be a little overwhelming. Overall, very good restaurant. We will return.

I love the furniture here! We went in looking for a coffee table and a large ottoman.  Pricey but all of the pieces are unique. Place was not busy and sales people did not circle you like road kill. They also didnt say hello, so I took a star. We were able to browse through and didnt have any questions so it didn't bother me that they didnt greet us. Large and small pieces to go in any room. Looked like they had a design center. Didn't find the perfect piece today.

Came here with an Australian friend I ran into, we wanted to do the whole American diner thing, and boy was it fun.

Very warm welcome for us, as a Brit & an Aussie we instantly hit it off with the staff and had a laugh.

Food was superb, I LOVED the chilli cheese fries, very hard to find over here and actually enjoy. Had the Chicken Philly cheese steak and it was great, really well prepared and quickly delivered. Prices were fantastic and service efficient and friendly. I'd love to come again for lunch.

"An diminutive, authentic Irish watering hole, characterized by a pervasive wooden motif within its interior, exudes an atmosphere of warm familiarity and conviviality reminiscent of a close-knit community. The Monterey Pub presents itself as an idyllic setting for a leisurely late weekend afternoon or a casual gathering with companions, where one can indulge in palate-pleasing fare and libations of remarkable value. Its proximity to the cultural institutions in the North End renders it an ideal stopping point following a visit to those hallowed halls. The pints are skillfully poured, the beverages are reasonably priced and of superior quality, and the culinary offerings are copious and satisfying, with a particular emphasis on beef dishes that have been marinated in Guinness, imbuing them with a rich, savory flavor. For those who are inclined towards culinary experimentation, the boxty's are an excellent option. It is worth noting, though perhaps self-evident, that the pub's location is situated on Monterey Street, conveniently adjacent to the YMCA; those seeking it out need only look for this easily recognizable landmark."

"The pinnacle of cheese curds, an unparalleled culinary experience that transcends the mundane and enters the realm of gastronomic nirvana. A veritable cornucopia of dairy delight, each bite a symphony of flavors and textures that will leave even the most discerning palate satiated. Pair it with a stein of frothy brew, and the resulting fusion of taste and aroma will transport you to a realm of pure, unadulterated bliss. But be warned, dear gourmand, for such pleasures come at a price; the portion sizes, while generous, may prove to be a challenge for those of lesser appetites, and the prices, while eminently reasonable, may induce a state of financial euphoria that could lead to reckless indulgence. And, of course, we must not forget the piÃ¨ce de rÃ©sistance, the cheese curds themselves, a golden, crispy delight that will leave you craving for more. In short, a dining experience that defies all conventions and redefines the very notion of culinary excellence."

Although they possess an establishment at the Beverly Center in California, I have indulged in culinary delights at this particular venue on the last two occasions that I have visited Las Vegas. I believe that if one is seeking a pleasant, adequate, comfortable, and economical dining experience subsequent to expending a considerable amount of currency gambling, then this restaurant would be an ideal selection. The portions are copious, and we were all unable to consume all of our food! I had the salmon that was prepared in three diverse manners, and I thoroughly enjoyed it! Additionally, we requested the beignets (sp?) for dessert, and it was significantly superior to those offered at Disneyland. I highly recommend this establishment if one does not feel inclined to dine at any of the other upscale restaurants in Las Vegas. However, it is worth noting that our server made an error on our bill by charging us twice for gratuity or something (my companion astutely observed this, while I was oblivious to it), and he only briefly returned to attend to us or replenish our beverages. Furthermore, we consumed our meal on a Sunday evening around 10 o'clock, which rendered the atmosphere relatively tranquil.

"I felt compelled to accord their coffee an effusive commendation, as I had the pleasure of receiving two cups of expertly crafted coffee from a former pupil of mine, completely unsolicited. One variety was Creme Brulee, while the other was Sugar N Spice; my student advised me to sample either or both and share my enthusiasm for them with others. In keeping with the spirit of community support, I gifted the second cup to a colleague, who expressed gratitude and relished every sip. Although I don't reside in close proximity to the establishment, I firmly believe in advocating for local businesses and investing in the growth of our neighborhoods. A flavorsome coffee experience with a unique twist indeed! It is my fervent hope that fate will eventually bring me to that particular vicinity, allowing me to pay a visit to the shop and express my appreciation in person."

I LOVE this place!!!  Discovered it by accident, but I'm no stranger now,.  My husband nevery tried anything like this before, but he took advantage of their special last Valentines Day for a couple, and now he goes with me every time.  We both feel so great after our session,.  The cost is really teriffic at $30 for an hour, and their massages are wonderful.  We didn't have anything like this in my former home of Yakima, WA!    Kathy

I have been wanting to try this place for a while now and recenlty had the opportunity. A few of my coworkers and I were at a training in Phoenix and desiring a spot for lunch.  A quick click of my GPS for local restaurants and Chino Bandino populated my screen. I shared the philosophy with my coworkers, my desire to try this place and they were game.\n\nIt was lunch time and busy when we arrived. We were a little confused as the place was crowded with people. One of the employees came over and inquired if he could help us and we explained that we were first timers. He took us to a side bar and gave all four of us samples of the Jade Chicken, the Carnitas, black beans, fried rice and a few others all of which were delicious. We excitedly ordered and sat down for our feast. Suffice to say we were stuffed when we returned to our training. Around 3pm the Snickerdoodle came in handy for our late day snack. Each of us enjoyed this outing and we shall return.

Viv B. is a fun boutique with a sophisticated but youthful aesthetic. I'm a real fan of their jewelry and art pieces, as well as their scent items, and though their clothing selection is small, it's very sharply curated. The owner named the shop after her grandmother, whose portrait presides over the shop like some kind of stylish saint.

"A novel patient arrived at our facility at approximately 5:45 PM and was accommodated promptly upon the commencement of operations at 6:00 PM. Following a brief waiting period of approximately 20 minutes, the patient was ushered into the presence of a veterinarian for a comprehensive diagnostic examination, the cost of which totaled $42, contingent upon the diminutive proportions of the patient, who happened to be a Chihuahua. In addition, the patient's nails were carefully trimmed for a nominal fee of $10. However, subsequent to the initial examination, the patient required an array of additional services, including radiography and blood tests, resulting in a substantial increase in the total cost of care to $700. Unfortunately, these efforts did not yield a definitive diagnosis, and the patient continued to experience considerable discomfort and limited mobility in her left front paw and leg. Pain medication and anti-inflammatory agents were subsequently administered, and the patient was discharged. Notwithstanding the occasional perception of haste or indifference on the part of our staff, the patient returned for recurring episodes of similar symptoms several times per month, necessitating periodic nail clipping."

"This venue offers an enjoyable experience, with delectable cuisine and exceptional hospitality, conveniently situated in close proximity to a cinema, thereby allowing patrons to partake in a satisfying meal either prior to or following a cinematic excursion."

Wow this is a really nice place. I've never visited this cinema before, but I was surprised. The restrooms are clean and modern, the theatre is a great size and they have a great selection at the snack bar. I will go back to this theatre for sure.

Firstly, permit me to express my utter satisfaction with the culinary experience offered by this esteemed eatery! The gastronomical delights presented before us boasted an impressive array of flavors, undoubtedly tantalizing our taste buds. Nonetheless, a caveat emerges in the form of a pecuniary concern, prompting a natural inclination to draw comparisons with other establishments offering similar fare at a relatively more reasonable cost. To elucidate, the delectable appetizers proffered by Halcyon, while unquestionably delightful, carried a price tag that some might consider exorbitant, amounting to a whopping fourteen dollars! This observation compels me to juxtapose the former with the Harvest Moon Grille, a dining destination renowned for its superior quality and comparatively greater value. Indeed, a cursory examination of their menu reveals a striking discrepancy in pricing, with the latter offering arguably more generous portions at a lower cost. Furthermore, my personal experience with the Ribeye Spackle served as a prime exemplar of this phenomenon; although the dish itself proved satisfying, the cooking method employed by the chef deviated somewhat from my expectations, specifically regarding the degree of doneness. Admittedly, such inconsistencies may be attributable to isolated incidents or momentary lapses in execution. Be that as it may, the desserts, though undeniably delectable, seemed to carry an inflated price tag, exceeding twenty dollars apiece! In light of these observations, I feel compelled to recommend that ardent devotees of Halcyon consider a comparative analysis between this establishment and its neighboring counterpart, Harvest Moon Grille, in pursuit of a more comprehensive and satisfying dining experience.

After being exposed to copious acclaim regarding Pho Kim Long, I opted to experience it firsthand; and I must admit that my expectations were not thwarted.

The establishment boasts a considerable size, and we were promptly accommodated (albeit with the possibility of a brief delay, which was mitigated by their efficient seating process). The personnel were assiduous in their attention to our needs, and multiple individuals visited our table to ensure our satisfaction.

The menu proved to be impressive, surpassing my initial assumptions of a typical Pho restaurant. It encompassed a wide variety of options, including appetizers, Pho, entrees, smoothies, and numerous other selections.

I selected the #11 Rare Steak and Brisket Pho, complemented by an order of Chinese Doughnuts as an appetizer. However, my sole criticism concerned the doughnuts' lack of sweetness, as they customarily arrive coated in sugar. Nevertheless, I resourcefully utilized the leftover Peanut Sauce from my companion's spring rolls, transforming it into a delectable dish.

The food was served at an incredibly rapid pace, with the preliminary courses being satisfying, while the Pho itself stole the show. Both the steak and brisket exhibited tenderness and flavorfulness, accompanied by an abundance of noodles and a rich broth.

I shall unquestionably revisit this establishment!

True to the City of Sin's unwavering commitment to unapologetic hedonism and unbridled decadence, McCarran International Airport embodies the essence of Las Vegas' tawdry charm, its tainted aura permeating every crevice of the facility, much to the delight of those who revel in the city's unabashed licentiousness. Expeditious passage through security checkpoints, while hardly remarkable, does little to assuage the palpable animosity harbored by those tasked with ensuring the safety of the traveling masses, their perpetual irk underscored by the incessant stream of gripes and complaints that constitute the bulk of their interactions with the public. Against this backdrop, the import of personal belongings becomes trivial in the face of the existential futility inherent in such grievances, rendering the entire process an exercise in utter futility.

Been here twice now. Excellent service each time.
Also this is a great hotel for a convention since
that is what I came for. Very spacious convention
area. The room I had was very luxurious and very
relaxing after a day of training, schmoozing, and
cocktails. It's the type of room you can always
completely relax in - so much space. Can't really
comment on the price as I wasn't paying - but a
big thank you to my employer for footing the bill.
Would definitely do it all over again. Love the 
whole Venice theme. I like the casino here and the
restaurants as well. This is also just the right
part of the Strip to be in. Viva Las Vegas!

"The establishment boasts an exceptionally robust quality, offering an impressive array of expertly crafted cocktails, particularly those featuring tequila, which garner immense appreciation from connoisseurs. The menu showcases a harmonious fusion of traditional Latin American flavors with contemporary twists, resulting in delectable dishes such as duck empanadas that surpass expectations. The ambiance exudes a refined yet relaxed atmosphere, fostering an enjoyable experience further enhanced by the attentive and knowledgeable bar staff. Overall, this venue offers an unforgettable sojourn for those seeking a sophisticated, indulgent escape."

"In my opinion, this particular buffet stands out as one of the most exceptional dining experiences I have had the pleasure of indulging in. The diverse array of meats, including succulent lamb and mouthwatering prime rib, were cooked to perfection, and the sliders, which I typically find unimpressive, were surprisingly delectable. While the ramen and crab legs were merely satisfactory, the sheer scope of culinary options available at this buffet truly impressed me. Despite my general skepticism towards buffets, this one stands out as a remarkable exception."

"Optimizing physical fitness through a visit to a health club during the midday interval, I find myself perturbed by the sonic ambiance of the male changing area, which appears to be permeated by an excess of adolescent-oriented pop music that seems to be at odds with the testosterone-laden atmosphere that one might anticipate in such a space; indeed, it is my fervent hope that the management will consider alternative musical selections that are more germane to the masculine demographic that predominates in this particular facility."

My preferred venue for an economical Chinese meal along Harris Boulevard is a veritable haven for those seeking a satisfying repast at a reasonable price point. The cost of this gastronomic indulgence? A mere $5-$6, inclusive of a complimentary egg roll. While the tea provided gratis may occasionally possess a questionable flavor profile, the culinary delights themselves are anything but mediocre. Authentic chicken, a generous helping of vegetables, and sauces that strike the perfect balance between savory and saltiness all conspire to create a truly gratifying dining experience. However, it would be unwise to anticipate a truly authentic Cantonese or Szechuan culinary excursion, as this establishment tends towards Americanized Chinese cuisine. Nonetheless, the quality of the fare served in relation to the cost warrants a four-star rating.

This is a cool bar. It's relatively small inside, but it's a cool environment and there's a variety of places to sit - high top tables, bar seating, cushy chairs and couches, etc. \n\nI can only speak for the beverage selection, and it's pretty solid. Typical impressive beer selection evident in most Madison bars and decent drinks. I've heard great things about the food, especially the sandwiches and wraps... looking forward to eating here sometime soon!

Came here for the first time and loved it! For a lunch price of around $9, it was definitely worth it. Downsides include the semi-long wait and the crowded walkways with kids frantically running around. But hey, it adds to the buffet environment! With a chocolate fountain bar and a cotton candy machine, I would recommend anyone with a sweet tooth to stop by. Not to mention, there was a variety of food. Nothing fancy but nothing nasty either. For the price, why not give it a try?

"Excellent culinary discovery in the northern region! 

Fried Chicken - most delectable deep-fried poultry dish I have had the pleasure of consuming, with a generous serving size ideal for two individuals. 

Catfish - quite satisfying, albeit slightly lacking in quantity. 

Burgers - merely adequate, with a flavor profile reminiscent of a standard beef patty. The moniker 'Hamburger Hut' seems somewhat misleading, given the unremarkable quality of their burger offerings. Haha

This establishment functions as both a convenience store and an eatery, with a primary focus on the latter. Judging by the persistent bustle and consistent customer demand for their fried chicken, it appears that this venue has gained considerable popularity. 

Please note that parking facilities are restricted, accommodating only a maximum of seven vehicles."

It was an utter delight to witness your critique of this Eat'n Park, Darren, albeit not entirely unexpected given its propinquity to my former domicile and preferred watering hole, Wilkie's Inn, which unfortunately has ceased operations. Despite the prevalence of unsavory recollections stemming from inebriated acquaintances engaging in physical altercations and heated disputes within its confines, this eatery remains unparalleled in the aftermath of an evening spent imbibing at the aforementioned establishment. Mental images of scrambled eggs, French toast, and delectable burgers accompanied by a side of pickles continue to tantalize my taste buds, not to mention the irresistible Eat'n Park smiley face cookies that have captured my heart. I implore those unfamiliar with Pittsburgh's culinary treasures to indulge in a visit to this Eat'n Park or any other branch, as it is bound to leave an indelible mark on one's gastronomical experiences.

"An indulgent lodging establishment boasting an expansive recreational facility situated atop its structure, providing an unparalleled experience for thrill-seekers! My kin and I acquired accommodations at a remarkably reasonable rate (sub-$100), which, while not lavish, offered a diverse array of amenities. Although not a luxury establishment, it possessed a certain je ne sais quoi. The edifice featured multiple dining establishments and a rooftop aquatic venue (during my visit). The elevated swimming pool presented an unique opportunity for aquatic volleyball enthusiasts, while the observation deck afforded breathtaking vistas of the adjoining amusement park's pinnacle attraction. As guests of the hotel, we enjoyed complimentary access to this exclusive area, strategically positioned in close proximity to the renowned Las Vegas Strip."

This establishment boasts an ambiance that exudes a sense of cleanliness and welcoming charm, rendering it an ideal destination for both family and friend gatherings. My culinary exploits have led me to discover that the pizza served here is of remarkable quality, albeit not quite on par with the gastronomical masterpieces offered by renowned establishments such as Spinato's or Grimaldi's. Nonetheless, the thin crust and innovative topping of ground hamburger elevate it to a level that surpasses the standard fare typically associated with bars. Additionally, the premises are equipped with an array of entertainment options, including pool tables, shuffleboard, and numerous televisions, thereby creating an atmosphere conducive to lively social interactions. Aside from the delectable pizza, my affinity for focaccias has been gratified by the impressive offerings presented by this venue. Weekends, in particular, prove to be an optimal time to visit, as the excitement of sports games permeates the air.

To transported a second-generation iPad from my place of employment to their establishment for the purpose of rectifying an issue, specifically, the device was in need of a new protective glass surface, which was successfully replaced within a time frame of approximately six hours, at a total cost of one hundred twenty-nine dollars, inclusive of taxes, and although the ambiance of the store could be improved, I was generally content with the quality of the service and repair provided, furthermore, they offer a ninety-day guarantee on their work, which served as an additional source of assurance, and the location of the shop, situated directly off Mill Avenue, enabled me to easily park and quickly enter and exit the premises to deposit and collect the device.

If you have had the pleasure of dining at certain Asian buffets in Arizona and have enjoyed them, I would strongly recommend visiting Jasmine Tokyo. Upon entering the establishment, I, standing at 6'4\", often receive inquiries regarding my athletic pursuits, specifically with the query, "Do you play for the Cardinals?" The proprietors' initial apprehension is understandable, given my stature, but rest assured, I am not a gluttonous individual. My primary motivation for visiting this eatery is to indulge in their seafood, sushi, and green tea offerings.  

Upon perusing the menu, I was thoroughly impressed with the vast array of sushi options available. With at least twenty distinct varieties of rolls, the selection surpasses any other all-you-can-eat (AYCE) establishment in the Valley that I have had the pleasure of visiting. What truly sets Jasmine Tokyo apart is the inclusion of authentic seafood such as tuna, salmon, and snapper nigiri, which were exceptionally fresh and flavorful.  

In addition to the delectable sushi, the fried rice, Chinese sausages, and grilled chicken are also culinary masterpieces. Even the raw oysters, which I have never particularly enjoyed in Arizona before, were surprisingly palatable.  

The service at Jasmine Tokyo was warm and welcoming, and the ambiance, reminiscent of a former Claim Jumper, added to the overall dining experience. Notably, this restaurant boasts an extensive selection of dishes, making it an ideal destination for vegetarians, who will undoubtedly revel in the abundance of plant-based options. Incidentally, I believe seaweed qualifies as a vegetable, does it not?

ah, Bouchon.  So many people talk about this place but I had never been.  First, it's in a ridiculous location as others have noted.  Everyone else's reviews are very poor in their direction.  I think someone said that it's in the southwest area of the Venetian.  Ok. Who the F**k  has a compass in the F**king casino???    It's by the registration lobby.  That simple.  Take the elevators up and you are there.

There was a small wait for the brunch.  The brunch menu is basically the same as the breakfast (with a few additions).  So. . . .

Chicken and Waffles.  - Glorious.  The waffles have bits of bacon in them and they are amazing.  The Chicken is roasted and not fried.  I have to think that it is better this way because I can't imagine this dish being beat by any restaurant.  You must get this.

French Toast - Looks great but it's not that impressive.  You should try something else.  

Ambiance - I think the restaurant loses a star here.  The decor is dated and the tables too crowded.  There were a couple of single old men sitting by themselves on the small tables and whenever they coughed, I cringed.  Who knows what germs they caught from their respective escorts last night?  

I still highly recommend, even just for the chicken and waffles.

"The superior quality of their coffee notwithstanding, my experience at this establishment was further enhanced by the welcoming demeanor of the staff and the inviting ambiance within. While I must admit that the cost of their offerings is somewhat prohibitive, my primary grievance lies in the absence of elevated seating options for young children. Notwithstanding this oversight, I am content to patronize this business and shall unquestionably return in the future."

"A symposium of culinary indulgence ensued at this esteemed eatery, whereupon we partook in a delectable morning repast, characterized by an ambiance of refined sophistication and unwavering attention to detail. Strategically positioned near a panoramic window, our table afforded a picturesque view of the surrounding landscape, further enhancing the gastronomical experience. A thoughtful touch, indeed, was the presence of a diminutive stool designed specifically for housing feminine accessories, its charm and whimsy serving as a testament to the establishment's commitment to excellence in all aspects of hospitality. My gustatory inclinations leaned toward the savory duck hash and eggs, a dish that did not disappoint in terms of flavor or presentation, although the fluffy pancakes beckoned seductively from their nearby perch. In essence, Tableau epitomizes a harmonious blend of elegance, sophistication, and relaxed conviviality, fostering an atmosphere conducive to both formal and informal gatherings alike."

"While indulging in the extravagance of a Las Vegas sojourn, I opted to immerse myself in the opulent ambiance of the NY NY hotel, whereupon I discovered that the establishment boasted an impressive array of amenities and facilities that rivaled those of a mini metropolis. The casino, being one of the more spacious and well-appointed in the city, offered an abundance of gaming options, ranging from traditional table games to state-of-the-art slot machines. Furthermore, the culinary offerings at NY NY were nothing short of exceptional, catering to a wide range of tastes and budgets, from modestly priced fare to exquisite gourmet experiences.  

During my stay, I had the pleasure of occupying a luxurious room on the 32nd floor of the Century Tower, affording breathtaking panoramic views of the iconic Las Vegas Strip and surrounding mountains. The accommodations themselves were both commodious and stylish, providing ample space for three individuals to unwind without feeling encroached upon. Although certain aspects of the room's decor appeared slightly dated, the overall quality and cleanliness of the amenities left little to be desired. Notably, the bathroom featured a separate area for grooming, complete with dual sinks, and the shower boasted high-end fixtures that delivered an abundance of hot water in short order.  

In conclusion, my experience at NY NY was thoroughly enjoyable, and I would highly recommend it to anyone seeking a unique blend of luxury, convenience, and entertainment in the heart of Las Vegas."

"It is utterly inconceivable to encounter an unsatisfactory culinary experience at Cheba Hut, as the victuals served are invariably scrumptious and the sandwiches are meticulously grilled to a golden brown perfection, thereby eliciting an unwavering craving for a repeat visit, particularly among novice patrons who have yet to partake in the establishment's gastronomical offerings."

first spot me and my gf decided to go when we arrived in vegas.  i was really dressed down, as a matter of fact the only person in the place dressed down.  But still, did the hostess have to look at me like i was a scrub?  cmon, you're a hostess in vegas, probably hoping some rich guy knocks you up.  anyways, the place was crackin, like most spots in vegas.  very nice, upscale place.  the food was great, the best salmon sashimi ive ever had.  i couldnt stop thinking about it 2 days later.  they set a new standard for myself when it comes to salmon.  id also reccomend the baked lobster.  prices are really steep, so if your taking someone here, i hope you get some action afterwards.  minus the snobby hostess, and i would have gave this place 5 stars.

"In terms of culinary offerings within the confines of the aforementioned eatery, it is our considered opinion that the so-called 'blueplate specials' merit unreserved endorsement, particularly when considering their pecuniary appeal; these delectable delights are available at a most reasonable tariff of eight dollars per person, an amount which includes access to both the soup and salad bar, the latter of which boasts an array of fresh fruits, thereby rendering it a veritable cornucopia of gastronomic delight; furthermore, we have found it advisable to partake of the soup and salad bar in moderation, given the generous proportions thereof, and subsequently transport the entree to one's domicile for consumption at a later juncture; it is important to note, however, that the ambiance of the establishment in question does not necessarily conform to the standards of high-end resorts such as the Wynn, owing to its status as a humble, albeit well-frequented, locals' casino with somewhat dated decor; nevertheless, the staff maintains a warm and welcoming demeanor, and patrons may rest assured that the quality of the comestibles served will remain consistently high, while the prices remain refreshingly affordable; incidentally, it is worth mentioning that a diverse selection of desserts is offered at a special price of two dollars per portion on a monthly basis."

"The culinary experience was satisfactory, but the service was somewhat eccentric.
