Specifically, the protocol for placing orders was unconventional, as we were required to do so through the waitstaff rather than directly communicating with the sushi artisan. Furthermore, upon ordering three rolls and additional sushi items, we anticipated that the latter would arrive prior to the former; however, the rolls were served first, and the sushi was inadvertently overlooked until we brought it to the attention of the staff. Notwithstanding this oversight, the quality of the seafood was impressive, as each dish demonstrated freshness and lacked any discernible trace of fishiness. We shall return, and their all-you-can-eat option, featuring an extensive array of choices, presents an excellent value."

When the admission is complimentary, every aspect of the experience appears significantly enhanced. We had the opportunity to partake in one of the evenings featuring LMFAO, and it was truly remarkable. What an exceptional manner in which to conclude a Las Vegas excursion. I thoroughly enjoyed the distinct ambiance of each chamber, particularly the bibliotheca where one can savor a beverage without the inconvenience of jostling elbows. Although my preference remains with the layout of XS, it is invariably fascinating to witness the creators of these opulent nightclubs stretch the limits of inventiveness and, above all, furnish revelers with an exceptional festive environment.

If you have an inclination towards seafood, then an excursion to Boardwalk Billy's is imperative. My preference from their extensive menu is the steampot, which boasts a delectable broth, and I request additional shrimp in lieu of oysters. The portion is generous and includes potatoes and corn, rendering it a comprehensive meal. Additionally, I have sampled their clam chowder, which is utterly delightful! We opt to visit on Thursday evenings, as it coincides with their trivia night and offers a plethora of beverages at a mere $2. Even the most exceptional local drafts are available for this nominal price. The service at the Galleria location is consistently efficient and cordial. However, I must deduct a star due to the subpar quality of their burgers. It is advisable to adhere to their seafood and wing offerings to avoid disappointment.

"Savory culinary delights and hospitable personnel have been the hallmark of this establishment for several years, and I have had the pleasure of partaking in their delectable offerings within my financial means, despite a recent upward trend in pricing."

We found this little hole in the wall by accident. We were in the area looking for something to eat and saw the sign Chicago Gyros. It is a small restaurant that is family run. I had my standard order of a Gyro and fries. The gyro was delicious. It was overstuffed with meat and fillings. They generally don't fill me up but this one did. The fries were your standard fast food type of fries, they were hot and they were crispy. I don't go for gyros worrying about the fries. The owner and I believe his daughter were very friendly and helpful with the orders. The food was served quickly and was the right temperature. I enjoy dealing with locally owned places and this is one I will be returning to.

I was surprised by the generous portions of lettuce with that came with my order of spring rolls.  Attentive and quick service.  Never had a problem flagging down one of the 4 servers on duty.  An all around good experience.  The first pho I've had in Vegas.  While not the best broth I've ever tasted, it wasn't disappointing.

I used to be a regular patron of this establishment when it was still operating under the name of Starbucks. Upon learning that it had been reopened as a bakery, my curiosity was piqued, and I made numerous attempts to visit, albeit unsuccessfully due to their unconventional and sporadic hours of operation. It is advisable to telephone ahead, disregarding any information provided by Yelp, prior to embarking on a journey to this location. On a recent visit, specifically on my niece's birthday, I was immediately captivated by their "stuffed cookies," which, much to my delight, were filled with an array of delectable ingredients such as Oreos, cheesecake, Snickers, and butterscotch. Additionally, they offered an extensive selection of cake pops in diverse and intriguing flavors, including Nerds Rainbow, orange cream, cheesecake, and red velvet. Furthermore, there were a limited number of caramel and candy apples available, as well as gigantic chocolate-dipped marshmallows. The quality of service was satisfactory, and the prices were reasonable. My sole grievance lies in their unorthodox and unpredictable schedule, which hinders my eagerness to revisit this establishment.

I know this is a chain, and I normally abhor and avoid chains, but I really liked this place.  The beer was excellent, the servers were very polite and attentive (Everybody speaks English) and the food was way above average.  First time we went I had a flammekuchen with Gruyere and smoked meat with a slice of dill pickle on every quarter.  Excellent!  My wife had the vegetable version which was great as well.  Second visit I had a meat dish with ham, pork knuckle, sausage and an excellent sauerkraut.  Very, very good.  We had a great time watching the Canadiens at the bar after the meal.  Overall I would highly recommend this place, at least one visit to sample their beers which are a cut above your average brew pub.

"Amidst an ambiance characterized by a subtle and understated elegance, patrons can indulge in a culinary experience that is both tantalizing and affordable on Mondays, whereupon the purchase of a $3 beverage, they may obtain a delectable burger for the remarkably reasonable sum of $5, constituting a veritable bargain that is unlikely to be encountered elsewhere."

I'm not really masterfully adept at recognising a good Indian: my weak British mouth can't handle the chilli and often leaves an unshakeable burning sensation for the rest my meal, ultimately ensuring I can't make head or foot of what I'm eating.

Deciding to man up and re-kindle my Indian food knowledge I opted for the BBC's kashmiri curry with a liberal dose of Cobra beer.  Much to my surprise I found I could recognise each flavour rather than  sweating the spices away and subsequently had an enjoyable meal.

Reasonably priced and with a cool name, I'll be back again.

"Savor succulent sashimi and an abundance of rolls infused with piquant flavors, as I possess an unwavering predilection for rolls imbued with fiery heat, and Sushi Fever boasts an impressive array of such dishes showcasing a harmonious fusion of tuna and salmon. Furthermore, the establishment features a spacious and stylish sitting area to the left of the entrance, complete with a colossal high-definition television, providing a welcome diversion for patrons who, like myself, derive pleasure from diversions beyond ceramic felines and traditional Japanese ornamentation."

"Aaron, your proficiency in customer service is truly commendable, and I must say that the brunette bartender also demonstrated an impressive level of hospitality. Although the colossal portion of nachos presented a formidable challenge that momentarily undermined my confidence, I shall assuredly bring reinforcements on my subsequent visit. Furthermore, I had the pleasure of encountering a few friendly individuals, including Greg and Mariam from California, and Mark from New Mexico. I sincerely hope that you will reciprocate by bestowing a favorable evaluation upon this establishment."

"Yummo! Authentic Cuban culinary delights abound at this establishment, particularly in the form of delectable sandwiches and pastries that exude an unparalleled level of flavorful excellence. The breakfast offerings, specifically the omelet, are a prime example of the kitchen's commitment to gastronomic mastery, boasting an impressive balance of taste, texture, and satisfying fulfillment that belies its humble price point. Furthermore, the opportunity to indulge in Ironbeer and Materva, beverages that are typically reserved for Cuban eateries, adds an extra layer of excitement to the dining experience. As we were on a road trip back to Los Angeles, we opted to procure some delightful pastries for the journey, which proved to be a wise decision given their exceptional quality. While this venue may draw comparisons to Portos, it is important to note that it maintains its own unique identity and does not replicate the same level of crowd enthusiasm, much to our relief. Although the variety of pastries may not be as extensive, each item is crafted with equal attention to detail and dedication to culinary artistry."

I have had the privilege of inhabiting this resplendent abode for a trifling three years, during which time I have been continually impressed by its unwavering ability to captivate my senses and inspire my spirit. Despite certain drawbacks, such as an occasionally problematic parking situation and an aural assault perpetrated by the raucous revelry of rowdy revellers, I remain steadfast in my decision to designate this magnificent edifice as my humble domicile. The aesthetic appeal of this structure is simply stunning, with each carefully crafted aspect serving to enhance the overall visual experience. Moreover, the ambiance fostered by the harmonious convergence of sleek lines, tasteful colour schemes, and strategically placed greenery, serves to create an atmosphere that is at once both tranquil and invigorating. It is little wonder, then, that I have been able to establish lasting connections with a diverse array of similarly discerning individuals who share my appreciation for the finer things in life. In light of these factors, I felt compelled to bestow upon this esteemed residence a rating of four stars, as it falls ever so slightly short of perfection. Nonetheless, I would highly recommend Optima to anyone seeking a truly exceptional place to call home, as it embodies the very essence of luxury living. My enthusiasm for this magnificent complex is further fueled by the impending completion of Optima Sonoran Village, a sister property that promises to offer an identical standard of excellence.

The occurrence of my presence at a gathering transpired within the parameters of Caesars Palace during the month of May, precipitating my attendance at said event. Preceding this particular visit, I had indulged in numerous excursions to the aforementioned establishment, yet had not availed myself of the opportunity to partake in the hospitality extended by the hotel's accommodations. Subsequently, we were assigned lodgings in the Octavius Tower, which afforded us commodious quarters, characterized by plush sleeping surfaces, well-appointed bathing facilities, and panoramic vistas that proved to be truly captivating.

Only on a singular occasion have I had the privilege of partaking in a culinary excursion to this esteemed establishment, yet it is safe to assert that my experience was indeed superior to the average patron's. My order consisted of a half pound JalapeÃ±o Jack burger, complemented by a side of onion rings. The burger itself boasted a flawless synergy of spices, utilizing premium quality meat sourced from Midwestern pastures, and a flavorful cheese that harmonized seamlessly with the other ingredients. The onion rings, though perhaps not the primary focus of my repast, were equally impressive in both texture and taste. While the portion sizes were generous, leaving me thoroughly satiated, I must admit that the total cost of my meal, amounting to $11 and change, seemed somewhat excessive for an unpretentious, no-frills eatery catering primarily to those seeking a hasty, post-work or post-event nourishment. This minor drawback, however, did not detract significantly from my overall satisfaction with the burger, which I would unhesitatingly recommend to others.

This establishment evokes memories of the Italian eatery, Pompeii, located in Chicago, where my roommate and I frequently partook in their culinary offerings via carry-out orders. Interestingly, my visit to Phoenix coincided with my acquaintance's inclination to procure sustenance from this very venue, prompting me to diverge from our customary selections and sample their Salami, Turkey, Ham, and Mozzarella panini, which was complemented by a delectable red wine vinaigrette that greatly enhanced its flavor profile. A cursory examination of the ingredients revealed an emphasis on freshness and meticulous preparation, while the prices, though comparable to those in Chicago, remained uncertain in relation to local standards. My curiosity piqued, I would eagerly explore additional menu options at this venue.
Great build your own burgers, crazy servings of fries. Always hot and fresh and cooked and topped to your order.

"It would be a fallacious statement to assert that I have never had the pleasure of visiting this establishment, for indeed, my experiences here have been numerous and gratifying. While it may not rival the grandeur of certain Canadian clubs, it unquestionably surpasses its local counterparts in terms of quality and overall satisfaction."

This place has one of my all-time FAVORITE Asian dishes - the Thai Spicy Noodles. Yeah, generic sounding as heck but it's really thin noodles with woked chicken & shrimp, scallions, egg, cabbage and I can't remember what else, with Thai spice. Squeeze a huge wedge of lemon over it and I'm in heaven. One order is enough to feed me, my hubby and our teen daughter, but we usually get two... it's sooo tasty when it's cold. Breakfast of champions. Their honey chicken is really good, in fact I can't think of any dish that we have not liked. Their appetizers are yummy, and they do both spring and egg rolls. That's handy for a family of mixed disciples. :) \n\nThe service is always very smiley and friendly, and there's never been a wait. Totally good Asian food for a very decent price, in a clean restaurant. What more could you want??

"Hyde's ambiance aligns with its namesake, presenting an ideal setting for an intimate encounter with a significant other, although patrons would be wise to remain vigilant lest they become preoccupied with the captivating physical appearance of the establishment's servers, as the delectable offerings from the kitchen may momentarily take a backseat to the visually striking staff; the culinary selections, particularly the fried calamari, boast an unparalleled crispiness that nearly results in an explosive sensory experience upon consumption, and the meticulous seasoning enhances the flavors without overpowering the delicate palate; however, the wine list, while impressive in quality, comes at a premium price point, and the absence of complimentary refills for soft drinks results in a notable increase in cost, making it the most expensive soda option in Las Vegas."

"Wow, this establishment appears to be quite extensive in its layout, with numerous sections and areas that seem to stretch out endlessly, almost like a labyrinthine maze designed to tantalize and confound one's senses. It's truly impressive, and I must admit that I haven't had the pleasure of exploring every nook and cranny of this vast space, despite my best efforts to do so. There are multiple levels, each boasting its own unique charm and allure, with upstairs rooms that offer an air of exclusivity and privacy for those seeking a more intimate experience. The staff here is incredibly friendly and welcoming, and while some might attribute their warm demeanor to my gender, I would argue that it's simply a result of their inherent kindness and dedication to providing exceptional customer service. Indeed, the performers themselves exude an aura of warmth and approachability, making them feel less like'strippers' and more like gracious hosts who just happen to possess a certain je ne sais quoi that sets them apart from the average individual. They are, in short, a true delight to behold, and their pleasant scent only serves to enhance the overall ambiance of the club."

I just stayed two nights at Aria. It is a great hotel...my company paid for it, which is great because I would never spend that kind of money...and the rooms aren't even the worse of it!! ONE drink at the pool will set you back a hefty sum...which I can't repeat here...just know, it's probably the most expensive on the strip.
We didn't get the chocolates or a turn down service that some other reviewers have mentioned, that's ok..most everything was wonderful.  I was dismayed a bit  at the bath products...a lower end brand, and of definitely lower end quality. 
The restaurants were all really good that we ate at...the Thai place was as good, if not better, than any I've been to in the US.  The casino was nice, not too smokey, and the servers were pretty quick. 
The pool was nice, a few good choices...one that was more adult orientated, so not a bunch of kids having a great time...not something I look for in a relaxing pool day. As usual...I always wish there was more shade and/or umbrellas..but all in all..a great pool experience. 
All in all, a great place, although pricey..that's expected.

"As one of the contemporary establishments situated along the famed Las Vegas Strip, this hotel boasts a sleek, modernistic motif that permeates its entirety. 

PROS -
+ An atmosphere of tranquility and refinement pervades the resort, fostering a sense of relaxation and serenity for its patrons. 
+ Immaculately maintained facilities, including a pristine swimming pool, spotless guest rooms, and immaculate corridors, contribute to an overall ambiance of elegance. 
+ The accommodations themselves are equipped with a host of cutting-edge amenities, such as an electric mini-stove, refrigerator, microwave, dining table, supremely comfortable bed, et cetera, all of which serve to enhance the overall experience of the guests. 
+ The hospitality of the staff is unparalleled, as they exude warmth, cordiality, and a genuine desire to ensure the comfort and satisfaction of their clientele. 


CONS -
- This particular lodging may not be the optimal choice for individuals celebrating a significant milestone, such as a 21st birthday, with a group of friends, as the atmosphere may not align with the anticipated level of revelry and joviality associated with such an occasion. (IE - minimalist attire, alcoholic beverages, and unsteady gait may elicit disapproving glances from other guests.)"

"Culinary-wise, this establishment merits a rating of 2.5 to 3 stars at most; however, the ambiance and coffee compensate for the fourth star. Allow me to initiate my critique with the culinary offerings. For those unfamiliar with genuine Spanish cuisine, the dishes will likely impress; otherwise, seasoned aficionados may find them lacking. 

The olives presented an agreeable taste sensation. 

The shrimp dish, specifically the gambas al pil pil, proved satisfactory. 

The traditional paella, while flavorsome, deviated from the customary preparation method, featuring an unusual rice texture and an overpowering creaminess. Nonetheless, the subtle saffron undertones and the presence of chorizo contributed a gratifying experience. 

The tortilla, though slightly burnt and dry, maintained an acceptable level of quality. 

The wine list, regrettably, does not showcase an adequate representation of Spanish varieties, which seems incongruous considering the restaurant's Iberian theme. Only two options, a Rivera del Duero and a Rioja, are available. Surely, a greater emphasis on Spanish wines would enhance the overall experience. 

However, the coffee selection boasts an impressive array, including both cold brew and kopi luwak. Their coffee-related accessories also deserve mention as a unique highlight. Just be aware that potent coffee blends may pose a challenge for the caffeine-sensitive patron. 

In conclusion, while the food did not fully meet expectations, the atmosphere and coffee redeem the establishment, warranting a return visit to sample their coffee and potentially discover 'cafe bombon,' a Spanish classic, on the menu."

Whenever I reflect upon Richardson's, a profound sense of warmth and comfort permeates my being. Having had the pleasure of partaking in numerous culinary excursions within its walls, I can confidently attest to the captivating ambiance that pervades this quaint, inconspicuous urban gem.

The 'Cuisine of New Mexico', characterized by a distinctive fusion of flavors and ingredients, boasts an unparalleled uniqueness; among their renowned offerings, the green chile potato and an array of pork dishes hold pride of place. As a pescatarian, I tend to gravitate towards the fish or seafood specials, which are artfully presented alongside a thoughtfully curated standard menu, complemented by an assortment of daily specials inscribed on chalkboards dispersed throughout the restaurant.

During my most recent visit, I relished the blackened scallop appetizer as my entrÃ©e, accompanied by a generous house salad. While the scallops exhibited a slight saltiness, their texture was cooked to perfection, and they were served atop a crispy tortilla, accompanied by a medley of rice, beans, and a spicy sauce that added a delightful zest to the dish. The salads, in particular, prove to be a highlight, with many of the entrÃ©e specials thoughtfully paired with a starter salad. In the company of four fellow diners, we opted to share a bottle of wine and a plain pizza as an appetizer, rendering dessert an afterthought, as none of us could muster the requisite capacity to indulge in anything further.

To avoid any unnecessary waiting, it is advisable to secure a reservation in advance. However, should you find yourself waiting, take advantage of the opportunity to situate yourself at the bar or near the fireplace; with a refreshing beverage in hand and surrounded by the warm, inviting aroma of the fire mingling with the savory scents of the kitchen, any perceived delay quickly dissipates amidst the convivial atmosphere. My affection for Richardson's remains steadfast, and I eagerly anticipate my next visit.

"If your quest for culinary satisfaction does not direct your attention towards this inconspicuous location, situated within a nondescript strip mall, you may unwittingly overlook it. My companion, Elite Emily, and I had the privilege of partaking in an exploratory venture throughout Henderson, which led us to this unassuming eatery. Upon entering, we discovered that the establishment was remarkably devoid of patrons, with the exception of ourselves. The portions of food, however, were quite generous, necessitating the request for a container to transport the surplus back to my abode. The quality of the cuisine was indeed impressive, leaving me eager to return and sample additional menu items."

"The young male individual, who typically does not derive pleasure from visiting institutions dedicated to the preservation and exhibition of artistic, cultural, or scientific artifacts, experienced an unusual sense of enjoyment during his visit to this particular establishment, which boasted an extensive collection of historically significant and provocative sexual instruments, as well as various multimedia presentations, live demonstrations, and an array of captivating objects that catered to diverse interests and preferences associated with human sexuality, thereby offering a comprehensive and engaging exploration of the subject matter, further enhanced by the presence of knowledgeable and unobtrusive staff members, who contributed to a welcoming atmosphere that encouraged repeat visits."

I arrived at this esteemed establishment on a Sunday, thereby obviating the necessity for a prior reservation. And let me tell you, this place truly is the apogee of culinary excellence, exuding an ambiance that is at once both convivial and sophisticated. The olfactory sensations that permeate the air are nothing short of captivating, while the visually appealing decor and well-appointed furnishings lend an air of elegance to the proceedings. The waiting staff, too, are deserving of commendation, their proficiency and hospitality being of the highest order. Upon divulging my dietary restrictions, the chef de cuisine himself kindly took the time to expound upon the various dishes that were already suitable for a vegan palate, in addition to those that could be easily adapted to meet my requirements. It transpired that a considerable number of sauces employed in the culinary process contained fish or oyster sauce, a fact that had hitherto escaped my notice. Suffice it to say that I wholeheartedly endorse this restaurant, and eagerly anticipate my next visit, when I shall most certainly indulge in the delectable green curry accompanied by tofu - a veritable gustatory delight, I have no doubt.

I have visited on a couple occasions and really enjoyed it each time. Our last visit was with some family and friends in town visiting and everyone left more than satisfied. 

If you're looking for unique, well-made cocktails then this is a must visit. They have broken down the various drinks by historical time period and the menu provides a little description of how the drink got its name. 

Almost everyone took advantage of the happy hour, half price steaks. One of the filets was a bit under-cooked, but for the most part they were spot on. All the sides we ordered were great, but the truffle mac and cheese was a table favorite. I can't say enough about the "Farmer" flat bread pizza - bacon, spinach, and a cracked egg. This is something you just have to try in order to understand how delicious it really is. 

Dessert was almost certainly out of the question until the server started to describe them. We ordered their version of the pizooki as well as the homemade doughnuts. The entire table thought they had died and gone to heaven after finishing these desserts. Save room!

Another satisfying and enjoyable experience. Great food, solid drinks and a unique atmosphere away from the hustle and bustle of the touristy Strip.
Nice, big patio to enjoy a conversation and catch up with friends. The inside was clean and service was nice. All the pastries looked especially tasty at this location. Nice job.

During one hot spring day in Chinatown I was STARVING (as always, my metabolism  is ridiculous). Tired of my usual Thai Food fix and wanting to seek something new I find HSP on Yelp. 

Initial reaction: HOLYSH!T did this just open!? 

Turns out its located towards the end of the Chinatown Plaza extension on Wynn Rd and Spring Mountain. The lady working told me they've actually been opened for 5 years! I seriously felt like I have been living in a pineapple on the bottom of the sea. I bear crawl my hunger self to there and in front of me was a small shop with smallish quantities of various poke! it must be a good sign that there are small quantities of the poke to maintain the fish freshness. No old poke, yay! I'm not from Hawaii, an islander, or have lived anywhere with fresh off the coast fish, BUT usually I can taste fish funk. In my Shoyu Limu Tuna bowl I had no funk, only delicious fresh poke and warm rice sprinkled with black sesame seeds and only $8ish!

Excited to come back and try more.

My pre-adolescent male progeny enjoyed themselves immensely, despite the somewhat exorbitant cost and the fact that the ambiance was not particularly conducive to tranquility. However, the Wi-Fi connectivity left much to be desired, and the culinary offerings were not only overpriced but also lacking in gastronomic quality. Specifically, a relatively diminutive iced latte commanded a price of nearly five dollars, which seemed rather steep considering its diminutive stature. Furthermore, the absence of any complimentary refreshments or amenities for adult patrons was a notable omission, especially given the already prohibitive cost of admission. On the other hand, all of the various diversions and amusements were in excellent working order, which was certainly a positive aspect of our visit.

I have been frequenting this establishment since the middle of the 1980s, and I must say that it has maintained a remarkable level of consistency throughout the years. At first glance, this may appear to be a humble, unassuming curry house, devoid of any pretenses of refined dining. However, upon closer inspection, one will discover that it offers an array of delectable and reasonably priced culinary options, accompanied by an attentive and hospitable service staff. On a cold winter's evening, as the biting winds whip through Bruntsfield Place, there is little more comforting than forcing one's way through the double doors and into the welcoming warmth and enticing aroma of exotic Indian spices that permeate the atmosphere within. A word of caution, however, regarding the naan bread: it is only available in massive, generous portions, suitable for feeding a small army, so be prepared to share or risk facing the consequences of overindulgence.

"It is imperative that I deduct a star due to the prolonged waiting period for the outdoor seating area, despite our repeated visits to this establishment, which has led me to infer that the patio does not accept reservations. A delay of one and a half hours at 5:30 PM is somewhat absurd, considering the reputation of this restaurant. However, it is worth noting that the culinary offerings are consistently exceptional, with my personal preference being a succulent steak, while my spouse favors either the skate or a hearty portion of slow-cooked short ribs. It is also worth mentioning that we have never encountered an unpleasant server or subpar dish during our visits. In conclusion, if you wish to partake in the ambiance of the patio, which offers unparalleled people-watching opportunities, it is advisable to anticipate a delay. Unfortunately, the current system in place does not allow for timely notification via text message when a table becomes available, which can be inconvenient given the limited range of the sensors within the casino. Nonetheless, the quality of the cuisine makes the wait worthwhile."

"Prior to this experience, my exposure to live performances had been limited, with neither a Cirque de Soleil production nor any other theatrical presentation in Las Vegas having been part of my repertoire. Consequently, my attendance at this particular show served as an inaugural encounter of its kind for me, which, to my delight, transpired to be a thoroughly captivating and enjoyable affair. The musicians' virtuosity was undeniably evident throughout the performance, while the dancers' vivacity and dynamism infused the production with an unmistakable vitality. Moreover, the acrobats' displays of physical prowess and artistry left me in a state of utter amazement. It is worth mentioning that our admission to the event was complimentary, which, needless to say, contributed significantly to the overall satisfaction we derived from the experience."

We ordered the lobster and shrimp dip. We had to send it back twice because it was too cheeseeeee.. yes!! The chips kept breaking whenever we dipped it in the sauce because the cheese made it to heavy. They ended up taking it off the bill. We then tried the parmesan chicken and bake potato. It was gooood!!! It was enough for two to share.
Great find!  Visiting from DC and loved the unique take on menu!  Witty and original.  The food was excellent! Can't say enough about the pierogi sliders and the eggplant lasagna!!

This is  a great little deli with a large menu.  Breakfast is available, fried eggs, potatoes etc. that is unusual for a place like this.  Not sure it is all that authentic but they have hot pastrami and corned beef.  Product seems to be above average but what really made me decide to make a return trip was the service.  Very friendly and helpful.   Seems to be a popular place.

My spouse and I indulged in an evening of artistic exploration, characterized by an unparalleled level of enjoyment, under the guidance of an individual named Melissa, whose vivacity and warmth permeated the atmosphere, albeit with a slight lack of clarity in her explanations, yet compensating for this deficiency by affording us ample time to execute each stage of the creative process. An exemplary work of art, suspended from the ceiling, served as a point of reference, allowing us to appreciate its beauty and complexity. Beverages, priced at five dollars for a glass of beer and seven dollars for a glass of wine, were available for purchase, with the added bonus of a fifty percent discount during the final hour of the session. As we had satiated our hunger prior to attending, I did not have the opportunity to sample the culinary offerings, although it appeared that many participants availed themselves of the brief respite afforded during the middle of the class to partake of various hors d'oeuvres. This unique experience, which I wholeheartedly endorse, is certain to be repeated in the future, and I would enthusiastically recommend it to any individual seeking an engaging and distinctive diversion.
If u come here on grave until 7am ask for Joy...great server....having saimin and Portuguese Sausage and scramble eggs....of course with rice... ono after a night out.

"The culinary offerings at this establishment are of an exceptionally high quality, boasting an authenticity that is unparalleled in its genre. The piquant flavors, as suggested by the moniker, are truly palpable and evoke a profound sense of satisfaction. So much so, that we felt compelled to partake in their delectable fare on two separate occasions during our brief sojourn in Las Vegas, and both experiences left us feeling utterly content."

It is indeed high time that Summerlin boasts a respectable public house, bar, or tavernâwhatever nomenclature one might opt forâand it is gratifying to observe that such an establishment has finally been instituted. The personnel at this venue are remarkably hospitable, exhibiting an attentive demeanor without being excessively intrusive. The culinary offerings are quite delectable, particularly the chicken sandwich, which constitutes a veritable explosion of flavors. The waitstaff has divulged that patrons can request the chicken sandwich to be served as a wrap, an option that is not explicitly listed on the menu. This revelation precipitates our profound gratitude.

However, there are certain aspects that warrant mentioning. Firstly, for those who partake in the practice of checking in on review websites, it is worth noting that doing so will reward them with a complimentary shot of the establishment's signature whiskey. Unfortunately, this particular elixir is not especially palatable, bearing a strong resemblance to a medicinal concoction such as Triaminic cold and cough medicine. Thus, it is advisable to exercise caution when indulging in this particular promotion.

Furthermore, the design of the bathroom sinks leaves much to be desired. The decision to implement a slightly tilted slab of tile as a sink is, quite frankly, baffling. Such a configuration not only hinders the effective containment of water but also generates an unfortunate propensity for splashing, thereby endangering the integrity of one's attire. It is our fervent hope that management will consider replacing these questionable sink designs with more traditional basins, thereby ensuring a more pleasant experience for all patrons.

In conclusion, this establishment offers ample space for socializing, a convivial atmosphere, and delectable victuals. While certain aspects may benefit from revision, the overall quality of this pub/bar/hang-out/tavern remains undeniable.

"We have had the pleasure of dining at this esteemed establishment on three separate occasions, and we can confidently assert that it offers one of the most exceptional buffet experiences for both local patrons and visiting gastronomes alike. The prime rib, in particular, has consistently impressed us with its flawless preparation, and we highly recommend requesting a thicker cut from the accommodating staff. The succulent crab legs, which are freshly procured on each occasion, are also worthy of mention, as are the diverse varieties of shrimp available. While the Mexican cuisine may benefit from some refinement, the abundance of delectable Asian options and the unwavering quality of the American fare more than compensate for any perceived shortcomings. Furthermore, the assortment of sweet treats, including numerous sugar-free selections, is truly impressive. Lastly, we must commend the servers for their unwavering professionalism and warm hospitality, which has greatly enhanced our dining experience on each visit."

"This quaint, family-operated eatery boasts an impressive array of delectable bagels, complemented by exceptional customer service. The extensive breakfast and lunch menus cater to diverse palates, and the accommodating kitchen staff readily fulfills special dietary requests with alacrity."

With moving to the other side of town, it was nice to find a new sushi spot near by. Service and rolls are great. Plus, they have a great happy hour that has options of 4-8 pieces. It gives you the option to try a lot of different rolls. All in all, it's a nice little spot and I've loved everything I've tried. Nice place as my last one was I Love Sushi.

"Exquisite vino and delectable bruschetta, particularly the pomaceous variety. Enjoyed lively melodies performed by a talented musician during my visit. However, an outdoor fire pit would greatly enhance the ambiance of this otherwise exceptional wine bar, as the existing atmosphere is somewhat lacking in vivacity and necessitates further enlivenment."

They always take the time with my kids and are very good.  Sometimes they have a waiting list and often are booked up....so I recommend calling ahead to make an appointment.  But it is very worth it as the results speak for themselves.

"My sentiments regarding this pizza are ones of profound admiration, specifically pertaining to the judicious blend of mozzarella and provolone cheese, wherein the latter is incorporated in a manner that enhances, rather than overpowers, the former, thereby creating a culinary experience that is truly exceptional; additionally, the service we received was of an impressively high quality, such that it served to further elevate our dining experience; it is worth noting, however, that my previous experiences at this establishment have been somewhat inconsistent, with periods of disappointment interspersed among moments of satisfaction, but on this particular occasion, they demonstrated a commendable level of competence and dedication to their craft."

Great place to go for family horseback rides. I  really liked the set up and the ease with which they do paperwork, riding prep etc. They desert in north Scottsdale is beautiful this time aof year and the grounds are lovely for a spring ride. The staff was very helpful , courteous and knowledgeable.  I would go there again in a heart beat.

I was sooooo excited to have the opportunity to ride a roller coaster in and around a casino/hotel. Yes, I realize that I may be getting a little old to ride roller coasters and hate to admit that it makes me sick as hell, but who the hell cares? You are only \"young\" once. The lines to pay were weirdly inefficient but maybe it was because everyone, including us, made a mad dash to get in 10 minutes before they closed (midnight on the weekend). \n\nThe ride was scary and hilarious at the same time (I didn't plan my shirt choice very well and I will leave it at that). My girlfriend and I laughed hysterically at our pictures. They were $15 a piece but $22 if you bought two. We decided to do that and split it. The employee gave me the most exasperated look when I asked him to charge two separate cards...really dude????? Be happy you got us to buy two and get over it. Besides that, this was a blast!

"Despite its unfavorable geographical positioning, Whiskey Dicks revels in its capacity to proffer an enjoyable drinking experience, courtesy of its impressive array of artfully-crafted brews and hospitable staff. Upon entering the establishment, we were warmly received by a congenial hostess clad in abbreviated attire, who expedited our seating process with alacrity. I opted for a Ranger IPA from their diverse selection of tap beverages, which, in my opinion, constitutes a commendable choice. The assortment of beers available at this everyday drinkery is indeed satisfactory. My culinary excursion began with an order of philly cheese accompanied by mesquite seasoned fries. The latter proved to be a gastronomic highlight, as the flavorful seasoning augmented the inherent deliciousness of the potatoes. However, the philly itself was not without its flaws, as the steak exhibited a tendency towards dryness and an excess of bread hindered the overall enjoyment of the dish. Nonetheless, the freshness of the onions and peppers provided a welcome contrast. Considering the aforementioned factors, I chose to elevate Whiskey Dicks by a star in my rating, primarily due to the establishment's commitment to offering a variety of palatable craft beers alongside its hospitable atmosphere. Although alternative pubs within close proximity may boast superior offerings, Whiskey Dicks' collection of New Belgian beers and Sam Adams seasonal brews renders it a worthy destination for those seeking a satisfying drinking experience."

"Having partaken of sustenance at this establishment on multiple occasions in the past, I must say that the culinary offerings have been consistently satisfactory. In fact, I have been fortunate enough to have had the pleasure of savoring their delectable dishes both via delivery and in-person, with the latter instance occurring in close proximity to my place of employment. My customary order consists of the Chicken Pita, which boasts an impressive array of flavors thanks to the grilled poultry, complemented by the nutritious whole wheat pita bread. Furthermore, I take great delight in augmenting my meal with a tangy cucumber sauce and a spicy hot garlic chili sauce, thus creating a veritable symphony of taste sensations. It is my conviction that this eatery merits unreserved endorsement, particularly given the reasonable price point of $8 for a complete pita."

"Having had the pleasure of visiting this establishment on multiple occasions, I must say that I have developed a profound fondness for it! The staff has consistently demonstrated exceptional friendliness and promptness, earning an A+ rating in my book. The ambiance, reminiscent of a Toby Keith's Jr., scores a respectable B+. The entertainment, in the form of live music, has been nothing short of spectacular, warranting an A+ grade. While the bar boasts an impressive selection, lacking only Norm, it still merits an A rating. Prices are average, but the food, with the exception of the steak, has been somewhat underwhelming, garnering a B score; however, the burgers and fries are highly recommended. In conclusion, taking into account the welcoming atmosphere, excellent staff, and top-notch entertainment, I award this establishment a solid A. I strongly advise paying a visit to this venue, as you are certain to appreciate the warmth and hospitality of the people and the surroundings. We eagerly anticipate our next visit, during which we undoubtedly will savor their delectable burgers."

I came here first time with an educated shooter that already had guns i could use. This was my second time ever shooting but first at a range. They sold us the bullets and targets gave us protective geer and off we went to an enclosed room to shoot very simple short breefing. Place is nicely set up central location, staff was nice. The other two people went to get certified not the paper test but shooting test i decided i needed more time to practice. The only thing i really did not like was how many tourist were there. I really hope they open another location more for locals. The prices are to high because its geared toward tourism. I like the fact classes are free though. I went on a monday around 9am not to busy but as the day progressed the place got packed so go during the week early otherwise you will be waiting. I will be back to practice more and test taking but i think im going to save some money and look for a cheaper place for bullets and targets.

The food is amazing.  If you've eaten at another Bianco restaurant, imagine that.... only better, with more options.

The service is not great.  Slow, they forget things, etc.

The portions are SMALL.

We went on a Saturday night and had our choice of inside or outside table with no waiting... so I think that issue is sort of hit or miss.

Vietnamese Sandwiches: The only thing I go here for, To be honest this is the best Vietnamese sandwiches in Las Vegas, trust me. Not like Lee's Sandwiches. Hue Thai bakes their bread fresh so when you get your sandwiches the breads soft and a little bit crunchy but still a little warm. I've tried a couple places and this place has to be the best. 

Other foods: They have a variety of Vietnamese dishes, Chinese, and even Thai. But nothing taste super Authentic. So that's why I never order anything there except the Vietnamese sandwiches and their boba (which is decent). Not a fan of their Pho

Price: Vietnamese Sandwiches here are dirt cheap, $3.50 a sandwich I believe. Only sucky thing is they require a minimum of $20 to charge a debit card. Which you should know by now, I'm a yelper who doesn't like to carry cash.

take out/eat there: To be honest dining there isn't so bad, other than the odd smell of cleaning products and food mixed together and the eye sore hallway to the bathroom the place is pretty alright. The design I guess is some kind of under the sea theme? I have no idea why its under the sea that has nothing to do with Vietnamese food. 

4/5 Stars for Price/Vietnamese Sandwiches/ Decent Boba

"Although the barbecue did possess a certain degree of culinary merit, it failed to surpass the threshold of excellence, falling short of the lofty expectations we had fostered. However, it must be acknowledged that the assortment of barbecue sauces available did exhibit a commendable diversity, catering to the diverse preferences of patrons. Furthermore, the gratuitous offering of kettle chips served as a welcome gesture, contributing to an atmosphere of unpretentious hospitality. It is worth mentioning that the speed at which our order was fulfilled and delivered to our table did border on the extraordinary, a testament to the establishment's proficiency in expediting orders with alacrity."

Fantastic!  The Farm burger was fabulous and the sweet potato fries with powder sugar were great. Huge fan of food.  Service on the hand was slow. They forgot our fries and we had to ask for them and did not get them until we were 3/4 done with our burgers.

I have been a loyal patron of this establishment for in excess of a decade, and despite my occasional forays into alternative venues, I invariably find myself returning to Nancy's salon, primarily due to the warm and welcoming ambiance, but also because of the exceptional quality of their nail care services and pedicures, which have consistently met, and indeed surpassed, my expectations.

This place is great! I received SO much stuff for my son when he was born (mostly barely worn hand-me downs from my husband's huge family and some of my close friends) that he couldn't possibly wear them all even if I changed his outfit 5 times a day! So I went on the hunt for a great consignment place I could utilize to get him "new" clothes as he grew. 
Luckily for me, there are quite a few places like this in my area (central phoenix). I checked out 2 others before I came to Smarty Pants (do NOT go to Urban Baby! Ugh!). 
The mother-daughter owner team at SP were very welcoming and friendly. They took almost all of the items I brought in and although I planned to just drop stuff off, I couldn't resist shopping for myself and ended up with three great tops for $15 total!! Incredible inventory, clean shop and friendly service... who wouldn't love it??

They informed me that they are expanding to the space right next to Bertha's (my favorite restaurant in town) to have a separate place for furniture and will be offering more adult clothing in the current space (I could have that backwards.... the new space is for clothes, perhaps?). 

So I will be heading back soon to spend my consignment money! Thank you Smarty Pants!

After seeing Paul put his review up...I had to join in! This venue is almost perfect in design and the acoustics are amazing. I love outdoor concerts and yet the amphitheater gives you a club feel while being outside.

That being said...like my review of the Fillmore...you will see that catching a buzz will require a credit card or a well hidden flask (leave your bongs at home). The whole Music Factory complex begs for a keg party straight out of high school to explode in the parking lot. Wait...what? Oh...that's right...we DO tailgate before shows. Ten dollars can get you a 12 pack of PBR and a sammy...or one 24 ounce beer inside...and that's without a tip. My tip? Lower your freakin drink prices!

Like others have said though...this place is great and they're attracting better and more obscure acts all the time. I'm just happy to have some reputable venues around.

This establishment boasted such favorable critiques on Yelp that we traversed a considerable distance from Scottsdale during our vacation to experience the ambiance of this venue in Tempe. Our excursion proved to be worthwhile, as we were greeted by a courteous doorman who requested my identification, cognizant of my advanced age, and pronounced my name accurately while extending his well wishes for an enjoyable sojourn. The attentive bartenders periodically inquired about our welfare, ensuring that we savored every moment of our visit. Although I do not partake in beer consumption, my companion sampled their trio of brews and expressed immense satisfaction with each selection. The atmosphere of this eatery exuded a convivial, relaxed, and sporty vibe, complemented by delectable pub fare.

I conducted a cursory observation of the surrounding area while driving and noticed a vacant commercial space with an absence of any visible signage or notification. Further investigation revealed that the establishment had relocated to a nearby location, in close proximity to other home furnishing retailers such as At Home, Creative Leather, and Spencer's Appliance, at 2711 S. San Tan Village Parkway, Gilbert. The newly-established store boasts increased illumination and expansive floor-to-ceiling windows on two sides, providing an optimal atmosphere for customers to peruse their offerings.

"As I previously mentioned in my initial posting regarding Princess Nails, the ambiance leaves much to be desired, bordering on squalor, and can aptly be described as a veritable hole in the wall. However, allow me to reiterate that Michelle, the individual responsible for administering the eyebrow waxing treatment, is truly exceptional. My second visit proved to be just as satisfying as the initial encounter. It is imperative that you request her services explicitly. While I refrain from bestowing a perfect five-star rating due to the establishment's conspicuous lack of cleanliness, I cannot help but wonder how they would fare without Michelle's expertise. It is essential to note that my assessment is founded solely on my experiences with eyebrow waxing and does not take into account any other services offered at this location, such as nail care, which I have never availed myself of and have no intention of doing so in the future."

It is a older hotel so you don't think of going there for the buffet right of the bat.  We somehow ended up here and the buffet was pretty good.  Not the largest selection but of what they offered everything was good quality (that's what really matters).  I was pleasantly surprised.  Would definitely go back.

After indulging in a succession of summer seasons within the confines of Phoenix, one becomes adept at identifying and cherishing specific aquatic establishments, whereupon the date shake at Sphinx transpires as an unparalleled delight, proffering a refreshing respite from the arid, sweltering ambiance that permeates the prolonged afternoons characteristic of this region, thereby catering to the needs of thirsty denizens who seek solace from the oppressive heat through the consumption of a revitalizing beverage, which has become an integral component of the local culture, boasting a rich heritage that spans multiple decades and continues to quench the thirst of Scottsdale's inhabitants to this day.

We have been eagerly anticipating the inauguration of this novel eatery for an extended period of time, and our patience has finally been rewarded. Upon partaking in a culinary excursion to this establishment on the second evening of its operation, we were thoroughly delighted by the exceptional quality of the service, complementary chips and salsa, delectable fare, and refreshing beverages proffered. The meticulous renovation of the interior space has resulted in a visually stunning ambiance that enhances the overall dining experience. It is gratifying to have another superior dining option in the vicinity, which serves as a harmonious addition to the existing array of distinguished Mexican restaurants in the area.

We finally got a Jimmy John's and I had heard so much about it being great.  We tried two different sandwiches (the No 9 Italian Night Club on their great french roll and the No 12 Beach Club on  thick sliced 7 grain bread).  Great quality product, great bread, very competitive pricing.  It is a little noisy with the music and hard surfaces in this location thou.  They are a brand new location so that will probably change (hope) over time.

Funny thing is, we went to a burger place at Mandalay first. But they didn't come to our table for 5 minutes to even say hello. And 5 minutes is longer than you think when you just spent 90 minutes at the MJ One show and you're ready to eat off your hand with hunger. So we left. And came here. A bit different, to put it mildly. Service was impeccable, but not snooty. The Missus and I both got different tasting menus. Mine was the Alain Ducasse 4 course one sans wine. From the cold broccoli soup amuse to the amazing lobster curry to the foie gras topped filet to the Armagnac dessert, almost everything was very well presented and tasted amazing. First time with foie gras. Would definitely have been beyond the pale if served solo, but topping the perfectly cooked medium rare filet balanced it's richness. All I know is the junk was tasty. The only misstep was the mashed potatoes that accompanied  the filet. They were served in a bowl separate from the plate, and surprisingly...basic.  \n\nAtmosphere was romantic, view was stunning, of course, and definitely an experience to remember. Not cheap. But actually worth it.

"A remarkably excellent minor coffee establishment, strategically positioned for an invigorating mid-shopping spree rejuvenation. Albeit slightly arduous to locate, diligent patrons can uncover this hidden gem by traversing the passageway nestled between Centre Eaton and Place Ville-Marie. It must be noted that this venue more closely resembles a counter than a traditional coffeehouse, as seating is scarce and the atmosphere is reminiscent of a hasty "fast food" establishment. However, rest assured that your order will be fulfilled with remarkable efficiency, taking no more than 5-10 minutes of your time, and the attentive customer service you receive will leave a lasting positive impression."

"Capacious servings! 

I had the pleasure of dining at this establishment during a recent luncheon excursion with my colleagues, conveniently located in close proximity to the Hilton hotel, where we were attending a seminar. Upon entering the restaurant, we were promptly accommodated and our server, a friendly and diligent individual, ensured that our dining experience was nothing short of exceptional. 

My culinary selection for the meal was a classic cheeseburger, accompanied by a side of fries. My fellow diners, Markus and Miyoko, opted for salads, specifically the steak and mushroom variety and a fruit-laden option, respectively. What struck us all was the enormity of the portions, truly generous servings that could easily have fed three individuals. Unfortunately, my well-done cheeseburger arrived slightly overcooked, with a noticeable charring that, while not detracting from its flavor, was aesthetically unappealing. 

In conclusion, this eatery offers satisfactory cuisine, particularly when considering the dearth of palatable dining options in the surrounding area. Would I return? Only if circumstances brought me to the vicinity once more. Nonetheless, it's comforting to be back in San Francisco, where a diverse array of gastronomic delights await my indulgence."

So after our hell of a boring time at PURE we walked our drunk asses over to Poetry. The sound of hip hop was like a breath of fresh air. Our first appearance was Thursday night around 1:30 am (or should I say Friday morning?) No cover (worked some magic) I think ladies were $20?? Anyways...we had sssooo much fun here....we danced all night....I had the best time here. Drinks came fast...everyone had a blast! If you like hip hop music this is the spot to be. \n\nWe actually came back for round two the next night and it was just as fun! I will mos def be stopping by every time I'm in Vegas....

Fish and Chips anyone? Had that and the quesadilla last night, both were delicious, but i'll admit I feel a little sluggish today. Place was clean, well kept, nice waitress. We went on a quiz or trivia night, so the mood was pretty mello. Tap beers seemed pretty standard for a pub. I will definitely go back for a nightcap as it is an easy walk from my house.

I indulged in the delectable flavors of the smoked salmon on a egg white omelet, savoring each bite while reveling in the hospitable atmosphere and appreciating the convenient parking facilities. Although my beverage was somewhat lacking in potency, I would unhesitatingly revisit this establishment, as the welcoming staff, impressive ambiance, and reasonable pricing comparable to that of downtown Scottsdale, all combined to create a truly enjoyable dining experience.

My assessment shall be confined to the culinary delight that I had the pleasure of ordering:

The White Pizza, a gastronomical masterpiece, exuded excellence in both taste and presentation. The subtle richness of the cheese was artfully balanced, thus avoiding the pitfall of overpowering the palate. A single slice proved to be sufficient for even the most discerning epicurean, unless, of course, one's appetite rivals that of a behemoth. It is worth noting that the pizza emerged from the kitchen in a timely manner, ensuring that the quality of the dish remained uncompromised. The generous dollops of ricotta only added to the overall appeal of the dish, thereby solidifying its status as a veritable gustatory triumph. While I do have a penchant for a slightly more decadent variation of the white pizza, the rendition presented before me still managed to elicit my approval. At a mere $5 per slice, this edible indulgence is an absolute steal, particularly when considering the late-night culinary options available in the city of Las Vegas.

The staff exhibited exceptional hospitality, and the gentleman behind the counter was particularly endearing. The promptness of the service only further enhanced the overall experience. In conclusion, I would highly recommend that you partake in this delectable experience for yourself, as it is truly a taste sensation unlike any other.

Summer's proficiency in haircutting and her exceptional customer service skills rendered an unforgettably satisfactory encounter, which left me reluctant to entrust my tresses to any other stylist. Her meticulous approach and commitment to catering to my preferences were evident throughout the process, ensuring a look that not only surpassed my expectations but also fostered a sense of loyalty towards her services. Such a remarkable experience has secured her a permanent client in me, and I shall unhesitatingly return to her expertise in the future.

This constitutes my second venture to Victoria, and it transpired during an organized Yelp gathering, thereby yielding an exceptional ambiance, yet it became patently evident from the demeanor of the bar personnel that this establishment remains a worthwhile destination even in the absence of a meticulously planned event, much gratitude is extended to Jody B for the coordination of this affair.

The mulled cider served here boasts an impressive quality, offering customers a choice between two distinct flavors, specifically Lingonberry and Pear, with the former being my personal preference and evoking memories of past excursions to a particular Swedish furniture retailer wherein meatballs are customarily offered. It is worth mentioning that Victoria's forms part of a broader assemblage of Swedish-themed bars scattered throughout Edinburgh, encompassing Hemma, Sofi's, and Joseph Pearce, thereby establishing a logical connection.

I shall unquestionably utilize this bar as a meeting spot in the future whenever my whereabouts fall within the vicinity of Leith Walk.

"On the second day of operations, all staff members were acutely cognizant of the heightened sense of urgency that permeated the atmosphere, as they assiduously endeavored to refine their culinary skills and provide an exceptional dining experience for their patrons. In light of this, we opted to sample the Buddy's Salumi & Cheese Board, a delectable ensemble of olives, pickled vegetables, grilled Italian bread, genoa salami, spicy capicola, proscuitto di parma, grana padano, tuscan pecorino, and gorgonzola. Upon savoring the assortment, we were struck by the unparalleled quality of the capicola and proscuitto, which were undoubtedly the most flavorsome we have had the pleasure of indulging in. Furthermore, the gorgonzola boasted an unforgettable combination of a pungent bleu cheese essence and the velvety texture of brie, thereby rendering it a true gastronomic masterpiece. In addition, our curiosity was piqued by the notion of consuming a cheeseburger within an Italian eatery, and thus, we decided to relish the Pat Lafrieda Burger, which featured a brioche bun, tomato aioli, provolone cheese, and tuscan fries. To our delight, the burger proved to be remarkably scrumptious. Lastly, no culinary excursion would have been complete without partaking in the sublime pleasure of the establishment's signature tiramisu, which, much to our satisfaction, transcended our expectations and emerged as the most exquisite specimen we have had the privilege of sampling anywhere. For those seeking to enhance their dining experience, we recommend requesting a table situated along the outer perimeter windows, thereby affording breathtaking vistas of The Strip. Additionally, we suggest that you bring your camera, as the captivating entree cakes crafted by Buddy and his team are certain to evoke a desire to capture their splendor and serve as enduring mementos of your gastronomic adventure."

I love independent/art/documentary/not-mainstream movies, so consequently, Camelview is one of my favorite spots as they are one of the few theaters here in the valley that gets these films.

Positive things about the theater: 
*Great movies! 
*Friendly employees
*Reasonably sized drinks (movie theater "bucket-o-cola" drinks are a pet peeve of mine and their small is equivalent to a medium soda from a fast food restaurant, which is just perfect) 
*Yummy cinnamon almonds for sale at the concession stand
*A retro-y feel 

Negatives
*Older theater that feels a bit rundown
*No stadium seating
*Seats that are not particularly comfortable

Point of note (not positive or negative)
*because of the type of movies they show, it seems like it is often popular with an older crowd of moviegoers. This can make for a sortof unique moviegoing experience if you come from a different demographic.

It is a fun spot that we manage to visit every couple of months. I wish that there were more options for Art films here in the Valley, but for the moment I do love Camelview, because I don't really have a choice in the matter ;)

Thanks to the exhaustive and meticulous evaluations proffered by Yelp reviewers, I was able to identify and select this moving company with confidence. As an individual who resides solo, I experienced considerable apprehension regarding the prospect of contracting the services of a moving company. However, upon initiating contact with the organization, my trepidation was promptly alleviated due to their judicious and considerate approach. Prior to the move, they furnished me with a photograph and comprehensive biography of the estimator who would be communicating with me, thereby engendering a sense of security and trust. Punctuality being a paramount concern, I was gratified to observe that the team arrived at the designated hour, ready to commence their labors with alacrity. Although a minor inconvenience arose in connection with the reassembly of my trundle bed, which remains unresolved at present, the overall execution of the move was flawless. In light of my thoroughly satisfactory experience, I would unhesitatingly recommend this moving company to any individual seeking such services.

I don't have a whole lot of experience with liquor stores, but have always been pleased here.  The staff are always nice, helpful, and non-intrusive.\n\nI once went with my boyfriend, who expressed a desire for a certain beer that they didn't have.  The dude behind the counter immediately said that they would order it.  Lo and behold, the next time we went, there it was.  We proceeded to buy lots of it.  Everything after that is kind of a blur.

"The performance was satisfactory, but it failed to meet the lofty expectations generated by their ABCD competition. Nonetheless, I took into account the fact that they were executing two consecutive shows, each lasting an hour and a half, which rationalized the JBWKZ's decision to refrain from exerting themselves excessively. Consequently, the display was not utterly awe-inspiring, but they did incorporate certain captivating elements, such as state-of-the-art technology, to create an amusing experience. They also exhibited an admirable versatility by exploring diverse musical styles, ranging from those reminiscent of the 1940s, to Disney-inspired pieces, hip hop, punk, and even a few disco tracks, which evoked mirthful sentiments."

"An establishment offering alcoholic beverages of superior quality, given its strategic positioning and capacious interior. Ideal venue to initiate nocturnal revelries. Unfortunately, my experience was marred by the bouncer's insistence on scrutinizing my age verification, despite my obvious maturity, when requesting an unpretentious beverage. The potations themselves were indeed delectable, and a minuscule area designated for dancing was available. The elevated platform situated above the bar featured live performances by talented artists, which enhanced the overall enjoyment of the evening, particularly owing to the captivating presence of an attractive female vocalist."

"My affection towards the frozen coffee beverage was profound, and the culinary excellence of every dish I had the pleasure of consuming within these establishments' premises was truly exceptional, thereby rendering it my preferred morning repast venue while situated in close proximity to this location."

"Upon entering the establishment, I was taken aback by the revelation that DSW now carries an assortment of running shoes, a departure from their customary array of casual and formal footwear for men. Although it does not compare to the specialized inventory of a store such as Run for your Life or TrySports, it was gratifying to encounter a retailer that offers esteemed brands like Mizuno and Asics. My routine typically involves navigating the right-hand side of the store, where the male shoes are showcased, in addition to the rear clearance section. My sibling frequently visits this location, occasionally for extended periods, which is understandable given the extensive variety of options available on the women's side."

Instead of suffering an interminable delay adjacent, I opted to sample Waffallonia's delectable offerings for the first time. Upon perusing their menu, I settled upon a waffle adorned with Nutella, bananas, and strawberries, albeit initially, the serving size appeared somewhat diminutive relative to my voracious appetite. Nonetheless, I quickly realized that my concerns were unwarranted, as each bite yielded an unforeseen profusion of flavors that satiated my hunger and left me utterly content. The waffle itself was replete with sugary morsels that evoked memories of indulgent funnel cakes, while the freshness of the fruit infused each mouthful with a vitality that was further enhanced by the harmonious blend of ingredients. My gratification was further amplified by the cozy ambiance of the establishment, whose limited seating capacity only served to enhance the intimacy of the dining experience. Ultimately, my decision to patronize Waffallonia proved not only worthwhile but indeed fortuitous, as their exceptional waffles have secured a permanent place in my culinary affections.

"Exceedingly gratifying culinary escapade!!! Although I had yet to indulge in the gastronomical delights offered by the Mesa branch of this esteemed eatery, I opted to partake in a delectable bowl of pasta, which not only satiated my hunger but also left me feeling profoundly appreciative of the exceptional service provided by my affable and attentive server, Ashley. In the event that you decide to grace this establishment with your presence, I implore you to request Ashley's assistance, as her vivacity, familiarity with the regular clientele, and unwavering dedication to providing an optimal dining experience are certain to engender an atmosphere of conviviality and merriment. Unquestionably, this visit constituted the most enjoyable encounter I have had the pleasure of experiencing at Oregano's, and I eagerly anticipate my next opportunity to savor the delectable Big Rig and Ashley's warm hospitality."

I stopped in here with the owner's girlfriend after she cut my hair. She kindly treated me to anything I wanted to eat and drink. wooo hoo! I ordered a Grey Goose and cranberry and a Las Vegas roll (my all time favorite sushi- even if it is fried). Both were delicious. Thank you!!

Last week, on the way from the Airport to the Convention Center, me and my buddies decided it was time for some breakfast.   Fortunately, we came across this IHOP.   The place was pretty empty, I believe there were only two other parties there besides us.   The service was fast and friendly.   Our hostess / waitress (Shee was her name) was awesome.   The food was average for an IHOP.   You know what you will get.   As a bonus, this IHOP is close to the Pinball Hall of Fame.   \nThis is a good place for breakfast.   \nWill I be back?   Yeah, maybe.

This review is only for the Chippery, not the daiquiris. (Though I bet they are delicious!) 

I was wandering around the Forum Shops and I wanted just a little snack before heading home. My friends were getting daiquiris and I saw they have food in the back so I shoved my way through all those wanting frozen drinks and went back. I was pleasantly surprised at the chip selection. They had 6-8 flavored of homemade chips for really reasonable prices, $3 or $5 per bag depending on size. 

The only reason that it gets less than 5 stars is that the service wasn't great. Not cheery people this afternoon at Caesars! It is definitely a hidden gem for a cheap little snack.

It's a maze of toys that you won't find at most department stores. 

I like the organization. It makes it easy to go the the area you want. All toys in their proper spot, divided into Toddler toys, board games, stuffed animals, learning toys, dolls, sports toys, action figured, cars, etc. 

I was serious about the maze thing, lol. There is 1 entrance and 1 exit and they are not interchangeable :) When you first walk in, because they know children so well and their ability to walk in a door and then break out into an all out sprint in all directions, you are guided through a few isles that curve around (they are chalk full of toys, of course) and THEN you get to the main isle. 

My check out experience was awesome. The lady actually noticed that I was hiding something my nieces view and she made sure to scan it when she wasn't looking and to double bag it :D I love her. 

Prices range, but the toys here do seem to be pricier in general compared to most department stores, but like it said, they have a much wider variety.

"The diminutive dimensions of the eatery do not detract from its ambiance, which exudes a convivial and welcoming aura, while the judicious deployment of embellishments and accoutrements contributes to an overall sense of refinement and sophistication; the attentive and proficient service further enhances the culinary experience. The Pad See Ew, a stir-fried rice noodle dish imbued with a rich, complex flavor profile replete with a variety of spices, is somewhat let down by a modest serving size, which, though perhaps understandable given its placement on the lunch menu, leaves a tad bit to be desired. In contrast, the Pad Thai, a dish consisting of stir-fried rice noodles, chicken, and a flavorsome sauce, boasts an impressive quantity that complements its commendable quality, with each component displaying a satisfying texture and taste; indeed, the dish elicits unreserved praise and ensures that future visits to this establishment will be forthcoming."

This culinary establishment is exceptionally delectable. The expedient drive-thru service remains available, enabling patrons to relish the convenience; the employee who attended to my order demonstrated remarkable alacrity and congeniality, constituting an impressive aspect of the experience.

The poultry appendages, specifically the wings, underwent preparation with utmost precision, resulting in a flawless execution. However, the supplementary items presented a minor drawback. We opted for French fries and potato salad, the former satisfying my companion's taste buds while the latter, despite its palatable quality, featured an unexpectedly diminutive serving size, barely sufficient to justify the cost of $1.89, thereby warranting a four-star rating.

Apart from this minor shortcoming, the eatery earns high praise, elevating it to a formidable status among competitors. Patrons are advised to bypass the supplementary dishes and focus on the exceptional chicken wings, allowing them to combine various flavors to their liking without incurring disappointment.

This establishment has become one of my most cherished venues in Las Vegas, owing to its exceptional value and captivating atmosphere. For the paltry sum of $9, I was able to indulge in two shots and a beer, an offer that I found impossible to resist. The clientele was a diverse assortment of individuals, which added to the allure of the karaoke performance that took place there. On the Saturday evening that we visited, the ambiance was lively and engaging, albeit somewhat congested and permeated with smoke. It is worth noting that those who are sensitive to cigarette smoke may find this environment less than ideal. The bartenders were proficient in their pours, dispensing generous quantities of liquor with precision and skill. The remaining staff members were affable and courteous, contributing to an overall pleasant experience. Notably, the restrooms conformed to the traditional dive bar standard, with a solitary toilet facility that often resulted in a delay for patrons seeking to relieve themselves. Thus, it is advisable for female patrons to exercise caution and avoid breaking the seal, as they may encounter a brief wait before gaining access to the facilities.

"Leith Links, situated in the northern precincts of Edinburgh, serves as a verdant oasis, offering a serene ambiance and myriad recreational opportunities for residents and visitors alike. This expansive green space, replete with winding pathways, play areas for children, and designated zones for canine companions, provides an idyllic setting for leisurely strolls, invigorating runs, or simply savoring the natural beauty of the surroundings. Although comparable to the Meadows in terms of its appeal as a popular gathering spot, Leith Links enjoys a more tranquil atmosphere, largely due to the absence of throngs of students converging upon the area for picnics. However, it's worth noting that the northeastern sector of the park may occasionally be subject to unpleasant olfactory sensations, courtesy of the proximate sewage facilities. \n\nDespite its peaceful ambiance, Leith Links hosts a diverse array of activities and events throughout the year. Within its borders, one can find allotments and a Children's Orchard, which serve as hubs of community engagement and sustainability. Additionally, the park plays host to various cultural celebrations, including the Leith Festival in June and the Edinburgh Mela in August, showcasing the rich tapestry of local and international talent. Furthermore, Leith Links lays claim to a unique distinction: it was here that the rules of golf were first codified, earning it the title of the true birthplace of golf, a fact that challenges the long-held notion that St Andrews holds this honor."

"Ubiquitous yet unremarkable, this establishment offers a diverse array of fresh and reasonably priced culinary options, rendering it a frequent destination for my midday repasts. The half-and-half combinations available for their soups, salads, and sandwiches are particularly appealing, as they afford me the opportunity to sample multiple offerings without committing to a single dish. The Fontana grilled cheese, tortellini Alfredo pasta, and Cesar salad are timeless classics, executed with varying degrees of success. However, the ambiance is occasionally marred by the intrusive sound of sweeping, as staff members persist in using a brush broom to clean the carpet in close proximity to my table, generating a substantial amount of dust and detracting from the overall dining experience. Despite these minor drawbacks, this venue remains a reliable choice for a hasty and satisfying meal."

"Culinary excellence and immaculate ambiance converge at this esteemed eatery. The chef emerges from the kitchen to engage with patrons and ensure a satisfactory dining experience. Although I do not subscribe to a plant-based diet, the vegan options tantalized my taste buds. In particular, the 'gardein beef', 'gardein fish', and 'gardein chicken' dishes showcased exceptional flavor and creativity. Additionally, the innovative 'Sweet Sour Scallops' (king oyster mushrooms sliced, breaded, and fried) offered a vegan twist on the classic sweet and sour pork dish, further solidifying the restaurant's commitment to gastronomic ingenuity. My plans to revisit this culinary gem are already underway, and I highly recommend that others follow suit."

"I thoroughly enjoyed my experience at this establishment. Upon entering, I procured a colossal frozen beverage synonymous with the city of Las Vegas from Purple Zebra.
