Unfortunately, my maternal figure was experiencing hunger pangs. Following a brief conversation with an accommodating host, we were escorted to our table. My expectations for the margarita, given the restaurant's cultural cuisine, were not met, as it was subpar. Despite the server's benevolence in replacing it with an alternative margarita, the second iteration proved to be equally disappointing. Therefore, I would advise against ordering said beverage. However, the remaining dishes were truly exceptional. The carnitas tacos embodied the essence of love, with each bite enveloped in rich, velvety flavors. Furthermore, the guacamole garnished with pomegranate seeds induced an almost euphoric response. Its creamy texture and subtle sweetness left me utterly satiated. Additionally, I sampled the green rice, which although visually resembling regurgitated matter, transported my taste buds to a realm of pure delight upon consumption. In conclusion, I wholeheartedly endorse visiting this venue."
I quite enjoyed the dinner I had here and would definitely return. Friendly service, excellent food... Seems on a par quality wise with Bankok Balcony in Squirrel Hill. Fairly small inside.
Great food. Kind of pricy for the portions but it is great food!! Makes you feel good about what you are eating!!

This eatery, situated within the Fiesta Resort Conference Center, warrants its own review on this platform. Unfortunately, owing to the late hour and our unforeseen presence at this establishment due to a missed flight connection, we were unable to fully indulge in the culinary offerings of this restaurant. However, the service we received in the lounge area was truly commendable, with Jenn, our server, displaying an exceptional level of professionalism and warmth, despite the influx of famished patrons. My dining companion and I opted for a soup and salad, specifically the "Chef's Famous Chicken Tortilla Soup," which, to our delight, proved to be an unparalleled gastronomic experience. In fact, it was so delectable that I would venture to say it was the most flavorful tortilla soup I have had the pleasure of savoring. Thus, if anyone has the good fortune of obtaining the recipe, I implore them to share it with me.

If you've never been to Wildflower before, it's a cute, nice soup, sandwich, salad, bread, pastry place. This is a big, bright location. 

Lovely, savory food that always seems to be made with nice ingredients, and great bread - we often come in for a meal and treat ourselves to a loaf of something delicious to go - today, sourdough with rosemary and sea salt.  It's pretty reasonably priced, and the food is interesting. 

Try the spinach salad (I get it with no bacon), or the egg, tomato & feta breakfast sandwich on ciabatta.

"My appraisal of this establishment is somewhat dichotomous, as while they proffer an impressive and delectable array of soups, sandwiches, and wraps, their smoothies fall short of my expectations. Specifically, they incorporate an excessive amount of orange juice into the majority of their offerings, which results in a discordant flavor profile that belies their advertised flavors. Despite my repeated attempts to sample various flavors, I am consistently disenchanted by the prevalence of orange juice or other fruit juices employed as a base, thereby diminishing my overall satisfaction with their smoothies. Notwithstanding, I must acknowledge that Franktuary's Blue smoothie stands out as a notable exception to this trend, earning it my unwavering endorsement."

"An exceptional establishment, distinguished by its fastidious attention to cleanliness and an impressive level of customer service; the culinary offerings, while not without their merits, were somewhat inconsistent in terms of flavor profile, specifically, the Devil's Egg, which lacked any discernible zest, was a disappointment, while the Short Ribs, though tender, were over-salted to an extent that made them unpalatable, save for a few bites; however, upon requesting an additional dash of spice, the Andouille Sausage, Shrimp, and Grits combination proved satisfying, albeit the latter component, the grits, seemed incongruous with the other elements of the dish, but ultimately, the meal concluded on a positive note with the delectable Donut appetizer."

"The cost of our midday repast at this esteemed hostelry was somewhat prohibitive, given the exorbitant tariff of forty dollars for a meal that, while undoubtedly delectable, did not seem to justify such an extravagant expenditure. However, as we awaited the preparation of our luxurious accommodations, we opted to kill some time by partaking of a light refreshment, which, much to our surprise, turned out to be a veritable culinary masterpiece! The chopped salad, replete with an array of fresh vegetables, including celery, peas, lettuce, and an assortment of other ingredients, was truly a gastronomic delight, with each component boasting unparalleled freshness and flavor. Furthermore, the dressing applied to this delectable dish was remarkably light and subtle, thereby enhancing the overall experience. Additionally, we were served a novel taco-like shell, reminiscent of Chinese shrimp chips, embellished with sesame seeds, which added a pleasing texture to the meal. Unfortunately, the same cannot be said for the French-sized grilled Mahi Mahi sandwich, served with a side of unimpressive, non-crispy fries that fell short of our expectations, particularly considering the hefty price tag of seventeen dollars. Nonetheless, the ambiance of the establishment, situated adjacent to the Wynn pool, was undeniably captivating, and we would highly recommend the aforementioned salad to any individual seeking a truly exceptional gustatory experience in the heart of Las Vegas."

"The gastronomical experience afforded by the pizza is merely satisfactory, whereas the pasta dishes are truly exceptional, thereby establishing this eatery as an optimal destination for either a tranquil family gathering or an intimate date, with the added benefit of some delectable salads augmenting the menu."

I really enjoy this place. It's low-key and upscale. Drinks are expensive but they're made on the strong side. The food is really go too. I've never had a dish I didn't enjoy. \n\nIt's a great place to sit down and enjoy a cocktail and have a conversation. The crowd looks like 26 and up.  I consistently have a positive experience here.

We executed a reservation via OpenTable for breakfast, which proved to be a judicious decision, as it precluded us from having to endure a thirty-minute wait in line. Upon entering the establishment, we observed numerous unoccupied tables, which rendered the prolonged queue somewhat perplexing. As we arrived at 10:30, we had the opportunity to sample both breakfast and lunch offerings.

My mother was particularly eager to indulge in their all-you-can-eat macarons, but unfortunately, they failed to meet her expectations, as they lacked the requisite texture of melting in one's mouth. However, several of their other dessert items, such as the creme brulee and fruit tart, were quite delectable. Their crepe offering, on the other hand, was disappointing - the batter was insipid, and the berries were too tart. Moreover, the candied nuts they utilized possessed an unpleasant refrigerated flavor.

In contrast, all the meat dishes I sampled were quite satisfying. The prime rib was cooked to perfection, and the pork apple dish was scrumptious - vastly superior to the parched, chewy offerings at The Bacchanal. Additionally, their hot cherries were palatable. It's amusing that they even offer sushi.

The service was adequate, given the nature of a buffet. However, our server visited our table so infrequently that we were compelled to place our finished dishes on a nearby table.

Ultimately, despite some inconsistencies, I found the food enjoyable, and I would likely return. An abundance of delectable desserts and meats is always an attractive feature for me.

I went out to Outback for a light snack. I was seated promptly without any delays. My server was very attentive and helpful with the menu. I ordered the side salad along with the soup for the day. The salad was fresh and crisp and I promise they have the best garlic croutons. The soup was better than I expected it was a creamy onion and cheese soup. And of course they brought out their famous bread and butter!

Great place for a quick, healthy bite, featuring flatbreads, wraps, panninis, salads, soups...even quesadillas!  No matter what you choose, you know exactly how many calories are in each (the calorie count is next to each menu item). 

I devoured the chipotle chicken wrap (380 calories). The veggies were plentiful and fresh, and the flatbread was the perfect thickness--soft but not flimsy. The chipotle sauce was flavorful, with just the right amount of heat.  My only complaint is the smaller portion of chicken--more is always better.  Try the peppadew hot sauce on your meal!  Wayyyyy better than Tabasco. 

It would be PERFECT if there was one located closer to Scottsdale...So many tasty options, all at very reasonable prices--$5 got me the wrap, a drink and my choice of chips, a cookie or a brownie.  Beat that, Subway!

They have an amazingly primo location, right next to ASU and all those local businesses.  They actually have a good amount of seating and easily accessible parking!  This alone practically makes the place 4 star worthy.  What nails it is the staff.  Everyone has been professional, friendly and super helpful.  I've seen folks who forgot to take all their cream cheeses, and they'll remind them they are entitled to them in the deal.  So many places would just let you leave.  

Notice I haven't mentioned their food yet?  Well, there is a reason. It is 100% ok.  I've never gotten anything bad - ever.  But nothing has been great either.  Average menu options, with some nice choices.  Bagels are ok, but nothing to write home about.  One of my favorite things is that for a sandwich you can upgrade your bagel to a wrap, artisan bread or a "softwich" which is like a bagel but softer and square.  

It's never going to be a bad choice, and the super service will have you leaving with a smile on your face.

A good locals bar.

You can tell it's a good bar when bartenders from other bars come to gamble and hang out.  The food is good, gambling is good and the bartenders are good.  My second time there I hit $400 on Keno and the third time $200 in video poker.  One of the few bars I'm still up on!

The bar area has a dozen or so spots without a machine so you can belly up without gambling and they have a few booths on one side and a few high-top tables on the other.

I haven't eaten here yet, but would give five stars for the view alone!  My dad and I went to the Duquesne Incline and then had some time to burn before his flight home, so we stopped next door at the Grandview Saloon for a beer and to hang out for a bit.

The patio is fantastic with a wonderful view of the rivers, and you can watch the incline go up and down.  They had a decent selection of beer (although we were uncreative and went with Yuengling) that was nice and cold and reasonably priced given the location.  Our server was prompt and friendly.

I'm guessing there's more interesting food options in downtown Pittsburgh, but I'd definitely stop here for the view again, especially with visitors.

"My affection towards this establishment remains steadfast, primarily due to the delectable culinary offerings and the welcoming ambiance that permeates the premises; however, my most recent visit did not quite live up to my expectations, specifically in regards to the novel inclusions in the menu, which unfortunately did not meet my expectations."

This place is so mix fun. The food is great and the people here are a blast. The only negative is they don't have deserts. This place screams s'mores and twinkee's but all they have is fruit. Regardless... Amaze balls!

"We were thoroughly impressed by our recent dining experience at this new restaurant located within the luxurious SLS Las Vegas hotel; boasting an avant-garde and stylish ambiance reminiscent of tapas-style establishments, the venue's meticulously curated decor exuded an air of sophistication and refinement. Our server provided attentive and proficient service, ensuring that our culinary journey was nothing short of exceptional. Each dish was artfully presented in generous portions, bursting with flavors that delighted our taste buds; specifically, the fusion of watermelon and feta avocado, accompanied by spiced nuts and a cucumber salad, proved to be a standout creation worthy of high praise. Additionally, their diverse selection of hummus and freshly shucked oysters left us eager to sample more of their innovative offerings. Lastly, the warm pita bread, fresh from the oven, served as the perfect accompaniment to our meal, further solidifying our desire to return and recommend this gem to fellow gastronomes planning to visit the city."

Ryan J brought me out here and, yes, I brought my A game--went ahead and ordered the Bear: peanut butter, cracker jacks, bacon, gouda and BBQ sauce. It was state-fair-what-did-I-Just-Do? awesome. So good. 

The carneys selling overpriced knitting nearby were odd--but we liked the lamps the guys recreating Mad Men were pimping out there.

I don't know anything about these Short Leash Dogs people--but they clearly have something dialed in. The Bear dog was part of some contest put on by the Arizona Diamondbacks. They won, so now it's become a big deal for them.

Ryan J got a different dog. And as he reviewed nearly two years ago: you gotta "unleash your hot dog inhibitions" to get into this place.

Who has hot dog inhibitions? Dumb people, that's who.

"We have had the pleasure of dining at this establishment on two separate occasions, and both experiences have been thoroughly enjoyable. The all-you-can-eat dinner option for $27 is an excellent value, particularly given the quality of the culinary offerings. While the sushi may not be exceptional, it is certainly comparable to that found at other reputable establishments. The true delight lies in the ability to order numerous dishes and sample a wide variety of flavors and textures. The menu boasts an impressive array of options, including salmon belly, super white tuna, salmon, hamachi, scallop, conch, halibut, sweet shrimp, seaweed salad, and an assortment of delectable desserts. It is essential to note that while the sushi chefs are responsible for preparing your meal, you must place your orders with your waiter. However, if you opt to sit at the sushi counter, you will be treated to attentive service and the opportunity to request whatever you desire from the sushi chefs directly. The spicy tuna crackers, which have garnered significant praise, did not quite live up to our expectations. Nevertheless, we would still recommend trying them, as they are part of the inclusive package. The pork belly, another highly-regarded item, was merely satisfactory in our opinion. Nonetheless, we suggest giving it a try, as it forms part of the overall experience. The service we received was generally impressive, with friendly and accommodating staff enhancing the enjoyment of our meals. When given the choice, we would advocate sitting at the sushi bar, as it affords a more engaging and personalized dining experience, allowing you to interact with the sushi chefs and explore their vast repertoire of culinary delights."

"This establishment evokes immense affection within me due to its hospitable personnel, reasonable pricing, and prevalence of regular patrons, which creates a welcoming ambiance. Their diverse array of delectable pastries and cakes, including the sublime Red Velvet Cake, has never been subjected to the unfortunate process of freezing. Moreover, their recent introduction of DONUTS has further augmented my enthusiasm for this venue."

My husband and I have stayed at Harrahs a few times. This time we brought our kids and booked a \"classic\" 2 queen bed room. This room is actually much quieter and bigger then their \"high roller\" or \"premium\" rooms, which is weird. There is no desk but there is a little table with 2 chairs. It's not fully updated but honestly it's not bad at all. I would book this room again if we had a choice of the other rooms. I didn't give 5 stars because the bathroom tub kept dripping water. It wasn't loud or anything but it was a minus.

Fianlly a happy hour that made me happy.

If you want some great food and drinks on a current economy budget the daily 5-7 happy hr may be a good choice for you.

$5 specialty drinks including a pomitini poured at the table. This drink was quite good and yes girly.

$5 appetizers including a great seared Ahi with a Jicama carrot salad. The Ahi has well spiced and of decent quality.

There are other $5 options as well.

$6 burger that looked huge and induced 2 onion rings and a challa roll for a bun. 

There also is a $12 ahi burger that is more of a croquet style with 2 onion rings or a portobello burger too.

This happy hr is available at the bar era, or in the more relaxed patio. There are heaters on the patio for the cooler nights.

With thees prices we kept eating, and eating and yes eating. We left stuffed on great food.

I recommended a side of the saluted mushrooms of the menu as they really enhance any meal.

Having La Cerise situated merely a short distance away from one's place of employment can be considered both a beneficial and detrimental circumstance; a curse in the sense that it tempts one to indulge in an excessive frequency of luncheons, thereby posing a threat to one's financial constraints. The eatery's amiable service, scrumptious culinary offerings, satisfactory coffee, and delectable on-site ice cream production undoubtedly contribute to its appeal. Furthermore, the prices charged for the consumables seem reasonable, considering the superior quality of the fare provided. The menu presents a variety of sandwich options, allowing patrons to select their preferred bread type, including panini, croissant, wrap, or bun. Additionally, a daily soup and pasta specialty (often lasagne or macaroni and cheese) graces the menu, accompanied by a vegetarian option. Those in the vicinity are cordially invited to partake in a meal at this establishment.

"Who could have anticipated that it encompasses a staggering 122 acres?! An expansive park boasting an array of recreational opportunities for outdoor enthusiasts. Furthermore, it features a picturesque lake, accompanied by an intricate drainage system, which I prefer to imagine serves as a concealed submarine summit. 

The basketball courts exude an aura of excellence! In conjunction with the tennis courts positioned across Park Road, they form an integral component of the park's diverse sporting facilities. The inviting children's play area is sure to delight young visitors, while the four softball fields appear well-equipped to host spirited matches. My initial impression was one of unwavering admiration, as the sheer scope of these various areas becomes readily apparent from even a cursory observation! 

However, I must acknowledge that certain sections may benefit from improved upkeep, potentially hindered by limitations in financial resources. 

Additionally, a recycling drop-off station graces one corner of the softball fields, a commendable initiative aligning with environmental responsibility. 

Although Yelp lists this location under Ballyntyne, it actually resides within the South Park region, situated along Park Road, just south of the intersection with Tyvola and Fairview."

My first venture in here, I wasn't sure what to think.  It felt difficult to get attention for service.  But then it warmed up.  The staff turned out to be very friendly and helpful.  The whisky list is monstrous and the food is pretty good.  I ended up coming back a few times during my visit and standing around the bar and listening to music was a most enjoyable way to kill a few hours (and brain cells).  \n\nWhen someone says \"Whiski\", there's Whiski Bar and Restaurant and then their sister establishment, Whiski rooms.  While related, don't confuse the two.

"Corey is undoubtedly the quintessential embodiment of masculinity and virility, as his unwavering dedication to providing an exceptional dining experience at Majerle's Sports Grill in Scottsdale, Arizona, has earned him widespread acclaim and admiration from patrons such as myself and my companions. Our initial foray into this culinary establishment was predicated upon our collective desire to satiate our hunger and partake in the captivating ambiance that permeates the venue, replete with an array of state-of-the-art audiovisual equipment that rivals the most opulent sports bars. The delectable cuisine, attentive service, and particularly the affable and charismatic manager, Corey, combined to create an unparalleled nocturnal experience that fostered an atmosphere of unbridled revelry and jubilation, commemorating Stephanie G's momentous 29th birthday in style, reminiscent of the iconic 'Girls Gone Wild' franchise. My anticipation for a future visit to this esteemed eatery is palpable, as I eagerly look forward to relishing the company of the friendly staff, savoring the mouthwatering fare, and indulging in the euphoric delight of dancing the night away, all while being captivated by the visual splendor of the finest hip hop and R&B music videos, displayed on an array of cutting-edge televisions that blanket the interior of this pulsating hotspot."

"I have merely been present at this establishment on occasions when my employer has hosted business dinners.  If I were financially responsible for settling the bill, I would likely opt for an alternative eatery, as I believe the cost surpasses the caliber of the cuisine.  Nonetheless, it is essential to acknowledge that Las Vegas is renowned for its exorbitant prices, and thus, it is unsurprising that such a phenomenon occurs within its borders.  The entryway and foyer of the restaurant are rather captivating, with the wine tower serving as a striking focal point in the primary dining area.  The hospitality has been meticulous and considerate, although perhaps a tad sluggish in tempo.  We encountered no difficulties in attracting the attention of our server during my visits.  It is conceivable that certain individuals might misinterpret a leisurely pace as poor service; nevertheless, I have discovered that the staff at this establishment is quite responsive and diligent in their efforts to ensure that patrons are content with their dining experience.  During each visit, my server demonstrated remarkable pliability in accommodating requests, including modifying orders from a fixed-price menu.  In summary, my experiences at this restaurant have been generally favorable."

"As an individual who does not partake in the consumption of whisky, I must admit that the mere olfactory sensation of its aroma has the capacity to induce within me a state of nausea. My previous employment with a catering company during my academic tenure necessitated my involvement in the service of various types of whiskies to guests, whereupon I was frequently queried regarding the distinction between diverse brands and styles. Despite my attempts to arrange the whiskies in a systematic fashion, I found myself struggling to accurately identify each variety, leading me to fabricate names and attributes for the benefit of those who inquired. Subsequent to this experience, my understanding of whisky remains limited, although I have acquired several bottles as gifts for retirement celebrations and the like. \n\nThe establishment in question appears to be a traditional whisky shop, boasting an extensive array of whisky brands and styles, complemented by an impressive selection of gins and other spirits. Given the store's specialization in whisky, it is likely that patrons will be able to locate their preferred whisky among the numerous options available. This venue offers an excellent opportunity for visitors to procure a memorable keepsake from Scotland, a gift for a whisky enthusiast, or simply treat themselves to a new bottle of their preferred whisky."

"The morning repast fare at this establishment is of exceptional quality! The scrambled eggs were thoroughly cooked, exhibiting a satisfying texture that was both fluffy and light. The bacon was delightfully crisp, possessing an enticing aroma that complemented its flavorful taste. The hash browns were cooked to perfection, boasting a satisfying crunch on their exterior while retaining a fluffy interior. Both varieties of sausage proved to be delectable, with each bite delivering a savory experience that left me eager for more. In addition, I partook in a bowl of wonton soup, whose flavorsome broth and plump dumplings pleased my palate immensely. Although the presence of bean sprouts was somewhat superfluous, the overall quality of the soup remained undiminished. Furthermore, the eatery offered an assortment of other delectable options, including pho, miso soup, shrimp noodle soup, and an array of sandwiches that elicited my approval with their satisfying taste and generous portion size. While I did not sample any of the sushi, Asian cuisine, BBQ, or salads, their visual appeal suggested that they too were of high culinary standards. Lastly, I highly recommend indulging in the chocolate-covered strawberries and cannolis for dessert, as their rich flavors and satisfying sweetness will surely satiate your sugary cravings."

"I thoroughly relish visiting this eatery, as it presents itself as an unassuming establishment, yet offers a culinary experience of superior quality. The fare served here is truly delectable, and the hospitality extended by the staff is equally impressive. Its proximity to my significant other's workplace was the impetus for its discovery, as his colleagues persistently sang praises of their signature salsa. Indeed, it is a flavorful delight, and the daily luncheon specials offered at a reasonable price only add to the appeal. Furthermore, the presence of outdoor seating provides a pleasant ambiance, further enhancing the dining experience."

"On certain occasions, I find myself craving a delectable serving of dense, rich ice cream. Specifically, I yearn for the authentic, traditional variety, unadulterated by the likes of frozen yogurt or frozen custard. This establishment boasts an impressive array of artisanal ice cream flavors, which I sample with great relish. To complement my indulgence, I opt for a crisp, chocolate-dipped waffle cone, a satisfactory vessel for containing my delightful frozen treat. The assortment of flavors available at this venue is diverse and extensive, thereby enabling me to select the particular flavor that suits my fancy."

I introduced this joint to my five companions on my most recent trip to Sin City and they immediately made it their dining choice every night (i should say morning..) for the remainder of the trip.\n\nYou can't go wrong coming to this place, unless you try to eat at around 7pm. In that case, expect a 75min wait for the best value restaurant in the county.

Went back for a second time to get the Irish coffee on a cold late afternoon.  The place was empty and there for the service was great.   The bartender was engaging and extremely knowledgeable about whiskey and even gave us some pointers about how to have a better experience and enjoy the whiskey properly.   The place itself is small  but let's not forget that it is inside a sea container but the patio during the afternoon is delightful and make a great perch to watch the playground.   The Boozery is the ONLY BAR IN LAS VEGAS that serves products from our very own Las Vegas Distillery!!!      So go enjoy this unique bar in the very unique setting of container park....

I looove sammiches and Jersey Mike's does a great job of making some good ones.

Located right next to Firefly, JM serves up some great sandwiches in their own way. Jersey has either cold or hot subs, and everything is cut and sliced fresh in front you like like Port of Subs. They don't have baked subs but they do have a grill for their phillys.

I came in and ordered the Club supreme or whatever they call it... The sandwich was great, they sliced a ton of meat on to it, the toppings were perfect and the bacon was suuuuper crispy. On top of that, the service was great! People who work here were real nice. The friends I came with had a the Chicken Parm hot sandwich, though it sounded good, it came out to a hot mess literally.

They def get points for offering a UNLV discount, but beware showing up at lunch time! They can get packed.

"This inconspicuous Greek eatery in Tollcross takes pride in offering a copious amount of genuine, flavorful, and painstakingly prepared Hellenic cuisine, as suggested by its name. Run by a Scottish duo who have recently returned from residing in Kefalonia, this culinary establishment is undoubtedly worthy of a visit. My companion and I decided to dine here on a whim one evening, and the vast majority of tables were already reserved, which served as a promising indicator. Rather than endeavoring to select from the comprehensive Ã  la carte menu, we chose to sample a variety of mezze from the starter menu instead: freshly prepared hummus, taramasalata, tzatziki, substantial and succulent olives, and a generous portion of delectably crispy whitebait. Accompanied by an unlimited supply of crusty bread and a reasonably priced house wine, it constituted a truly delightful repast."

Myriad of slice options during the week here, with fewer on the weekends but still good.  Pizza is a general NY style, nothing spectacular or memorable, but still solidly good.  Crust at the end is deliciously chewy inside with crispness on the outside.  Sicilian crust isn't as good here, in my opinion.  Prices good for lunch specials, but ordering a few pizzas with various toppings can get quite expensive.

My husband and I visit Viva Mercado's often.  The wait staff is attentive and very friendly.  Our drinks are never empty! The complimentary soup they serve is very good! And I also love the chips and salsa/bean dip.  The chips are always fresh and crispy.  I love their chimichanga's and my husband is partial to the fajitas that come to the table still sizzling.  If you haven't tried this place yet, you're missing out!

Wow, what a great Mexican place! The most amazing collection of sauces I've ever seen. Their homemade sauce was enough though, the food is very tasty, and the price is certainly right. Fish tacos FTW!

"I had the pleasure of partaking in a culinary experience at this esteemed establishment last evening, and while the Pinot Grigio did not quite meet my expectations, the gastronomical offerings were indeed impressive and warrant recommendation to any individual seeking a satisfying repast."

"Gastronomical excellence in the form of steak fajitas has left me in a state of utter satisfaction, particularly after an evening of indulging in adult beverages and engaging in games of chance. My compliments to the establishment for providing an ambiance that is not only visually appealing but also conducive to musical entertainment. It is with great anticipation that I look forward to my next visit, when I shall partake in the delectable cuisine once again."

"I thoroughly relish the exceptionally tender and delectable Prime Rib served here. To circumvent potential irritation stemming from prolonged queuing, I opted to reserve a table via OpenTable, thereby ensuring a prompt and seamless dining experience for both my companion and myself. Upon arrival, we were expedited through the 'VIP' entrance, where we settled our bill and were immediately escorted to our table. Our server promptly approached our table to solicit our beverage preferences, and we subsequently received our culinary delights in a timely manner. As I eagerly awaited my turn to savor the mouthwatering Prime Rib, I noticed a considerable throng of individuals ahead of me vying for their preferred sauce accompaniments. Subsequently, I ventured towards the seafood section, only to be mildly disconcerted by the sight of a multitude of patrons monopolizing the crab legs. However, I decided to temporarily forego my craving for crustaceans and return later for my second helping. 
Upon perusing the assortment of sweet treats, I became particularly enamored with the French macaroons, of which there were only a few remaining. Interestingly, the same individual who had previously claimed the lion's share of crab legs was now positioned behind me in the dessert queue. In a playful gesture of retribution, I decided to claim the last few macaroons, leaving none for my fellow diner. Ultimately, I departed the establishment in high spirits, satiated by both my crab leg and macaroon cravings, and appreciative of our attentive server's efforts in maintaining our hydration throughout the meal."

"I believe I have reviewed their alternative venue situated on Mill Street, and I must say, this particular establishment exhibits marked improvement, primarily due to the absence of rowdy individuals and intoxicated college students, which creates a more pleasant ambiance for patrons. In terms of flavor preferences, I tend to opt for traditional options, nothing excessively extravagant. On this occasion, I selected the citrus-inspired 'Naranja' variety, while my spouse chose the coconut-based offering, whose name escapes me at present. Suffice it to say, both flavors lived up to our expectations and were thoroughly enjoyed. Additionally, I noticed that the establishment boasts an array of stickers adorning their walls, and I felt compelled to contribute to the decor by affixing my own sticker, albeit in an unconventional manner, on the speaker."

"Serendipitously stumbling upon this culinary gem during a perambulation around our corporate edifice, I was immediately captivated by its gastronomical offerings, particularly their delectable Jambalaya, which has become my go-to item on the menu. Despite its diminutive stature, this eatery consistently attracts a copious amount of patrons, making queuing an unavoidable aspect of the dining experience. However, for those who value rich, bold flavors and are willing to endure a brief wait, this establishment truly delivers."

The pho here is not the best that I've had, but it's most likely one of the best pho restaurants on Spring Mountain. I was born and raised in San Jose which is home to the largest Vietnamese population in the country so I have a good idea on what good pho is. The single most important factor is the broth which gives it the flavor, and I'm happy to say that Kinh Do has a great pho broth.\n\nI don't care for beef too much, so I order chicken pho like I normally do and it has been great every time. The bean sprouts + basil leaves are fresh and those go well with the meal. Like I mentioned already, the broth here is awesome. The service could be better though...sometimes I have to flag down a waiter to get my water refilled.

I have been to St Francis several times and really love it but I had one dish that simply blew me away. The forbidden rice bowl-wow-flavors just explode in your mouth.
I had chicken added for protein-the dish came to the table so fresh-with perfectly cooked veggies in season, the rice was beyond tasty and the shredded chicken the perfect compliment. The real star is the sauce-delicate,aromatic, light.
I ate most of it for lunch then took home the leftover and and had a light dinner.
I never eat the same thing twice in a day but this is the type f dish I could eat weekly.
Thinking about going back soon...

"The eagerly anticipated relaunch of the former water park, now operating under new management as Wet'n'Wild water park, is mere days away, boasting an array of exhilarating thrill rides and meticulously manicured landscaping that promises to elevate the experience to unprecedented heights. As the fifth largest city in the nation, it is only fitting that Phoenix should finally host an A-List theme park worthy of its stature, especially given the abundance of such parks in Southern California. The Travel Channel's list of the top ten water parks in the US serves as a testament to the superiority of those in SoCal, and thus, it is hoped that the revamped wave pool will incorporate rolling waves akin to those found at Big Surf, rather than the previous intermittent undulations. With season passes available at a discounted rate of $59.99 prior to opening day, enthusiasts can stay informed of updates and potential opportunities to secure complimentary season passes by following the park's social media presence on Twitter and Facebook."

"Fanciful culinary indulgences are my penchant, ergo, I opted to partake in an epicurean escapade at a posh eatery on a Friday evening, craving their delectable victuals and beverages. We reserved a table and chose to sample their elaborate tasting menu, inclusive of the prized foie gras, as an additional delight. Furthermore, we elected to complement our gastronomical experience with a bottle of superior quality wine, thus elevating the cost of our repast to a considerable extent. Upon entry, a cloakroom was provided for our outerwear, which proved to be a considerate gesture. Alas, the gratuity-inclusive valet parking fee amounted to $13, which seemed somewhat incongruous with the establishment's luxurious ambiance. The comestibles presented themselves as scrumptious and visually stunning, yet they failed to surpass the lofty standards I have come to expect from such an upscale dining establishment. Our servers exhibited varying levels of proficiency; one member of the waitstaff demonstrated exceptional descriptive abilities and addresssed our queries with alacrity, while others appeared slightly less articulate in their communication, much to my chagrin, considering the importance I attach to comprehending the ingredients and preparation methods employed in the creation of my meals. Lastly, the prices for the menu items were as follows: $92 for the menu degustation, with an additional $12 per person for the foie gras degustation, and $80 for a bottle of Baron Louis red wine."
Always a great meal. The food is out of this world. One of my fave places in the East End.

Great affordable place and all the food is very fresh. I visit a lot as it is close to my house. Tried quite a few menu items but my favourites are the rare beef and brisket soup and their mixed dumplings and imperial rolls. Yum :)

This food here is pretty good. I give it 4 stars because I have had better Chinese food in other cities, but for Phoenix (which lacks quality Chinese food in general) it is actually quite good. The fried rice is OK, could be better (more fried)....it tends to be a bit more on the steamed side. The Mongolian beef is good but it's not seared/crispy the way I like it. The flavor is still very good though. The Lo Mein is quite good as well. The fried spring rolls that come with the lunch specials leave a little bit to be desired. Overall I do enjoy the food here very much. For Phoenix, it is quite good. Prices are reasonable as well. I recommend it.
I had the BBQ chicken pizza which was very good.  I think the extra topping prices are a little high and it would be nice if they had some more options but overall pretty good.

This undoubtedly constitutes a singular Las Vegas experience that every individual should endeavour to partake of at least once in their lifetime. During my most recent excursion to this city, I had the pleasure of accompanying my sibling and romantic partner to this establishment, and we were able to endure the chilly ambiance for a duration of approximately two hours. It is imperative that females attire themselves in warm, layered garments, as opposed to donning apparel that is conventionally considered fashionable or attractive, lest they succumb to the detrimental effects of the cold temperature. Conversely, males are advised to consume alcoholic beverages prior to their visit, as the potent drinks served herein may not produce the desired effects due to the extreme coolness of the environment. Despite the aforementioned factors, this venue boasts an enjoyable atmosphere and a team of accommodating personnel.

"Levant has recently commenced operations in the upscale Mint Museum edifice, situated in the vicinity of the Knight Theater's expansive outdoor screen. The establishment is under the proprietorship of the identical entrepreneurs who operate the renowned Kabob Grill. Upon visiting the venue, I was impressed by the welcoming demeanor of the staff and the scrumptious fare they served. Notably, my Kafta wrap was steaming hot and freshly prepared, and its aroma proved so enticing that it attracted colleagues from various parts of the office to investigate. The hummus boasted an unmistakable freshness, while the beef was tender, savory, and expertly spiced. Furthermore, the fries were cooked to perfection, displaying a satisfying crunchiness on the exterior and a well-balanced seasoning. I am eager to sample their offerings again, opting for the eat-in option next time. Indeed, this sector of downtown Charlotte has experienced a surge in novel dining establishments, and I extend my warmest wishes for prosperity to Levant and its neighbors."

We indulged in a culinary escapade at this recently established sandwich boutique subsequent to the recollection of its grand opening. The proximity of this novel eatery to our domicile elicited our gratitude, as we relished the opportunity to sample their offerings without the necessity of an arduous trek. Perusing preceding assessments, we anticipated a considerable delay; however, our experience contradicted such presumptions, as we merely waited a brief intervalâapproximately two minutes, which we perceived as a pleasing anomaly. Furthermore, we had the distinct pleasure of being the sole patrons present, rendering the ambiance tranquil and intimate.

My apologies for the previous response. Here's a revised version that is more concise and within the 512 token limit:

We visited this newly opened sandwich shop after recalling its debut. Its proximity to our home was welcomed, and we were pleased to find a Vietnamese sandwich shop nearby. Expecting a long wait based on previous reviews, we were surprised to be served promptly, with only a brief two-minute delay. The atmosphere was peaceful, likely due to our status as the only customers present.

I opted for the sliced pork sandwich (#7), savoring the flavorful seasoning of the meat. Fresh vegetables complemented the dish nicely. My wife chose the Mekong special (#11), and we shared bites, revealing a divergence in our preferences. While she enjoyed her sandwich more, I preferred mine, highlighting our contrasting tastes. I appreciate a meaty flavor, whereas my spouse relishes the essence of fresh produce.

Despite our varying opinions, we both relished our meals and would unquestionably return to this establishment, enthusiastically endorsing it to others.

A phenomenal Starbucks situated within an exceptional community, characterized by an amiable staff, a melodious ambiance, and an invigorating atmosphere, but slightly marred by the inconvenience of securing a parking spot.

"We were thoroughly delighted with our stay at this quaint hotel, primarily due to its prime location directly opposite the iconic Hard Rock Cafe. The accommodations were tastefully appointed, and the hospitality demonstrated by the staff was truly exceptional. While the pool area was a pleasant respite from the bustling streets of Orlando, we did encounter a minor inconvenience in the form of an absence of a pack n play, which, granted, may not be a standard amenity for establishments catering to a more adult clientele. However, we were able to procure one for the duration of our stay, albeit at an additional expense. Additionally, we appreciated the welcoming ambiance extended to our canine companion, and the culinary offerings served by the attentive waitstaff were undoubtedly a highlight of our dining experiences in the city."

What an eclectic menu for a diner!  The ambiance is just what you would expect from a classic 60's diner.  I had a ruben and some fries and it was really good!  Most places use processed corned beef.  Theirs was real sliced beef...very tender and very flavorful.  Probably the best ruben I have ever had.  I had to try the pie too since they tease you with a great display right when you walk in.  The French silk was really rich and chocolaty.  Definately worth the stop if you are in the area or passing through.

These ostensible sandwiches elicit incredulity due to their unparalleled gustatory appeal. When confronted with an untimely craving for sustenance during the wee hours of the morning, Earl's delectable offerings provide an unwavering sense of reliability. Throughout a brief sojourn in Las Vegas spanning three days, I have availed myself of Earl's culinary prowess on no less than three separate occasions (each instance undertaken while in a state of sobriety). A comprehensive evaluation of Earl's menu yielded an unequivocal endorsement of the club sandwich, whose inclusion of baconâan irresistible component, in my opinionâsecured its status as an unmitigated triumph. Furthermore, the Caribbean jerk sandwich boasted a remarkable diversity of flavors, complemented by a judicious balance of tenderness and potency that has earned it the distinction of my personal favorite. Lastly, the tomato soup, adorned with freshly baked croutons and served at an ideal viscosity, constitutes a satisfying repast for those seeking a light meal. In conclusion, Earl's provides an affordable epicurean experience characterized by freshness, quality, and above all, tantalizing taste.

Yummy! So this is what 'real corn beef hash' should look like and taste? I've only been here for breakfast, now I have to try their lunch & dinner. If you go there for breakfast, get their early or expect to wait. It's a small and popular place.

Took my buddy here the other day to nurse a hangover. Great food. Reasonably priced. Definitely did the job for us. They are open til 2pm serving breakfast. Friendly staff. They brought us pitchers of our drinks so we didn't have to chase a waitress down everytime we wanted a refill. I like that.

"Despite having never stayed in the rooms, I have had the pleasure of dining at the Grand Cafe on multiple occasions, and I must say that the quality of the culinary offerings is exceptional, particularly given the reasonable prices and generous portion sizes. Although I am not typically a fan of buffets, I have indulged in the spread at this establishment on several instances, and I have yet to encounter any issues with the variety or freshness of the dishes. It is worth mentioning that as a holder of a Players Card, I have been able to take advantage of advantageous deals, which has further enhanced my overall experience. Unfortunately, like many other gaming establishments in Las Vegas, the atmosphere within the casino can be somewhat hazy due to the ubiquity of cigarette smoke, which seems to permeate every corner of the facility; however, this is a minor drawback considering the otherwise excellent amenities and services offered. Speaking of services, I have noticed that locating assistance can sometimes be a challenge, likely due to the lingering effects of recent budget cuts; nevertheless, a helpful hint for fellow patrons would be to seek out the individuals clad in suits and sporting badges, as they tend to be especially helpful and knowledgeable. Lastly, it is worth mentioning that Station Casinos appear to hold a special affinity for local clientele, which is certainly appreciated."

"Our sextet collectively partook of an assortment of delectable victuals, specifically, duck fat fries, meatballs, pork belly, mussels, pappardelle, lamb carpaccio, dates, octopus, beets, porchetta, guinea fowl. Additionally, we indulged in a variety of sweet treats, including cheesecake, custard bread pudding, and port tawny for dessert. The consensus among our group was that the duck fat fries, pork belly, and dates were the most exceptional offerings, with the latter two dishes being particularly noteworthy. However, the remaining items were generally well-received, with the sole exception of the lamb, which unfortunately lacked both texture and flavor and was also excessively expensive. Our server provided commendable assistance throughout the meal, suggesting a wine pairing that greatly complemented the cuisine. The total cost for our repast, inclusive of numerous libations and dessert, approximated $300.00, which we considered reasonable given the quality of the culinary experience. We would unquestionably return to this establishment in the future."

"A Dual Review of The Mill: An Authentic and Innovative Hub of Commerce and Culture

The Mill, an establishment that exudes an air of unpretentious sophistication, warrants a five-star rating on Yelp for its sheer coolness factor alone. While it has yet to fully realize its potential, this multifaceted venue boasts an array of captivating features that make it a standout destination. Allow me to elaborate on the aspects that render The Mill a truly singular experience.

First and foremost, Big Ben British Pub, with its inviting ambiance and impressive selection of libations, is a veritable gem within The Mill's diverse landscape. Next, Zucca Pizza, a culinary masterpiece that artfully blends traditional Italian flavors with modern twists, is sure to leave even the most discerning palates thoroughly satisfied. Lastly, Savory Spice, a shop specializing in gourmet spices and seasonings, offers an unparalleled opportunity to explore the realm of flavor enhancement. The Mill's art gallery space, expertly curated by Mr. Elder, showcases works of art that are both visually stunning and thought-provoking, further solidifying The Mill's reputation as a hub of creativity and innovation. 

While the market area, though aesthetically pleasing, falls somewhat short of expectations due to the infrequent attendance of vendors during weekdays, it remains a worthwhile venture for those seeking unique and artisanal goods. Of the few vendors that I had the pleasure of encountering, Pickleville, with its delectable assortment of pickled delights, stood out as a personal favorite, closely followed by Cloister Honey and Simply Local, the latter of which offered an assortment of mouthwatering chocolate bars from esteemed establishments such as Uncle Scott Root Beer, Black Mountain Chocolate, and Escazu. Additionally, the muscadine juices available at Simply Local, although not without merit, fell somewhat short of excellence, leaving room for improvement in terms of flavor profile. 

In conclusion, The Mill, with its eclectic mix of eateries, shops, and galleries, has the potential to become a true icon of modernity and culture, provided that it continues to build upon its existing strengths and addresses areas of improvement."

"An exceptional ambiance, courtesy of the establishment's French maÃ®tre d', permeates the dining area, thereby creating a hospitable environment that, in conjunction with the restaurant's fixed menu offering excellent value, fosters a sense of loyalty among its clientele, resulting in a high frequency of return visits; however, it is advisable to secure reservations in advance, as the venue tends to be quite popular and therefore often reaches capacity."
My wife and I had breakfast here while staying at the Wigwam. The coffee was great. We both ordered omelets which were good sized and packed with ingredients. Very tasty and a good atmosphere.

"This establishment serves as an optimal destination for individuals who derive pleasure from observing artistic creations, while also providing an adequate learning environment for students like myself, who are required to familiarize themselves with the subject matter as part of their academic curriculum. \n\nThe gallery in question stood out as particularly captivating due to its electrifying exhibition, despite my lack of comprehension regarding the underlying conceptual framework. Nonetheless, I thoroughly enjoyed my visit and managed to capture some remarkable photographs, thereby rendering the excursion well worth the time and effort invested."

"We partook in a delectable morning meal at this esteemed establishment today, and I must say that the culinary offerings were of exceptional quality, as per usual. Our hospitable server, Brady, provided attentive and unobtrusive service, ensuring that our dining experience was optimized without interrupting our conversational endeavors. Kudos to Brady for his commendable performance!"

"On a solitary occasion, I have partaken of a culinary experience at this establishment, and my sentiments regarding the venue are favorable. My gastronomical exploits encompassed the consumption of a Thai Peanut sandwich, accompanied by a bowl of tomato basil soup. My palate found the former to be delectable, while my expectations for the latter were surpassed, in contradistinction to the opinions voiced by a previous patron. The comestibles served within these walls are of superior quality, and the visually arresting exterior has captured my attention, impelling me to venture forth and explore the interior. It is not uncommon for me to frequent Paradise Bakery or Firehouse Subs when in close proximity to this location; however, the vibrant and striking illumination emanating from this edifice has captivated my attention and enticed me to investigate its offerings."

Ambiance: Excellent
Room: Excellent
Service/Concierge: Excellent
Parking: Reasonable
Location: Excellent
One can get a good price for this place if planning properly. The location is good but could be better its a short  walk to the main shopping area and restaurants area. There is plenty of parking and the service is great as always with the Delta Chain of hotels. You can park on the street if you want but I would be wary considering what I have seen in Montreal Downtown. We were upgraded to the Signature Club room which allows you access to the Signature Lounge.Continental breakfast and complimentary hors d'oeuvre are served in the Lounge. Great for someone like me who wants a quick coffee fix. Being a Delta Hotel fan I would recommend it any day. This hotel can get busy and sometimes you have a rowdy crowd so I would recommend a higher floor if you can manage it.

"For individuals possessing a substantial craving for consumables and a particular fondness for flesh-based dishes, this establishment may prove to be a suitable venue. A diverse array of leafy greens, vegetables, and seafood comprise the salad bar, including artichokes, caprese salad, calamari salad, et cetera, serving as a delectable complement to the primary course. I opted for the seafood platter, featuring shrimp, scallops, grilled salmon, and what was described as 'tempura' cod. Unfortunately, the salmon exhibited a certain degree of dryness, while the cod was somewhat overwhelmed by oiliness; however, the shrimp and bacon-wrapped scallops demonstrated a satisfying level of culinary excellence. A recommendation for the seafood platter would not be forthcoming from my person. \n\nIn contrast, my male companion chose the all-you-can-consume meat option, a decision that ultimately proved to be the superior selection. An assortment of lamb, sirloin, chicken, and other meats were available, each one showcasing its unique characteristics and flavors. Particularly noteworthy was the lamb accompanied by a balsamic reduction, boasting exceptional tenderness and flavor. Likewise, my companion greatly enjoyed the spicy chicken, its succulent texture and delicious taste leaving a lasting impression. By leveraging the Tix4tonite promotion ($24), we were able to realize significant economic benefits."

"The opulent lodging and expansive accommodations provided an unparalleled level of comfort and luxury, particularly during the festive season. Upon arriving on Christmas Eve, we were presented with a generous offer, inclusive of a personalized letter and two premium tickets to Le Reve, in addition to two sumptuous buffets. The package was offered at a discounted rate of $299.00 for a two-night stay, which we eagerly accepted. However, we were dismayed by the imposition of a resort fee, despite not utilizing any additional amenities beyond internet access. Furthermore, we encountered a minor inconvenience regarding the cleanliness of our quarters, although the remainder of our stay was largely satisfactory. Notably, my partner was delighted to discover her name prominently displayed on the television screen, contributing to the overall ambiance of the suite. Unfortunately, we experienced a malfunction with the air conditioning, resulting in an inadequate cooling effect in the bedroom area, prompting us to sleep au naturel due to the oppressive heat."

"Prodigious cake segments. Diversified array of macaroons. However, I perceived the almond croissant to be excessively saccharine. Despite my profound affection for confectionaries, I found it arduous to consume the minuscule portion due to its cloying sweetness. In contrast, the almond croissant obtained from La Belle Terre exhibited a markedly superior quality."

"I had the pleasure of partaking in a morning repast at this esteemed establishment on a recent day, and I must say that the culinary offerings were quite satisfactory and the hospitality received from the staff was of an exceptionally high quality, marked by promptness and efficiency; thus, I would rate the gastronomical experience as a 4 on a scale of 1 to 5, with 5 being the highest rating, and the service as a perfect 5, also on a scale of 1 to 5, with 5 being the highest rating, which would subsequently yield an overall rating of 4.5, alas, due to the inherent limitations of the rating system, it would be rounded down to a 4, but rest assured that the actual experience was indeed closer to the higher rating."

This constitutes a remarkable revelation in the South Side, deviating from the conventional establishments synonymous with the region. It boasts an unparalleled culinary experience, one that defies expectations and transcends the customary fare associated with such venues. Moreover, this eatery proudly offers a smoke-free environment, further enhancing its appeal and rendering it an even more desirable destination. Thus, I strongly advise paying a visit to sample their delectable sliders on your next venture into the vicinity.

I must give it up for Wolfman. As a former resident of California, their pizza is no more "California" than is Taco Bell, but I imagine they're going for the comparison to California Pizza Kitchen.

We love the White Wolf. I also enjoy the pizza with the chicken, spinach and fine herbs. The crusts walk that line between thick and thin very well. I know that folks have crust preferences (NY style, Chicago style, etc), but this might be a crust which embraces all pizza eaters.

The appetizers are great for handling a very hungry table anxiously waiting for the pizza, though not really all that memorable. 

The individual-sized salads are really enough for two to split, and the large size could serve three or more. If it is just the two of you, ask for the individual size and an extra plate, along with the dressing on the side (they often have a pretty heavy hand with the dressing).

NIce folks serving, though the speed of delivery of the food can vary with no discernible reason (e.g., restaurant not really busy, off-peak time, etc). Good selection of beers, and some nightly specials (check their website for details of that night's deal). Seating available outside, which can be a nice touch on a good evening.

This establishment boasts an expansive outdoor seating area, colloquially referred to as a patio, which is complemented by an extensive array of artisanal beers, commonly known as microbrews. My affection for the layout of this venue is twofold, as it encompasses both a spacious front and back patio, the latter of which is conveniently designed to accommodate canine companions. The rear patio's configuration is particularly noteworthy, offering a picturesque view of Camelback Mountain and showcasing a unique bicycle-themed decorative element in the form of tire fans. Our visit on Father's Day coincided with their BBQ Sunday special, which proved to be a culinary delight, characterized by generous portions. The service we received was exemplary, as the staff exhibited warmth and attention to detail, with our server providing insightful recommendations that did not disappoint. My enthusiasm for this establishment is such that I eagerly anticipate future visits.

"An exceptional setting for a nuptial celebration, this venue boasts a charming chapel replete with historic charm and character, rendering it an ideal choice for couples seeking a non-traditional, yet undeniably romantic backdrop for their special day. Furthermore, its central location between midtown and uptown districts ensures convenience for guests hailing from diverse areas of the city, while the picturesque garden and gazebo provide an idyllic setting for capturing unforgettable wedding photographs."

This show is different from every other Cirque du Soleil show I've ever seen.  Be prepared - this is an adult show with nudity and very adult themes.  There were a few uncomfortable moments with the performances, but on the whole, it's still a very visually stunning show.  As always, the costumes are incredible.  The music is perfect.  The acts are all very inventive and the performers are amazing.  \nSimple words of warning - Don't bring your parents or grandparents.

"An exceptional and diminutive Cambodian eatery in Phoenix, offering an extensive array of culinary delights and hospitable service. The interior boasts a meticulous and alluring ambiance, replete with Cambodian ornamentation and literature conveniently positioned on each table for perusal during one's dining experience. A fusion of Thai and Vietnamese gastronomy, this establishment proffer a novel epicurean adventure. My palate was delightfully satiated by the savory Loat Cha noodles, complemented by tender beef and eggs. However, the serving size proved to be somewhat disappointing, given the tariff. As a sweet finale, I sampled the corn, a delectable ear of maize enrobed in a saccharine and fish-sauce infused glaze, rendering it a scrumptious deviation from customary dessert fare. Notwithstanding, the venue presented a minor challenge in terms of wayfinding, as the moniker of the restaurant was inconspicuously positioned laterally to the edifice, while the entry point was obscured by an adjacent mechanical workshop."

We availed ourselves of a Groupon for my spouse and myself, which enabled us to indulge in a therapeutic massage and detoxification treatment, and we thoroughly enjoyed the experience, with the exception of a minor issue regarding communication pertaining to the intensity of the massage; however, the staff was accommodating and responsive to our needs, ensuring that we felt pampered and rejuvenated upon departure. The comprehensive massage encompassed our head, neck, shoulder, arm, foot, and leg regions, culminating in an overall satisfaction with the service rendered.

My roommate and I decided to momentarily abandon our stringent dietary restrictions today, indulging in an unapologetic craving for Thai cuisine, and we were utterly delighted that we did so, as the culinary experience was nothing short of exceptional. The eatery we patronized was remarkably tranquil this evening, a characteristic commonly attributed to many downtown establishments on Monday nights, thereby allowing us to receive prompt and attentive service. I opted for the delectable swimming rama, a dish comprising beef immersed in a rich peanut sauce, served atop a bed of expertly steamed vegetables; the flavors were undoubtedly tantalizing, and I would unquestionably order it again in the future. My roommate, on the other hand, selected the fiery pad pik sod, a dish boasting a medley of colorful vegetables and jalapeÃ±os, complemented by succulent chicken; although the spiciness was somewhat intense, the sheer depth of flavor was truly remarkable. Both of us relished every bite, leaving not a single morsel uneaten, and joining the esteemed ranks of the clean plate club. Our fellow diners opted for the mouthwatering yellow chicken curry and tom yum soup, their visual appeal being nothing short of stunning. The ambiance of the restaurant was open and pristine, albeit slightly lacking in character. Prices were eminently reasonable, ranging from $10 to $15 for the majority of dishes. While my entrÃ©e undoubtedly satiated my hunger, the allure of the other dishes was impossible to ignore, compelling me to consider exploring alternative options during my subsequent visit; however, for now, I must regretfully return to my rigid dietary regimen.

"This eatery exudes an ambiance of culinary excellence, boasting generous serving sizes and a consistent quality that is reminiscent of traditional Hawaiian cuisine. Particularly noteworthy are the mixed plate and Katsu/Teri beef combination, both of which are served alongside a delectable macaroni salad. Although one cannot help but ponder the proprietorship of this establishment, speculating whether the owner is a local or simply purchased the franchise, the fact remains that the fare served here serves as an authentic representation of the gastronomical delights one would expect to find in the Aloha State."

I have had their Brisket on several occasions, pretty good stuff, I am a BBQ fanatic, if I like it, you may love it, I have tried BBQ from some of the best cooks in the world... that being said, this stuff is pretty damn good... try it for yourself

"Optimize your culinary experience by indulging in a delectable croissant accompanied by an expertly brewed coffee, all while luxuriating in the welcoming ambiance of this charming establishment. With its extensive selection of mouthwatering pastries and baked goods, this cozy cafÃ© has the potential to supplant our beloved Ellefsen as the go-to destination for satisfying our morning cravings. Conveniently located in Ahuntsic, this eatery enjoys a steady stream of customers during the week, but it's during the weekends that the crowds truly flock to savor their renowned brunch offerings, freshly baked bread, and assorted sweet treats."

"This serves as an augmented rendition of the previous assessment, wherein the latter review's effusive praise is now supplanted by an even more emphatic expression of gratitude towards the exceptional customer service proffered by the drive-thru staff, specifically that of Guillermo, whose remarkable efficiency in expediting my repast was so conspicuous as to warrant unstinting commendation, thereby setting a new standard against which all future dining experiences shall be measured; this laudatory account was recorded on November 15th, 2013, at 6:42 p.m., and it stands as a testament to Del Taco's steadfast commitment to excellence in the realm of fast food service."
The Kona coffee is a personal favorite for my coffee for my hubby.  We love the banana crepes and Monte Cristo.  I also love the Chicken strip salad!

Whenever we go to a Coyotes game or a concert @ Jobing.com Arena, we stop by this location to grab some grub and pre-game Brewskies.  If you plan to come here pre-game, be prepared for a long wait.  We average 30-45 min every time we come here before a game.

What can I say about Yard House that hasn't already been said?  I love their Beer selection and food.

My favorite dish is of course the Sliders ($10.85).  When they have it, I get the Green Flash IPA ($7) to wash it down.

Overall, it's a great place to be just before a Coyotes game.

Return Factor - 90%

"Would have garnered a perfect five-star rating if the waiting period and service quality had been more satisfactory, thereby aligning with the exceptional culinary standards set by the restaurant's creative farm-to-table fare, particularly in regards to the mouthwatering fried sage fried chicken and the delectable chicken and waffles dish, which undoubtedly showcased the establishment's commitment to innovative gastronomy."

I'm here a few times a week with my dog (the large dog side). Considering the craziness that takes place at most dog parks this one is pretty relaxed. Most of the dog owners here are pretty responsible here handling their dogs and cleaning up after them. It's super convenient and has a lot of space for all the large dogs.

"In the proximity of the Phoenix area, there are numerous exceptional eateries that offer an array of delectable cuisines, and as a Chinese student, I would like to highlight the Szechwan palace as an exemplary representation of genuine Chinese gastronomy. During my visit, I opted for the Mopo Tofu, Chongqing Hotpot, and Boiled beef and fish, all of which were characterized by an intense spiciness that I thoroughly relished."

After a day traveling around Edinburgh, Wings was the perfect snack to fill my American wing-loving desires. Good atmosphere. They had a movie marathon going on downstairs. Service was pretty good too. I had a magner's and dancing in the bleu flame (hot bleu cheese)! I'll be coming back sooner rather than later! :)

The people working at this store are awesome- they remembered me the both times I went in.  I will drive to this Autozone over the others because they are so friendly.  There was a line both times, but with the summer heat in AZ, a lot of people needed new batteries.  Bottom line- great Autozone!

Now that I have had the opportunity to slumber on the floor of this terminal, I feel an intrinsic bond with my surroundings.

The advantages of this establishment are as follows:

1. Complimentary wireless internet! I am currently utilizing it to convey my thoughts.
2. The atmosphere is now devoid of smoke, a welcome alteration.

However, there are some drawbacks to consider:

1. By design, airports are intended to be uncomfortable, a deliberate attempt to encourage travelers to expedite their departure.
2. I am perplexed by the ubiquity of the Wheel of Fortune slot machine, which seems to pursue me relentlessly. Why does it persist in its pursuit?

After a duration of 12 hours, I find myself yearning for a potted plant, any potted plant that might provide a modicum of solace. In the future, enlightened airports will feature botanical gardens, alleviating the stress associated with air travel and creating a more hospitable environment for those who find themselves waylaid. Until then, I shall continue to appreciate the benefits of smoke-free airports, despite the occasional inconvenience caused by the callous treatment of luggage by airlines.

If it were not for an encounter with Yelptern Izzy D and a serendipitous convergence at a thoroughfare evocative of Monroe, I might have indefinitely overlooked this establishment. How fortunate that I did not, for my culinary explorations have led me to discover a truly captivating venue. Although I have yet to indulge in their gastronomical offerings, rest assured that I shall partake in their delectable victuals forthwith and provide a comprehensive assessment. In the interim, allow me to extol the virtues of the interior design, which exudes a tranquil ambiance that belies its quirky eccentricity. The space is segregated into two distinct areas, with the entrance boasting a livelier atmosphere that I find particularly appealing due to its unconventional furniture arrangement. The staff members are graciously hospitable, eager to share their knowledge, and refreshingly unhurried in their approach to customer service. As for the coffee, it is quite satisfactory. 
Additionally, this edifice boasts a unique feature that sets it apart from other establishments: live musical performances every evening from 5 to 6 o'clock, as advertised by both their signage and staff. While I have yet to experience these melodic offerings firsthand, I remain optimistic about the prospect of savoring delectable delights accompanied by harmonious sounds. Shall we proceed to explore this enticing destination together, dear companion?

"Recently, a comprehensive renovation has been conducted, resulting in an efficiently designed floor plan that seamlessly facilitates user navigation and optimizes spatial functionality, thereby creating a highly effective and well-flowing layout. Furthermore, a designated area for well-behaved children and those who may require additional attention has been strategically positioned on the opposite side of the building, effectively separating it from the primary library space and minimizing potential disruptions. This thoughtful design element can be attributed to the genius of the architects and planners responsible for the project."

"I possess a predilection for Firebirds, an establishment that ostensibly embodies the quintessence of culinary excellence and atmospheric ambiance. Perching atop my expectations, the eatery's delectable fare and hospitable staff never fail to impress, with the exception of a singular grievance pertaining to the manner in which my victuals are conveyed to my person. Specifically, I implore the servers to refrain from digitally violating my repast with their thumbs, instead opting for the utilization of a tray, thus ensuring an untarnished dining experience. Furthermore, I must commend the proprietors on their judicious selection of a new venue, which boasts an aesthetic grandeur that rivals the gastronomical splendor of the edibles served within."

"The culinary offerings at this establishment are truly singular and tantalizing, representing a creative synthesis of Mexican and Chinese gastronomic traditions. It is imperative to sample the fare in order to fully appreciate its delectability, as the combination of flavors and ingredients results in a truly unparalleled epicurean experience. Furthermore, the ambiance is relaxed and conducive to enjoying a leisurely repast, allowing patrons to savor their meals in a tranquil setting while perhaps even partaking in a glass of vinous beverage, thereby enhancing the overall enjoyment of the dining experience."

"Although the quality of the food does not quite compare to the exceptionally high standards set by Persian Room, the restaurant still manages to deliver a satisfying dining experience, primarily due to the impressive tenderness and flavor of their meat dishes, which are consistently cooked to perfection and served with a generous portion size that more than justifies the moderate price point. Furthermore, the friendly and attentive service staff ensures that all patrons feel welcome and well taken care of throughout their meal, making for an overall enjoyable dining experience. Additionally, the establishment boasts an extensive selection of hookah flavors, which are expertly prepared and maintained by the knowledgeable and accommodating hookah attendants, who regularly replace used charcoal and ensure that each hookah is properly cleaned and functioning at optimal levels. Moreover, the venue occasionally hosts live musical performances, adding an extra layer of entertainment and ambiance to the already pleasant atmosphere. Lastly, the beverages offered on the menu are likewise notable for their rich flavors and refreshing qualities, providing the perfect complement to the delectable cuisine and lively setting."

Call it in a head of time. There's always a line and its not fast service by any means. Inside is kind of cramped and outside seating is very limited. Customer service is not where they excel, but I've gotten over it. Getting in and out of the parking lot is always entertaining but well worth all the hassle. \n\nThey have a lot of different pasta salads in their deli case that you can get by the pound, perfect to go along with your sandwich and so far all that I've tried have been delicious.

Pasand, a culinary establishment previously known for its mediocre offerings, has recently undergone a transformation under new proprietorship, and my expectations for a familiar dining experience were pleasantly subverted during my visit. The fare provided was of exceptional quality, showcasing a remarkable improvement from its predecessor, with spices that were not only more pronounced but also fresher, resulting in a heightened gastronomic delight. Furthermore, the proprietors disclosed their intentions to renovate the interior of the establishment, as well as expand their buffet options, which, in my opinion, will further enhance the overall dining experience. Thus, I wholeheartedly endorse the changes implemented at Pasand, particularly the marked improvement in the cuisine.

I recently had the pleasure of partaking in a culinary excursion to this establishment, and I must say that my experience was quite satisfactory. Upon entering the premises, I was greeted by a team of hospitable staff members who exhibited a high level of proficiency in their customer service skills. The speed at which my order was fulfilled was quite impressive, as it was executed with utmost efficiency and expediency. As for the cuisine, I must admit that it was reminiscent of a traditional barbecue restaurant, with the ribs being the highlight of the meal. The taste was authentic, with a subtle smokiness that permeated each bite, complemented by a dry rub that added a delightful depth of flavor. However, I must confess that I am partial to a more tangy and unctuous variety of ribs, as the ones served here were slightly leaner than my personal preference. Moving on to the cornbread, it was adequate, but not particularly memorable. Lastly, I must mention that the hot sauce provided was somewhat overpowering, as it dominated the palate and left little room for the natural flavors of the meat to shine through. In conclusion, while there were some minor shortcomings, my visit was generally enjoyable, and I would still recommend this eatery to anyone seeking a satisfying barbecue experience in the South Side area. Moreover, I implore potential patrons to support this establishment during their lunch hours, as it appeared to be rather deserted during my visit.

I dined here on Monday 04/29. I ordered the Korean steak tacos, they were ok but nothing special. The vanilla bean cheesecake however was good. The waitress young lady long blond hair, was very good and attentive.

"Freed's Bakery facilitated the process of procuring a personalized cake with remarkable efficiency, ensuring a seamless experience for us. It was merely a week prior to our excursion to Las Vegas, where we would be commemorating a milestone birthday. Their culinary masterpiece, a delectable red velvet cake, was not only expertly crafted but also delivered promptly to the restaurant, sans any inconvenience or complications. We opted for a red velvet cake adorned with Irish Bailey filling and buttercream frosting, which proved to be an unparalleled gastronomical delight, as its profound moistness induced an unbridled craving among the group of us, ultimately leading to its rapid consumption. Our sincere gratitude extends to Freed's Bakery for their exceptional service and commitment to excellence."

Best Wishes is another of those alternative, independent gift shops which are very popular in Edinburgh.
