It sells all sorts, including artsy cards, funky wrapping paper, jewellery, trinkets, make up, and toys which are all excellent stocking filler gifts or something small to give as a birthday present. The gifts are not the cheapest around but they are good quality and the cards are very original, think Clinton's but actually good. \n\nThe store is well laid out, making it easy to find what you are looking for which for me is a huge help, seeing as I often get lost in these type of shops, and end up buried under hundreds of little accessories or being attacked by care bears. The owner was exceptionally helpful as well, offering to wrap everything, and was a cheerful person to have a chat to.

"My ardent desire is to confer a perfect quintet of stellar ratings upon this culinary establishment, as it has consistently demonstrated a laudable proficiency in providing delectable fare at reasonable tariffs, while fostering a welcoming ambiance that facilitates a convivial rapport between patrons and staff. However, I find myself reluctant to bestow the full complement of five stars, due to a singular yet salient shortcoming that unfortunately compromises my dining experience. Specifically, the presence of employees partaking in noxious nicotine fumes outside the premises, subsequent to preparing my plant-based victuals, engenders an unsettling sense of dissonance that sadly precludes me from extending the highest rating. Such a state of affairs strikes me as analogous to a comedic sketch on Saturday Night Live, wherein the incongruity of smoking and cooking in a vegan eatery would serve as the central theme."

"A recently established nail salon in the vicinity of Villeray, boasting a spacious and well-appointed interior, pristine cleanliness, and an inviting ambiance. A diverse array of color options is available for selection (including renowned brands such as OPI, Essie, and Shellac), catering to the preferences of a broad clientele. Furthermore, the salon offers a discount of 15% for students and seniors on Mondays and Tuesdays, rendering their services even more accessible and affordable. Notably, their prices are highly competitive, even in the absence of said discount."

I adore this place! It is always packed and the service is wonderful. This is my 3rd visit in 2 months; the portions are huge, the options are endless and the waitstaff is knowledgeable. My only advice is not to order any of the steak menu items. The sirloin was fatty and just bad (one star subtraction). Everything else I have had from sushi to chicken to shrimp has been off the charts delicious and fresh. Grab a few friends, get the sushi boat and prepared to be blown away. A hidden gem that is in our regular rotation. CHECK IT OUT!!!

This eatery proved to be remarkably superior to my expectations, given its unassuming appearance. Arriving at approximately 10:40 a.m., I opted to pay for the morning repast, but was pleasantly surprised to receive both breakfast and lunch, courtesy of their generous policy during the transition period. Of particular note were the savory beef sausages, which differed significantly from the customary breakfast links, and the delectable flank steak. Additionally, the Mexican rice deserves high praise for its flavorfulness. Considering the exceptional quality of the cuisine, the prices are truly unbeatable.

"The morning repast menu boasts an exceptional array of delectable options, catering to the diverse tastes of its patrons. Our party of nine was accommodated with celerity, and the hospitality we received was of the highest quality. This eatery unquestionably warrants a revisit, whether for a casual brunch encounter or a momentous celebration."

"On the occasion of my second stay at the Aria, which transpired during the festive season of New Year's Eve, it came to my attention that the table limits had experienced a notable increase. Although this elevation in minimum bets served to deter throngs of people, it simultaneously presented an obstacle for me, as I was reluctant to engage in a game of Roulette with $5 chips, especially during the early afternoon hours. Notwithstanding the fact that it was a holiday weekend, I managed to locate tables at MGM that offered betting limits of $10, even during the evening hours. 

While the lodging facilities at Aria were pleasant, they did not compare to the accommodations I had previously enjoyed at MGM Grand, which boasted a superior level of luxury. Unfortunately, my stay at Aria was marred by several inconveniences. Specifically, the minibar refrigerator proved to be non-functional throughout the entire weekend, resulting in warm beverages. Moreover, upon returning to my quarters after an extended absence of seven hours, I discovered that the room had not been attended to, with uncollected room service and an unkempt environment. Following a prolonged delay, a staff member was dispatched to address the situation, yet they failed to restock the water bottles. Subsequently, I was compelled to contact the hotel's room service to request water, resulting in an exorbitant charge of $30 per bottle, in contrast to the $10 fee associated with the minibar. This series of events proved to be vexing. 

Despite these setbacks, the sleeping accommodations at Aria were exceptionally comfortable. Additionally, the casino itself was visually appealing and attracted a clientele with refined tastes. Nonetheless, my preference remains with MGM Grand, where I have yet to encounter such peculiar issues and enjoy a superior quality of accommodations."

"Okay, I'm not going to feign indifference towards visiting this establishment; in fact, I thoroughly enjoy patronizing this restaurant due to its exceptional service, captivating ambiance, and the manager's authentic Italian heritage. However, I must express my disappointment regarding the quality of food, which, although delectable, falls short of my expectations when compared to other culinary experiences in Charlotte. This deficiency can be attributed to the inferior quality of the local water supply. Notwithstanding, the grilled octopus stands out as the premier item on the menu, unrivaled in its flavor and texture."

Great service. The food was awesome we order a royal Hawaiian pizza, cheese bread (looks like and is the same size as their pizzas), roasted chicken w/pesto dish. All the food had great flavors, the only thing I would change was the ventilation of the restaurant the fire wood scent was very strong, other than that I'd say it was overall a great place.

"Buffalo chicken wings constitute one of my primary culinary categories, and my profound affection for them is exemplified by my unwavering quest for an equivalent experience outside of the Southwest region, specifically in Arizona where I previously resided. The harmonious balance of piquancy, warmth, and tanginess in each wing is what renders them flawless, and my exposure to the exceptional quality offered by NNY has unfortunately elevated my standards to an unattainable level, making it arduous to discover a comparable alternative despite my numerous attempts to do so. Notwithstanding my enthusiasm for diverse culinary options, my infatuation with Buffalo wings remains steadfast, and I exploit any opportunity to visit my family in Arizona, principally to indulge in NNY's delectable fare and exceptional service that has consistently met my expectations throughout my visits."

I don't get haircuts often. That being said I enjoyed miniBar Ber Shop. Its a little more modern than my tastes, but after a few beers I couldn't care less. And yes, beers at the barber....INGENIOUS! 

Boris gave me a trim and shaved off my beard. We gabbed about raising kids, and going on vacation, and how generally awful we both think New York can be. After I was done I had a couple more beers. Hey its almost noon and I'm on vacation.

PS the girl at the front desk is c-u-t-e.

I came here last time I was in Vegas, and I came back again cause it is that good!! I don't actually eat burgers lol, so my review is really focusing on the milk shakes.  I've had the mother fluffer both times I came now and it is so freaking delicious.  My husband had the lunch box milkshake and he loved it too.

I had the Caesar salad for actually food - it was good, nothing unbelievable.  My husband had the classic burger and also said it was good but not the best ever.

The milk shakes are so good though, and so are the fries, so go for those and you will be happy!!

It is an exceptional cinema. Why, you might ask? Well, let me elucidate. Firstly, the premises are immaculately maintained, creating a welcoming ambiance for movie enthusiasts. Secondly, the staff exudes warmth and friendliness, with a particular employee, formerly of Taco Bell fame, now gracing the establishment with his presence. Thirdly, the temperature within the theater is pleasantly cool, ensuring a comfortable viewing experience for patrons. Fourthly, the screens are impressively large, further enhancing the cinematic enjoyment. Fifthly, the chairs are not only expansive but also luxuriously soft, providing optimal comfort for an extended period. Sixthly, the stadium seating design grants an unobstructed view from any seat, elevating the movie-going experience. Seventhly, the theater's relatively low attendance can be seen as both a positive and negative aspect, depending on one's perspective. Lastly, with 24 screens available, it is highly likely that the desired film will be showing at the preferred time, eliminating the need for prolonged waiting periods. Additionally, parking validation is offered in the adjacent AZ Center garage, rendering the overall experience even more convenient. Therefore, my preference for this cinema is unequivocal.

"Coffee aficionado here, with an unwavering predilection for the beverage that has persisted for a remarkable four years and continues to thrive. My ardor for coffee remains an enigma, as I am unable to pinpoint the impetus behind my initial fascination with the brew. However, I must extend copious accolades to this establishment, as their coffee is truly exceptional.

My recent visit afforded me the opportunity to sample their exemplary fare, including a standard cup of joe, complemented by a complimentary chocolate-coated coffee bean. My companion opted for a Rockstar infused with fruit punch, which, despite its seemingly superfluous nature, given the ready availability of fruit punch Rockstars at local retailers, proved to be quite palatable.

Additional advantages of this venue include a double drive-through system, prices that are considerably lower than those of Starbucks, and a staff whose cordiality is nothing short of extraordinary. Unfortunately, the sole drawback that precludes me from conferring a perfect five-star rating is the menu's overwhelming complexity, boasting an excessive number of options that can be daunting for patrons. A potential solution to this issue could involve streamlining the menu or increasing the font size to enhance readability.

In conclusion, I can confidently endorse this establishment, enthusiastically urging coffee connoisseurs and devotees of novel beverages to give it a try."

When we arrived at the Senor Taco in Fountain Hills, situated within a dilapidated strip mall behind a Circle K, the initial aspect that caught my attention was the plethora of trucks populating the parking lot, which, albeit limited in size, was brimming with large trucks adorned with an array of construction-related tools and equipment. This sight instilled within me a sense of optimism, leading me to surmise that the establishment was likely to serve quality cuisine.

Upon entering the restaurant, we were greeted by a recently renovated interior, characterized by spotless formica booths and shiny tile floors, although the ambiance remained relatively unremarkable. Customers are required to place their orders at the cashier or utilize the drive-thru window, following which their meals are prepared and ready for collection within a mere five minutes. The prices, in my opinion, are one of the primary draws of this eatery, as they are eminently reasonable and affordable for the majority of patrons.

We opted to sample the fish taco plate, which consisted of two generously proportioned tacos enveloped in fresh corn tortillas, complemented by an abundance of crisp cabbage and rich, creamy crema. Although the rice and beans accompanying the dish were undeniably delectable, they were regrettably not served at a sufficiently high temperature, thereby precluding them from attaining a perfect rating. Notwithstanding this minor shortcoming, my spouse and I were able to share a single platter for the modest sum of $6.99, a price point that strikes me as remarkably reasonable.

Furthermore, the diverse array of authentic Mexican flavors available at this establishment is certain to appeal to aficionados of the cuisine. The prices, while not exorbitant, are sufficient to ensure that the restaurant remains profitable, and the clientele appears to comprise primarily individuals who genuinely appreciate and understand the nuances of Mexican cooking.

A self-serve salsa bar, replete with an assortment of customary salsas, as well as my personal favorite, pickled carrots and fresh radishes, further enhances the dining experience. While the ambiance may not be particularly refined, the eatery's focus on providing rapid, economical, and delectable sustenance renders it an excellent choice for those seeking a satisfying meal without breaking the bank.

"A veritable cornucopia of gastronomical delights, this esteemed eatery boasts an impressive array of delectable dishes, including but not limited to, an extensive selection of pasta classics such as squid ink fettuccine and pesto crafted from only the freshest basil, thereby imbuing said pasta dishes with an unparalleled depth of flavor. Furthermore, a meticulously curated wine list, replete with an assortment of exquisite vintages, serves to complement and enhance the overall epicurean experience. Notwithstanding the aforementioned, a dearth of beer options does not detract from the establishment's reputation as a culinary gem, as a diverse array of scalopini, soups, and fresh seafood offerings round out the menu, thereby catering to discerning palates. Moreover, the staff, both cordial and proficient in their duties, contribute significantly to the welcoming ambiance, ensuring that patrons feel at home and well taken care of throughout the duration of their visit. In conclusion, a return visit is not only warranted but indeed, eagerly anticipated."

"I visited this establishment with the intention of indulging in their steak and eggs, which were advertised at a price point of $3.99. However, upon perusing the menu, I noticed that the actual cost was $4.49, a discrepancy that, while minor, was somewhat vexing. Furthermore, the quality of the customer service was subpar, as the staff appeared to be perpetually irritated. Notwithstanding these issues, the steak itself was rather satisfying, boasting an abundance of flavor despite being somewhat marred by an excess of gristle and fat. When offered the option between toast or biscuit in gravy, I would advise selecting the former, as the latter tends to be unpleasantly cold and the gravy has a suspiciously canned quality. In conclusion, while not without its flaws, this restaurant provides a sufficient quantity of sustenance at a reasonable price, making it a viable choice for those operating within a limited budget, such as students."

This show is different than any other show you have ever seen. "Different" could mean a lot of things depending on your taste, mood, interests, and the level of craziness. 

I cannot say how much I enjoyed the music portion of this show, and I wish they would fill more of the show time with music. I couldn't wait for them to play on their crazy instruments. The band is very cool and so are the blue men; plus the special light effects make the whole thing a super fun show. 

Some of the comedy stunts are a little too long, in my opinion. I think they could do so much more than just standing there and eating cereals. But again, maybe I just didn't understand the message. 

I don't want to give away too much, but please go and find out for yourself. I absolutely recommend this show.

"Following a rigorous five-hour trek at Red Rock, nothing could be more gratifying than indulging in a delectable breakfast, and Baby Cakes certainly did not disappoint. Upon entering the establishment, my initial impression was that it was likely to be an unremarkable dining experience, given the throngs of patrons and the unassuming decor. However, my expectations were quickly dispelled upon perusing the menu, which boasted an array of innovative and tantalizing options. My companion, who was adhering to a restrictive diet, opted for a simple tuna salad and biscuit with gravy, while I decided to sample the Mexican omelette and red velvet pancakes, the latter of which I had never encountered before. The omelette was satisfying, with its generous portion of marinated carnitas, sliced jalapenos, pico gallo, pepper jack cheese, and dollop of sour cream. Nonetheless, it was the red velvet pancake that truly captured my palate, as it was suffused with a subtle tanginess and delightfully fluffy texture. My acquaintance offered me a bite of her biscuit and gravy, which I devoured without hesitation, much to her chagrin. The prices were eminently reasonable, and the hospitable servers ensured that our needs were met promptly and attentively, despite the bustling atmosphere. Without a doubt, Baby Cakes will be my go-to destination for a delectable breakfast in the future."

I stopped by here on a whim, thinking they had wifi because it is a coffee/tea/smoothie spot and I learned that they didn't have wifi
No biggie 
The girl that helped me was nice and gave me the run down on the menu and the Flavors that she liked
I went with a strawberry piña colada smoothie and it was really, really good 
It was pretty cheap too, which made it even better 
I sat at the table out front and enjoyed the smoothie
The foam on top made my day
I will have to stop by and try one of their coffees

I indulged in an extended sojourn at this esteemed establishment during its initial opening, when behemoths such as Caesars and The Mirage dominated the landscape, and the extravagant pirate-themed spectacle outside served as a pivotal aspect of my captivation with the city's vibrant atmosphere. Subsequent to my gratis upgrade to an opulent, top-floor accommodation boasting a breathtaking panorama, I fostered an indelible affection for Las Vegas, which has remained a constant source of fascination throughout my life.

Fast forward approximately a decade and a half, and my sporadic visits to this venue have been cursory, amounting to little more than a hasty traversal of the premises. However, upon my recent return in pursuit of a steaming bowl of noodle soup ( refer to my review of the Coffee Shop for further details), I chanced upon a $5 craps table en route to my egress. Prompted by my curiosity and the allure of an enjoyable diversion, I elected to tarry and partake in the game alongside the convivial morning throng.

The dealers presiding over the table displayed unwavering cordiality and wit, their infectious joviality permeating the atmosphere and ensuring an agreeable experience for all participants. Furthermore, I must commend the implementation of the feature bet, despite its dubious reputation as a "sucker bet". The tantalizing prospect of 176 to 1 odds can readily transform even the most skeptical individual into a contented, albeit temporary, victor. Suffice it to say, my craps-playing endeavors at this establishment have been gratifying, and I eagerly anticipate my next visit, armed with an appetite for both gastronomic delights and the unpredictable nature of chance.

No matter what hour of the day, day of the week, or time of the year - the Grapevine is a must visit kind of place for locals and tourists alike!  

The patio upstairs is fantastic for hanging out with your family or friends, grabbing a bite to eat, and relaxing and enjoying the sunshine.  The bar upstairs has TVs, so you'll be able to catch whatever game you are trying to see. 

For happy hour and on into the night, you can stay and rock out to the karaoke. The people here aren't messing around!   You'll get a little bit of everything from Elvis to Dixie Chicks to Sir Mix a Lot.   Where could you find that kind of entertainment all in one place?!

Every time that I have been to Montreal in the last six years, I have gone to Schwartz's.  More because of my husband's affliction for it: If we're in the city, he needs to go and get his fix. After all this time, I don't blame him.

Everyone has their own way of ordering - and I don't judge (unless that way is 'lean'; that I don't understand.) You might want a cherry coke with your sandwich. You might eat your sandwich with a knife and a fork. And that's fine. (My order? A sandwich, fries to share, a pickle, cherry coke. The A1 steak sauce needs to be nearby, too.)

I don't know if I would call this place 'the best restaurant in Canada' or 'the Katz's of Montreal', but it is terribly good smoked meat, in a style very different from New York delis (bagels and smoked meat - it's what sets New Yorkers and Montrealers apart). It's mouthwateringly delicious, served in a setting that requires that you get close to your neighbour (and I've had some great conversations as a result).

The line appears daunting, but the guy manning the door knows what he's doing. Trust him. Trust the staff inside. Trust the smoker in the kitchen that has been churning out incredible sandwiches for the past 82 years.

I just hope that Celine Dion doesn't mess it up when the sale is finalized.

"I thoroughly appreciate the fact that the free weights are segregated from the treadmill zone, which enables me to focus extensively on my strength training exercises without being distracted by the cardio enthusiasts. Moreover, I find the ambiance of the swimming pool to be particularly appealing, and the proficiency of the trainers has been a significant factor in my decision to join this gym. Additionally, I tend to visit the establishment after work, and I have observed that it rarely reaches capacity, thereby allowing me to engage in my fitness regimen unimpeded. Furthermore, I must commend the gym on offering an exceptional array of spin classes, which have proven to be an excellent means of enhancing my cardiovascular endurance."

"My affection for their Chai frost, augmented by the indulgent addition of whipped cream, is unwavering...

Moreover, this establishment boasts an inviting ambiance, characterized by subdued illumination and a warm, welcoming atmosphere, rendering it an ideal setting for a leisurely coffee break.

For those seeking an even more comfortable experience, I suggest bringing a pillow and blanket, thereby enhancing the coziness factor exponentially...:

The staff is proficient in their duties, ensuring a prompt and seamless service, which is particularly advantageous during the sweltering summer months when the judicious employment of misters maintains a refreshingly cool environment within the premises."

"Upon perusing the inspection report dated January 24th, 2011, I failed to discern any pressing concerns, despite the enumeration of five ostensibly critical items. Specifically, the absence of a date on portioned salad dressings, which I presume refers to the practice of transferring dressing from a primary container to a smaller vessel for daily usage, was noted. Additionally, the placement of fish and fries in easily accessible locations during peak lunch hours was also highlighted. Furthermore, an issue pertaining to the ice drain line, an air gap problem associated with the drive-through window, and the storage of a bag of ice melt on the same shelf as food products were also mentioned. Considering the relatively low score of 31, I would have expected more severe violations, such as spoiled foodstuffs, unclean or ill staff members, or evidence of rodent infestations. However, these minor transgressions do not deter me from indulging in my preferred fast food fare. In fact, this establishment offers the best alternative to traditional burger chains, serving delectable burgers, chicken fries, fried okra, and fish. While their fish is unexpectedly tasty, their burgers are best enjoyed doubled and shared with a companion. Notably, my sole grievance lies in their lack of root beer or ginger ale offerings, thereby prompting me to abstain from ordering a beverage altogether."

Stopped in for some emergency supplies. (Emergency as in there was only butter in my fridge and I had one roll of toilet paper.) The employees were lovely as always, colorful, fresh fruit and vegetables greeted me and I scored in the free coffee & food that was available to sample. Trader Joe's never fails to delight and, of course, I purchased more beer and wine that is humanly necessary. Trader Joe's doesn't need a review. Of course a visit here is wonderful. This is a definite favorite of mine!

Have been here a few times. I like the atmosphere and the servers were very easy going and laid back. It wasn't busy so the service was top notch though I have been there on nights it was slammed and they still managed to do a pretty good job. I will decently be back. Don't take offense it that it's only a four star rating. It's hard for me to give a five anywhere. :)

Big fan of this location. I loved the Sahara location, but alas, it was closed on Thanksgiving (we found out the hard way...)

Came here instead - were told there was a 1-3 hour wait with no guarantees. After bugging the hostess a few times - she let us know that if we kept bugging her - we might get in a little earlier. 

Who knew, just as I bugged her a 3rd time - a booth opened up and we were ushered in immediately. So happy.  Note to self -  make a reservation next year when it might be a holiday night...

Didn't opt for the traditional Thanksgiving meal - as that was likely just being carved and dished out en masse.

New York Steak, Ribeye, Pork Tenderloin - all amazing, all deliciously moist. The sweet potato mashed-up-stuff didn't tast very sweet-potato-y, but it was all decent. Fried green tomatoes app was delicious! But the blandish chicken seemed slightly out of place - but gave the dish an surprisingly good pairing to tackle the heavy textures and flavors of the fried and the balsamic dressing.

Amazing view by the way - overlooking the pool at night, much better than Sahara.

Needless to say, we brought 3/4 of our meal back with us. Not complaining at all.

"This establishment offers a unique and enjoyable experience for visitors of all ages, particularly those with an affinity for anthropomorphic characters. Upon entering, my daughter was immediately drawn to the endearing polar bear mascot, whose elaborate costume boasted exceptional craftsmanship and surpassed our expectations. The upper portion of the costume was designed with a puppeteering mechanism, allowing for a high level of animation and expressiveness. While taking photographs with the mascot was permitted, the backdrop consisted merely of a green screen; however, an additional fee granted access to professionally taken photos set against an Arctic-inspired background. We opted for the package deal, which included two 5x7 prints and four smaller photos for a total of $35. The staff members were friendly and accommodating, and the store itself featured an impressive array of Coca-Cola-themed merchandise. This attraction stands out as one of the many complimentary delights that Las Vegas has to offer."

"Indubitably, I am cognizant of the fact that it is, indeed, a chain; however, it played a pivotal role in our culinary lives during a particular juncture. My maternal figure was experiencing difficulty in consuming adequate sustenance independently, and my second-born offspring, whose whereabouts were situated in close proximity to the eatery in question, would frequently halt her vehicular conveyance at said establishment, thereby allowing her to procure a pair of delectable dinners en route to paying a visit to her ancestral figurehead. Thus, providing both parties with an opportunity to partake in a satisfying repast and enjoy each other's company. Furthermore, as my progenitor consistently displayed a penchant for the victuals proffered by my issue, we were able to infer that she was, at the very least, obtaining adequate nourishment from this source. Additionally, the presence of leftovers ensured that she could enjoy a subsequent meal the following day. 

Whenever I found myself in the vicinity, I would also make it a point to visit this establishment, as I held their comestibles in high esteem. Specifically, their assortment of sides proved to be particularly appealing to my taste buds, leading me to opt for a platter consisting solely of these items on multiple occasions. Moreover, their roast sirloin, or whatever appellation they saw fit to assign it, struck me as a satisfactory option, given its cost. Lastly, their dessert offerings were noteworthy, and I appreciated the fact that their menu featured dishes not commonly found in similar establishments. In light of the consistent quality they maintained, I would unhesitatingly bestow upon them a rating of four stars, relative to other enterprises of this nature. Needless to say, I would not hesitate to return, should I experience a hankering for traditional American comfort fare."

"Although I am generally not an ardent devotee of restaurants that incorporate gift shops within their premises, I must confess that Saddle Ranch has managed to capture my affinity. This establishment boasts one of the most optimal vantage points for people-watching on the western side, owing to the presence of a mechanical bull that seems to attract women clad in scanty attire and sporting artificial bosoms with an uncanny resemblance to bees drawn to honey. As I savored my enormous Long Island Iced Tea, I found myself utterly diverted by the spectacle of individuals being hurled from the bull, which often constituted pure comedic gold. Despite my lack of culinary experience at this venue, my parents have partaken in their fare on two separate occasions and have reported thoroughly enjoyable encounters. During their initial visit, they were compelled to await a table, at which point the manager gallantly escorted them to the bar and treated them to a complimentary beverage. The manager seemingly comprehended that a gratis Bloody Mary held the key to winning my mother's affection and ensuring future patronage."

We thoroughly enjoy this establishment, and we make it a point to visit at least once a month, as it offers an exceptional dining experience that caters to our culinary inclinations. The "bottomless fries" appetizer serves as an excellent distraction for our offspring, while we peruse the menu to select a delectable entree. The array of burger options is diverse and satisfying, and the service we receive is consistently prompt, friendly, and attentive. Additionally, we highly recommend registering for their frequent diner card program to accrue complimentary burgers and redeem a birthday burger, thereby enhancing the overall dining experience.

About as large as a small Wal-Mart, this is truly a warehouse of shoes. And surprisingly, not all women's shoes. There is a large section of shoes for men too!

I stuck to my side of the shop and saw that the shoes were organized by style - boots, laceups, slip-ons and such were all neatly put together with one on display and a stack of others underneath with a variety of sizes. I have average size feet, so it's rare that there is any problem finding shoes in my size that fit.

After I had narrowed down my selection to just two and was walking around to test comfort, I spotted their "clearance" racks in the back had a pair of the style I wanted in my size! So instead of buying a full-price (marked down?) pair at $62, I got a "last pair in store" with a 20% discount that was a name brand (Timberlake!) for $52. Boom!

When you shop at Off Broadway, you also get an encore rewards coupon for 10% of your spending that you can use on your next visit. I can't imagine that I'll be back for shoes again and remember this coupon, but hey, you never know!

In my subjective experience, there exists a profound schism within the city of Pittsburgh, analogous to the historical conflict between the Montagues and Capulets. This dichotomy is manifest in the culinary preferences of the city's inhabitants, with individuals either aligning themselves with Pamela's or Deluca's, the two establishments representing the antitheses of the breakfast food spectrum. As an ardent adherent of the latter, I would eagerly engage in a spirited dispute with proponents of Pamela's, provided that I have been adequately fortified by a colossal breakfast burrito, proportionate in size to my cranial dimensions, and numerous cups of coffee. 
 Deluca's, while possessing certain idiosyncrasies, continues to captivate my attention. These peculiarities include an interminable wait for seating (attributable to the universal desire to partake in the restaurant's offerings), an ambiance reminiscent of a vintage diner, replete with an eccentric mural and surfaces susceptible to stickiness, and a service staff that, while proficient, does not indulge in excessive coddling of their clientele, given the restaurant's bustling nature and modest gratuities. Personally, I find these characteristics appealing and actively seek them out in a dining establishment. My fondness for Deluca's extends to visiting the restaurant in a state of mild inebriation, whereupon I relish devouring a gargantuan burrito and copious amounts of orange juice and coffee, the latter replenished at irregular intervals by an accommodating server. 
 Notwithstanding my unwavering loyalty to Deluca's, I must confess that a certain diner, situated beneath the 16th street bridge, whose name escapes me at present, serves exceptional biscuits and gravy, thereby earning my esteemed recognition as my preferred dining venue.

"Consider ordering a mere half of the portion size you genuinely desire, as a single scoop is equivalent to approximately two; however, be prepared to navigate through a smoke-filled casino to reach the secluded location on the second floor. Despite the somewhat lengthy journey, the prices are reasonable, and the distinctive flavors available are certainly worth sampling. A young child received a towering shaved ice treat, nearly six inches taller than the container it was served in, prompting my companion, a self-proclaimed ice cream aficionado, to remark that while the quality was satisfactory, it fell short of her beloved Baskin Robbins standard. Personally, I opted for the banana Caramel chocolate chip variety, which, although enjoyable, did not elicit excessive enthusiasm from me, as I am not particularly fond of ice cream."

Clearly the magic words here are Capastrami and Bobbie. Go in knowing those two words and I promise you you'll leave one happy sandwich-eating mofo. 

For me the Bobbie beats the Capastrami hands down. (The damn amazingness that is the pastrami from Brix in Sunset Beach has ruined all other pastrami for me.)  

The taste of Thanksgiving all smushed together on the tastiest, softest bread ever though, truly makes the Bobbie something to write home about... or at least will make you want to find your nearest Capriottis location and get there ASAP!

Awesome checkouts so they are In a bad neighbourhood who cares??? Take your High class behinds back to the high class ville this is the west side. Come in, friendly associates (see Stephanie) and leave easy, fast, clean and friendly..all I expect from a local Walmart

Self-serve frozen yogurt has emerged as a contemporary fad that permeates the entire valley, with certain establishments executing it magnificently while others falter in their attempts, occasionally yielding an unpleasant experience. This location, in particular, boasts an array of distinctive flavors, much to my delight; however, my fiancÃ©e expressed mild discontent due to the absence of red velvet, which, in her opinion, would have elevated the overall enjoyment of the frozen treat. During my visit, I had the fortuitous opportunity to sample moshi for the first time, and I must say, it was nothing short of a culinary revelation. As an individual who adheres to kosher dietary restrictions, I generally refrain from consuming marshmallows manufactured outside of my home. Moshi, with its ethereal texture and delicate flavor, serves as a superb alternative, seamlessly complementing any variety of yogurt. My sole criticism concerns the strawberries utilized by Yogurtology, which, although plump and succulent, could benefit from a more fastidious selection process to ensure optimal ripeness. Notwithstanding this minor drawback, the establishment itself exudes an aura of spotlessness, and its interior design elements are undeniably eye-catching. Unfortunately, the cost of enjoying Yogurtology's offerings proves to be a tad prohibitive, with each ounce priced at 45 cents, a tad higher than the Yogurtland located near Arizona State University's campus, which I frequent.

This venue experiences a significant influx of patrons during weekends, rendering it remarkable; however, the converse is true regarding the dearth of clientele during weekdays, despite which the quality of service remains subpar, ostensibly due to the underutilization of staff members, which one might presume would not be the case, given the lack of occupants. The culinary offerings are satisfactory, albeit slightly deficient in terms of doneness, particularly with regards to eggs, which are frequently served in a manner that falls short of the desired consistency, specifically, an amalgamation of sunny-side up and runny yolks. Notwithstanding, the ambiance and freshness of select edibles somewhat justify the cost. I relished my visit and shall return in the future.

"Culinary excellence, panoramic vistas, and exceptional hospitality converge to create an unparalleled dining experience, where the prix fixe menu offers a delightful array of gastronomic delights, while the Ã  la carte options provide an equally satisfying alternative for a memorable evening out."

"The service my spouse and I received during our in-person visit was exceptional! Upon arrival, the staff promptly relieved us of our luggage, eliminating the need for manual handling. We were informed that our bags would be securely stored until check-in time, which was conveniently scheduled for either 2 or 3 pm. Additionally, we were advised that we could contact the front desk at check-in time to obtain our room number, thereby avoiding an unnecessary wait in line. However, despite these impressive efforts, we were disappointed to encounter a rude staff member when calling to obtain our room number. The individual in question curtly replied, 'the main tower,' without providing adequate directions, leading us to spend 45 minutes fruitlessly searching for our accommodations. Eventually, we discovered that we were actually situated in the grand tower. It is worth mentioning that the sheer magnitude of the hotel, combined with the occasional absence of visible signage, contributed to the confusion. Nonetheless, our suite was truly remarkable, thanks to the meticulous attention to detail displayed by the housekeeping staff. Their dedication to maintaining a spotless environment was genuinely impressive. My spouse and I are eagerly anticipating our upcoming stays at other MGM Hotels, specifically THE Hotel at Mandalay Bay next month and Bellagio in December. We look forward to comparing their quality of service to determine which establishment best suits our preferences."

"Desirous of indulging in a locally-based culinary establishment, I opted to sample the fare at this unpretentious venue, boasting an accommodating team. As a caveat, for those who are temperature-sensitive regarding their gastronomical intake, I must advise that the piquant flavors presented by the chef may prove formidable; however, for aficionados of spicy delights, the posole (a traditional Mexican soup) is an absolute must-try item, accompanied by the delectable homemade tortillas that diverge slightly from the customary preparation methods associated with this dish in my previous experiences within the realm of Chicago-style Mexican cuisine. Despite these minor deviations, my overall satisfaction with the meal was quite high, and I look forward to future visits."

All I have to say is... Grilled cheese and creamy tomato soup!!!! And excellent beer selection. I'm a fan of the Rogue Hazelnut (goes just right with the grilled cheese and soup).\n\nDimmed, relaxing lighting and awesome service!

"Culinary indulgences possess an inherent allure that transcends mere sustenance, and my recent visit to this establishment served as a testament to that notion. Specifically, my taste buds were treated to an unparalleled delight courtesy of the Vegenini, a gastronomic masterpiece that expertly married the rich flavors of a vegetarian pizza with an unmistakable je ne sais quoi. Needless to say, my dining experience was further complemented by the delectable potato fries that accompanied my meal, their crispy texture and savory taste coalescing to form a veritable epicurean symphony. Moreover, the customer service I received during my visit was nothing short of exceptional, as the staff's warmth and hospitality effortlessly fostered a sense of belonging that greatly enhanced my overall satisfaction."

"The Cosmopolitan exuded an air of pleasantness, its ambiance rendering a sense of satisfaction, albeit not to the extent of the Aria or Vdara, yet still impressive nonetheless. However, upon entering the premises, we encountered an unexpected sensation of being overwhelmed by the abundance of stimuli, which permeated throughout the vast expanse of the casino and multiplicity of levels, thus creating a labyrinthine atmosphere that proved arduous to navigate. Furthermore, our attempts to locate the sushi bar were futile, despite our concerted efforts, and our quest for assistance from the hotel staff proved equally unsuccessful. Notwithstanding these inconveniences, the Cosmopolitan remained an esteemed establishment, boasting amenities such as a balcony and minibar, which contributed to its allure and rendered it an enticing prospect for prospective guests."

"The culinary experience would have been rated three stars, but the exceptional service proffered by our affable and knowledgeable server, Tashja, elevated the overall rating to four stars. Her warm demeanor and unwavering attention to detail enhanced the dining experience, as she offered insightful recommendations from the extensive menu. The North Boulevard cocktail was a delightful and potentially hazardous concoction, as its subtle alcoholic flavor belied its potency, much like a happy hour elixir. The fried pickles were satisfyingly crunchy, while my Ahi Tuna burger, though an unconventional choice at a burger establishment, was quite palatable. My spouse's turkey burger, however, fell short of expectations, with a peculiar taste that left him unimpressed. Notably, the sandwiches were not particularly substantial, as observed by previous patrons."

Bouchon Bistro, in the Venetian, is Thomas Keller's Las Vegas presence. Judging from the google results and "Bouchon Las Vegas dress code" being a popular suggested search, there's some confusion about this bistro. It's relatively casual, but chic. It's decorated like an old French bistro, and the menu reflects its casual but traditional nature.

His plate: Steak Frites - pan-seared prime flat iron served with maître d'hôtel butter and frites

Her plate: Sourdough Waffles - sourdough waffles with bananas, toasted walnuts, maple syrup, & Tahitian vanilla bean butter; cappuccino; mimosa

To share:  Beignets with chocolate and fruit dipping sauces; side of bacon

The bread for the table was beautiful and fresh, nice mini leaves of thoroughly authentic and crusty French bread. Our beignets came out hot and fresh, very dense and covered in cinnamon sugar. The dipping sauces were chocolate (that may have had a hint of hazelnut) and strawberry/raspberry.

D's steak was good, though he was disappointed that the fries weren't house-made or more special. My waffles were fantastic - and the combination of the vanilla bean butter and the walnuts were really delicious. The syrup was not really needed at all, but I did appreciate that it was served warm.

Last week, I opted to treat my significant other to a culinary excursion at this establishment in honor of his birthday, seeking to indulge in an intimate ambiance and delectable fare. Upon entering, we were greeted by an accommodating hostess who showed us to our table promptly. Our server, a friendly and attentive individual, presented us with menus and offered recommendations while ensuring that our dining experience was satisfactory throughout the evening by checking in on us regularly. In terms of the cuisine, I opted for the Spaghetti Bolognese, which, unfortunately, lacked a certain je ne sais quoi in terms of flavor. However, my companion's selection, the FRUTTI DI MARE, proved to be an unmitigated success, boasting an array of fresh seafood that was expertly prepared and presented. So much so, that I found myself pilfering succulent shrimp from his plate on multiple occasions, much to his amusement. Lastly, we shared a scrumptious gelato, augmented by a shot of espresso, which served as the perfect finale to our meal. All things considered, we thoroughly enjoyed the culinary offerings and exceptional service afforded to us during our visit.

"In the city of Las Vegas, there exists a culinary establishment that specializes in Vietnamese cuisine, which, according to my personal experience, is of considerable quality. Prior to returning home, I discovered this eatery through the utilization of an online review platform known as Yelp, and opted to partake in their offerings. The dishes presented by this restaurant were satisfactory in terms of taste and portion size, and the prices charged for these items were reasonable and aligning with my expectations. Furthermore, the hospitality displayed by the staff members was quite cordial and welcoming, contributing to an overall positive dining experience. Based on my assessment, I would unhesitatingly recommend this venue to individuals seeking genuine Vietnamese fare within the Las Vegas area. However, it is worth noting that there were no exceptional aspects that distinguished this restaurant from others of its kind."

"It is unequivocally evident that this particular Arby's establishment excels in its culinary offerings and exceptional customer service, as evidenced by the occasional prolonged waiting period, which is more than compensated for by the assurance that one's order is prepared with precision and the food is invariably fresh. Additionally, this location boasts a consistent stream of promotional coupons and special deals, both through conventional mailings and publication in local periodicals such as the Centennial View. It is utterly devoid of any significant criticisms, as they assiduously ensure that the food items on one's tray or in their takeout containers are indeed 'Good Mood Food,' an apt moniker that accurately reflects the restaurant's commitment to gastronomic excellence."

"A succinct evaluation of Macaroni Grill is presented herein, highlighting the establishment's consistent quality in terms of culinary offerings and hospitable service. Upon numerous visits, I have yet to encounter any dissatisfaction, as the staff's amiability and promptness have consistently met my expectations. The diverse pasta dishes and grilled pork chops have proven to be particularly satisfying, with the latter being a delightful surprise upon ordering. Notably, the Insalata Blu, composed of bibb lettuce, walnuts, red onions, and grated bleu cheese dressed in a balsamic vinaigrette, has proven to be a delectable option. Furthermore, the complementary bread accompanied by olive oil and cracked black pepper has consistently impressed, and the blackberry mint iced tea has quenched my thirst quite satisfactorily. Ambient music, featuring a medley of Italian opera and 1950s Italian crooners, such as Frank Sinatra, contributes to the restaurant's convivial atmosphere. It is not uncommon to witness celebratory moments during one's visit, as birthdays are often acknowledged with a melodious rendition of 'Happy Birthday' in Italian, performed by a skilled vocalist. Additionally, a unique feature of the establishment's restrooms involves the playing of Italian language lessons, providing an unexpected educational opportunity while attending to personal needs. In conclusion, Macaroni Grill is an excellent choice for those seeking hearty Italian cuisine, attentive service, and an overall enjoyable dining experience."

"This eatery proved to be satisfactory, and my research on the World Wide Web facilitated my discovery of its existence. Notwithstanding my desire for sushi, my physical discomfort compelled me to opt for the noodle-based dish, which, to my delight, was both steaming hot and gratifyingly filling. Furthermore, the accompanying salad garnered my approval, its freshness and crunchiness providing a pleasing contrast to the savory noodles. While I harbored a desire to sample their other culinary offerings, I deemed it acceptable to forgo doing so on this particular visit. Suffice it to say, I would not hesitate to return to this establishment in the future."

This establishment was exceptional during its tenure as Oasis and remains relatively impressive, securing a position among my preferred venues along the strip. Prior to its renovations, it was considered the most economical option, though its prices have since aligned with those of neighboring establishments. I am uncertain about the specific experience that led an individual to question its cleanliness. 

I appreciate the thoughtful design and emphasis on creating tranquil spaces, which sets it apart from Mirage and Canyon Ranch. The latter two prioritize gym facilities and fail to provide sufficient areas for patrons to unwind. The ambient lighting throughout the facility contributes to a sense of serenity, while the availability of water and refreshing cucumber eye treatments in multiple locations is truly remarkable. 

For individuals who, like myself, intend to spend several hours lounging within the spa, Nurture presents a viable option. However, I must note that the strip's overall attention to spa amenities remains inadequate, thereby precluding me from assigning it a perfect rating of five. To enhance their offerings, I suggest that management consider visiting Asian casinos, which boast superior spa facilities, and incorporate their features upon returning. 

It is worth mentioning that the spa is situated at a considerable distance from both the parking area and main entrance, necessitating a sizable allocation of time for appointments, particularly for guests not residing at the Luxor. Plan accordingly to ensure punctuality.

I love this place but always seem to forget about it. The rockin shrimp is an absolute must! The slider app actually makes a nice meal for the ladies. I love the salmon and my husband loves the chimichurri  skirt steak. Their happy hour is one of the best around!

"During our tenure in Las Vegas, we have had the pleasure of partaking in libations and culinary delights at this establishment on two separate occasions, and both experiences proved to be thoroughly satisfying and memorable. Our initial visit saw us sharing a platter of chicken and steak nachos, which was copious in size and bursting with flavor, and we were unable to consume the entire dish together, despite our best efforts. Subsequent to that, we indulged in a serving of tortilla chips and salsa, accompanied by mild chicken wings, both of which were scrumptious and not excessively filling, making them an ideal accompaniment to a frothy beverage. It is worth noting that the prices are reasonable and the portions generous, making for an economical and gratifying dining experience. Furthermore, we highly recommend acquiring the tickets from the young woman stationed at the entrance, as the buy one get one free drinks promotion offers significant savings compared to the happy hour specials. Our servers during both visits were attentive, cordial, and displayed a high level of proficiency in their duties."

Subway, an establishment renowned for providing copious amounts of nourishment at an affordable price point, specifically $5, boasts an impressive reputation for both cleanliness and expediency, particularly within affluent neighborhoods. However, it is advisable to exercise caution when visiting during peak hours, as the influx of patrons can result in prolonged wait times. While it is plausible that superior subs may exist, they are unlikely to match the value offered by Subway at this price range.

I thoroughly enjoyed my visit to this establishment, as the ambiance was pleasant, the servers were cordial, the embellishments were quaint, and the musical selection, although somewhat excessive in volume, was tasteful. Furthermore, the expedient delivery of crisps and salsa was greatly appreciated by myself, as well as others who share my predilection for prompt service. The venue offered both indoor and outdoor seating areas, with the option of two separate patios.  
The potato chips were cooked to perfection, neither overcooked nor too thick, and the homemade salsa boasted a subtle smoky essence without an overpowering degree of piquancy, thus catering to the preferences of those who are sensitive to spicy flavors. In addition, I sampled a refreshing cucumber mint agua fresca, characterized by its light and revitalizing quality. Moreover, I opted for the nachos, augmented with a modest portion of corn. The server's description of the dish as "a meal" proved accurate, as I felt thoroughly satiated and had ample leftovers.  
My intentions to revisit this eatery are fueled by a desire to experience their diverse agua fresca flavors and vegetarian tacos.

This contemporary lodging establishment is of considerable quality, albeit Google's directions proved to be somewhat deceptive, leading us astray and causing us to traverse an inconsequential distance beyond our initial assumptions. Notwithstanding this minor setback, we ultimately succeeded in locating the premises. It is worth mentioning that the advertised provision for automotive parking incurs an additional tariff of twelve dollars per nocturnal period, which we found to be somewhat disagreeable, given that the parking area in question is situated across the street and lacks a certain sense of security. Nevertheless, the accommodations themselves are quite pleasant and well-maintained, and the staff members we interacted with exhibited a commendable level of cordiality, despite the fact that we were unable to converse in the local language.
Cheap prices and a great place to get fresh veggies. Place does get busy on the 1st and 2nd of the month given how cheap the place is so try to avoid those two days.

The ambiance of this establishment exudes an aura of quality, albeit at a premium price point, yet it is somewhat understandable given its affiliation with a luxury hotel. However, the throngs of patrons and extensive queues that often form can be quite vexing, especially for those who prioritize efficiency and promptness in their dining experience. Nonetheless, the early opening time of 6 am is a welcome convenience for those who have indulged in nocturnal revelries and seek sustenance before retiring to their lodgings, as was the case with us during our recent visit to Las Vegas. Indeed, the unique combination of circumstances and setting made for an amusing and memorable episode, one that we could only laugh about and attribute to the unpredictable nature of the city's nightlife.

"For a culinary establishment situated within an airport, the quality of the fare served is, in fact, superior to the norm, thereby warranting a rating of four stars; however, it must be noted that the gastronomical experience offered by this particular eatery would, in all likelihood, be relegated to a rating of three stars were it not for the unique circumstance of its location within an airport, and thus, the assessment of its overall merit must be considered in relation to the specific context in which it operates."

"Well, I must say that I find the concept of Motel One to be quite appealing. The notion of a hotel that is consistently situated in the heart of the city, boasting a contemporary aesthetic and providing exceptional sleeping accommodations, all while eschewing superfluous amenities, resonates with me. This particular Motel One in Edinburgh epitomizes this ethos, offering an optimal location, albeit somewhat challenging to uncover. \nThe breakfast offerings are satisfactory, but by no means extraordinary. However, the service provided by the staff is indeed friendly and welcoming. Unfortunately, it appears that twin rooms are not available at this time."

I recently went to Panini Cafe for the first time after learning that it was kosher and vegetarian-friendly.  As far as I could tell, the menu was entirely pescatarian (or pesco vegetarian) -- meaning the only meat options on the menu were fish.  This is exactly the diet I've been enjoying for the past few months.  The fish on the menu included salmon, tuna, tilapia, and others.  

My friend and I started with an appetizer of hummus and warm fresh pita bread.  Our hummus included sauteed onions, pine nuts, and olive oil.  It was delicious and we devoured it all.

As a main course, I got the Ravioli Athens, which is ravioli tossed with garlic and basil and topped with feta cheese and kalamata olives.  At $16.99, It was a bit more than I wanted to pay, but it sounded so good I couldn't resist.  And I was not disappointed.  I loved the flavors, and I appreciated the fact that it was kosher.  I also refrained from eating the whole plate, so that I took about half of it home and enjoyed it for another meal later. 

My friend, who ordered the roasted Creamy Eggplant (which came with a house salad), was also pleased with her meal.  

We had no problems with the service.

I would definitely like to return and try some other dishes on the menu.

"An exceptional destination, this locale boasts an impressive culinary establishment and multiple drinking establishments of considerable quality!! My olfactory senses are pleasantly satiated by the pervasive presence of a fragrance reminiscent of coconut and suntan lotion, which permeates the atmosphere in a manner that obviates the need for noxious cigarette fumes; the personnel affiliated with this enterprise exhibit a commendable level of cordiality and usefulness."

At this establishment, I had the pleasure of partaking in a delectable dining experience last night, subsequent to enduring a particularly arduous day. The culinary offerings proffered by this esteemed eatery proved to be an effective panacea for my weariness, as I relished every morsel of the expertly prepared duck breast and savored the rich flavors of the duck/pork meatballs. Furthermore, the chocolate soufflÃ© that followed left an indelible impression on my palate, owing to its sublime texture and delightful sweetness. The hospitality displayed by the staff was also worthy of commendation, as their cordial demeanor and attentive service greatly enhanced my overall satisfaction.

I had only been to the poolside before, but went to the club for the first time! The bouncers were actually friendly, making sure there was enough space to walk around. The sound system here is amazing! Fun to see some great DJs! \n\nTwo floors to the nightclub - the one upstairs is a lot larger!

Five guys is a great alternative to fast food burgers without getting mixed up in the world of \"gourmet\" burgers. Their burgers are very tasty and are available with a huge list of free toppings unlike most places at this level. Get some free peanuts while you're waiting for your order? Yes please. Although I enjoy the burgers, I think the fires are worth equal mention. They come in regular and cajun variety and I've never seen anyone who actually needed to order a large. The regular is plenty, even to share. The menu is pretty basic but they do have a hot dog and a grilled cheese option for those who aren't into burgers. I will say that for me it is kind of a toss up between Five Guys and In N Out, but I seem to find myself here more often.

This establishment represents an economical dining option, which we frequent due to their delectable cuisine and generously portioned margaritas, with the exception of the diminutive size. The culinary offerings are quite satisfactory, particularly the La Mejor, which I highly recommend. My spouse consistently orders the Pollo con Crema, and we customarily request takeout containers to enjoy the remaining fare the following day. Although the service can be somewhat unpredictable, the staff generally exhibits attentiveness and expedites the delivery of food in a timely manner. Unfortunately, the dining area appears somewhat dilapidated and could benefit from aesthetic renovations, as the booths and tables evidence signs of wear and tear.

After culminating my workday, I decided to halt at this establishment in pursuit of a potent margarita and a delectable hors d'oeuvre. The ambiance evoked a sense of familiarity, reminiscent of the erstwhile Super-Mex that had previously occupied the space. Upon partaking in the beverages and savory delights, I found them to be of considerable quality, and the bartender exhibited a congenial demeanor.

Arrived at around 10 am on a Friday with my best friend. We didn't schedule an appointment and were luckily enough able to be sit right down for a pedicures. 

I would suggest making an appointment because after being there 10-15 minutes it became packed. 

We were asked which pedicures we preferred and I believe it was called the Luxury one ($45 one) It was amazing! I have had a lot of pedicures but have to say nothing like this one. 

The Luxury spa was the royal treatment that is for sure. From a mask type cream for your legs, salt scrub, sugar scrub, hot wax for your feet (never had I had that done before) and just all around special treatment. 

My best friend was helped by Henry and I was helped by an elderly woman. They were both very nice and friendly and for the most part understood us and spoke relatively good English. 

I was highly impressed at least by receiving a pedicure so we have agreed this will be our monthly spot for our girls day pedicures.

Wow, what a cool place! I went for the first time last night and had the farmer sandwich, it was fabulous. Service was great. Love the atmosphere and vibe here. The patio is especially nice when the weather is right. The menu is just salads, sandwiches and pizzas but if that's what you're looking for, give it a try.  I highly recommend Liberty Market.

Came in to order some drinks for the long ride back to  Los Angeles and was not disappointed... I'd say probably one of the better tasting boba places I've tried while here in Vegas. They have similar squatty cups that don't fit in normal cup holders like half n half have back at home. Tea tasted good, boba was soft but not as \"sweet\" as I was expecting/hoping. Atmosphere and employees were nice. Overall not bad if you're in Vegas :)

My parents have an unwavering affection for this establishment, and as a result, I have developed a fondness for it as well. The pizza served here is reminiscent of the New York-style variety, characterized by a thin crust and elongated slices, which is strikingly similar to the pizza we enjoyed in our native New York. Despite the initial impression created by their prices, the quality of their offerings is, in fact, quite satisfactory.

During my recent weekend sojourn at this esteemed lodging establishment, I had the pleasure of indulging in a series of hedonistic escapades that left me feeling both exhilarated and financially drained. My adventures began with a solitary excursion to the city of Las Vegas, where I managed to inexplicably find myself on the famed Strip, outside the illustrious Wynn resort, following an evening of unbridled revelry. Upon my return to the hotel, my companion and I established a daily ritual consisting of ordering luncheon via room service at 3 p.m. (our wake-up time), followed by successive glasses of champagne, and culminating in the depletion of the minibar's contents, only to have it restocked and subsequently plundered once more. Our nocturnal exploits commenced around 10 p.m., as we ventured forth to partake in the opulent ambiance of XS, and concluded at 4 a.m., when we transitioned to engaging in vigorous gaming activities. Unfortunately, our financial euphoria was short-lived, as the staggering sum of $700 for our hotel room fee, combined with an additional $800 for room service, abruptly reduced us from carefree, globe-trotting celebrities to anxious, penny-pinching adolescents who had inadvertently appropriated the family automobile. In light of our experiences, I would recommend that any individuals opting to pursue a similar course of action should consider indulging in the mouthwatering burger sliders (crafted from the finest ground beef) accompanied by perfectly cooked onion strings. Additionally, each bottle of champagne we sampled was truly delectable, and prudent travelers may discover that the champagne and sparkling wine offerings are indistinguishable, thereby providing an opportunity for fiscal savings. Furthermore, the hotel offers a "happy hour" for room service, featuring Corona beverages at a reasonable $5 apiece, alongside select culinary delights available for a mere $10 per plate, which, in comparison to the standard prices, is indeed a palatable option.

"Exceptional customer experience, yet invariably characterized by excessive congestion! It is highly recommended to schedule an appointment in advance, lest you be prepared to endure a protracted waiting period of approximately twenty minutes. Additionally, it is worth noting that the pricing for gel manicures tends towards the higher end of the spectrum."

"As an ardent devotee of the Cracker Barrel franchise, I was eager to partake in a culinary experience at this particular establishment, and my expectations were not disappointed. The ambiance of the restaurant was quaint and endearing, reminiscent of the rustic charm that has become synonymous with the Cracker Barrel brand. Furthermore, the fare served was expertly prepared and presented, showcasing the hallmark of quality that distinguishes homestyle cooking. Additionally, the staff exhibited a warm and welcoming demeanor, contributing to an atmosphere that was both convivial and comfortable. Lastly, the prices for the meals were eminently reasonable, making it an accessible dining option for those seeking a satisfying repast without breaking the bank."

"The gastronomical offerings at this establishment surpass the quality of the beverages, specifically the coffee. The culinary creations, including sandwiches and salads, are meticulously prepared and presented. The welcoming atmosphere fosters an environment where patrons can freely express themselves, engaging in conversation, enjoying a meal, or utilizing the Wi-Fi for web browsing or literary pursuits, all while basking in the natural light that streams through the expansive windows. The site's accessibility is also notable, with ample parking options adjacent to the venue. However, my sole grievance lies in the fact that the coffee, albeit a fundamental component of any reputable coffeehouse, falls short of expectations. Notwithstanding this anomaly, I choose to overlook it due to the numerous attributes that render this locale an appealing destination."

"We recently traversed through McCarran International Airport, both ingressing and egressing, without any notable impediments or complications. The auxiliary transportation services, pertaining to our lodging establishment, were facilitated with celerity, albeit via an external provider, as TI does not possess an inherent shuttle system, yet modest fees are associated with these brief conveyances. However, an inconsequential security-related episode transpired, stemming from a multipurpose utensil, encompassing a corkscrew, bottle opener, and knife, which inexplicably materialized within my acquaintance's luggage, prompting us to ponder the preceding night's chain of events."

"I habitually opt for the convenience of the drive-thru, and my experience has led me to anticipate a brief waiting period of approximately 5-10 minutes prior to receiving my burger combo and proceeding on my way. The culinary offerings have consistently met my expectations and justified the temporary delay."

"My companion and I indulged in a visit to this establishment's hookah lounge during their happy hour, and we were thoroughly impressed with the pricing strategy employed. The cost of both beverages and culinary offerings was precisely 50% of the standard price, which we deemed to be eminently reasonable. Specifically, we would recommend the Pear-sian Drop martini, priced at an affordable $4, as well as the Pesto Pita Pizza, available for $3.50, and the Athens Fries, offered at a slightly higher price point of $4. Upon entering the premises, we were warmly received by the staff, who presented us with an array of hookah flavors for our perusal. We appreciated the straightforward and ingenious nature of this approach, particularly given the unpredictability of flavor options at similar establishments. For a mere $7.50, one could partake in the enjoyment of a hookah; however, we elected to indulge in the superior 'frozen' hookah experience, featuring a gel reminiscent of those utilized in beer-cooling devices, for a modest additional fee of $10. The ambiance of the lounge was characterized by an opulent and exotic essence, further enhanced by the selection of classic rock melodies that filled the air. Unfortunately, our hookah-smoking experience was marred by the fact that the coal refills were not provided during happy hour, which we felt was a significant oversight. Despite this shortcoming, we found the taste and quality of the hookah smoke to be satisfactory. However, we would suggest that Paymon reassess his coal service policies to ensure a more complete and satisfying experience for patrons."

I had the privilege of experiencing Eagle Mountain Golf Club for the first time last week, and I must say that I was thoroughly impressed. In fact, it has quickly become one of my favorite golf courses in Arizona, and for good reason. Firstly, the course is meticulously maintained, with lush fairways and greens that are both challenging and rewarding. The design of the course is also noteworthy, offering a diverse range of distances from the various tees, allowing for a enjoyable and inclusive experience for golfers of varying skill levels. Furthermore, the rolling hills and changes in elevation throughout the course create a unique and engaging experience for players. Additionally, the greens are cleverly designed, featuring subtle slopes and undulations that require careful consideration and precision when putting. The breathtaking views of Phoenix from the course only add to its charm. Lastly, the affordability of the course is an added bonus, with reasonably priced drinks such as $2 16oz PBRs available on the day we played. Needless to say, I'm eagerly looking forward to my next visit. Return factor - 95%.

This particular venue possessed an impressive array of complementary items, and I did acquire several exceptional blazers. Unfortunately, the customer service experience was not optimal, with the staff exhibiting a somewhat indifferent demeanor, albeit not overtly discourteous or disrespectful.

Never have I had the pleasure of visiting the city of brotherly love, Philadelphia, nor have I had the opportunity to indulge in the delectable delights of numerous establishments specializing in cheesesteak sandwiches. However, upon entering this eatery, I was immediately transported to a familiar setting reminiscent of Frankies South Philadelphia Cheesesteak, a quaint restaurant nestled in Tucson, Arizona. 

It is my understanding that this culinary gem has undergone a transformation, shifting its location from the bustling thoroughfare of 5th Avenue to the charming surroundings of Craftsman Court in historic Old Town Scottsdale. This move has afforded the establishment triple the amount of space, allowing patrons to luxuriate in an expanded dining area. Retaining its signature attribute of being open 24 hours a day, this venue remains a beacon for those seeking a satisfying Philly cheesesteak at the ungodly hour of 3 am. 

My significant other, having purchased a discounted coupon through Groupon, elected to treat me to a dining experience at this very location. Opting for a traditional 9-inch cheesesteak adorned with whiz cheese, I supplemented my meal with a side of freshly cut fries. To our delight, the wait staff delivered our orders with remarkable expediency, the entire process transpiring within a mere five minutes. The bread, soft and fluffy, complemented the generous portion of flavorful steak, leaving us both utterly satiated. 

This dining establishment truly merits high praise. The sole drawback, albeit minor, pertained to the challenge of securing a parking spot. Encircling the block in search of a vacant space, time seemed to elongate, fostering an illusion of an interminable quest (exacerbated by hunger pangs). Nonetheless, my affection for this venue persists, and I eagerly anticipate a future visit.

"Not only do the beverages possess an exceptional degree of culinary excellence, but the hospitality extended by the staff is truly extraordinary, as they manifest an unwavering commitment to ensuring that each patron's experience is optimized through their warmth, friendliness, and eagerness to engage in conversation. Furthermore, while the variety of options may not be as extensive as that offered by a certain ubiquitous coffee chain, the selection is imbued with a sense of playfulness and originality that will undoubtedly appeal to individuals seeking a more unique and enjoyable beverage experience. Additionally, it is worth noting that many of these creative concoctions boast a superior taste profile compared to their more traditional counterparts."

I indulged in the delectable Buta-Burger, as it encompassed a multitude of flavors that I hold in high esteem, and I must say, it was utterly scrumptious! My expectations were surpassed by the gastronomical delight that it presented, and I was taken aback by the remarkable efficiency of the service, despite being second in line; such celerity is indeed laudable. However, my sole grievance lies in the fact that the cost was somewhat prohibitive, yet, apart from that minor drawback, the culinary experience was truly exceptional.

Thankfully, this establishment has resumed its operations, thereby affording patrons the opportunity to partake in a delectable New York-style pizza at a price point considerably lower than that of the adjacent pizzeria. It is worth noting that the temperature at which said pizza is served is positively scorching, to the extent that one might describe it as 'holy mackerel' hot. In addition to the culinary offerings, the service provided by the staff is both efficient and friendly, extending well into the evening hours. This venue serves as an ideal location for those seeking a hasty slice while traversing E. Fremont, and the proprietor, Uncle Joe, is a personable individual who maintains a welcoming atmosphere, though it is advisable to avoid engendering any animosity towards him, lest one risk being summarily ejected from the premises, as was demonstrated in the instance of two unruly individuals who opted to engage in a physical altercation within the restaurant. All things considered, this establishment offers a satisfying dining experience.

"Upon relocating to Bloomfield in April, I was under the impression that Little Italy would cater to my fondness for Italian cuisine, owing to my ethnic background. However, my expectations were not met until the present evening. Previous attempts at dining at Italian restaurants had been disappointing, ranging from Del's subpar offerings to the overhyped Pleasure Bar. Lombardozzi, on the other hand, had escaped my notice until now. My initial encounter with their meatballs during Little Italy Days had been enjoyable, but it wasn't until tonight that I decided to indulge in a full meal. Our culinary excursion commenced with calamari, which was fried to a golden crisp and lacked the unpleasant rubberiness that plagues many establishments beyond the East Coast. My dinner companion and I shared a plate of homemade gnocchi, served with a flavorful red sauce and complemented by a duo of delectable meatballs. Although the sauce did not quite live up to my lofty standards - nobody can rival my mother's or grandmother's expertise in that department - the dish was undeniably delicious. Unfortunately, the service we received was less than satisfactory, with our server taking an inordinate amount of time to take our drink orders and displaying a general air of disinterest in her work. Despite this drawback, I am eager to return to Lombardozzi, as it stands out as the sole Italian eatery in Bloomfield that comes close to satisfying my cravings."
Fresh shrimp, crab legs to enjoy. Prime Ribs & Leg of lamb on carving table. Many different other dishes. A lot of desserts, including crepes made to order. Weekday price is more worth it.

"An exceptional steak sandwich, boasting a savory profusion of flavors, is complemented by an equally delectable side of fries, both of which demonstrate a culinary mastery that transcends the need for condiments. In contrast, my spouse's selection, the Mama's Burger, while featuring a satisfying bun and an assortment of flavorful mushrooms, suffers from a dearth of flavor in its patty. Despite this disparity, we shall afford this establishment another opportunity to showcase its gastronomic prowess."

If you desire to indulge in a seated culinary experience, be prepared to partake in a queuing process external to the edifice, and potentially share a table with unfamiliar individuals. In alternative settings, such circumstances might elicit annoyance or surprise; however, on this particular day, my enthusiasm rendered me receptive to these idiosyncrasies, which ultimately enhanced the ambiance and charm of the establishment.  

The smoked turkey sandwich boasted succulent tenderness, augmented by the tangy application of mustard upon a crustaceous bun, thereby transcending mere sustenance and ascending to a celestial realm of gastronomical delight. Fries exhibited a satisfying crunchiness on their exterior, while maintaining a fluffy texture within, achieving an exemplary balance of contrasting sensations.
