However, I must emphasize that bringing pets into the store poses a significant risk of exposure to various diseases, as not all pet owners adhere to rigorous vaccination schedules or proper animal care practices. Consequently, while the notion of shopping alongside one's furry friend may seem appealing, it is, in fact, wiser to leave them at home, ensuring their safety and wellbeing.

"A remarkable establishment specializing in expediently prepared gastronomical delights, my personal experiences at this venue have been varied, with the most recent visit falling short of my elevated expectations, despite the fact that the culinary offerings remained palatable and the service was relatively prompt, provided the queue was not excessively prolonged. My previous indulgences in their assorted sandwiches have been uniformly satisfying, although I must admit that the salads I have sampled have not quite met my lofty standards."

Great food, really like the green chile burger. ( I know, I order a burger from a Mexican food place, but it's awesome) Also, they bring sopapilla's (sic?) after your meal which are delicious. Service has a tendency to be slow, never got refills, but otherwise a good place to get your grub on.

I proceeded to visit this establishment based on favorable critiques received in recent times, and I must say, they did not fail to impress. I opted for the Machaca breakfast, which was accompanied by rice, beans, and tortillas. However, upon requesting an additional order of tortillas, I was taken aback by the revelation that there would be a supplementary fee. To my utter dismay, I was charged $1.50 for two minuscule flour tortillas, a price that seemed exorbitant in comparison to the cost of a dozen tortillas available elsewhere for merely $0.99. While the culinary offerings were undoubtedly satisfactory, such seemingly insignificant particulars left a lingering sense of dissatisfaction. In the future, I shall bring these concerns to the management's attention personally, with the expectation that minor amenities such as complimentary refills or additional salsa will be provided without hesitation.

"It is not my customary practice to provide feedback on service due to its inherent variability contingent upon the individual server, however, I must express my unequivocal praise for our waitress' exceptional performance. Despite the fact that she appeared to be the sole staff member attending to the entire restaurant, her proficiency was unwavering, ensuring that my beverage was consistently replenished and her diligent efforts were undeniable. A supplementary star is warranted solely on the basis of her meritorious service. 

This unpretentious establishment, ostensibly a sports bar, boasts an impressive array of culinary offerings, encompassing dinner entrÃ©es, salads, burgers, sandwiches, appetizers, et cetera. Our expectations were surpassed by the diverse menu, as we anticipated a limited selection of pub fare. Both my spouse and I opted for the Western burger, a satisfying meal comprised of a slightly underseasoned patty, yet the BBQ sauce exhibited a pleasing flavor profile, rendering it an enjoyable consumable experience. 
The Frings, an order of both fries and onion rings, accompanied our meals, displaying commendable crispiness and judicious seasoning. 

This cozy eatery offers an ideal setting for viewing a sporting event while partaking in a satisfying repast. Its extensive selection renders it an excellent choice for a casual dining experience."

"While aimlessly meandering through the culinary domain in pursuit of a gastronomical delight, my gaze fell upon the remnants of a recent Amore pizza order, which had been artfully arranged within the confines of my refrigerator. Inspired by a sudden craving for a savory indulgence, I decided to sample a slice of the aforementioned deep-dish pizza, opting to consume it au naturel, without the benefit of thermal rejuvenation. To my utter astonishment, the unheated pizza proved to be remarkably delectable, with an array of subtle flavors that had hitherto remained imperceptible to my taste buds during its initial consumption. Consequently, I would enthusiastically endorse maintaining a chilled reserve of this culinary masterpiece for those unexpected visits from dear relatives, such as one's younger sibling or brother-in-law."

"An ideal location for a brief repast, appetizer, or dejeuner. Particularly suitable when uncertainty regarding the availability of other dining establishments on Christmas Day necessitates a temporary gastronomic solution, thereby warranting a visit to this eatery, especially given the two-hour waiting period at either Sam Woo or Dim Sum. 

The porcine buns, priced at $1.30 apiece, emerged fresh from the oven at 11:30 a.m., boasting an adequate size. However, the avian pot pies failed to justify their cost, unless one harbors an unwavering yearning for the quintessential American adaptation. In contrast, the shredded beef accompanied by green onion rolls proved satisfactory, primarily due to the latter's ability to withstand the rigors of time, thus rendering them suitable for consumption during the subsequent morning's hangover, albeit at a price point surpassing that of the aforementioned porcine buns. 

Honey, allow me to behold your porcine buns in Las Vegas, baby Las Vegas."

"Ample parking facilities were readily available, thus facilitating our vehicular ingress and egress. Prior to partaking in the culinary offerings of the establishment, we opted to sample the beverage selection. Unfortunately, our request for a Crown Royal was met with an apologetic dismissal, as the venue had ostensibly exhausted their supply of this particular libation. Suffice it to say, we were incredulous at this turn of events. 
Nevertheless, we persevered and elected to procure an alternative accompaniment for our breadsticks, which arrived promptly and in satisfactory condition. The attendant proffered oil and butter, and we must admit that the latter augmented the flavor profile of the breadsticks considerably. 
Pursuant to our investigation of the menu, we determined that the grilled shrimp on the rock appetizer and clams possessed an uncommon savory quality, further enhanced by the visually appealing presentation. 
Upon consummating the main course, which consisted of angel hair pasta accompanied by marinara and meatballs, we were pleasantly surprised by the gustatory satisfaction afforded by each item. Although the venue was bustling with activity, the attendants managed to maintain a respectable level of attentiveness and efficiency throughout the dining experience. 
Regrettably, our stomachs having reached satiation, we were unable to partake in the dessert offerings, specifically the bombalinos. However, we assure you that our patronage shall be renewed in the future, as we eagerly anticipate the opportunity to sample further delights from this establishment's culinary repertoire."

"My preferred pizza in Madison, WI, boasts an unparalleled combination of flavors and textures that render it a culinary masterpiece, obviating any concerns regarding the crust's quality or the cooking method employed. The pizza's toppings, an assortment of delectable ingredients carefully curated to maximize taste and aesthetics, serve as the primary focus of my enthusiasm, rendering me nearly speechless upon each encounter. My recent indulgence in this gastronomic delight, following a five-year hiatus, has only reaffirmed my unwavering admiration for its unrivaled excellence."

The club boasted an expansive interior, characterized by an open layout that afforded patrons ample space to engage in various recreational activities without experiencing a sense of claustrophobia or confinement, which was further accentuated by the novelty of dancing on the water; this unique feature not only added an extra layer of enjoyment to the overall experience but also fostered a convivial atmosphere that encouraged social interaction among the club's clientele.

This is my favorite boa location. Staff is helpful and friendly. It can get busy tho especially with all the retailers banking here. \nI don't mind it because after your done there is so many food places around that area!

A nice casual breakfast spot. Food was tasty and even though there was a line out the door, it moved fast. We did have to sit outside because the tables inside were full. Only disadvantages to note: it's serve yourself/cafeteria style. You have to get your own silverware, condiments and drinks. 2nd is they do not have any alcohol so you can't get your Sunday mimosa or Bloody Mary here.

Went here again (7/5) to get my birthday bowl. GG corporate is pretty awesome and they extended my bday bowl a ways to let me get my bday bowl when we were in the area. Props to them for that. There seems to be a wait almost everytime we go there, but this time my veggies were cooked perfectly and my sauce was almost perfect (I put too much salt..dang) but overall it was a great $16 for 2! Love you GG!!

The store here is laid out very well.  It is more of a custom baby store, but has quality items at all diffrent prices.  Some of them my husband and I were sticker shocked, but with having our third baby nine years after the last lots has changed.  The staff here was very helpful and we will be registering for some of our items for the baby shower.

This place is solid. It's not in the same league as Two Sisters Thai or Sala Thai in Phoenix (and I wouldn't call the flavors \"exceptional\" as other reviewers have - I would call them slightly above average), but I go there regularly since it's close to where I live. It's more authentic than a lot of the trendy Asian restaurants in Scottsdale, so that's a plus. One caveat: if you walk in and more than half of the tables are full, LEAVE. This place is not equipped to deal with a full house.

"Gourmet Burger. 

Visited on Memorial Day and unexpectedly, it was teeming with patrons, yet not overwhelmingly so. We managed to secure two seats at the bar. I was inclined to divide a boozy milkshake, but my companion was in the mood for a mixed drink. I opted for the Brown Cow Float. It was lighter, and my companion still needed to provide assistance in consuming it! The flavors were sublime. A true root beer aficionado, I relished the taste of the alcohol. 

Both of us chose to order burgers. My companion augmented his Steakhouse Burger with an egg. I selected the Funghi variety. Both were prepared to perfection. They were delectable. Generous servings. While the fries were unremarkable, the burger's immense size made up for it. The truffle essence was detectable, and the Gruyere cheese was melted to a golden, creamy brown. It was an elevated, sophisticated mushroom and Swiss burger. In a positive manner. The fries were average, but considering the caliber of the establishment, they should ideally serve impeccably cooked fries. Kudos to them, however, for including them in the burger's price. 

The bartenders provided adequate service, but the preparation of the shakes and burgers was leisurely. My companion expressed satisfaction with the mixed drink he had ordered. 

We shall return, and on our next visit, I will request that they ensure my fries are crisp."

I reside and am employed within a mere two blocks of the establishment, hence upon perceiving the pre-opening preparations through the windows, my excitement was palpable. Having an economical and delectable taco venue in such close proximity was nothing short of a culinary dream come true.

Having partaken in their offerings on at least fifteen occasions, I can confidently attest that while some menu items excel over others, the overall quality has yet to disappoint. The pork tacos, in particular, have recently transcended into the realm of the sublime, whereas the beef variants are merely satisfactory. The chicken option, though not necessarily the most scintillating, boasts the dual advantages of being both healthful and flavorful. However, the Carne Asada fails to impress, and the fish taco, regrettably, falls short of the exceptional standards I have experienced elsewhere. Notwithstanding these observations, the inclusion of organic cabbage and tomatoes constitutes a considerable merit in my estimation. Furthermore, their assorted flavored lemonades range from utterly captivating to merely adequate.

The most compelling aspect of this dining establishment lies in its unparalleled value, with three generously proportioned tacos available for the eminently reasonable sum of $4.50. Although authenticity may not be its strong suit, the combination of healthy, non-greasy ingredients, economical pricing, and a proprietor distinguished by his warm and welcoming demeanor render this eatery an irresistible draw, enticing me to partake in its delights on a weekly basis.

This critique pertains exclusively to Le Rive, as the performance itself was largely consistent with my preconceived notions, albeit with a few unexpected elements that rendered it marginally perplexing; specifically, the sheer volume of stimuli bombarding my senses at any given moment made it challenging to absorb every detail simultaneously, and the narrative thread did not unfold with utmost clarity until its ultimate resolution; however, certain aspects of the production did manage to impress, such as the instance when the ensemble cast engaged in synchronized aquatic maneuvers while donning crimson stilettos, their movements fluidly choreographed to avoid surfacing for respiration, which constituted a visually captivating spectacle; furthermore, the arena's innovative design, featuring an unobstructed 360-degree perspective of the pool from any vantage point within the seating area, contributed significantly to the overall immersive experience.

Even though XS totally stole Tryst's thunder, I still love this place. I always have fun here. I like how the dance floor spills outside near the waterfall/pond so that there's readily accessible fresh air. Also, the layout is more interesting than the boring boxy clubs and the people who work here are a gazillion times better than TAO. It's never a problem getting in, and it's not uncomfortably crowded. Also, getting a drink doesn't usually take too long. And the bathrooms are really cute!

"An establishment that offers a satisfactory dining experience, particularly for those who crave a delectable burger. While it may not boast the most exceptional burger one has ever had the pleasure of consuming, it undoubtedly possesses an appealing flavor and generous portion size. The vegetables accompanying the burger, such as lettuce and tomato, exhibit remarkable freshness. Patrons can select from a diverse array of toppings, contributing to a customized dining experience. The prices, though not exorbitant, align with the quality of the culinary offerings. It is worth noting that the standard burger is of considerable size, and thus, it is recommended to opt for the junior version, which proves to be more than sufficient. Furthermore, the small-sized fries bear a striking resemblance to large fries offered at other establishments, leading one to ponder the magnitude of the large fries served here. The ambiance is well-maintained, and the staff demonstrates commendable efficiency in their service."

I periodically frequent this establishment on a biweekly basis, as it offers an extensive array of organic produce, which is regularly rotated to avoid monotony for customers who prioritize organic purchases. The staff members are generally courteous and willing to extend themselves to assist patrons, albeit occasionally, it can be somewhat arduous to locate an employee available to provide assistance. Despite a few idiosyncratic cashiers, the overall experience has been pleasant, and I have yet to encounter substantial queues, primarily due to my tendency to visit during the week. I derive satisfaction from patronizing this store.

"A captivating culinary haven, tucked away amidst an assortment of enterprises on this particular block of Rachel, directly opposite a stately house of worship, and merely a short distance from the picturesque Jeanne Mance Park, presents itself as a veritable haven for gastronomic indulgence. Despite its diminutive dimensions, this charming bakery boasts an impressive array of delectable pastries, which proved to be nothing short of a delightful revelation to our taste buds. Upon entering the cozy establishment, we were warmly greeted by the friendly staff, who graciously informed us that due to the presence of a sizable gathering within, we would need to momentarily await the availability of space. Undeterred, we opted to exercise our culinary curiosity and sampled a pair of their tantalizing specialties (specifically, almond chocolatine and Petit pain brioche), the excellence of which left us utterly enchanted. It is with great enthusiasm that we eagerly anticipate our return, as there were numerous other scrumptious offerings that piqued our interest, including a selection of alluring pies and decadent squares that seemed to beckon to us."

"The quality of this eatery is rather impressive, boasting an extensive array of culinary options that cater to diverse dietary preferences. Notably, the absence of a queue for our party contributed significantly to the overall positive experience, allowing us to indulge in delectable treats without unnecessary delay. Of particular note was the sugar-free cheesecake, whose rich flavor and satisfying texture left a lasting impression. In conclusion, this dining establishment has demonstrated its merit and earned my unwavering endorsement."

"The culinary offerings at Delmonico's were indeed of superior quality, however, I have had the pleasure of partaking in comparably exquisite fare on previous occasions. The ambiance, while aesthetically pleasing, conveyed an air of affected refinement that bordered on discomfort. The supplementary charge of $10 for a side dish of broccoli accompanying my $62 steak appeared somewhat exploitative. 

The service, on the other hand, was impeccable. The staff demonstrated a profound knowledge of their craft and exhibited genuine warmth and hospitality. 

In conclusion, while my experience at Delmonico's was undoubtedly satisfying, it fell short of exceeding my expectations. Nevertheless, I would still consider dining there again in the future, albeit with tempered anticipations."

"The victuals are ostensibly fresh (with the exception of the meat, which has been subjected to cryogenic preservation, thereby precipitating a decline in the establishment's rating by a single stellar increment) and the hospitality is satisfactory. For an approximate sum of $9, a copious bowl of culinary delights, inclusive of white or brown rice, a savory broth, crispy fried noodles, and a potable beverage, can be obtained. The eatery's maintenance is commendable, allowing patrons to customize their meals according to their individual preferences."

Pretty solid Japanese food, I must say. I'm originally from California and I go to school in New York so I've tasted some pretty good Japanese food before and I would definitely say that Chaya is among the top contenders. Is it the best Japanese food I've ever had? No, I wouldn't say that at all. But is it Japanese food that is enjoyable? Yes, I would definitely vouch for that.

I think my slight issue is that I feel like the prices are a bit more on the expensive side. I don't think some of the items on the menu are reasonable at all, but I mean, I suppose they can charge whatever they want since they're one of the better places I've had in Pittsburgh. Service is very nice and always coming by to ask how the food is and if you want any water refills so at least that is good.

If you want traditional Japanese cuisine in Pittsburgh and you have some money to spare, I would definitely say this is a place to go.

"Recently relocated to Phoenix from the Pacific Northwest, we opted to dine at Big Heng, having discovered it through our perusal of online reviews on Yelp. While the culinary offerings were generally satisfactory, we encountered several unanticipated charges for items that are typically included in a traditional Chinese dining experience, such as egg drop soup. Additionally, we found it necessary to request repeatedly certain condiments, specifically mustard and sesame seeds, which are customarily provided without prompting in our former geographic locale. Our meal consisted of kung pao chicken and a combination platter (#3), both of which were served expeditiously, leading us to ponder the freshness of the fare. Notwithstanding this concern, the quality of the cuisine was sufficient to warrant our future patronage."

My bibimbop was good, and it was served in a normal bowl like I expected. I didn't expect a hot pot, because it's not listed as dolsot on the menu. The kimchi was also good, the server was pleasant, and the price was $10 which is reasonable. I'm glad I can get bibimbop in my neighborhood.

"This establishment evokes immense affection within me! I would unhesitatingly confer a perfect five-star rating upon it, were it not for the service, which, albeit satisfactory, falls short of exceptional. As a devoted patron, I frequent this restaurant on a monthly basis, eager to partake in their delectable all-you-can-eat sushi offering for a mere $25. The culinary quality has consistently met my high standards; indeed, I have yet to encounter a dish that did not tantalize my taste buds. However, the atmosphere can become somewhat boisterous during peak hours, as the restaurant's popularity ensures a constant influx of patrons, resulting in a vibrant, albeit somewhat cacophonous ambiance."

This establishment boasts a vibrant and lively bar section, conveniently situated in the heart of downtown Phoenix, merely a stone's throw away from the US Airways Center. Upon entering, it became apparent that the family-friendly zone was segregated from the bar area, a feature that I greatly appreciated. While they offer ample seating, it's not uncommon for the venue to become quite crowded during peak hours, particularly on evenings when sporting events are held. Additionally, parking can prove to be a challenge, especially for patrons who are solely visiting for a meal and beverages, as I discovered upon being charged $10 for parking.  

My order of the Long Island Iced Tea was well-received, as it possessed an adequate amount of potency and a flavor profile that was spot-on, just as a properly crafted Long Island Iced Tea should taste. My spouse opted for the chicken wings, which, although I did not partake in, seemed to impress him. I selected the fish tacos as my meal choice, and they were indeed quite satisfying. However, the cilantro sauce provided alongside the dish was slightly overwhelming in consistency and bore a stronger resemblance to ranch dressing, while the accompanying salsa was merely average.  

Despite these minor drawbacks, I thoroughly enjoyed my experience at this venue, thanks in large part to the friendly and attentive service provided by the bartenders.

"For nocturnal repasts, I am unequivocally an ardent devotee of Tao. The culinary offerings are undoubtedly delectable, the hospitality is unparalleled in its excellence, and the ambiance is utterly captivating. The salads, in particular, are a masterful synthesis of Western and Eastern influences, such that I could easily consume an entire bowl as my solitary course and still feel thoroughly satiated. Furthermore, the sea bass dishes are truly exceptional, nearly rivaling the sublime quality of the sea bass skewers available at Sushi Samba. Lastly, their assortment of sweet treats is nothing short of remarkable; indeed, I have had the pleasure of sampling each and every one of them, and I must say, they are simply divine."

"Gastronomical excellence and an accommodating ambiance for herbivores. A culinary gem reminiscent of an upscale eatery in Manhattan's Meatpacking District, offered at a fraction of the cost. Sporadic visits have rendered mixed experiences with regard to the pace of service, occasionally bordering on unacceptable tardiness. An otherwise exceptional dining establishment, elevation to a perfect rating would necessitate streamlined bread and beverage provision, transcending the prevailing sluggishness. For those with ample time and a relaxed schedule, seeking delectable Italian cuisine sans marinara reliance, a visit is highly recommended."

I loved the crab cakes here! They were made perfectly, very flavorful. The decor is pretty and modern with dim lights and lit candles. Very romantic. The one thing I didn't like was how the tables were all so close to each other. The restaurant is pretty big but not roomy. Our server was great, he knew how to crack jokes which kept the mood more lively. \n\nMe and the bf both ordered the ribeye which came in a pretty big portion. Although it was missing a little flavor. There wasn't anything special about it so it was just average. I wanted dessert but we were just too stuffed from the steak. I def. regret that! Although our waiter knew it was our anniversary so he brought out a plate with some chocolate and on the plate it said \"Happy Anniversary\". That was sweet and it seriously made my night. I left happy and satisfied.

Been here a couple times for the XDC event and I've only ever really seen one track. BUT!!! When I do go, next to the track is a huge lake where people drive their different water vehicles and can do jumps I think if they want to go water skiing. I do get burnt when it's hot but when track doesn't get you burnt?

"A delightful establishment offering delectable indulgences, strategically positioned near the central square of the academic institution, providing a brief respite from the arduous journey across the expansive grounds. Although the taste is generally satisfying, the freshness leaves little to be desired, yet the true disappointment lies in the discontinuation of their most alluring confection, the Earl Grey Truffle, thereby diminishing the overall experience by one star, as it has cruelly fostered an unrequited affection for an unattainable delicacy."

"We opted to dine at Delights following an evening of merriment at the Signature, and our culinary excursion proved to be a satisfying experience. My selection, the Las Vegas Blvd sandwich, boasted an array of delectable ingredients including skirt steak, a fried egg, caramelized onions, and a savory sauce. While my only criticism pertains to the slightly diminutive serving size and the relatively elevated cost, I must concede that the quality of the dish was, indeed, quite impressive. My total expenditure for this gastronomic indulgence was $12, yet I harbor no significant grievances in light of the sandwich's exceptional taste."

This place is really good.  There are five meats (pork ribs, beef ribs, fried chicken, catfish, and perch), and with your meat you get two sides (e.g., collard greens, black-eyed peas, sweet potatoes, mac and cheese, sauteed veggies) and a bread (corn muffin, hush puppies, or dinner roll).  This is for about $8 combined, and you can also order the sides separately.  Plus there are desserts like sweet potato pie and lemon cake.

Doug cooks up all the dinner food in the back, and his wife makes the desserts and does the table service in the front.  That is pretty adorable.  The food is good - no crazy frills, not particularly refined, but solid.  The fried chicken is particularly tasty, with a thin but very crispy skin and super juicy interior.  I also thought the mac and cheese and collard greens were highlights.  The pork ribs were actually underwhelming at the restaurant, but they were significantly better heated up at home the next day.

There are about 10 tables in the storefront, but you can also do takeout.  There was not a lot of business when I was there on a Wednesday night, probably because the location is kind of out of the way.  But, you should make it a point to go.  In my opinion, Doug's is a clear winner over Kip's, even though Kip's is also good.

"My sentiments regarding this establishment are unequivocal; the culinary offerings presented by this eatery are nothing short of delectable. Their Pho, a traditional Vietnamese noodle soup, is an epicurean delight that showcases the perfect balance of flavors and textures. Furthermore, their fried rice and rice plates are equally impressive, boasting an array of savory ingredients expertly prepared to tantalize one's taste buds. Should you harbor any skepticism regarding my claims, I implore you to partake in a personal culinary excursion to this venue and experience the gastronomical excellence firsthand."

"The Rigatoni Bolognese is utterly phenomenal, constituting an unparalleled gastronomical experience that ascends far beyond my expectations! It's my utmost favorite dish served at this esteemed culinary establishment, and I cannot wait to partake in its delectable flavors once again. (Written in 2012, but regrettably posted with an unfortunate delay.)"

A culinary aficionado and gastronomic historian escorted me to Joe's Diner, and my subsequent visits have been numerous and recurrent. The eatery's ambiance exudes a traditional American diner motif, while the victuals and beverages boast a superior quality. Sandwiches priced at $10 are skillfully prepared and presented with precision. The coffee, specifically Arbuckles Ariosa cowboy coffee, is an exemplary representation of the brew's rich flavor profile. The server, a paragon of hospitality, exhibited a warm and friendly demeanor. This unpretentious gem in the Melrose District has captured my patronage with its delectable offerings and welcoming atmosphere.

Been here several times and always leave happy and full! 
The drink menu is fantastic... a few of my favs are the red headed stepchild, stoney bah-loanie and pure vesper. 
The food is always spot on...love the pork belly, nancy with pork belly, charcuterie, pork tostadas and ALWAYS try to the TOT of the day!
I can't imagine ever having a bad meal here!

When I placed a call to them, they exhibited an unwavering commitment to providing me with an accurate estimate by going to great lengths to ensure that they had procured all requisite information, including physically inspecting my unit to ascertain its serial number for the purpose of determining warranty status. Their dedication to transparency and integrity was evident in the manner in which they presented their quote, which, although slightly higher than the other two estimates I had obtained, was accompanied by an ironclad guarantee of their workmanship for a period of one year. Furthermore, they demonstrated an unwavering commitment to customer satisfaction by expeditiously cooling my residence during the height of summer and following up with me on two separate occasions to ensure that their services had met my expectations. Throughout the entire process, I was impressed by their exceptional level of professionalism and unwavering commitment to honesty, which served to foster an atmosphere of trust and confidence.

A great menu, very polite staff and a nice atmosphere. Not cheap but definitely not the worst in the MGM. Four of us had some drinks and nice amount of food for $300. Have the server mix up a plate of oysters for you, they are to die for. Clams are always \"ehh\" so don't expect miracles. The meat selection is not terribly vast, but what they did have is just fine. The rib-eye is something truly special.

On our maiden visit to this esteemed eatery, we opted for the delectable lunchtime spread, accompanied by a pair of companions, and our gastronomic expectations were not only met but indeed surpassed, owing to the copious array of vegetarian delights that awaited our eager taste buds.

"This particular establishment serves as the preferred venue for my spouse and me to indulge in beverages, browse through literary works, and engage in recreational activities. Despite its lack of eccentricity or modernity, it maintains consistent operational hours, including on Sundays when I am occupied with grading assignments. The staff members exhibit amiability and proffer assistance in securing publications, boasting an impressive selection of games for a sizable bookstore. I was able to acquire the popular cooperative board game Pandemic there, which added to my delight. Furthermore, I derive pleasure from observing the frequency of educators patronizing this business."

If you are willing to tolerate a slightly more distant location from the strip, then this lodging option is an ideal choice! While it may not offer the opulent hotel experience typically associated with Las Vegas establishments, I found the experience to be thoroughly satisfying.  

During a recent trip to Las Vegas with a group of friends, we opted to reserve two suites for a duration of three nights. Each suite featured a fully equipped kitchen, a washer and dryer, two spacious bedrooms (one boasting a king-sized bed complete with a Jacuzzi, and the other outfitted with two queen-sized beds), and a stylish living area adorned with a flat-screen television, a plush couch, comfortable chairs, and a dining table. The accommodations exuded a warm, welcoming ambiance, and meticulous attention had been paid to ensuring spotless cleanliness throughout. Additionally, there were ample supplies of fresh towels in each bathroom.  

The property also showcased a lovely pool area, where guests could unwind and enjoy a refreshing swim. Although glass containers were prohibited near the pool, Solo cups were permitted for beverages â?a subtle detail that added to the overall convenience. While the pool may not have rivaled the renowned Encore Beach Club, it offered a serene atmosphere perfect for lounging, sunbathing, and dozing off.  

I would undoubtedly choose to stay at this establishment again if given the opportunity. My sole criticism would be the delay in preparing one of our suites upon arrival, and the presence of a substantial hole in one of the bathroom doors. However, the customer service team demonstrated exceptional efficiency in addressing the issue and did not impose any charges for the damage.

"The proficiency and culinary prowess exhibited by this establishment's staff are truly commendable, as they have successfully created an ambiance that exudes excellence in both the quality of their fare and the attention accorded to each patron. It is evident that no superfluous embellishments or unnecessary elements are present in the presentation of their dishes, as the emphasis is placed squarely on the authenticity and superiority of the cuisine itself. Furthermore, it is apparent that every dish that leaves the kitchen is not only visually appealing but also redolent with aromas that betoken the rich flavors that await the diner. Needless to say, I shall indeed revisit this eatery in the near future, eager to indulge in a more comprehensive exploration of their extensive menu."

We entered the 9:30 pm performance without preconceived notions, and our expectations were pleasantly surpassed. The production boasted a diverse array of acts, which captivated our attention and left us thoroughly entertained. Although the showcase was intended for mature audiences, it incorporated instances of risquÃ© humor that may not be suitable for all family members. The seating arrangement was somewhat cramped, particularly the temporary seats that lacked adequate comfort. Nonetheless, our overall experience was enjoyable, and we would recommend this production to anyone seeking a lighthearted and engaging evening of entertainment.

I'm never disappointed when I eat at a Wildflower.  It's a better version of Paradise Bakery with a feel free to stay all day if you like (but less pretentious) Starbucks vibe.  I also dig that one of the founders of the company emailed me to address some of my critiques of another location, even though the review was generally positive.  It's great to see that they're paying attention to their customers.

There's a great selection of sandwiches, salads and baked goods.  For the sandwiches I think the secret is in the simplicity and quality.  Most of them don't have more than three or four ingredients, but they seem to put together the perfect combination between those two slices of fresh baked bread.  My wife's caesar salad may have been one of the tastiest caesar salads I've ever tried.

This location also has a few cool things going for it.  There are power outlets under many of the booths, making it convenient for computer and tablet users to do whatever they are doing as they enjoy their drinks and meals.  Like other locations, there's the standard lounge near the front of the restaurant that's a perfect place for waiting for take out orders, or for coffee drinkers to hang out in a more open setting.  And this Wildflower also has a private party room in the back, which is also nice if you have a big group.

If you're anywhere nearby, Wildflower Bread Company is certainly worth a try.

I love West Elm... what girl doesn't.  Great bedding, throw pillows, ok everything!

This is a very large store, but it doesn't seem to have several designs that are on the website.  I know most of the West Elm stores only get certain designs, but for the size of this store I wish they had a little more. 

I noticed that they have items on sale online from my email, but it doesn't always translate to the same price in their store.  

Staff is super friendly and very helpful!  I'm so thankful Las Vegas has West Elm... I had a mini panic attack when I realized there was no Crate and Barrel.

The is the one of the best places in Vegas to shop for home decor.

"My culinary infatuation with Ethiopian cuisine commenced upon my exposure to its delectable flavors in San Francisco, courtesy of my uncle's acquaintance with an individual proficient in its preparation. Subsequently, my appreciation for this exotic fare was further reinforced by a close family friend hailing from Ethiopia, who introduced me to an array of mouthwatering dishes. My ardent affection for this cuisine is such that I would unhesitatingly consume it daily if given the opportunity. With regards to my experience with Blue Nile, the first Ethiopian restaurant I had the pleasure of visiting in Phoenix, I must confess that my initial impression was one of immense satisfaction. Upon entering the establishment, I was struck by the inviting ambiance and the pleasant aroma of spices wafting through the air. The menu offered a diverse selection of dishes, which I eagerly perused before opting for the chicken entrÃ©e accompanied by mushrooms and lentils, served with the customary spongy bread that serves as the utensil for consuming the meal. The taste was sublime, and I relished every bite. Although I would have preferred the opportunity to sample multiple dishes simultaneously, I cannot deny that Blue Nile left a favorable impression on me. Notwithstanding, my affinity for Cafe Lalibela remains unwavering, and I look forward to revisiting both establishments in the future while enthusiastically recommending them to others."

"Despite its antiquated moniker, The Old Fashioned exudes vitality and resides within close proximity to an institution of higher learning in the Great Lakes State. Patrons can indulge in artfully crafted mixed beverages at a reasonable tariff, while also savoring delectable fare that transcends the menu's apparent simplicity. Of particular note is the establishment's signature dish, cheese curds, which boast an unparalleled quality that renders them a compulsory selection for any gastronomic aficionado. These golden nuggets of gouda are served with an array of complementary dipping sauces, available at an additional cost yet well worth the supplemental expenditure."

This place is super cool. Loved the tree stump stools, the unfinished tables with hardware and chalk menu board. The staff is very nice and the java is pretty darn good. I went for iced latte but I couldn't resist the the chocolate chip cookie with BACON! Yes...bacon! Why does bacon make everything taste better?! \n\nCan't wait to check out their wine selection next!

I really enjoy this place. Ambiance is fantastic. Just the right lighting, cool space, nice bar which is the center piece and should be because the bartenders are top notch. Drinks are not the average bottle slinging. Anything off the menu is an experience though the special was too smokey like eating a piece of wood out of the fire. However no uppity BS, she took it back and made me another. 

Had the special which was the chacatuire as an app with the fried Brussel sprouts. Both were outstanding. For main course we had the special strip which was also fantastic. The only reason I don't give it 5 stars is because the waygu was way too fatty and not well seasoned. Dessert was phenomenal. Chocolate pecan pie and the chocolate mousse. Both of them were so good we nearly ordered another. 

This place consistently delivers a great dining experience. Karen was a great waitress as well. My friend from Cincinnati repeatedly said they had nothing like it there. Props to the burgh and to meat and potatoes for bringing big city dining to our beautiful city.

Prior to the advent of Whole Foods Market in New York City, I was invariably captivated by any branch I chanced upon, and despite the fact that WFM has had an esteemed presence in NYC for over a decade, my fascination with their establishments remains unwavering. My recent visit to the store located in the heart of Manhattan's Upper West Side was a particularly pleasant experience, primarily due to its relatively recent opening last September, as conveyed by one of the employees. The second-floor outdoor seating area was a tranquil oasis, offering a respite from the bustling cityscape below.

While perusing the prepared foods section, I noticed an enticing promotion, whereby four healthy salad options could be obtained for the nominal fee of $4, a veritable bargain. However, my enthusiasm was somewhat tempered by the middling quality of the hot and cold prepared foods arrayed on the buffet table. Notwithstanding this minor shortcoming, the establishment boasted an impressive selection of soups, and the ample parking facilities below ground were an added convenience.

"Our discovery of this bakery was facilitated by the utilization of the popular review website, Yelp. My companion and I had been eagerly anticipating the opportunity to sample their delectable almond croissants for an extended period of time. Our desire was further amplified by our presence in the vicinity during an early Saturday afternoon. However, much to our dismay, we were met with disappointment upon arriving at the establishment, as they had exhausted their supply of said pastries. Nevertheless, we chose to persevere and elected to indulge in an apple pastry and a pistachio eclair instead. To our delight, both items proved to be scrumptious. We eagerly look forward to revisiting this bakery in the future."

"Their gastronomical creations, specifically their sandwiches, possess an exceptional level of culinary excellence, which is a testament to the establishment's commitment to providing delectable fare to its clientele. Moreover, the convenience of their 24-hour operations is an added benefit, catering to the diverse needs of their patronage. Upon arriving at the venue subsequent to midnight, we encountered a sizable queue and noticed that a considerable number of tables were already occupied, indicating the popularity of this eatery among nocturnal revelers. Furthermore, the artisanal bread utilized in their sandwiches boasts a satisfying crunchiness, contributing to the overall enjoyment of the dining experience. In conclusion, my personal endorsement of their offerings includes, but is not limited to, The Original variety, which surprisingly piqued my taste buds despite my initial reservations regarding the inclusion of horseradish. I eagerly anticipate the opportunity to sample additional items from their menu, thereby enabling me to provide a comprehensive assessment of their culinary prowess."

"Genuinely exceptional culinary experiences featuring premium quality, mesquite grilled steaks, burgers, chicken, et cetera, are available in a charmingly rustic, yet meticulously maintained ambiance.  Reasonable pricing, diverse offerings, and an impressive level of hospitality are hallmarks of this esteemed dining establishment. 

Conveniently located merely seven minutes away from the US 60 via the Idaho exit (rather than Tomahawk), this eatery offers a unique and pleasurable respite for those seeking a divergent atmosphere. 

The sole drawback, albeit minor, pertains to its popularity among seasonal visitors, transforming it into a veritable snowbird mecca during peak seasons."

Went here once for labwork.  My wife had something down the street to tend to.  No one was there, and it was only me that Friday morning.  I was in and out in 7 minutes.  Too bad this place is now closed :-(!!!

I've been wanting to stop by here before work for weeks and I finally had the chance this past week and it was definitely worth it! They currently have a $1.50 deal for a doughnut and a cup of coffee; the perfect way to start your Friday. Their pastries and doughnuts are delicious! Absolutely stop by if you get the chance.

"I had the pleasure of experiencing the exceptional services offered by this airline during a previous aerial excursion from Phoenix, Arizona to Portland, Oregon. My journey was characterized by an unparalleled level of comfort and convenience, which greatly enhanced my overall satisfaction with the flight. It is worth noting that this carrier operates out of Terminal 2, which is situated in close proximity to the intersection of Interstate 10 and the airport's entrance. This terminal's strategic location enables effortless access to parking facilities and streamlined security screening processes, thereby facilitating a seamless and efficient travel experience for passengers. In light of the aforementioned factors, I would unequivocally consider utilizing the services of this airline again in the event that my travel plans take me to the Pacific Northwest region in the future."

As an Italian, I eat way too much pasta. I was a bit skeptical trying out a place that makes \"fresh pasta\" since we do it fresh at home but this place is definitely worth your time and money. The pasta is very fresh, the sauces are quite tasty and the people working there are super helpful. I would suggest this place if you're having guests over and want to make something super quick and good!

"My culinary experience at this establishment was thoroughly satisfactory, as I indulged in their delectable jambalaya, which proved to be a flavorsome and gratifying selection. My companion, who accompanied me on this gastronomical adventure, opted for the fish and pasta entrÃ©e, which she relished with unbridled enthusiasm. Unfortunately, our alfresco dining experience was slightly marred by the presence of an annoying bee that persistently buzzed around our table, interrupting our otherwise tranquil ambiance. Notwithstanding this minor drawback, the beverages served were of superior quality, the portions were generous, and the overall ambience of the restaurant exuded a sense of serenity."

"Hunan Park Chinese Takeout Shop is your quintessential destination for delectable and expeditious culinary experiences, consistently delivering palatable fare without any unnecessary delay. Their General Tso's Chicken is an unmitigated recommendation from this writer, a gastronomic indulgence that will undoubtedly satiate even the most discerning of palates. However, it is advisable to request utensils in advance or bring your own, lest you find yourself in a predicament bereft of the necessary implements to enjoy your meal. In conclusion, Hunan Park earns high marks across all aspects of their service."

"Culinary excellence was exemplified by the delectable salmon dish, which elicited an unwavering craving for more of its kind. However, our server's comportment was somewhat incongruous with the otherwise pleasant dining experience, as his responses to our inquiries were tainted by a perceptible trace of superciliousness and a lack of cordiality, thereby diminishing our overall satisfaction to a degree that precluded us from conferring a rating exceeding four stars, particularly given the eatery's propensity for attracting novice patrons such as ourselves."

"For those who are seeking a luxurious yet economical accommodation experience in Las Vegas, this hotel is an optimal choice. Located on Fremont Street, it boasts an impressive size and has undergone extensive renovations in recent years, totaling millions of dollars. Many visitors are surprised to discover that such a high-end hotel is not situated on the famous Las Vegas Strip. The hotel's pool area is particularly noteworthy, featuring a unique shark tank with an exhilarating water slide that passes directly through its center. This attraction is certain to captivate visitors and create lasting memories. While the hotel's location may not offer the same fresh air quality as those on the Strip, the reasonable admission fee of $20 makes it an appealing option for those seeking a refreshing aquatic experience without breaking the bank. However, it is worth noting that the hotel's non-Strip location may pose a minor inconvenience for some guests, particularly those who are sensitive to smoke, as the air quality may not be as pristine as they would prefer."

Tea Station serves as an optimal destination for individuals seeking a brief rejuvenation during the late hours of the evening, particularly for those who partake in nocturnal indulgences such as clubbing or dining. My associates and I tend to frequent this establishment as a prelude to our nightly escapades or subsequent to culinary excursions. A peak in patronage is typically observed between the hours of 9 pm and 11 pm. The ambiance of the venue exudes a relaxed demeanor, while the staff has demonstrated marked improvement in their attentiveness and communication skills since my initial visit approximately 2-3 years prior. An array of tea varieties is available for selection, accompanied by an assortment of edible items. My personal preference is their taro milk tea complemented by boba.

"The culinary offerings at this establishment were truly remarkable, particularly in light of its designation as a brew pub. The quality of the beverages served, specifically the beer, was truly exceptional and rivaled that of other, more specialized drinking establishments. Furthermore, the hospitality displayed by the staff was characterized by a prompt and courteous demeanor, which greatly enhanced our dining experience."

Terrific, family-friendly burger joint with an outstanding craft beer selection and a roomy patio. What more could you ask for? The burgers may not be the best I've had (hit SmashBurger or Big Daddy's for those), but they get the job done. And did I mention the craft beer selection? Best I've seen in a casual dining joint. B.T.'s is an outstanding addition to Charlotte's burger scene!

My predilection for the Cheesecake Factory is rooted in its reliability and uniformity, as evidenced by the vast and diversified menu offerings that never fail to impress, albeit not quite attaining gourmet standards, but nonetheless satisfying my culinary inclinations within the affordable price range. Moreover, I am particularly fond of their innovative curbside takeout system, which enables patrons to place orders over the phone and have them delivered directly to their vehicles, thereby eliminating the need for physical entry into the establishment, thereby optimizing convenience; a pioneering attribute that sets the Cheesecake Factory apart from its competitors. Lastly, it would be remiss of me not to mention the exceptional quality of their eponymous cheesecakes, which boast an array of creative flavors and textures that cater to diverse tastes, thus solidifying the Cheesecake Factory's reputation as a paragon of culinary excellence.

Since Yelp orders things by original date, and there are 2982 reviews when I write this, I'm thinking my review will be read in say, March of 2017.  

That said, I've made a point to try most of the Strip buffets, the other reviewers aren't lying it's pretty tasty here overall.

They've got the small pots/baskets for a lot of the dishes like some of the other buffets do, and though they are cute, you end up with one on your plate, and no room for any of the other tasty treats.   

All the usual seafood choices (crab legs, etc...)

The bone marrow is good, but wow it's filling and greasy.  Do not have it first!  

Dessert choice is great, a lot of choices (macarons even!) to be had.

Service is normal for buffets, the servers are attentive and friendly, clearing your multiple plates away without you noticing.

Out of the way to get to in the hotel though, which is both a good and bad thing.  Good in that it reduces lines.  Bad in that you have a long hike to get there, and honestly, it feels like you're walking through dead parts of a convention hotel where you probably shouldn't even be.  But viola, there you suddenly are, and it's food coma time.

"This quaint eatery thoroughly delighted me, secluded in a tranquil corner of the Grand Canal Shoppes, boasting an authentic Italian experience, courtesy of its native Italian proprietors and staff. Their recommendations were highly commendable, and my linguine fruti de mare (a delectable fusion of clams, calamari, and shrimp, enveloped in a spicy marinara) was relished immensely, while my mother savored her linguine in clam sauce, and my aunt indulged in the swordfish piccata, accompanied by succulent steamed vegetables. Notably, the swordfish piccata's flavors were masterfully balanced, with the piccata's richness complemented by the fish's tender texture. Additionally, the gratis garlic knots were a pleasant surprise, offering a satisfying crunch and subtle infusion of garlic. Our skepticism regarding the tiramisu was swiftly dispelled upon sampling its luscious, velvety goodness; its surprisingly airy creaminess rendering it a refreshing delight. My aunt's initial hesitation was quickly replaced by gratitude for our decision to include it in our culinary excursion. Furthermore, the news of their impending expansion brought me joy, as this hidden gem undoubtedly merits increased exposure."

I had the chicken rice noodle soup and it was good, so was the fried eggroll. My husband had the chicken curry soup, I didn't care for that very much. Their thai coffee was good. I would definitely go back.

The worst thing about this place is its name.  I think even the hostess mispronounced it and it really has nothing to do with the menu or ambiance of the restaurant.  Goodyear needs another Mexican restaurant to go out of business 2 months after opening like it needs another pizza place.  So I was pleasantly surprised to find that although it has a Latin flair, Caballero Grill is not another Mexican restaurant.

We went for a late lunch which meant we were there for happy hour.  I had a great, big cheese burger and fries for 6 dollars.  Quality ingredients through out.  My wife ordered a couple of their specialty drinks which were a bargain at $4.

There were some other misses though.  The trio dip, while good was not worth the $5 happy hour price much less the $7 regular price.  Our neighbors had the mini chimichangas and they barely looked worth the $4 happy hour price.  My wife had the club sandwich sliders which were just too much bread and not enough flavor.  Domestic drafts are 50% off at happy hour but micro-brews are only 20% off which does not make me very happy.

Overall though it was a pleasant surprise and not a complete fleecing.

"The culinary offerings and hospitality at this establishment are truly exceptional, and despite its diminutive size, the ambiance is welcoming and conducive to a pleasant dining experience. Upon being seated, we were promptly attended to by a staff member who inquired about our beverage preferences. I am eager to return and sample additional items from their extensive menu."

To indulge in an opulent morning repast with my kin, specifically "the Fam" and their progeny, I opted to dine at Joe's, an establishment renowned for its delectable culinary offerings. Our group's satiation was achieved without incurring an excessive financial burden, and we departed the premises with palates thoroughly gratified. For aficionados of cured pork, I recommend ordering multiple servings of bacon, as it attains an unparalleled level of gustatory excellence. Other menu items sampled by our party included French toast, breakfast burritos, pancakes, and cinnamon buns, all of which were consumed with great relish. My offspring and I elected to partake in the biscuits and gravy, a decision we both enthusiastically endorsed subsequent to savoring the dish's tender, flaky pastries complemented by a rich, flavorful gravy. At a mere $2.99, this indulgence proved not only satisfying but also an economic boon. In conclusion, I wholeheartedly advocate paying a visit to Joe's for an experience that will satiate your hunger and delight your taste buds.

"Phenomenal pho, boasting an exceptionally delectable and generously proportioned broth, complemented by an assortment of succulent rolls that are executed to perfection. Have had the pleasure of partaking in their culinary offerings on multiple occasions, courtesy of its convenient location, and must say that the experience has been nothing short of delightful each time. Of late, had the opportunity to sample a diverse array of dishes in the company of several fellow gastronomes, resulting in a veritable feast that not only satiated our appetites but also yielded ample leftovers. Noteworthily, the establishment's hospitable staff extended their operating hours to accommodate ourselves and a few other patrons, exemplifying their commitment to providing top-notch service."

If you want sushi at your own pace and without telling the sushi chef what you want, then this place is it.  The quality I would say borders good to excellent. This is rather surprising in the fact that this is a conveyor belt styled sushi place. The price is very reasonable.

The staff cycles the dish frequently to keep the items fresh and cold. For a sushi connoisseur, there is nothing worse than warm or luke-cold sushi.

Selections are average in that, there are more rolled sushi as opposed to nigiri styled sushi.

I do hope the staff will provide ginger (gari), along with wassabi to all the patrons. 

Finally, this is not a restaurant to hold your power meetings, but will accommodate groups, family style dining, in casual setting.

We indulged in a delectable dining experience at this establishment, partaking in both a savory meal and refreshing beverages, and our expectations were surpassed by the exceptional quality of the fare. The gargantuan soft pretzels proved to be a culinary masterpiece, boasting an irresistible allure that was attributable to their buttery texture and delightful flavor profile, which was further complemented by a tangy roasted pepper cheese sauce. Although the pretzels were undoubtedly a highlight of our dining excursion, we found it judicious to share them, given the abundance of rich, velvety butter that graciously saturated each bite. Furthermore, the prices for these delectable offerings were eminently reasonable, and the alfresco seating area provided an idyllic setting in which to enjoy our repast. However, what truly elevated our dining experience to an unparalleled level was the music, which was carefully curated to create an ambiance that was both lively and convivial, thereby fostering an atmosphere that was conducive to relaxation and merriment.

I love whole foods ! The groceries are soooo fresh and decently priced but the only drawback is the employees... \nThey're kinda rude and don't have much of a personality... The cashiers don't hold much of a conversation, they seem so miserable working here! \nEven though the employees are lame, it won't keep me from giving whole foods my business that's why I am giving four stars!!

"Peruse the plethora of delectable dining establishments offering Sunday brunch in Montreal, but be cognizant of potentially extensive waiting periods, which may prove detrimental to your culinary experience. Instead, consider visiting such an eatery mid-week, when the ambiance is likely to be less frenetic, thereby enabling a more leisurely and enjoyable repast. By doing so, you may even have the felicitous opportunity to cross paths with renowned figures, such as the illustrious Georges St. Pierre, who, coincidentally, was encountered by us during our own Sunday brunch excursion, whereupon we savored scrumptious Eggs Benedict, accompanied by the esteemed gentleman's presence, thus rendering the occasion even more memorable."

"The verdant expanse known as The Green serves as a tranquil focal point within the urban confines of Charlotte, its diminutive stature notwithstanding, it remains an unmistakable nod to the iconic Central Park in New York City.  Scattered throughout this picturesque setting are distinctive works of art, each one showcasing the creativity and ingenuity of local artisans, while whimsical signposts direct visitors towards various imaginative destinations, adding to the overall sense of playfulness and merriment that permeates the atmosphere.  This idyllic venue offers an ideal setting for families to indulge in frozen treats and allow their children to burn off excess energy, courtesy of the sun's warm rays, or for couples to stroll hand in hand, basking in the romantic ambiance that envelops them.  Amidst the lush foliage, a charming fountain featuring colossal fish adorns each corner, inviting passersby to partake in a customary act of coin tossing, symbolizing wishes for future prosperity and good fortune.  Although The Green may be reserved for nuptials and associated celebrations, personal preferences may incline individuals to seek alternative, less populated locations for such momentous occasions, opting instead to savor the serenity and leisurely pace that this captivating park embodies."

I was badly craving asian food and decided to give PF Chang's a try.  Being a lone diner since I was in town for business, I was worried that they were going to ignore me or sit me in a crappy area to hide me.  However, the service was great.  I was glad to see my food come quickly and taste good.  \n\nI had the lettuce wraps, crab rangoon, and a cup of their hot and sour soup.  All three were excellent.  I would definitely recommend this place to business travelers who might be staying in the area.  (There are a lot of hotels near by)
I just had to drop a note to say just how nice it was to have fast, clear and strong Wi-Fi in my room.\nWhomever handles that for your place is doing great work.

This boutique, situated within the luxurious Bellagio resort, boasts a more diminutive stature compared to its equivalent establishment stationed within the Aria property. The visually striking chocolate fountain serves as an ideal backdrop for photographic opportunities. However, the queue can become somewhat perplexing, particularly when throngs of patrons congregate within the compact shop, which features restricted seating. Eager to procure personalized sweets for my companion's celebration, I inadvertently disregarded the sales associate's description of the item I was indicating. Specifically, my taste buds recognized the phrase "Raspberry Macaroon," while the young woman actually uttered "Raspberry Macaroon infused with ROSE OIL." Consequently, I did not relish the miniature version I purchased for myself, whereas my companions expressed immense satisfaction and fervor towards their respective desserts.

Love the food amazing for being as vegan as I can be amazing place to dine in on a date with options for us. Our order has come our a few times with seafood in it but we look past it for the amazing staff and management willing to correct it. As well as more than happy to serve us. When ever our order has been wrong we still paid full price we weren't looking for a freebie just simply a correction in the kitchen and it was made. Great drinks, food, and staff, will always return.

"This eatery certainly warrants affection! For those who relish authentic Mexican cuisine, it's imperative to experience the culinary delights offered here. My personal preference is the flour tortilla chicken flautas, which harmonizes beautifully with the complementary chips, salsa, and beans served prior to ordering. Additionally, their Sunday brunch buffet presents an exceptional value. Featuring handcrafted tortillas and a medley of traditional Mexican morning fare, including juevos con hamon, chile verde con pollo, and, of course, crispy bacon. The ambiance is further enhanced by live musical performances."

"As an ardent devotee, my enthusiasm for this establishment hinges upon two pivotal factors: the economic feasibility of their morning repast and the diverse array of baked delights available. My scrutiny of the menu revealed that the breakfast price of $8.95 is only applicable prior to 10 am, at which point it transforms into the more expensive 'brunch' option ($13.95). Consequently, I advocate for an early arrival to optimize your dining experience. The buffet itself was a veritable cornucopia of culinary delights, boasting an impressive assortment of fresh fruit salad, savory biscuits and gravy, creamy grits, delectable cheese and potato hash, succulent muffins, buttery scones, flaky pastries, and an assortment of eggs prepared to your liking. Additionally, there were mouthwatering sausages, rashers of bacon, and even blueberry French toast. Each item was meticulously prepared to accentuate its unique qualities, ensuring that every bite was simultaneously crispy, fluffy, and moist. The boundless nature of the spread only augmented the enjoyment. The hospitable servers contributed to the convivial ambiance, and by 10:30 am, the venue had begun to fill up. The desirability of the south-end location serves as the icing on the cake, rendering any further justification for giving them a try superfluous. Rest assured, I shall return!"

"Indulge in an array of delectable oyster varieties at this esteemed establishment, where the freshness and quality of the bivalves are unparalleled in Las Vegas. The ambiance is suitable for both intimate gatherings and larger groups, offering an extensive selection of premium oysters that cater to diverse tastes. The knowledgeable staff provides exceptional service, allowing patrons to sample each variety before selecting the optimal dozen. Although the seafood platter may not meet expectations, the overall dining experience remains satisfying, especially when complemented by a friendly rapport with the bartender or oyster monger. A $50 meal of this caliber is certainly a worthwhile investment."

"This charming and diminutive eatery boasts an array of delectable pastries that are undoubtedly worth a visit. The friendly and hospitable staff adds to the overall appeal, creating a welcoming ambiance that invites patrons to linger and enjoy their culinary delights. Although the shop's physical dimensions may appear modest, it surprisingly offers an impressive amount of seating, accommodating a sizable number of customers within its cozy confines. However, be advised that complimentary samples of their scrumptious pastries are generously offered, which may tempt you into indulging in more than you had initially intended, transforming a hasty coffee stop into a leisurely gastronomic experience."
They quoted me 15 minutes, and just 10 minutes later called my name to say it was done. Quickest oil change I've ever had.\n\nPaid $38 and some change with the $5 off Ladies' Wednesday discount.
What a truly amazing view and ride through that mountainside! I will recommend this place to anyone that ends up in the area. It is something to see for sure

"The gastronomical establishment has undergone a thorough renovation, resulting in an expanded interior that exudes a more modern and sophisticated ambiance, with a repositioned bar area that affords increased space for socializing and dining, complemented by plush, tufted leather armchairs and subdued crimson illumination. My personal preferences include the delectable Cowbell Chili & Smoked Cornbread, a savory black bean burger, crispy sweet potato croquettes that resemble miniature donuts, and Dali's fries adorned with an assortment of flavorful toppings such as garlic aioli, buffalo sauce, grated Parmesan cheese, and a medley of fresh herbs. A comprehensive assessment of this culinary venue can be found on my blog, but the aforementioned items represent the most notable aspects of its offerings."

"Tacos El Gordo offers an array of delectable and authentic Mexican culinary delights, boasting an impressive taco selection that is both extensive and diverse, catering to the discerning palates of aficionados who crave rich, bold flavors. Furthermore, the prices are reasonable and affordable, making it an accessible dining option for those seeking a satisfying meal without breaking the bank. Additionally, the establishment remains open late, providing patrons with ample time to indulge in their preferred dishes at their convenience. However, the line system can become somewhat disorganized and perplexing, detracting from the overall experience. To enhance the efficiency of the queue, strategically placed signs above the ordering counters would greatly improve the process, thereby warranting a perfect five-star rating."

Been going to this place for years....... Hadn't been there in a long time and happened to be on Decatur today and we stopped by........ We should have just gotten one hoagie...... We split one and that was more than enough for both of us, ended up saving the other one for later..... Not a fan of fried Okra but we had some anyway, it was so so, I prefer the zucchini .. Don't understand the complaints about the prices, i think for what you get its fine.....We didn't bother eating outside since it's too damn hot this time of year, so we just brought everything home and it was pretty darn good.... We'll be back for more next time we're on that side of town........

Flavors and portions were precise and satisfactory, yet the quality of customer service was subpar and left ample room for improvement. Despite this shortcoming, the restaurant's culinary offerings were sufficient enough to warrant repeated visits.

"Having conducted a previous assessment of Eggspectation, I can confidently attest that the culinary offerings of this establishment are indeed exceptional. It appears that considerable efforts have been made to enhance the quality of service, which was already impressive in my previous experience. Therefore, I unhesitatingly bestow upon Eggspectation a rating of four stars, in recognition of its meritorious performance. 

A perusal of the menu reveals a deliberate shift towards a more streamlined and focused selection, with an emphasis on showcasing the restaurant's core competencies. While the absence of the former diverse array of options may be lamented by some patrons, the remaining dishes demonstrate a masterful blend of flavors, yielding a truly satisfying gustatory experience. 

In light of the unfortunate closure of certain other brunch venues, my decision to traverse a distance of over a kilometer to partake in Eggspectation's delectable fare serves as a testament to its enduring appeal, which continues to draw patronage due to its consistent quality, generous portions, and welcoming ambiance."

"I indulged in an epicurean escapade accompanied by two female companions. The verdant squash blossoms were a sight to behold, their delicate petals unfurling like nature's own canvas. The ambiance was nothing short of sublime, meticulously curated to create an atmosphere of refined sophistication. Each dish was a masterclass in culinary precision, the chef's dedication to his craft evident in every bite. My pork chop, cooked to a perfect medium rare, was a juicy, flavorful delight that left me in a state of gastronomic nirvana. The star of the show, however, was undoubtedly the quail, its tender flesh infused with a depth of flavor that was truly exceptional. I would enthusiastically endorse it to anyone seeking a culinary experience that transcends the ordinary. Although the menu is seasonal and subject to change, I have no doubt that future visits will afford me the opportunity to sample further delectable creations from this gastronomic haven. The wine list, featuring an array of Arizona-crafted vintages, piqued my interest, and I look forward to exploring its offerings on a subsequent visit. In conclusion, my sensory receptors were treated to a symphony of indulgence, leaving me in a state of unadulterated gustatory pleasure."

The comparative analysis of the shopping malls in Springfield and Decatur versus the subject mall reveals a distinct superiority in favor of the latter, boasting a conspicuous absence of vacant retail spaces and a palpable liveliness in its atmosphere, thereby rendering it the optimal choice among the trio. The presence of an exceptional steak and potato franchise, which unfortunately met its demise in Springfield several years ago, constitutes a significant factor in the mall's appeal. Additionally, the diverse array of specialty stores, encompassing a kitchen store, numerous children's apparel outlets, a video game retailer, department stores, and a pet store, contributes substantially to the mall's allure.

I had the privilege of partaking in a nursing conference in Las Vegas on September 18, 2013, where my colleagues and I opted to dine at The Noddle, located within the luxurious Bellagio hotel, subsequent to our exhaustive exploration of the strip. To our delight, the culinary offerings at the establishment far surpassed our expectations, particularly the shrimp pad thai that I had the pleasure of indulging in, which was remarkably delectable and well-prepared. In contrast, my fellow diners' choices of various soup and noodle dishes were merely satisfactory, with the beef being somewhat overcooked. Nonetheless, I would unhesitatingly endorse this restaurant to those seeking a satisfying dining experience following an extensive excursion and people-watching escapade on the famed Las Vegas Strip.

I went to Praying Monk on Saturday night with my wife. I love the look of this place and it has a great atmosphere. The staff was very friendly and nice.  They did a great job making you feel welcome. 

I am a Belgium beer fan so I was very happy too see their great selection on tap.  I had a St Bernardus ABT12 and my wife had the Triple Karmilet (our two favorites).

Now on to the food.
We had the Brussels sprouts and the soft pretzel to start. The brussels were light and fresh (not heavy and oily like most places) and the pretzel was very tasty. It was served with some sort of mustard butter that was awesome.

For dinner I ordered the Burger. The burger was great. It was flavorful and juicy. The Sriracha Aioli had the right amount of heat to kick this burger up a notch and the arugula... arugula always has a place on my burgers!

My wife ordered the Kale salad. The Kale was extremely fresh and crunchy. I would want it chopped into smaller pieces but my wife loved it.  The dressing was great and they didn't over dress it. 

Next time I go I will have to try the Lump crab.

One of my preferred culinary establishments offering affordable gastronomical delights, this particular eatery boasts an unpretentious gem of a dish concealed within its menu, specifically a delectable T-bone steak and eggs dinner that is sure to satiate even the most discerning palate; peruse the image provided for visual confirmation of the dish's quality.

"Oh my, oh me! This establishment comes highly acclaimed... 

Despite the presence of an exceptionally disgruntled server! 
It appears that there are two of these eateries situated at adjacent hotels, which led to a hilarious mix-up among my companions and myself, as we endeavored to convene for a 6 a.m. repast... (Ah, yes, how very Las Vegas of us, indeed!) 

In any case, I have had the pleasure of visiting both locales on separate occasions during my previous sojourn in this city. Both experiences were thoroughly enjoyable. 
The hospitality was adequate (with the notable exception of the aforementioned grumpy server, of course), the culinary offerings were delectable, and the variety of options was impressive. 

It is unfortunate that certain menu items are only available at specific times, but we managed to discover suitable alternatives... 

Both venues were well-maintained and spotless, and we were seated in a timely manner... Most crucial in Las Vegas, in my humble opinion... Particularly when reveling in the city's vibrant nightlife, don't you agree? 

I struggle to recall any further remarks concerning this establishment... It exudes a distinct "Cheesecake Factory" ambiance... Which, in my estimation, is a positive attribute... Hmm, shall we say, 'a good thing'?)"

"Wow, the queues for this establishment can become remarkably lengthy, especially given its popularity among tourists and locals alike! I had the privilege of visiting this eatery twice during my vacation, and both experiences were utterly delightful. On my first visit, I opted for their delectable chicken sandwich, specifically the variety adorned with fiery hot peppers, which truly elevated the flavor profile to an extraordinary level. However, my second visit proved to be somewhat disappointing, as the chicken sandwich featuring cheese, bacon, and lettuce was unfortunately marred by an unpalatable sauce. Nonetheless, their coffee offerings are undeniably impressive and well worth sampling. Additionally, during my third visit, I decided to indulge in their Greek salad, which, much to my surprise, boasted an array of incredibly fresh ingredients that would rival even the most esteemed restaurants. It's worth mentioning that this location remains open 24/7, catering to the diverse needs of patrons, and the efficient staff ensures that orders are fulfilled at a remarkable pace."

"Wing Haven, an undiscovered gem in Charlotte, was brought to my attention during a Bike!Charlotte Bingo Bike Ride on a picturesque Saturday afternoon. The cycling route, which commenced at SouthEnd and traversed through downtown/Noda/Plaza Midwood/the greenway, culminated at Wing Haven, a secluded haven nestled within a residential area, strategically positioned between the Dilworth and Sewlyn districts. Despite its inconspicuous location, Wing Haven has the potential to attract a sizable audience, as evidenced by the 'NO WING HAVEN' parking signs erected in front of neighboring residences. This enchanting venue offers a diverse array of attractions for ornithologists, nature enthusiasts, and those who appreciate exceptional settings. Additionally, the space can be rented for intimate gatherings, and there are numerous activities designed for young children to engage in and explore."

Go for the Salt n Pepper Shrimp, fried chicken wings, cocktail shrimp, snow crab legs, raw oysters, greens, and fish... they also have clams, mussels, crawfish... the kids love this place.
